description:
Came here on the Sunday when France won the world cup! Had to wait for an hour but it was worth it.

The ambience was super cute/frenchy. We got the miracle pancake (bread pudding) and it was the best pancake ever. I got the egg benedict  w/ salmon and my boyfriend got the chicken sandwich. We both enjoyed our food but the pancake was def the highlight, would come back!!
author: Amy J.

description:
Ooooh great brunch place!

We got here on sunday around 1 and waited about 30 minutes to be seated. We sat on the back patio and it was perfect! We ordered miracle pancake, french toast with fruits and egg benedict! That miracle pancake was so delicious! I love that lemon curd. It was seriously the best pancake I've ever had in SF! It definitely lives up to its name! That combo was just miracle!
French toast was okay for me! It was tasty but just standard.
La Mer Egg benedict was great! It was topped with crab meats and roasted potatoes! 

Another thing I love about this place is its ambiance. It's very warm, cute and frenchy! This is kind of place you want to take your bestie to have brunch with! 

Great service, nice location, delicious food but long waits...But I would still be coming back because it's so good!
author: Clare L.

description:
Zazie has over 4000 reviews on Yelp. This is a popular brunch spot in Cole Valley. I heard about it by word of mouth from some man I helped shoot a short film with. I have been to Chloe's in Noe Valley. And you could get your egg scramble at Crepevine. Well, the outdoor seating is cute and nice on a nice day. And so that's what I ended up with. I was solo. I went around noon 12pm and it was pretty busy. There's gonna be a line with names on the board. I snagged my outdoor table first come first served. 

And then I decided I had to try the virgin Bloody Mary and have an Italie scramble with potatoes and white toast. The scramble had tomatoes and rare cheese, but I didn't even eat one chunk of cheese at the end. I didn't finish one piece of bread either. It was alright and just real quaint in Cole Valley near the N Judah. After I treated myself to ice cream across the street. This is SF life for you. I sat next to a young mother talking about motherhood with her friend.
author: Denise C.

description:
Today was my first (1st) visit to Zazie but it won't be my last. It was a beautiful day and colleagues spoke very highly of Zazie's weekend brunch menu. It's important to arrive early, especially on Sunday. Zazie opens at 9:00 am and there will be a wait. We arrived at 9:05 am and there was already several families outside waiting. Each party has to sign up on a paper sheet indicating your eating preference (outside or inside) and how many in your party. Zazie has a small eating area both in the front and the back of the establishment. Our waiter, Adam, was knowledgeable and very friendly. He did a great job providing recommendations as our server! We ordered the following:
1. Divorcee Eggs Benedict
2. Two Egg Special with chicken sausage, potatoes, and wheat toast
3. One pancake with Bacon
The food was really good. This is definitely a spot worth trying
author: Rhett B.

description:
This was our post medical appointment breakfast destination since it was relatively in the neighborhood.  On a foggy weekday morning, we were the second party in line for a table as all tables inside were occupied.  After a few minutes, we were seated at a table in the back of the front dining room (didn't know at the time, but there is a rear dining area too).  After studying the menu, we quickly ordered and I tried the following:

Double lemon coffee cake, shared (https://www.yelp.com/user_local_photos?select=fBbKmNCAiOOu3f8igDlKJQ&userid=saJuyv784apZzH--psHZ3Q) - Not really shared as my friend took one bite and found this too sweet.  I enjoyed it though I caution that it's not for the health conscious diner.

Miracle Pancake, shared (https://www.yelp.com/user_local_photos?select=yEYSJtcyrbK7AVOr2IyvoA&userid=saJuyv784apZzH--psHZ3Q) - This was interesting and, from afar, it almost looks like a large Danish.  This had a nice chew and the lemon curd and strawberries were enough flavor.  We did not use the offered syrup at all.

Scrambled eggs Mexico (https://www.yelp.com/user_local_photos?select=SC667wwZ0I6bBPU0PFYTzQ&userid=saJuyv784apZzH--psHZ3Q) - Debating between this and the Fontainbleau, the salsa tipped the scale for me.  This was pretty good though the oil from the chorizo made this a bit saltier than I hoped.

Service was efficient and not particularly warm which is to be expected given the popularity of the restaurant and the lines here.  The tables in the main dining room are arranged pretty tightly so it's probably not a good place to close a business deal or discuss your most intimate thoughts.  We were in and out of the restaurant at just under an hour.  Do come early as, on another attempt to dine here, the line was quite long.  Hope to return again and try some of their other menu offerings.

*** Recently dining here again, I forgot to mention the menu prices already includes gratuity for the staff.
author: Mike C.

description:
Gotta try this extremely busy brunch spot while visiting SF. They have an interesting policy of not tipping; but the food prices are high compared to other brunch spots. 
I had the eggs benedict which was delicious. Cappuccino with almond milk was even better! 
They have open seating at the entrance which doesn't require your name to be on the waitlist, so you kinda just have to hover around people finishing up and paying their bill..
author: Sugandha M.

description:
When we got here, there were about 18 tables ahead of us and we were told that it would probably take an hour to get a table. However, the tables outside are free for all so if you are a party of two - I would highly recommend that you wait around to try to snag one of the tables outside!! 

The scramble I had was delicious and the breakfast potatoes were great!! They came with roasted garlic as well. I asked them for hot sauce and the server brought some homemade tomatillo jalapeño salsa, and that was icing on the cake!
author: Jeanette C.

description:
Ah, one of my favorite brunch in the city. I do appreciate that you don't need to tip in addition to the bill since the prices are meant to encompass livable wages for the employees.

Love the challah french toast and most egg dishes. The waits can be pretty brutal on the weekends so I only come during the middle of the week.
author: Sophia L.

description:
Sooooooo good!!

I come here always to celebrate something.  Usually it's my passing an ice skating test, but this last trip I finally had the La Mer Benedict.  Adding the home fries with gaaaaaaaaahllic... 

Sooooooo good!!!   Their pumpkin spice latte (when they have it) leaves Starbucks' version in the dust... their Miracle Pancake is yummy too!!!  My one minus is the bacon.  Was kinda dry... go with the chicken sausage instead!!! 

It's pricey... for good reasons.   But... probably best if you're on a budget to go here on special occasions!!!

Sooooooo good!!
author: Joanna R.

description:
I ordered Divercee - egg Benedict, french toast will orange zest and fruit. The food was okish it didn't live to the high expectation setup by Yelp (4star , 4000 reviews).




The best part - ( that's why the 4stars)

It's dog friendly .
First come first serve seating outside.
No tip
author: Minar A.

description:
Great Brunch with a side of RACISM!

Zazie is a mainstay of the SF brunch scene so I won't say anything about the food that hasn't been said before. This is some of the best brunch food the city has to offer and the restaurant is cute.

This review is aimed towards our server who I believed is named Sarah Jane, whom was our server yesterday morning. Now no one will know what went through Sarah's mind when this occurred and admittedly this could simply be BAD service. And we do live in a hypersensitive environment, however if it was racism then there is zero tolerance for that in this city. Racism can be subtle, it can infest our lives and poison our thoughts. In this case we have reason to believe the actions of Sarah Jane have led us to believe she had unfavorable service towards us, we were a table of 2 Asians. 

1. She refused to simply take a photo of my friend and I having brunch, claiming she was too busy. Not a big deal and very understandable, right? However, she promptly and happily volunteered to take the photo of a Caucasian family literally at our neighboring table!!! WTF
2. She, asked us where we were from, also not a big deal. But why ask if you have no intention of making small talk or other bs, and simply and blankly walk away.
3. She conveniently forgot to refill our water, when we verbally asked for a refill. Also, not a big deal, maybe she's just a bad server. But maybe not! 

Fool me once, shame on you. Fool me twice, shame on me. Fool me three times, I'm going to call you out on your shit and make sure other people see it. 

Enjoy!
author: Byron C.

description:
I came early Friday afternoon, and there was a little wait before my friend and I were seated in the back of the restaurant at the cozy patio. It was a very nice area with natural light and fresh air, and a lively atmosphere, perfect for good conversations and aesthetic pictures. 


Our server was very nice, but a bit slow. We waited almost ten minutes before we got his attention to take our orders. We ended up getting the French toast Tahiti, special mix pancakes, and a side of potatoes. Everything we ordered was delicious. The pancakes were super fluffy and soft and the potatoes were tasty. 

The only con about this place is probably the price and service. I understand that the food is very good, but $11 for a piece of bread and puree is pretty expensive. However, tips are factored in, so it kind of makes up for it. It also took forever to get one of the server's attention because they were constantly coming and going to bring food and seat people. 

Knowing that I will always have to wait when I come to eat, to be seated and to get the server's attention, it'll be a while before I come back again.
author: Kristine P.

description:
This place is worth the wait outside. They are great to their employees so everything is slightly more expensive, but honestly compared to other brunch spots, the prices end up being about the same!

Personal favorite: the mimosas and the omelettes!
author: Sydney G.

description:
Zazie has been on my bookmarked list for the longest time, but the location and long lines has always deterred me away. On a Sunday morning, we finally made our way over here. After about 45 minutes of looking for parking and waiting for a table, we were finally seated inside. Note that there's a couple tables in front that's first come, first serve.

I ordered the Divorcee Benedict ($21) with 2 eggs and half/half on the salad and home fries (actually potatoes). The benedicts were topped with bacon, avocados, and fontina cheese over English muffins, which was a great combination of ingredients especially with a perfectly poached egg. This was actually quite filling to me that I was hardly able to eat the Pancake Flight ($19) we ordered to share. This sweet dish came with 1 buttermilk, 1 ginger, and 1 french toast. Unfortunately, this dish fell short and I was rather disappointed in the flavor and texture --hard pass.

Overall, good brunch spot though. The thing I like the most about this place is the fact that they don't take tip since their menu prices already include the living wage, healthcare, and other benefits to their employees. I'd definitely always support a restaurant who cares about their employees, so huge plus for that!
author: Cindy Z.

description:
Cool spot on Cole that routinely has a long wait . I wish they had a better wait system but they simply have a clipboard and you write your name . 

I went with their two signature dishes

French toast Tahiti - Their delicious version of French toast . Oh so good , one of the best French toastd these lips have tasted...
La mer -crab eggs Benedict . Pretty good but not as good as I had anticipated perhaps??? 

I liked the French toast significantly more than the La mer. Given the wait time and price point I was conflicted between three and four stars . After  I was seated it took the server quite awhile to greet me and take my order which Im typically not too picky on but it was longer than normal at similar venues. 

So an improvement on the wait system and taking the orders when inside was the determining factor of my 3.5 star review being bumped down to a 3. In summary , I would go here if there was no line but I wouldn't go if there was a wait.
author: Rod M.

description:
I'd heard good things about Zazie, but  the fact that they don't take brunch reservations was a deterrent for me. However, I finally went today and realized they have a good system in place: you put your name in line, get an estimate (approx 1 hr for brunch) and then you can wait at the bar next door having a drink until you're called. 

1st Visit (Indoor Seating) 
Before we knew it, we were escorted inside into the French Bistro next to a winding iron staircase (loved it!). 

There were lots of mimosas to choose from- I got The Magical Mimosa which had a scoop of peach sorbet and mint syrup. Very nice!

We also ordered the day's special omelette stuffed with bacon, mushrooms, and brie. It came with a side of soft, buttery garlic house potatoes that barely required chewing. 

Next was a very cheesy, creamy croque monsieur with a side salad. 

For dessert we ordered an exquisite lemon ricotta pancake with lemon curd.

The service was fantastic and the food was served in neat, generous portions. 

I would definitely come back to try the mango mimosa w tajin rim and the extensive selection of Benedicts. 

2nd Visit (Patio Seating)

The patio is both beautiful and romantic! It didn't feel as crowded as eating indoors and the tables were a little bigger. 

This time, I had the spicy mango mimosa with tajin rim and another one with a blooming rose at the bottom which made it look pretty and taste wonderful.

Since it was during the fall, I got to try some yummy seasonal dishes like the French Toast Tahiti, which was like a Bananas Foster with caramelized bananas, a Pumpkin Pie Pancake served with a dollop of pie on top, and a pumpkin latte! So GOOOOD!

There were so many benedicts to choose from, but we settled on the Monaco- with Prosciutto & Tomato with lemon Hollandaise sauce. Very tasty. 

So now, this place is Two for Two! I love this place and it's totally worth the wait. 

An added plus- the restaurant is Tip Free. The gratuity and SF Health mandate are already included in the price which makes paying the bill so convenient.
author: Mitzi G.

description:
This place is amazing. Everything from the service, food, wine, atmosphere, cleanliness, etc. - it was all wonderful. On the top of their (dinner) menu it reads "All of our menu prices include a living wage, revenue share, paid family leave, fully funded health & dental insurance, paid time off, and a 401(k) with employer match for all of our hard working employees." I really think this helps the staff relax about whether they are doing well enough to get a good tip, which I think dramatically improves their level of service. Our server was so nice and funny, and he really gave us great service for the 2 hours we were there. We even tried to tip him more at the end but they wouldn't let us! 'Tips are included.' 

I ordered the Etxea Rose after asking for a dry Rose, and it was great. I then moved to the Tablas Creek red wine, which was also delicious! Everyone received a warm bun after sitting down which was a nice touch and start to the meal. We ordered the mussels marinieres to start - super creamy and yummy, followed by the French onion soup. I wish the soup had a stronger onion flavor but it was still great regardless. I then ordered the Moroccan lamb tagine as my entree and wow was it good. Slowly braised lamb stew with eggplant, tomato, almond, and served over couscous, and it was extremely hot when it came out which I appreciated. Just because I know it didn't sit at all after they finished preparing it. I ended with the vanilla creme brulee which was perfectly baked, although I didn't feel like the strawberries on top added anything to it. They were just cut up and sitting on top of the brulee and I felt like they didn't go with the dessert BUT they were fresh and I ate them before digging into the creme brulee so it all worked out fine.

I can't wait to come back on their Tuesday no corkage night, and I will definitely be coming back multiple times over.

The restaurant is always busy so I highly recommend that you make reservations rather than just drop in.
author: Bri T.

description:
Come when the doors open, the wait is long if you come later. Located in the Haight-Ashbury neighborhood, this restaurant offer indoor/outdoor/garden seating. The menu offers all types of Benedict's and speciality pancakes. We ordered the La Mer Benedict which is topped with crab meat and roasted potatoes. The potatoes were amazing and roasted to perfection with cloves of garlic. The Benedict was tasty but did not live up to its price point. We also had their banana pudding pancakes which were rich and sweet.

*Make note that they do not need you to tip here. The menu food prices already include tip, healthcare, and whatever that is mandated by SF.
author: Iver N.

description:
I do not do 5 stars often. The food has to be very good, the ambiance special and the service  memorable. That was the case when we went this week.

 We are staying in the area for vacation and have checked all the reviews of all the places in the area and were eating very well, we had read about this one and decided to stop in. Even though we didn't have reservations we were made to feel welcome! We chose to sit outside in the patio with the heater and we engaged in a great conversation with our server.

 Now, my wife and I like to eat a lot of good food but we have certain things that we don't eat including nuts. They were very accommodating to serve some of the meals without the nuts and the food was still wonderful.

 I have the grilled salmon which was very tasty especially with the pureed parsnips and my wife had the lemon ravioli.  Just wow.

I have to say again how friendly and caring the serving staff was. 

We are here one more week and we will be back.

Loved they served my espresso in a bowl..seems to be a local thing.
author: Larry S.

description:
I've mostly been here for breakfast weekdays because the wait for weekend very cheap is usually insane and the same is frequently true of dinner, even weeknights. 

Occasionally there's a weekday breakfast wait. I mention this to underscore how popular the place is. 

They have a lovely patio which is a delight to be seated in, even when the weather isn't great. It's beautifully landscaped if you can say that about a patio. 

The dining room is very crowded even by San Francisco standards so don't bring a group larger than four. It's packed with all things French and very pleasant and surprisingly not as loud as most San Francisco places these days. 

Service is always very good and it's included in the prices -- very Euro. 

Now for the food. I can't say enough about the garlic loaded home fries. They are delicious. The banana stuffed French toast should not be missed. I have t sampled the pancakes in a long time but I've had the ones they drench in fresh fruit years ago. 

The Benedict's include some creative flair such as a grilled tomato with ham. I usually go for their creative scrambles: one with ratatouille, others with cheese and ham and much more. 

The toast seems homemade and they make their own preserves. 


And the cafe au lait is authentic

Don't miss a chance to sample their breakfast.
author: Tim P.

description:
Zazie, don't get mad at me. I always loved you. The previous 4 star review didn't mean anything, really.

The first time I came here, I fell in love with the ambience, decor, and food. The home fries were my favorite thing here! This time around, I took my boyfriend to show him what SF brunch is all about. 

You led me to the back of your restaurant, to your hidden outside patio that I never knew existed. It was such a cute, charming patio with Valentine decorations and I was instantly drawn in. I scanned the menu and once my eyes saw the eggs benedict with crispy bacon, fontina cheese, and avocado, I knew it was love at first sight. The food was just as I remembered it. The bacon is super crispy, just the way I like it. The hollandaise sauce is on point. But, even after all these years, the home fries is still the BEST I've ever had. Consistent and delicious even years later. 

I love you Zazie!! Do you forgive me now?
author: Samantha C.

description: For anyone who knows me, they know Zazie is the first place I will take you when in town! It's the atmosphere, it's the servire, the food, it's EVERYTHING YOU WANT! The best I can suggest trying is their special pancakes since they are fluffy with a yum lemon custard and they make you feel in heaven, not just food heaven like HEAVEN HEAVEN. In terms of eggs, I really like the New York ones but that cuz I'm obsessed with salmon. Yesterday I tried being adventurous and tried the special omelette with roasted peppers and sausage and was so so good! Also, the manager Mario is the nicest guy you can find in town and he is kind and gentle while managing the longest line outside! Go for it, you won't regret!
author: Irina P.

description:
I had never heard of Zazie before but found it after searching yelp for a restaurant to try while in the area. 

Zazie did not disappoint. As my husband and I walked to the restaurant we turned off of the loud and bustling Haight Street onto Cole street and found it to be  relaxed and quiet. The restaurant is quite small but has additional seating in the front and back patio. The back patio was beautiful and romantic, the walls were covered with green plants and outdoor lights. 

The food was delicious. We both started with a lentil soup as an appetizer served with complimentary bread that was nice and warm! I had fettuccine with mussels that was cooked perfectly and my husband had monkfish, mussel, and prawn stew.  We ended the evening with a warm fresh fruit crumble.

The service was warm and attentive and each course came out well timed. I will definitely be coming back!
author: Amber M.

description:
I took some friends from the east coast here for dinner on Saturday night, and they absolutely LOVED their experience at Zazie. I honestly can't forget about my great dinner there either!

We were a group of 4 and ordered the Mussels Marinières, 2 Pasta d'été, and the Country Pork Chop. We also got bread & butter on the table (free of course.) All of the food was clean, tasty, flavorful, and filling. Especially the Pork Chop, we all died of joy eating it! We also ordered coffees and cappuccinos.

We had a reservation for 5:30pm on Saturday and ended up sitting in the outdoor patio area. We were reluctant at first, but there are STRONG heaters outside so we were all in! Strong enough that I could wear a sleeveless top in 60 degree weather. Theres also blankets for extra warmth. There are a few Christmas lights strung around and leaves everywhere - so beautiful!

I also want to give a shout out to the friendly staff, especially our waiter John! He was attentive, honest, and gave great suggestions. I also love the restaurant model of no extra tipping, but instead paying their servers fairly and including it in the price of each dish.

If you're looking for that "must go while in SF" restaurant, THIS IS IT. I'm from LA so I was also a visitor, and was extremely pleased with my experience here.
author: Alice A.

description:
Wow, okay, okay. Hype: lived up to. Expectations: exceeded. Bellies: distended. Come with full pockets and empty stomachs; leave with full stomachs and empty pockets. 

Omelette du jour: it's not a huge stretch to think that putting garlic in things will make them taste better, but somehow in my life no one has ever put garlic in my omelette. Buddy, lemme tell you the difference it makes. The Portobello mushroom and tomato within were unabashedly garlicky. If you choose the fries instead of the salad, you'll be rewarded with gorgeously crispy potatoes and FRIED GARLIC. I LOVE garlic. I LOVE crunchy things. I LOVE paying like 18 dollars for an omelette, wondering how you can charge that much for one slab of rolled egg, and then allowing the sweet stench of garlic to wash such economic worries from the mind. Ahhh. 

French toast Tahiti: gushy and sweet and gooey. 

Pain de mine: French toast with orange cinnamon batter and fruit. Sounded like a blast, but it didn't taste as impressive as the description sounded. Skippable. 

Service: awesome. Come early cause the wait is something fierce. We got there at 9am and waited about 10 min for a table of 2. 

Cost:
Coffee + omelette + 2 different slices French toast = $56 for 2 people = $28 per person, no tip necessary, and while it is far from a cheap brunch, the satisfaction of an amazing meal and knowing the staff have health insurance, dental benefits, and a 401k make it an expense you can bear with. Brunch is a privilege.
author: Connie L.

description:
I have been wanting to come here for years and finally made it last month; however, maybe I should have passed because it is the epitome of too much hype for me. We were seated at a table out back on the patio which was the most lovely part of the entire meal. I got the croque madame which was subpar at best. The egg was overcooked and for the $$$ I would say... Buy the ingredients at home and make it yourself! Probably save 1/3 of the cost and taste way better.

My friend also got a scramble--I'm not sure which one but it was also pretty mediocre I would say. The potatoes were rather soggy and not that flavorful.

Maybe we should have opted for their most popular dishes but... I don't think I'll be coming back to try.
author: Michelle K.

description: Fontainbleau was the showstopper and I don't typically like omelettes or scrambles. Miracle pancakes are always a guarantee that you will leave happy. All of the Benedicts are delicious. Every chance I get on a weekday that I'm free I will take the opportunity to partake at one of my favorite restaurants in Sf. Parking may be tough, might be a bit of a wait, but Service is always great and the food never disappoints.
author: Elaine S.

description:
Law School Girl loves this place and drags me here pretty often. I generally don't protest extensively. If I were richer I wouldn't ever put up a fight as the food is good, the service is good, and the ambiance is good.

As a result I have had many many meals here. Among my favorites are the salade nicoise, the trout, the pork-chop and the mussels. In the evening there is a 3 course prix fixe menu with a variety of options which is a very good deal. 

They have outdoor seating in front (first come first serve) as well as a lovely patio if you'd enjoy sitting outside. 

The biggest drawback to eating at Zazie is the wait. It can be a looong wait. The horrible parking situation in Cole Valley is also a concern.

Baker St, Chez Mama or Zazie? All abt the same price, but I think this is my favorite as long as I'm in a zen mood abt the crappy parking situation and the inevitable wait.
author: El B.

description: This place gave us an authentic French experience. The food and service was amazing. Try to go before dinner time to ensure you're not waiting forever as it is a small restaurant and it can get super packed. We came here for our anniversary and we had a super romantic and intimate environment. It was a perfect evening
author: Lily N.

description:
Miracle Pancakes- sour cream poppyseed pancakes w/ lemon curd and strawberries.

Eggs en Fonte grilled polenta cake with spinach, wild mushrooms, spicy tomato chèvre sauce, and two over easy eggs baked in a cast iron skillet.

In, Deux, Trois- one buttermilk pancake, 2 eggs, 3 bacon strips.

Albert Eggs Benedict- with crispy bacon, white cheddar, and homemade salsa fresca.
author: Lorene P.

description:
Eggs eggs eggs!

I love Zazie. Amazing spot for brunch but the wait is always long. They have indoor, outdoor and patio seating. The patio is really nice if you request it or end up sitting there. Came with some friends for the Greece scrambled eggs, Monaco eggs benedict.

Their menu also states that gratuity is not needed as they pay their employees fair living wages, and offer a variety of benefits. AMAZING business model that many should follow.
author: Mabel Y.

description:
There was quite a wait outside when we arrived - it was about 11am on a Friday morning. It was a nice day outside so we walked around. We finally got seated in the front booth area (which is a little awkward because it's right in the window). We started with a few of the mojitos (wow, they have quite an extensive selection) and the seasonal cinnamon roll. The roll was fantastic, soft, moist and flavorful. The service was a little inattentive (probably didn't help that we were way in the front of the restaurant in the window/nook area. 

I ordered the eggs vincent. The dish was good, it was essentially polenta (which I'm typically a fan of). My sister was a huge fan of her eggs benedict. The brunch menu is quite extensive, especially the eggs benedict section if you're a fan of that dish. I'm not sure if this place was good enough to warrant a visit back with a wait of that caliber (maybe 30m?). It was also relatively expensive - probably because they offer incredible benefits for their employees and they're tip free. I'd recommend giving this place a shot if you're in the area and trying it out for yourself.
author: Katie Y.

description:
I went to Zazie for a dinner with a couple of friends for the first time last week. It is a super cute restaurant with a really great ambiance. It would make a cute date spot for sure. They also include tips in all of their pricing so there is no need to tip at the end.

They have a great selection of wine and have really really tasty mimosa combinations and I'm not talking about your typical traditional mimosas these have wonderful exotic flavors. For dinner I ordered the Le Canard Piallat which was a beautifully cooked duck leg served with potato salad and haricots verts. It was simply delicious! We then opted to all share a dessert and we chose the Le Deux Cremes. It was a chocolate pot de creme and creme brulee. Both were very rich and super yummy. 

Overall, I definitely want to go back to Zazie, I definitely want to hit it up for brunch. The service was great and the food was amazing! I would recommend making a reservation ahead of time for dinner.
author: Stephanie A.

description:
Hands down one of my favorite brunch restaurants when visiting San Francisco! I had the St. Trop Benedict and my boyfriend had the Bretagne Benedict. Both of them were absolutely delicious, I would highly recommend the Bretagne Benedict if you love prawns! We also ordered the French Toast Tahiti. We didn't have much expectations for it but it was soooo good!! 

Tip: go at least 25 minutes beforehand if you don't wanna wait 1+ hour!! (But even when arriving early there will probably still be a line)
author: Carol L.

description: Come for the atmosphere, stay for the food. Great food and fantastic service. My suggestion, get here early as the secret is out. Plenty of parking in this neighborhood.
author: Mehran A.

description: You spend your entire life waiting for this moment. The moment your name is called for a table at Zazie. By that point the anticipation has built up, but skepticism also sets in as the thought of eating a meal not up to your standards parade through your mind. Luckily, Zazie does not disappoint! Everything we had was amazing but would like to especially point out that the La Mer Benedict was so amazingly good. I'd come back just for another bite. Cheers.
author: Samantha S.

description:
Favorite breakfast spot in San Francisco! My father and I usually come here weekday mornings and we usually never have to wait...but I think we just get lucky. Very cozy feeling decor inside and a garden patio in the back with heaters perfect for these chilly sf mornings. Service is always great, consistent on checking in with us. Although the menu says tipping is unnecessary, we always do. 

The thing we love about Zazie the most is the freshness of their food. I was surprised that they even make their own condiments! 

We usually order the St. Trop: smoked salmon Benedict & the La Mer: Crab Benedict. I believe most of there savory dishes come with a roasted garlic, which we absolutely LOVVVVVVVVE!!!(who cares about garlic breath!) Takes the flavors to a whole other level!

As for sweets, the miracle pancakes are great but the French Toast Tahiti is bommmmmb.com. The banana stuffing inside is delicious, the French toast is fluffy n moist, caramel on top mmm, and then add a bit of butter to add a salty element! Perfect!
author: Mary R.

description:
What a treat! My boss had been raving about Zazie since I started working with her and we finally made it in together for a weekday birthday brunch.
The ambiance is so cute and their outside back patio is even cuter! 

We ordered:
Monaco Benedict, Mexico Scramble, French Toast Tahiti and 1 Miracle pancake which was Lemon Cornmeal. 
Everything we ordered was delicious! We finished everything! Luckily, our server stopped us from ordering 2 pancakes or else we wouldn't have been able to finish everything! The eggs were cooked perfectly with the benedict and the scramble wasn't overly cooked. I love the whole roasted garlic cloves with the home fries. Such a nice touch. 

I can't wait to come back and try more!
author: Nari M.

description: I am speechless! I had to try this place while in SF. Nothing more to say than the fact that the eggs Benedict dishes (both divorcee and Florentine) were outstanding. The hollandaise sauce has a great lemon flavor, eggs were PERFECTLY poached, and you have the option between one, two, or three eggs. You have the choice between a salad or home fries too, and I have to say that the home fries were seasoned perfectly with garlic and a little bit of salt and pepper! Very happy I tried this place out! I will definitely be back the next time i am in the city.
author: Tammy L.

description:
Brunch
Mimosas or Sake Bloody Mar made with tomato juice, horseradish & tabasco
La Mer 
Eggs benefit w/hand picked California Dungeness crab, avocados, chives
No tips
author: Amanda T.

description:
This is probably my new favorite brunch spot. Come here before 10 am on a weekday to snag a spot all by yourself. I had the back patio to myself. By 10:30, the place was full of an elitist hash: the junkie rock n roll couple visiting from la, the 1st year UCSF med school couple skipping anatomy for a quick upscale bite, the old paleo conservative in the corner drooling waiting for his latte and dreaming of Ike Eisenhower and the quiet French backpackers cursing American "portions" and still confounded by the trump-macron bromance. 

I had the divorceé Benedict's: bacon, fontina cheese & avocado. I told the waitress I loved the roasted garlic cloves in the home fries. She told me she hates it when the other patrons don't. I told her that they should be deported from the Bay Area. I
Finished with a slice of the French toast tahini which was stuffed with banana purée and topped with caramelized bananas. Thank you Zazie. Oh, and now a word from them: 

__+++++Zazie+++++__ is tip free! 
Our menu prices include a living wage, revenue sharing, paid sick leave, fully funded insurance, paid parental leave & 401(k). Merci a vous!
author: Johny B.

description:
The vibrant atmosphere of this breakfast/brunch location is simply one to remember. The staff and decor definitely brings this little location to life. Zazie was on the top of my list since getting to SF. We tried going on a Saturday morning and the wait was 1hour for 2 people!! It was Bastille Day and France just won the world cup, go figure. 

We left and returned that Monday. I was so very happy with this decision. 
They had a pretty big menu and plenty of delicious French cuisine options. 

I ordered a Croque Madame and my friend ordered the Ranch Burger. We pledged to allow a couple bites of each entree for the experiene. I ordered a Mayan Mocha drink which had cinnamon and chili in it. Wow that was quite a drink. It was absolutely delicious and was not too sweet!

We waited for our food and simply admired the atmosphere. There was natural light coming from the ceiling. We appreciated the wall art decor and the personalized Zazie magnets posted everywhere. 

Our waitress was peppy and charismatic. I love that about a place; it helps bring that community atmosphere. We also appreciate the fact that Zazie offers their employees full benefits and proper wages. They do not require a tip at this place!

Our food came out and we were ready to eat! My dish was essentially a cheese sandwhich, with blackforest ham and an egg on top. It had a perfect amount of cheese on top. I ordered mine with potatoes and garlic. I loved it! 

My friend's ranch burgers was juicy delicious and savory. He absolutely enjoyed his meal as well. 

As the other reviewers noted, you must come check out Zazie if you are in the area. Go during the weekday where you can get a spot!!! I shall return.
author: John L.

description:
Good brunch spot with a cute patio area. Seating is limited so prepare for a wait. They have a pretty good system so the process isn't bad. 

Tip: tip is included in the price, so don't be discouraged by the prices.
author: Sandy G.

description: Great food, Excellent service, nice cozy place! People are so friend. Clean place. They even have out door sitting & outdoor patio!
author: Michele T.

description:
How have I not reviewed you Zazie?? How!?!?! You are my go to for brunch and breakfast. A pleasant place for coffee. A lovely place to relax and take in the greenery. Oh Zazie, you charming place

My girlfriend and I go out of our way to drive up to the city to get a bite here atleast once every 2 weeks. The prices are a little high, but it's because they do not accept tips. I don't have a plate I always get here, I mix it up. The croque madame is very good here as is their French toast. My girlfriend usually gets the salmon and we'll end lunch with a cup of their beautiful coffee. If you can, try sitting the back garden area, it's very spacious and charming with it's vines and flowers all throughout.The service is usually very nice too!

Overall; Zazie is a charming hole-in-the-wall that never let's you down
author: Bruce's A.

description: Favorite brunch spot in SF! They don't take reservations so you'll have to put your name down and wait a little even if during the week. It's about a 20 minute wait especially if you want to sit in the patio but worth it. I love the fountainbleu eggs.
author: Yas E.

description:
Zazie has a super cute ambience and fresh food, but I waited upwards of 40 minutes for my food on a Friday afternoon at 11:30 AM. I've been told to check out Zazie for a while and their unique "no tip" policy is different from most places, so that's why I had to see it for myself but the wait definitely impacted my experience here and was quite disappointed. On the flip side, I've heard a wait of 1-2 hours is expected and we waited about 15-20 minutes -- but the total waiting time for seating + food was probably the same in total, so were we really that "lucky"?

My party of 3 ordered:
Tahiti French Toast ($18) 
Omelette du Jour ($18)
Eggs Benedict - Albert with 2 eggs ($21) 

I appreciate that the French toast and eggs Benedict had options to pick 1, 2 or 3 piece(s)/egg(s) because most brunch places always give me too much French toast and taking leftover French toast just isn't the same. Otherwise the ingredients were obviously fresh and the potatoes were super good! Wish they had been more generous with their potato portions and not sure if I'll be back, but I heard the back patio is super pretty so maybe if I'm feeling brunchy I'll give Zazie another shot. Also, as a dental student, I really appreciate that all employees have dental insurance coverage
author: Leslie T.

description:
Well after a morning 10K practice run we had to get brunch so my lovely friends suggested this place. 
Arrived around 11 and a wait list of 45-60 minutes.  No problem because there's a bar next door to watch the game while we wait. Well time flew by and we got our table. 

Nice little place with a Parisian design. Great atmosphere and fast service. Got our food and appetizers  and we was eating. 

Food was superb
Service was great 

Only thing is kind of hard to find parking. 
I will definitely have to come back and enjoy other items on the menu.
author: Kao S.

description:
This has been one of the top brunch place spots I have wanted to try.  I am so glad I had wonderful friends who woke up super early to come eat brunch the morning I went.  Waking up early was definitely worth it because we didn't wait that long.  I was expecting 15 people ahead of us but nope!  The customer service was great.  I like the concept of not having to top.  I highly recommend coming to this place but also coming early!  

Ordered: french toast tahiti ($18), cappuccino ($4.95), divorcee ($16), genevieve ($18), pierre noir ($15), and side of egg whites + bacon
author: Mikayla M.

description:
When you look up best brunches in SF, you'll notice that Zazie is consistent across MANY if not all of the articles, blogs, etc. I feel like I've had Zazie bookmarked for a while but being in Cole Valley I really had to set some time up to come check it out for weekend brunch. 

PRO TIP: If you don't care for waiting, grab any of the open tables in the front of the restaurant because they are first come first serve. We came at around 10:30 aka peak brunch time, but we luckily nabbed one of the tables in front and avoided the 1.5hr + wait time. While this is also a pro there's also a reason why they do this - it can get hot on a sunny day because they don't have any cover or umbrellas out front for shade. So if you're willing to do this option definitely slather on that sunscreen. 

FUN FACT: Zazie is tip free because their menu prices include a living wage, PTO, etc for their employees. Makes the not ridiculously crazy price tag sound even better right? 

Their menu itself if quite extensive ranging from starters, eggs any style, eggs benedicts, scrambled egg dishes, griddle dishes, soups, salads, and their plats du jour which is constantly changing. Needless to say the menu is quite egg-cellent. What's great about Zazie too is that they price based on how many eggs, griddles, etc you want in variables 1, 2, and 3 so prices can be as low as $9 and as high as $38.

I ended up getting the the 2 Albert Benedict (bacon, white cheddar, salsa fresca) w/home fries for $21. I thought the portions were decent for the price and the quality was there. The bacon was crispy, cheddar melted, and eggs yolky enough. The home fries are the clear winner though especially with the chunks of garlic mixed in. If you're in a drinking mood try the spicy mango mimosa - basically a mangonada for breakfast!

Can't complain about our service experience here either. Our waiter was attentive and he never made us feel like we weren't taken care of in the front of the restaurant. All in all, not a shabby first time here at this infamous SF brunch spot. Next time I'll be sure to actually walk through the place and see the inside and outside patio in the back.
author: Keizzel C.

description:
Came here on a weekday morning and it was surprisingly crowded. It seems pretty small from the outside, but there is a cute patio out back which seats alot more people. The mimosas are delicious, and there are several kinds of juices you can pick.  We liked the Mango juice.

Portions are a tad small, but delicious. Definitely would recommend this place for brunch - just a tad small and the service is a little slow. Other than that its great!
author: Elizabeth L.

description: I live in inner sunset so this place is walkable distance from my place. This was my third attempt of going after previous 2 failures due to time restrictions. This place opens at 11am but line forms before opening and people already start filling waitlist. There are plenty of seats- front porch, inside, and patio in the back- so if you come on time, you will be seated. Expect to wait for food! Food is bomb though! Zazie is definitely one of my favorite brunch places in SF (La Note in Berkeley being my favorite in the bay area). So many options on the menu, everything sounds so good- from omelet, pancakes, to American style breakfast. Drinks are good too. Price is bit on the higher end but that's because tips and taxes are included as part of the total price so no additional tips necessary.  I recommend sitting in the patio if weather is good outside. Patio is a lot more spacious than inside. I'd definitely go back when I crave for some brunch- hopefully I can bit the line!
author: Adel A.

description:
The food is really good here! I had the Miracle Pancakes (Lemon Ricotta Pancakes) with meyer lemon curd. God, it's divine! My parents had the Florentine Eggs Benedict and my sister had the Albert Eggs Benedict. They really enjoyed their dishes! 

Really liked the ambiance and service was great!
author: Annette L.

description: Dinner review- I know everyone raves about Zazie's brunch scene (which I haven't tried) but I can say that their dinner was amazing!  They also take reservations for dinner, and probably walk ins too (it wasn't too crowded).  Anyways we started with a grilled fig toast with goat cheese & arugula which was sweet and savory.  For dinner we had the lamb tagine, hanger steak and pork chop.  While all dishes were good, the real winner is the pork chop.  It's thick and juicy and comes with a kale, mint cous cous.  In my opinion it is a rival to Nopa's chop.  We ordered the lemon mouse and rotating cobbler.  THE COBBLER WAS AMAZING! We got it with gelato but it would have been better with the cream.  It was sweet but still tart and had a tasty brown sugar tart.  Prices are inclusive of tips.
author: Alexandra L.

description:
Highly recommend, and go early! We waited about 1.5 hours for a party of 2. The food was so so so good, though. We ordered some food off of their standard menu and then some off their special menu (changes daily) and it was all excellent.

Pancakes with strawberries and lemon curd: SO GOOD. I usually don't prefer sweet breakfasts but this is a must-try. It was off the changing special menu, but should be available all the time!

Gingerbread pancakes: Ordered this out of curiosity. I didn't like them as much as the strawberry/lemon pancakes but if you like gingerbread, you may like this!

Monaco benedict: Prosciutto and tomatoes at first seemed like a different combination for an eggs benedict but it was actually really good. Served with a side of house potatoes that are amazing in flavor and texture. 

French onion soup: Really hit the spot on a rainy morning.
author: Lillian B.

description:
Totally worth the wait. 

If you are stopping in for brunch on a Saturday or Sunday, expect to wait 20 or 30 minutes. This is worth it. Walk down the street and grab a cup of coffee but don't lose your place in line. 

We started with a carafe of mimosa which was delightful. I had the croque monsieur and both of my friends ordered variations of eggs benedict. Everything was stand out good, but we all decided the croque monsieur was the winner :) 

The staff is paid a fair living wage with benefits and all of that is built into the prices on the menu. That means you don't have to struggle with leaving a tip. This works excellently at Zazie as the service is fantastic. There were so many things that looked good on the menu, this spot will be a winner for a long time to come.
author: John W.

description: I've only been here once but I enjoyed everything we ordered. Me and 2 other people got the 1 Miracle Pancake and it was the best pancake I've ever had. They make it with bread pudding. We also shared the Bretagne Eggs Benedict, also great. The seasonal cake was some Lemon Cake with strawberry purée, very rich and a generous portion. And we also ordered a Toasted Baguette with cream cheese, tomato and basil also great. We were able to share everything and still be full. I can't wait to come back and get that Miracle Pancake.
author: Claudine R.

description: Cold eggs, untoasted toast, SLOW SLOW ZZZZZ service.  very disappointing considering the line outside
author: Kay C.

description:
This place never disappoints!! Whenever I'm in The City I make it a point to come here. It can be busy in the weekends, but mid week you can walk right in most of the time. 

Today...Eggs benne and a Bloody Mary!! Like I said, it never disappoints. I'll let the picture speak for itself.
author: Aaron K.

description:
Been waiting a long time to grab brunch here (the wait and the long lines were very intimidating) but I finally had a chance to do so recently, and boy have I been missing out!

I came around 10 am on a Saturday morning thinking that was early enough to avoid a really long wait, but to my surprise (ah I was so naive..) there were already plenty of names ahead of mine on the sign up sheet, at least a whole page's worth. But I was determined to wait it out, so my friend and I killed some time by grabbing coffee at the Peet's nearby, and then we hovered around Zazie's entrance for the remainder of the time. 

Finally our names were called after an hour or so, which was faster than I was expecting.The space inside was bigger than I thought, as there is not only a regular seating area but a patio all the way in the back. I only caught a glimpse of the patio as I was going to the bathroom, but it looked really cute.

Food wise, my friend and I decided to each get a savory item and share a french toast. I ended up with the Eggs Fontainbleau ($16), which is scrambled eggs with wild mushrooms and spinach. I know you're probably thinking, how good could scrambled eggs be, it's just scrambled eggs! But I was in love with the eggs here.They were so soft and fluffy and not overcooked at all; And I don't know how they prepare their potatoes, but it was perfectly seasoned and soft on the inside but surprisingly crunchy on the outside. Both of us were pretty obsessed with the potatoes as well.

My friend ordered one of their benedicts, which they're known for, and commented that their lemon hollandaise sauce was very light compared to the other hollandaise sauces that she's had.

The french toast was also good but not as mind blowing as the savory dishes were for us. This could've been because we ate it last, so it had been sitting on the table getting cold for a while before we dug in?

Also I LOVE that for a lot of their dishes, you can choose your portion size. Not too many places in SF will let you only order one benedict or three if you're feeling extra hangry from the wait :P

Our server Megan was amazing. Upon learning it was our first time at Zazie, she gave us a rundown of the most popular items on the menu and was just super helpful in general. I also really appreciated the fact that despite how busy the restaurant is and how many people are waiting outside, I never once felt rushed. She first grabbed our drink orders, and then came back and asked for our food orders instead of doing everything at once.

Parking wasn't too bad. I was able to find a spot two blocks away on a residential street pretty easily.

All in all, this was one of the best brunches I've had yet in the city, and I definitely want to come back, maybe try to get patio seating next time?
author: Dianna H.

description:
Recently went here for a Memorial Day breakfast. I was craving French toast and this place did not disappoint. We got here at about 10 am and waited about about an hour to get seated. If there is only two of you, the outdoor seating before you go inside the restaurant is first come, first serve (you don't have to signup on the waitlist). You either have a choice to sit inside, out in the front or out in the garden (back of the restaurant-- which is such a cute outdoor area). 

The first thing we noticed when we got the menu is that the food is a few dollars more than what you would typically see at a brunch place. All of their menu prices include a living wage, revenue share, paid family leave, fully funded health & dental insurance, paid time off, and a 401(k) with employer match for their hard working employee-- which is amazing.Servers/workers in restaurants don't get paid enough for the work they do or people aren't generous enough to tip even when the service is phenomenal. Since they have this tips are not expected. 

My bf and I ordered La Mer and the french toast Tahiti. Both are so delicious-- perfect combination or sweet & savory. 

The reason I'm giving this place a 4/5 is because of a few reasons:
1) Completely understand that the menu is a little more pricey because they want to make sure the employees are compensated. However, all of the items are a little more than average price. If a person were to order an appetizer,entree, side, and a drink... the costs to compensate definitely adds up. The French toast Tahiti was about $20 and the La Mer for two eggs was almost $30 
2) Depending on the weather and where you sit, you can smell the garbage in the garden area.
author: Hazel R.

description:
Okay so this place is a great place to go for brunch if you have 2.5 hours to kill, one hour to spend in line. Personally I think the 1 hour wait for a table for two seriously detracts from the experience, especially because there is zero seating outside and you just have to stand outside in a line trying not to get too jealous of those seated outside eating in front of you. Other places like Plow have wait seating that is separate from the outside tables.

With that said, the food and service is impeccable. I had a Florentine Eggs Benedict which was very tasty, my girlfriend had an omelette with a huge latte, and we shared a pumpkin pancake. Everything was served on cute plateware in a cozy restaurant with servers with great attitudes and service. Plus there is a zero tip and the servers are paid a living wage. Probably why the servers are so pleasant. This is the way it should be at all restaurants.

Bring friends or a date here in a party of 2-4, reservations highly recommended unless you have plenty of time to kill. And get the eggs Benedict!
author: Myles L.

description:
Brunch is almost like an amusement park ride here in San Francisco. You have to wait in line for the main attraction. At Zazie, the main attraction is the food. Let me tell you, the wait is pretty much worth it. 

I ordered the French toast with fruit and when it came out, I was shocked. It was so colorful. The fruit was just right and the French toast was ok. However, they had this strawberry jam sauce on the table. Adding that to my French toast really made it so much better. 

Whenever I come here, I try to always order something with fruit because I just love fruit and how it brightens up the dish.

If you come here, I would recommend any dish with fruit.
author: Allyson L.

description:
I came here with a party of 3 on a Saturday morning at 10:45am. We didn't get seated until 12:15pm. Once we put in our orders, we didn't get our food until 12:45pm. It's a good thing that we all ate breakfast before showing up here for brunch because I would've been starving from the long wait lol.

I got the divorcee eggs benedict with two poached eggs and house potatoes. The food was amazing but the portion sizes were small and not filling. My boyfriend had ordered one poached eggs for his eggs benedict and regretted it because of the small portion size too. My best friend ordered one of the eggs scrabble and said it was one of the best scrabble she's ever had. I took a bite of her scrabble and it was really good. We all enjoyed our meals but they were very overpriced for what it's worth. 

Notes: If you want to avoid waiting in line for more than a 1.5 hours, I'd suggest to come right before the restaurant opens or come during 12:30-1PM. That's when we noticed that the restaurant had a lot of open seats with less people waiting outside. The restaurant is pretty small with 4 two seater tables in the front (good for people with pets), some seat insides, and some seats in the heated patio in the back. Definitely not recommended for a party of 5+. There's a tiny unisex restroom. There isn't much walking space inside the restaurant since they try to cram as much seats as possible. The staff is super friendly and attentive. The meals are pretty pricey but that's because the restaurant pays their employees full benefits, so they encourage their customers to not tip.
author: Sylvia H.

description:
Such a let down! Especially after waiting in line for 1 hour.

The eggs dishes were meh, the potatoes were tasteless. The pancake was pretty good actually, but wasn't worth the wait.

Maybe it's famous back in the days when brunch places were harder to find? No idea..
author: Novalina N.

description:
Came here for my birthday and totally fell in love with this place. It's a small little place and I believe they have a garden out back. From the small glimpse I got, the garden looked beautiful and I am sure it was because there was a wedding reception going on. 

There was quite a wait to be seated inside. You sign your name in and they will call your name when there are seats. I recommend coming here for a lunch date for 2 to 4 people. Seating is pretty small and mostly for 2. They can put tables together, but I'm sure the wait would be a little longer. The seating in the front of the restaurant is first come first serve, so you don't have to put your name down for it. Just grab the table as soon as you see someone get up. 

The service is amazing. The staff always checked on us.  Boyfriend got a omelette. It was the special for the day. It was filled with sausage, mushrooms and some other things. I was too focused on my food to remember his. It was tasty though. Food wasn't too salty. The omelette did have a little run in the middle, but my boyfriend lives for that. I got the crab Benedict. It was delicious! You can ask for 1 or 2 eggs. It comes with a side of salad. They do not skimp you on the crab meat. It's pretty light and the salad goes really well, which left room for all the sweets I ordered. 

We got French toast Tahiti and miracle pancakes. You get to choose how many slices of French toast or pancake you want. The French toast came with caramelized bananas and in between the slices of toast there were some crushed walnuts mixed in cinnamon. It was pretty delicious. Definitely got my French toast fix. Appreciated that it wasn't that sweet and that the center of my French toast wasn't a soggy texture. The pancakes though!!! The miracle pancakes are really a miracle. It had poppy seeds and a lemon sauce with strawberries! It was freaking to die for. It's perfection! It's everything! I believe it was part of the special menu. I'd go back just for that! I'd go back for all of that! 

As for the drinks, I got the chai tea with almond milk. It comes in a big ol' bowl! Loved every bit of it. It wasn't too sweet and it was just right. The boyfriend got the lemonade soda thing. It was just the right amount of tang, but my drink was greater than his drink. 

Overall, really great experience. Definitely recommend to go.
author: Al H.

description:
Hit this spot up for brunch on Saturday - and yum!  Be aware, they do not take reservations and there will be an hour wait.  We opted to wait to be seated in the patio, and it was worth it!  It's secluded and in the back -- I loved that it's a covered patio with vines, lights, and heat lamps.  It's pretty romantic looking!  I'd definitely wait for the patio if I were you.

To start, I ordered the spicy mango mimosa that has a tajin rim and OMG.  This drink is first of all gorgeous and totally IG worthy.  Secondly, it's absolutely delicious.  Our server warned that it's very spicy, but it's not bad if you are a fan of spicy things.  I would definitely recommend this mimosa -- it's super unique and fun.

I also ordered the special pumpkin latte, which was so delicious!  This latte legit comes in a bowl - like a bowl lol.  It's pretty big, and you have to drink out of it while holding it with both hands.  Loved it.

I order another mimosa, but I sadly don't remember what it is called!  Our server recommended it to me because it's red and it comes with a flower that looks like a rose that sits on the bottom of the glass.  It was very "beauty and the beast" looking -- so IG worthy and delicious.  

For my meal, I ordered the "french toast tahiti" - which is stuffed with caramelized bananas and walnuts.  YUM.  This dish is beautiful and delicious -- definitely recommend.  

I also ordered the "monaco eggs benedict" -- which caught my eye because it has prosciutto.  I love that you can select how many eggs you want - 1,2, or 3 -- because I can never finish two, so this was perfect.

Our server was great, the venue is cute, the food is delicious and IG worthy.  I would definitely recommend.  I'd say that the spicy mango mimosa with tajin was hands down my favorite thing, and I'd come back for it!
author: Michelle S.

description:
We got lucky and came on a Monday morning and were able to snag a table outside right away. 

They don't tip here so the prices are pretty high but ended up spending about the same amount as we probably would anywhere else. 

The food was delicious! 

I'm omitting 1 Star specifically for service. I knew that our server was working really hard so I don't think it was his fault. I'm guessing they were understaffed in general but...

We waited for a good 15 minutes before being able to order even a coffee. Once we did order it was another 10 minutes or so before the coffee reached our table. Typically you get coffee right away. And at no point during our meal were we offered refills on the coffee... maybe they don't come with refills but the cup is pretty tiny so I went through it pretty fast. 

All in all the Food was the star of the show.
author: Chelsea J.

description: This place was so yummy! Went here last night for dinner with some friends and the service and the food were great. I ordered from the pre fixe meal, which i thought was a great deal. You get an appetizer, entree, and dessert for $39. I ordered the mussels for an appetizer, and oh boy, delicious. The sauce that they have the mussels in was so good, definitely sopped up all the extra sauce with the bread they give you. Next, was the trout. This was also good, it came with ratatouille on top of the fish and a generous portion of wild rice on the side. Last up was the dessert. I really wanted their chocolate lava style cake for dessert, but that wasn't on the pre fixe menu, but with an upcharge you could definitely exchange it. OMG so chocolatey and delicious! Also, the server overheard it was my birthday, so she added a little candle which was really sweet. Also, the service we received was so great. When we first got there we waited for a table outside, for not a considerably long time, but for the wait, they offered us a free glass of champagne. Our server was delightful and just an overall great experience here. Would definitely come back.
author: Jessica F.

description:
The first time I tried to eat at Zazie, I gave up after waiting over an hour in the weekend brunch line. This time, I came on a Monday and didn't have to wait at all (even though the restaurant was still quite busy). After eating brunch here, I totally understand why the weekend wait is so insane!

I ordered the Un, Deux, Trois: 1 gingerbread pancake, 2 eggs, and 3 pieces of bacon. The gingerbread pancake, topped with lemon curd, butter, and a slice of roasted pear, was fluffy perfection! It's just the right amount of sweetness and the gingerbread pairs perfectly with the lemon curd. Warning: it is a giant pancake (but I still finished it because it is THAT good!). The eggs and bacon were also delicious and provided the perfect balance to my meal. My dining companion shared his home fries with me and they were super flavorful -- cooked with whole cloves of garlic, yum!

This is such a cute, cozy restaurant that serves up a stellar brunch. I love that they pay their employees a living wage and that tips are incorporated into menu prices. The only thing that could have made this meal better would have been ordering one of their magical mimosas!
author: Elyse W.

description:
This place was AMAZING! I heard it's hard to get a reservation on a weekend, so I decided to go on a weekday since it's close to work. 

When my boyfriend and I walked in, we were immediately greeted by the staff and asked for our seating preference. We decided to sit in the back patio. The chairs and tables were a bit stiff, but the ambiance was incredible. 

I ordered their coffee, which was very smooth and warm. For the meal, I ordered the gluten-free pancakes. These are made with steel-cut oats and bananas cooked in the batter. It was one of the best pancakes I've ever had. It was very tasteful, and the hint of banana was a great touch. It was also nice knowing that it was a healthy brunch.

I will 100% come back here.
author: Remy B.

description: I want to give higher stars since it's such a popular neighborhood brunch place but I just don't think my experience was that good. The price point is on the slightly high side and the food didn't impress me. I'm not saying it wasn't good, it's just I've been so many brunch places that blew my mind. Zazie just seems pretty ordinary. And the dishes weren't even completely warm when we got them so... The service was not very attentive. The waiting process was ridiculous (their estimate was off by a lot so we didn't come back in time and missed our spot and had to put our names down again -- took us 2.5 hours for a table of 4). The one tiny bathroom is outside and if you don't want to wait in line again after waiting in line for your food, you need to go next door. Overall, I wouldn't say it was a bad experience but I likely won't be recommending it to people or coming back.
author: Iris H.

description: My fiancé and I have been planning on trying this place out and decided to try this place out on a week day since it's packed on the weekends but OH MAN was it packed on a Tuesday morning!!! Great thing was we only had to wait less than 10 minutes to be seated at the patio. It's a very small restaurant so anyone who can't handle tight spaces should refrain from this place! I ordered the Sarah Janes Griddle Flight which consisted of one butter milk pancake, ginger bread pancake, and regular french toast and my fiancé ordered the French Toast Tahiti which consisted of bananas and walnuts. We also ordered a side of homemade fries which was so delicious. The pancakes were okay but both the regular and Tahiti French Toast was delicious! I wouldn't come here again but it's a great place to try at least once if you're in the area!
author: Neloffer E.

description:
I do not typically write Yelp reviews, but we had an absolutely horrendous, even racist service today at Zazie. We were not speaking English, but we can speak English fluently, and our curly-haired waitress (wearing a gray shirt) did some things that infuriated us and were downright racist:

-          She wouldn't refill water, despite nicely asking her. And, she brought it instantly to the Caucasian family next to us

-          She downright refused to take a picture for us, but minutes later, she happily took a picture for the Caucasian family

-          She asked us where we're from. We told her where we are from and her response was a very blunt and obviously negative - "Hmmm"

-          Her attitude was generally negative towards us, despite being cheerful to the Caucasian family

The food was amazing, but given the undoubtedly racist behavior of the waitress (my first time ever experiencing Racism in San Francisco, this is the first and easiest one-star Yelp review I have ever given).

I will never eat here again, and I hope others never experience this again when eating at Zazie; and, I hope this post encourages others to speak up about any other potential racist experiences they had at Zazie. I feel awful from this experience.
author: AJ M.

description:
I was so excited to finally get to this place, I'm a Eggs Benedict crazy fan; I was not amazed by its flavor, were good yes but not the flavor explosion that I was expected, hollandaise sauce was good, potatoes were delicious; EXCELLENT service
May I come back?, yes and order different plate
author: Gabriela R.

description:
Loved the fact that this restaurant states clearly that patrons don't need to tip, but I found the plate that I ordered to be mediocre. 

I had the smoked wild salmon sandwich and while it tasted alright, I couldn't distinguish anything special or unique about the dish. It just tasted like smoked salmon on a slab of bread with cream cheese and some greens and capers. 

On the other hand, I do appreciate that the restaurant supports their employees by providing them with livable wage that includes benefits and 401Ks, which is a unique business model that I haven't quite encountered in the restaurant industry. 

Since Zazie is known to be a popular brunch spot, I may come back and try some of their egg dishes, and see if I enjoy that more. However, with the insane wait and not being able to make reservations, I don't think I'll be coming back anytime soon.
author: Allison T.

description:
I came here for brunch with friends and I loved it!  There was a bit of a wait, which I'm sure you've read in several reviews but it really wasn't that bad - maybe 30 minutes because we specifically wanted to sit in the outdoor area and we came on a holiday weekend.  I was really expecting to wait at least an hour.

I ordered the La Mer and everyone else also ordered some kind of Eggs Benedict and everyone was definitely pleased with their meals.  The eggs were poached perfectly, and the garlic in those potatoes were to die for.  I did originally think everything here was too expensive, but once I realized it was a no tip restaurant I totally understood. 

The service here was great as well.  I hope all the employees that work here are as happy as we were with our experience!
author: Cori A.

description:
I honestly don't know what the hype is. 

I came here on a Tuesday for brunch at 11am. We were seated right away, with our choice of indoor or outdoor seating, which was lovely. I mean, this is expected for a Tuesday anyway, right? Anyway, my friend and I ordered food within 10 mins of getting there. We didn't receive our food until 11:40am!!!! Omg. Mind you, the restaurant is only 50% full of customers. So basically, half empty.

Not only that, but the food was disappointing. I ordered the Genevieve scramble, which comes with black forest ham, white cheddar, and haas avocados, with your choice of toast and home fries or salad. To be honest, the scramble was too watery and cheesy. A weird combo. Usually avocados can save the day, but they barely put any. Maybe 1/4 of a small avocado. The home fries were too crispy, slightly burnt. 

The service was frustrating. Yes, they were extremely friendly and seemed to love their job. However, why the hell did it take half an hour to get our food?! The whole restaurant was NOT even slammed at all. It seemed like the cooks in the back were on their 30 min lunch break. And why did it take another hour to get our check?! I wish they were more attentive to us. I don't know WHY they AUTOMATICALLY include service charge when their service is ABSOLUTE CRAP. 

If I am paying for your health insurance, and automatic tip, I expect top of the line service. It says on their website that, "All of our menu prices include a living wage, revenue share, paid family leave, fully funded health & dental insurance, paid time off, and a 401(k) with employer match for all of our hard working employees."

I should have complained that their employees are NOT hard working. It is employees like these that expect high wages, great benefits, for sitting on their butts while working. I know another job for them; it's called an office job. It also says on their website that they're, "Proud to be tip free." There is nothing prideful about providing employees work where they can just act however they want, while still receiving tips regardless.

Never coming back here.
author: Jocelyn L.

description:
Found this cute little brunch spot before visiting the Cal Academy of Sciences nearby.  Enjoyed a yummy meal in a beautiful setting.

Parking and Seating:  Since the restaurant is in SF there is not designated parking, but we were able to find street parking just a few blocks away.  The interior of the restaurant makes you feel like you've been transported to France. It's adorable decorated  and has a very cozy atmosphere.  We asked to sit on the back patio, and if the weather is good I totally recommend it! It's a small space cloaked in vines and greenery, and it's absolutely beautiful. The perfect spot for a nice quiet brunch.

Vegetarian options:  There were quite a few yummy options to pick from.  To avoid having to decide my friend and I decided to share the Eggs Vincent (grilled corn cake with spinach, avocados, spicy goat cheese, and poached eggs) and Fresh Lemon Ricotta raviolis.  The flavors were simple but well balanced, and it was overall a yummy meal.  I do wish the portions were slightly larger for the prices, but otherwise I had no issues with the food.

Cocktails:  I would definitely recommend this place if you like mimosas with your brunch because the widest range of options and some of the most unusual placer combos I have ever seen.  They infuse their mimosas with flavors like mint and elderflower, and instead of using juice they add small scoops of sorbet. So refreshing! We ordered the special "Magic Mimosa" which contained mint and green apple sorbet, and it was so delicious! They will even let you customize the flavor of your mimosa. The options are endless.

Service:  The staff was nice and attentive, and the service was all-around very quick.

I'll be keeping this spot in mind for the next time I'm in this part of the city.  Definitely want to revisit to other mimosa flavors
author: Sapna P.

description:
Amazing. The brunch at Zazie is second to none; they have a fantastic selection of sweet and savory dishes, with rotating specials that are always worth considering. Their Bloody Mary is spicy and flavorful, and the home fries are a perfect mix of crunchy and salty, with roasted garlic mixed in. My favorite dishes are the New York scramble (with lox, green onions, and cream cheese) and the Salade Niçoise (perfectly seared tuna and very fresh veggies). If you are indecisive, get the Un Deux Trois with a miracle pancake and a side of fresh fruit.

Because it is San Francisco, you can expect a significant wait for weekend brunch. That's okay; Cole Valley is super cute. Put your name on the list and walk north to Ice Cream Bar (sundaes before brunch are totally acceptable, don't tell me otherwise). If there's a long wait and the weather is nice, you will probably even have time to walk to Tank Hill Park and back.

Don't overlook Zazie for dinner either. The wait will be shorter, the menu won't have Eggs Benedict, but it's still delicious. I've had the roasted trout, the duck leg, and the pasta of the day; every time I've walked out stuffed and grinning.

Expert mode: come for lunch on Wednesdays when the kitchen staff makes dozens of their favorite tacos. Incredible.
author: Alex L.

description:
Great breakfast in the city. Must have been one of the few places open on Monday because there was a big crowd. Pancakes were SO soft. They provide a blackberry jam and that was great with the cakes. 

The food is good American breakfast with a French twist (artwork, theme, etc)
Food can be pricey because it reflects how well the restaurant pays their employees. A tip isn't required or expected because they pay living wage plus full benefits, which is really great!
author: Layla E.

description: We had the prix fixe menu and this was all that was left at the end of a fantastic meal. Great price for San Francisco. I had the trout and my husband had the pasta. Dessert included. Creme brûlée and pot de creme. Yum.
author: Joyce H.

description:
One of my favorite places for breakfast or brunch in San Francisco. 

The scrambled eggs and their toasts are beyond amazing and totally worth the wait - yes they almost always have waiting but it moves much faster. 

Their house potatoes have a nice garlicy flavor - it also has pieces of garlic in it with the skin - so watch out for that. 

Also don't forget to try their french toast or pancakes - save room for that.
author: Rupa S.

description:
Zazie is so, so good! I've only been there for brunch, but I've heard that their dinners are good too. 

I've gotten lots of things from here like eggs benedicts, french toast, pancakes, and just your other classic brunch stuff. I really enjoyed their mimosas because they had different juice flavors.

Just be prepared to wait and don't go with a huge group, otherwise you'll wait even longer!
author: Stephanie K.

description:
Great place for breakfast/brunch.

The new Yorker omelet was delicious!

Be prepared to wait..

Neighborhood gem!

First come 1st serve for outside street seating.
Clipboard near the door to put your name on.
author: Michele R.

description: Was here on a Sunday afternoon around 1.30 and they had a super long line. It was worth it though. The La Mer Benedict  was really good!
author: Sunil R.

description:
First, can we take a moment to applaud Zazie's on the fact that they are tip-free? The top of their menu states that their employees are paid a living wage and benefits (which they also list, but I won't), all of which are included in their menu prices. As a result, the prices are a couple of dollars more than other brunch places in SF, but still reasonable considering how much they care for their employees. Love it!

As for food, we got the St. Trop Benedict (with wild salmon, capers, red onions), which was really good and savory. Also tried the French Toast Tahiti - super soft and sweet! Zazie also gives you the option of different-sized portions in the form of 1, 2, or 3 eggs/pieces of french toast.

The place is quite small, so I wouldn't recommend for groups larger than four. It sits in a old-school-looking space (and plates to match), with a brick wall on one end and a skylight. Staff is friendly and attentive.
author: Winnie N.

description: Amazing food and service! I had a white peach and black currant mimosa, Lemon Crumble Pound Cale with Meyer lemon glaze and blueberry compote and an omelette with bacon, goat cheese, caramelized onions and arugula! Everything was made perfect. The waitress was very knowledgeable and versed on the menu and the area. The Lemon Pound cake was my favorite! Moist, full of flavor and not overly sweet. The goat cheese made the omelette sooo creamy. Excellent meal. We arrived at 830a and there was already a line; highly recommended to get there early.
