They don't open till 9a but a long line had formed by that time.
author: Mara W.

description:
This place definitely answers for all of its reviews. Was our last morning in SF area and we decided to go to this place as our friend said it's packed on the weekend and if there's no wait get in and go. We walked in and got a seat immediately. The four stars is honestly just for the seating, when you go to the patio you are cramped. But that's honestly nitpicking this place because they make it up with their food and quick service. 

Right when we sat down we were immediately welcomed and told about the menu which was very pleasing. The menu is set up with how many eggs you want either 1,2,3 eggs and they are all differently priced. I got 2 gets scrambled with sausage and bacon. Super simple and it was delicious. Seems like they make their jelly in house as well because it looked and tasted fresh. 

We also got the eggs Benedict and who I was with is gluten free and they have gluten free English muffins. The company that they use for their gluten free products is Glutino, that company still bothers them so they got a bread less English muffin and it was still delicious. 

This place meets the hype and if you can get in for brunch get and in go. As I said I docked a star off because of just how cramped you feel in the place. But the food will make you look over that. 

Also they do not expect tips with their checks. As someone that tips constantly was caught off guard with that because it's the first place in the US that I have been to that makes it known that they do not expect the tips.
author: Brian M.

description:
A French-inspired brunch place with the comforts and portions of America. 

The brunch dishes (especially the savory ones) were delicious, with what I think of as the most defining feature of French cuisine -- cooking simple ingredients in a way that makes them taste even more like themselves. My bacon was rich and crisp. The provencal tomatoes on my benedict had somehow been cooked and intensified while remaining hunky and juicy. But a friend's pan-grilled trout was even better, with fish, peppers, olives, and goat cheese somehow combined into bites of simple, briny, powerful goodness. 

All of this was combined with huge portions, free-flowing coffee, a very patient waiter (who was both forgiving and doting to our wiggly baby), and a restaurant that pays a living wage and includes service on the bill -- an incredibly civilized custom for an incredibly civilized place.
author: William B.

description:
Waited in line for more than 1 hour to get seated. There is a big note saying not to ask the waiters how much time it is going to take to get you seated.
The restaurant claims to be "tip free" but everyone knows what it actually means.
Menu is very clearly organized. I will rate 5 star only for this one feature. You can customize the quantity like 1/ 2 / 3 eggs, pancakes, etc. 

Ordered Eggs Florentine, lemon ricotta pancakes and Zazie Signature tea.
Eggs Florentine --) OK--) Eggs perfectly poached but the sides potatoes and garlic are burnout. Also too much garlic. Attached photo.
2 Lemon Ricotta pancakes aka Miracle pancakes--) Tasted Bland. I was not able to eat them without maple syrup. Comes with house made lemon curd, raspberry sauce. Attached photo.
Signature Tea -- It sounds so good when you read in the menu because they claim lavender, rose hips, blah ...  blah ... blah.. But it was just another bland tea.

I wouldn't wait in line for more than an hour for such an average brunch.
author: Krishna M.

description: I think Zazie has the potential to be super good, but the food just wasn't out of this world. I got the speciality pancake, which was a banana bread and one pancake with fruit. They were both just okay, definitely not out of this world. However, my sister loved her eggs Vincent, one of the specials and the waiters were all so nice and very attentive. The food was just disappointing in comparison, especially considering the price.
author: Abigail K.

description:
3.5 stars for food but the fact that they're a no-tip establishment pushed it to 4. 

Definitely get there early! My friend and I got confused because there was a line of people forming up, so we naturally joined the line, but it turns out the line doesn't mean anything. Make sure to put your name down on the clipboard near the door! We should have been in the first seating of people but had to wait an additional 45 min because of our error. They REALLY should make it more clear! 

The restaurant has a really nice ambiance to it, especially in the back patio. It's larger than it looks from the outside, which is even more impressive because the kitchen is really small. 

I ordered the New York scrambled eggs (smoked salmon, cream cheese, green onion) and my friend had an eggs benedict that was one of their daily specials which came with prawns and avocado. We also split a slice of french toast. 

First off, the home fries are amazing! Super crispy with whole roasted garlic cloves that are amazing. The lemon hollandaise that came with the eggs benedict was also delicious. My eggs came with a really solid amount of smoked salmon, but overall I was a little disappointed/unsatisfied because I felt like the entire plate was a tad greasy. I was also really excited to try the jam with the toast, but it seemed like it was just plain Smucker's strawberry jam. French toast was just alright. I've had way better elsewhere. 

Service was good, if a bit rushed, which is understandable given the amount of people waiting for your spot. Prices are a tad high but Zazie completely makes up for it by doing away with tips! Really want to come back and try their dinner service.
author: Melissa H.

description:
Surprised I haven't reviewed zazie before. They have a great outdoor back patio, and as such get quite busy - even on a weekday. I've only been for brunch so that's what I'll talk about. 

They are a tip less restaurant, which I know - some people  are really for and some people are really against. But whatever your view is on the topic, when looking at the prices, when they look high to start, remember you won't leave tip (and if you were going to leave 18-20% like you should it's pretty comparable). 

I got the omelette du jour which was quite good! Bacon, arugula, carmalized onion and goat cheese. Delicious combo and plenty of all the fillings. I like their potatoes because they have whole roasted garlic cloves in them. 

The Benedicts are fun too because you can order one, two, or three eggs. They have a bunch of kinds and if you got really crazy you could try more than one!
author: Sarah C.

description:
4.5

Came here for a Saturday brunch around 11 and ended up being seated around 11:45. Not too bad, there's a bar next door that's usually open where you can hang out and wait. There are also 4 tables out front that are first come first serve.

I loved the feel of the inside of Zazie, it really felt like home. The tables weren't too close together but the vibe was still cozy. Our waiter was great.

I had a mango mimosa (not as big as they seem like they used to be as pictured in some yelp photos) and the benedict La Mer (per yelp recommendation). I got the benedict with 1 egg and home fries.

The potatos are soooooo gooooooood. That's all I have to say about that.

The portion of the 1 egg benedict seemed to be the perfect amount for me. My friend got a 2 egg benedict and couldn't finish it. The crab tasted fresh and everything went together well. Big fan. Pricy for the portion.

My friends got:
Prawn benedict - friend complained it was a bit heavy after a while, and not that many pieces of prawn
Smoked salmon scramble - friend was moaning with joy
Smoked salmon benedict - friend finished it lol

Overall, nice brunch experience. Everyone seemed to enjoy their food, the La Mer was especially good. Definitely pricey, but they don't take tip.
author: Gwendelyn W.

description:
Zazie's is a very cool restaurant in Cole Valley.  Two of us had an early dinner - 6PM.  They are known for brunch - but you have to try Zazzie's for dinner. 

Service was spectacular.  Prompt delivery of food and drinks, with friendly chatting.  

Food - we had a simple salad with goat cheese, the polenta squares, and white trout.  The polenta sat in an awesome tomato based sauce.  The trout was cooked perfectly.   Lemon cake to share - incredibly good.  

We sat outside on the patio under the canvas cover on a night when it rained - monsoon-like rain.  The wind blew rain onto us diners. We didn't get too wet and it added to the outdoor patio experience.  If its raining, shoes your seats wisely. 

I highly recommend Zazzie's.  

An economic note - Zazzie's advertises that it pays its staff a living wage, provides medical and retirement benefits and so on.  They do not have a tip line on the CC bills.  No tipping.  I like that Zazie's has built a business model that charges an amount to pay for staff benefits and a wage that does not require tipping.  I did not consider the cost of the meal to be out of line with other SF restaurants.  I do not like when restaurants (like some in, for example, San Mateo) add a surcharge to the bill to cover minimum wage increases or other mandated costs.  This is a cost of doing business in a city and state that has decided to be "progressive" and the restaurant has chosen to do business there.  They should all do as Zazie's has done - get over it and charge what is necessary to make a restaurant in a high cost of living location work.  I applaud how Zazie's is making the economics of having a business in SF work for them and their staff.
author: Raymond M.

description:
Love love LOVE the brunch here!

The hubs and I came here on a Friday afternoon and there was a short wait. We shared the pancake flight and a Cannes egg scramble (bacon, tomatoes, cheese) which came with a side of toast and homefries. I enjoy choices so it was nice that the flight allowed us to try their buttermilk pancake, gingerbread pancake, AND french toast. Their menus say that they charge more for their food in order to pay their employees better wages and don't expect tips. I thought this was a cool idea and didn't think the prices were bad at all for the quality of food and service! 

We're planning to come back and brave the lines this weekend, wish us luck! :)
author: Beverly T.

description: I was in town from Los Angeles working at Outside Lands and Yelped breakfast and brunch and this is the first to come up so I decided to try. Overall it is a beautiful, cottage-like ambiance with back outdoor patio seating. I got the Eggs Vincent which is 2 sunny side eggs on a small bed of corn salsa and other veggies, comes with a side of potatoes or a salad. Food was good nothing I can't make at home myself, service was excellent!
author: Gabriela E.

description:
Zazie's is yummy, but the wait could be very long. I came here in a party of 5 on a Sunday around 10:30 AM. Since it is prime brunch time, we ended up waiting for a little over an hour to get seated and maybe another 20 to 30 minutes to get our food.

All of us ordered some variation of the eggs benedict, but I was really impressed with the St. Trop or the smoked salmon. I also really like how you could customize the size of your order. Because I wasn't too hungry, I just got one eggs benedict with home fries. Their hollandaise sauce is not too creamy and light, so it doesn't feel like a heavy meal. The home fries are exceptional potatoes with fried garlic. They are super crispy. The lemon pancakes are also some of the best pancakes I've ever had. The flavor of the pancakes was subtle, but the lemon curd really brings it home and the tartness of the raspberry just makes it even better! Overall, I would highly recommend Zazie's, but the downside is that it's likely that the wait to get seated and fed will be long.
author: Christina Y.

description:
TL;DR Great brunch spot, get the homefries!!!

The food was so so so good. I shared the eggs Benedict and pancakes with a friend. The eggs Benedict were rich and creamy, but not too overwhelming. The pancakes were nice and fluffy, but the winner was the homefries that came with the eggs Benedict. (Shoutout to the server who helped us choose our side). I feel like most restaurants have dry, crumbly home fries just to take up space on the plate, but these were SO GOOD. They were golden brown and crispy on the outside, soft and fluffy on the inside. The seasoning and garlic really hit it out of the ball park. They even had some roasted garlic with the potatoes. So so decadent. I could eat a whole plate of their home fries. 

This is on the pricier end of brunch establishments, but it's worth it because you're getting great quality!
author: Sophia L.

description:
Zazie's will always be a brunch favorite. It's a MUST if you live in San Francisco. BIGGEST TIP TO AVOID LINES: Get there when they open. They fill up the restaurant quickly and once the first round of people are seated, you have to wait about an hour until they are done eating. :/ SO get there when they open to avoid waiting an hour to 2 hours.

Zazie's has everything your little brunch heart desires- eggs benedicts, pancakes/waffles, omelettes, scrambles, french toast, huevos rancheros. A basic brunch list but everything is cooked very well with lots of flavor and looove. YOU WILL NOT REGRET WAKING UP AT 9AM FOR THIS.

Yummy brunch, reasonably priced, can't lose.
author: Marcie A.

description: Eggs Benedict was amazing! Love that you can order 1, 2, or 3 eggs. Never seen that done before and I love it! The bacon and tomato Benedict was perfect. The French toast was delicious. And for 2 people we waiting about 15-20 min at 10am on Saturday, pretty good!
author: Awmber M.

description: My first visit to Zazie was 16 years ago. I have returned about 3 times over the years, but not recently. My visit this morning was like seeing an old friend and picking up the conversation where we left off. It's such a solid brunch place. My visit this morning was exactly like the first, excellent food and service. I like how you can choose the size of your breakfast. We arrived a little before they opened and put our name on the wait list. After they opened we were seated quickly.
author: Lola R.

description:
With more than 3K reviews, Zazie has a large enough sample size that you can believe the 4 star rating. This is a solidly 4 star brunch joint, but because of that, I actually don't think it's worth making the effort to go to.

I'll start with my knocks. First, it's kind of out of the way. Cole Valley isn't one of the hot areas in the city to visit, so you probably will have to make a specific trip to get here. Second, the wait is very long. We arrived around 10AM to see many people milling about outside in the sun. Our wait for 2 ended up being about 2 hours. Third, it is a small restaurant, so it's a bit cramped inside, and because of the wait, there's enough social pressure to hustle along.

Despite all of those qualifiers, the actual meal was great. The service was friendly, and the menu is standard American brunch fare with a few twists. The menu allows you to order pretty much everything in 1s, 2s, or 3s (e.g. eggs, french toast), and they have a few daily offerings in addition to their regular menu, so you have reasons to go back. We ended up splitting the Tahitian french toast and eggs benedict. Both were delicious, and with 2 pieces each, we were plenty full. Oh, and their home fries are delicious. Definitely get those

If I had a reason to come back, I would happily go, but I don't think I would recommend going out of your way for it.
author: Kevin L.

description:
Truly a San Francisco gem. They do NOT accept tips, so the price on the menu is exactly what you are going to pay. The prices, however, do reflect that and are slightly higher than a normal brunch spot. I had a fab champagne drink and I split an eggs benny & a turkey sausage omelette with my sis. We didn't leave a crumb on either plate. We went Thursday morning and there was no wait around 11 am. I could see this place having brutal wait times on a Sunday morning, though, because it is pretty small! 

Also... they cook the potatoes with whole cloves of garlic right in there. I died and went to heaven. #GarlicIsMyBestFriend
author: Adriana C.

description: Loved the decor and vibe of this place. The kitchen is super small and everything is quite pricey, but tip is included so I can't say I'm surprised. My boyfriend and I shared a miracle pancake and an eggs benedict. Both were quite tasty, just wish everything wasn't so expensive.
author: Tessa K.

description: We arrived a couple of minutes after they opened. Luckily, we got in right away but there was a line when we left. Our waitress was very friendly and fast. I ordered 1 miracle pancake and 1 divorcee egg Benedict. Both were awesome! Probably the best pancake I've ever had. Fiancée ordered and loved her French toast. It was melt in your mouth delicious.
author: Juan M.

description:
I am fortunate enough to live a few blocks away from Zazie, and I walk by the delicious smell of bacon and eggs every morning on my to the N line. 

On weekends, the wait time is ridiculous. I once waited 2 hours for a table for four -- and it was super rainy and foggy that day too! In SF, people will wait for brunch like it's the olympic trials. (Thankfully, there are a few coffee shops down the street if you need some caffeine before interacting with people)

They do not do bottomless mimosas -- the highlight of this place is the very cute ambiance and the carefully crafted dishes. I always order the build-your-own-dish type thing with eggs, bacon, and a pancake, because the pancake of the day changes pretty frequently and the flavors are always good! 

I bet it's really romantic in the evenings for dinner -- they have a heated patio in the back! :o)
author: RachEl L.

description:
I have never finished an order of pancakes because they get boring after a few bites. Zazie changed all this: for the first time I demolished a stack of pancakes and wanted more. 

Shared the Miracle Pancakes (at the time, lemon poppyseed topped with strawberries on lemon curd) and the Albert eggs Benedict with a friend. Everything was soooooo good. I still think about those fluffy, delicious pancakes. 

Also, Zazie's prices include tip which is awesome for convenience sake and for workers' benefits! Cherry on the top of a perfect brunch. Just prepare to wait to be seated because it's a very popular place!
author: Jennifer W.

description:
Wait time was ridiculous, and they have a bad management system for seating. Kitchen and wait staff are very inefficient, and my friends and I spent about 2 hours and 15 minutes here. 15 minutes for eating and the rest of the 2 hours just waiting for the table and waiting for food. I understand that the place is popular and that there are other customers, but this is just not okay  

The Florentine eggs Benedict was absolutely amazing, but they were definitely not worth such a long wait. The French toast was mediocre, and they weren't cut aesthetically/exactly in half but cut crookedly and uneven shaped sizes. 

Quite done with this place.
author: Tiffany H.

description: Waited over an hour, so I was expecting some really good food. Just moved to the city so I was going off yelp reviews to see where to go for a good brunch. Ordered the La Mer and I'm going to assume that the chef forgot to add salt because it was literally tasteless. In addition, my sister and I were sat next to an older couple who seemed to know all of the servers. The waiters were talking about some person getting sexually assaulted and other very personal issues with the older couple right in front of me and my sister. I was really appalled that the waiters thought that this was appropriate behavior. I really wanted to like this place but I came out really disappointed.
author: P. S.

description:
zazie!! If this place wasn't crazy packed I'd be here every weekend. Great drinks, great food, great service. 

Plus they have the cutest little coke bottle magnets.
Be sure to come here early on weekends, and be prepared to wait.

It's worth the hype
author: Gidget S.

description:
The wait for brunch is expectedly long because SF peeps looooove their brunch. My friend put our names down early and when the host called us, we were waiting on a couple of people. He then made a comment about not liking liars, which I found a little rude. But I think he thought it was funny? 

The service was quick, the waiter was nice, and the food was amazing. The New York scramble (pictures below) had good portions of salmon, eggs, cheese, etc. (nothing was overwhelming). The mango mimosa was unique and delicious. They serve it with a rim of tajin chili powder which was BOMBB.
author: James Victor K.

description:
Delicious food! I had the Eggs en Fonte and my boyfriend had the Divorcee Egg Benedict both were  amazing. The French toast with fruit is the best I've ever had and I added some of their jam and bam even better. 

There is a long wait to be seated and to get your food but it's definitely worth the wait. I can't blame them for the wait though they produce magic with the small kitchen. The seats in the front outside are on a first come first serve basis. That's if you don't mind everyone waiting looking at you eat.
author: Indira R.

description:
3600 reviews, 4 stars and not a single bit overrated!

A Saturday visit at just after 10am resulted in a 40 minute wait for 2 but it was worth it for the lemon poppy seed miracle pancake and tahiti french toast that we had. The pancakes were perfectly fluffy with just a hint of sweetness and the lemon curd on top provided just the right amount of sweetness and tartness to balance each other out. The french toast was just the right thickness with plenty of flavor in the bread alone. If you like what basically tastes like banana bread, this french toast is for you because the banana-walnut spread in the middle hits that sweet spot. 

The portion sizes are also generous and filling, service is friendly and tip is included! I'll definitely be back some time to get some more of that pancake
author: Jason W.

description:
Mmm definitely one of those places where you finish every bite on your plate. Zazie has delicious options for every kind of breakfast lover. We tried the omelette special, a one egg Benedict with bacon and tomato, and a cornmeal pancake! 

The omelette had a thin egg layer with perfectly cooked veggies inside. They were slightly grilled and very tasty. The benedict had a wonderful hollandaise that worked well with the egg yolk. Smoky bacon and roasted tomato. The home fries were soft and crispy on the edges. I loved the texture and fuller flavor of the pancake because of the cornmeal! Topped with lemon curd and strawberry. Our table had homemade jam which was a nice touch! 

The garden patio in the back was so beautiful. Surrounded by greenery and even a vine that snaked around the patio. There's plenty of heat lamps to keep you warm during the chilly SF summer.
author: Jennifer D.

description: Excellent service and ambience but it fills up very fast. I arrived promptly at 9.00 AM on a Saturday when it just opened (no reservation) and in 10 mins it was full with a big crowd waiting outside to be seated as well.
author: George R.

description:
An extremely popular breakfast/brunch destination for locals and tourists alike because they deliver amazing meals. The wait can be insane, but with preparation and good timing you can be one of the first parties in the full house. 

With that said, on Saturdays Yelp says they open at 8am. WRONG. my gf and I showed up promptly at 7:50am only to see the restaurant sign say they open at 9am. Fast forward to 8:30am, there are parties already camping out at the front tables (which are first come first serve) and people waiting outside for the sign in sheet. By 8:45am there is a fully formed line for the sign in sheet which hasn't even come out yet. People start signing in and by 9am parties are getting sat and caffeine is being poured. 

The menu is a little bit on the pricy side because they include the tip, a little comforting knowing the employees of Zazie are taken care of but got me wondering, what if I did leave a tip?? Where would it go?? 

Anyway, I got the Pierre Noir Benedict and the lady got the Croque Madame. She got a cafe au lait which COMES IN AN ACTUAL BOWL and I got a great cup of coffee. The tomatoes on the Benedict were of European taste, it did not taste like regular California tomatoes, whatever that means. But Zazie changed the name of the game for tomatoes on Benedicts. I loved the potatoes as they were crispy and well cooked. 

Service was attentive, extremely friendly and polite. Come early, stay awhile and enjoy the food and company. It's a great way to start any day. A plus is Haight/Ashbury is only a few blocks away!
author: Elizabeth M.

description:
TL;DR: Yummy food, awesome service

Went here for dinner on a Wednesday at 7:30. We had a reservation to sit outside because we were bringing our dog. We sat down immediately. They had heaters for outside seating which was great. Ordered the:

* Lemon ricotta ravioli
* Pasta d'ete
* Figs Figaro (Grilled figs with greens & goat cheese on toast)

Everything was really tasty and served quickly. The dishes might be slightly expensive but tip is included so I think it balances out as well.

Finally, the wait staff was awesome! Our server was super sweet and brought our dog water and treats. She told us about their Monday night dog event where they allow dogs to the back patio (I had a quick look and it looked cute back there) and $10 off a bottle of wine if you bring your dog! Planning on coming back for that, and also to check out their brunch :)
author: Dana Y.

description:
So. Freaking. Good. The the Mexican scrambled eggs blew my mind. The ambiance is great and the wait staff is really pleasant and helpful. 

I went during the week and got a table for two instantly (I hear the weekends are a little tougher). 

Highly recommend this place.
author: Jess A.

description:
We arrive to the place at 9:50 on Sunday while they open 9:00. We have waited 1 hour 30 minutes to get seated. The waiting was crazy long and by the time they let us in, we were anxious, hungry, inpatient and kind of angry. Thr menu is interesting, for most of brunch menu you can order 1/2/3, we ordered 3 dishes for two. We have ordered Divorcée, Taiti french toast, gingerbread pancakes. 

The food was really great. They have a no-policy and they pay their employees really well. Employees have dental and health insurance and 401k. Overall, we enjoyed our brunch over there, but if you want to go there, plan ahead or show up at 9:00 sharp
author: Roozbeh Z.

description:
I can say that this is the best brunch place I've ever been to within the United States. I may have not wrote reviews on others but I believe that I've been to quite a few as I'm a lazy to cook rather eat out person. 
I can't remember the exact name of the dishes I've had but the Benedict with prosciutto- that's just fantastic. 
It was a day trip to SF with my friend from Ukiah and we thought we'd try this place out - an article we found said this apparently is adele's favorite place. 
So we tried the Benedict with prosciutto & salad and walnut banana french toast. It was just heavenly. We didn't have high expectations to begin with but the food just melted in my mouth!! I don't know what other words i could say other than just heaven dancing on your Tastebuds. Also the place & plates are so adorable. 
So after that first visit we made couple more day trips & weekend trips to SF just to go to Zazie again. So we ended up trying quite some of the menu but i would still pick benedict with prosciutto & that walnut banana french toast as the best plate.
I moved from the area now so I won't be able to visit here unless i fly there and that really upsets me.. 
so if you happen to visit or lay over at SF, please do try this place out for brunch.
Oh and i almost forgot to mention that the staff are so friendly yet polite.
I would give 5+ stars for the brunch but 4 for dinner as in food. So if you can, try to grab brunch from here.
There's generally a long line waiting to be seated so try early when they've just opened or 1h-30min the break time.
author: Jisoo K.

description: Prob one of the best brunch places in sf. Get it w potatoes. Eat it w the garlic, if u dont eat it w the garlic, you must not be from here.. back patio is dope. Mimosa w sorbet is the shizzle
author: Jose J.

description:
I came here for brunch, and everything on the menu looked amazing. I ended up ordering a miracle pancake along with a side of eggs. The miracle pancake is huge, and it is one of the best pancakes I ever had! 

As great as the pancakes were, I'm giving Zazie's a four because the coffee was a bit watered down and service was pretty slow even with it not being super busy during an early weekday. But would def come here again.. still drooling thinking over that delicious pancake I ate! :) 

Beware.. apparently it gets pretty hectic here for brunch on weekends.. be prepared for a wait.
author: Jackie C.

description:
Maybe I came on an off-day or maybe this food just doesn't suite my palate, but I honestly don't understand the hype for Zazie. The ambience is very nice and you can choose to sit both indoors and outdoors on the patio but when it comes to the food it just doesn't deliver.

I tried both the poppy seed pancakes and the Croque Madame and neither dish had any sort of "wow" factor or any memorable taste at all. By no means were either of the dishes bad, it's just that they tasted like your run-of-the-mill pancakes and sandwiches that you can easily make for yourself at home. Definitely not worth an hour long wait, and I just think that with so many better options in the city, I can't see myself coming back for a second round.
author: Tyler W.

description: Food is excellent. Wait time is not. It took us 45-60 mins of waiting around until we got sat. Their Benedict's are delicious. Try them during the week if you don't want to wait too long.
author: Farzan M.

description: Excellent french toast and conveniently located next door to Finnegan's if you need to drink to pass the wait time.
author: Joshua S.

description:
Zazie has been at the top of my brunch list ever since Adele said this is the one spot she would return to California for! 

Came here on Saturday around noon, and it was still packed (waited about 30 minutes for a party of 2). The interior is quite small, but there is an outdoor patio as well. Service was great and very friendly! 

For food, we shared an order of french toast and eggs benedict, both of which were great! The breakfast potatoes are some of the best I've had! One thing I really appreciate about their menu is that you can get just 1 egg or 1 slice of french toast if you wanted. 

Pricing is fairly standard for the city, but Zazie is also unique in that they are tip free! Definitely recommend and would return!
author: Alyssa P.

description:
Absolutely delicious pancakes that are worth the wait!

The wait is always aggressive, so come early, write your name down and grab a coffee (or beer) nearby as Cole Valley is a super cute neighborhood.

Added bonus: they have an extensive mimosa list. If the weather is nice, try to sit outside in the back patio.
author: Sejal D.

description:
Went to the restaurant with a friend. Decided to order the chicken liver pate app to share; friend ordered Le Canard for entree; I ordered the seafood stew; and we finished with the goat cheesecake and baked hot chocolate for dessert. Both of us thought the food was great (personally I found the hot chocolate to be a bit too sweet, but friend found it irresistible so no doubt it's perfect as a guilty pleasure.

Tips are already factored in the menu price, like how it is in France. Found the service to be excellent and much better than traditional American restaurant. Overall had a wonderful time and would recommend to all.
author: David Q.

description: Really liked this French style cafe.  Was there for breakfast and had Florentine/ mushroom omelet.  Perfect size; great diced potatoes: crispy with garlic bulbs sautéed in. No need to tip; included.  A little bit more expensive than other locals but worth it
author: Diane L.

description:
I came here for brunch one weekend at the behest of my friends. I opted for the smoked salmon Eggs Benedict, which was decent - the eggs were cooked nicely and I liked the home fries, which featured roasted garlic cloves that made for a flavorful side. We also shared a pumpkin pancake dish that was mediocre; while the pancakes were fluffy, we all agreed that it was overly sweet. Our server was friendly enough, and the interior is well-lit with interesting decor.

This place seems to get a lot of hype for brunch and I must admit I don't quite understand why - while I enjoyed my meal, there wasn't anything exceptional about it that warranted the wait.
author: Oliver L.

description:
"Breakfast for the price of dinner" 
Funny thing... the bakery failed to deliver the brioches used for making their signature dish: French toast.
The lemon-poppy seed pancakes were very good, though do not pour any of the fake maple syrup on them!
The Monaco eggs Benedict were good, though the potatoes came with too much garlic.
The egg nog cappuccinos were very good.
The scrambled eggs with veggies were slightly undercooked and flavorless.
No tipping is required because everything costs about 30% or more. Two eggs: $10.
 It is high-minded to give your employees a living wage, but you are passing all the cost to your customers!
Service was nothing special nor friendly.
The bathroom is definitely Third World.
We won't be returning...
author: ColomboArgentino C.

description: I love this place. It's been around forever and they never let me down. They have outdoor seating up front on a first come first serve basis and a back patio that's very nice. I sat by myself in the front and enjoyed my Smoked Salmon Benedict so much under the sun. It was delicious and my drink was awesome.  There's a very tasty and creative cocktail menu. They allow you to choose one, two, or three of eggs of Benedict! I think that is great because sometimes I'm more hungry than other days. They treat their employees well with a good benefits package. Their prices include the tip so you don't have to add one unless you want to bump it. This makes it easy for splitting the bill with a big group. They do actually accommodate small to large groups even at lunch/brunch time. The dude makes it happen. My friend has also rented out the whole place for her birthday and even then, the food was great.
author: Jen L.

description:
Food: 3.5/5
I personally ordered off their daily special menu and got an Omelette du Jour. The eggs were cooked just right and bacon was crispy as promised on the menu. I opted for wheat toast and salad for the sides, which were toasted and dressed perfectly. Overall an enjoyable meal but I wouldn't say it was anything "special" considering it was on the special menu. I would've loved to see more variety or unique savory recipes that I could only get here at Zazie's. 

Service: 5/5
Came here on a Wednesday afternoon with a group of 8. We were seated immediately in the back patio. All of the staff were friendly and attentive. The wait for food wasn't long at all. 

Ambience: 4/5
I really enjoyed the back patio area which suited my type of aesthetic - wooden seats/benches and tables, some greenery, and cute lantern decorations. It has heated seating so definitely would not be an issue if it were a colder day. Other seating options included the indoors area and outdoors by the entrance. In general, seating is pretty cramped, but they do manage to seat large groups.

Cost: 3/5
I paid in total $20 for just my meal. Their menu prices essentially already includes tip given that they're a tip-free restaurant.
author: Althea H.

description: Zazie is spectacular for brunch, they also have a no tip policy which is pretty cool. Zazie gets really, really busy on the weekends. So if you are looking for brunch, expect a pretty long wait, and to have people eager to snatch your seat once you are done. With that being said, if you are able to go on a weekday, I do recommend this much more! Also the benedicts, and the pancakes are what I ordered and it was all awesome. Give it a check out!
author: Ross S.

description:
One of my favorite brunch places in SF! I have been here countless times over the years and countless more when the wait was too ridiculous so I had to pass it up. I would recommend coming on a weekday and putting your name down then grabbing a coffee from Peet's or another cafe nearby. I was also able to reserve a table for a large group for a birthday celebration by calling the restaurant. 

I love the ambiance of Zazie. It's so cute and French and I adore the back patio (with heat lamps, which is essential for outdoor dining in SF). Service was also always friendly though sometime can feel rushed since they're so busy all the time. 

In terms of food, I usually get one of their benedicts, my favorite being the La Mer (with dungeness crab and avocado, can you get more SF than that?). I try to be healthy and get the salad on the side but omg their home fries are incredible, especially with the grilled garlic that's all mushy and delicious when spread on a piece of toast.

Zazie is one of the first brunches I've had in SF and it remains the gold standard of all brunches for me!
author: Wendan L.

description:
Yum yum yum.

Recently went here for brunch. We got mimosas (mango and a spicy one), french toast and pancake. The pancake was truly brilliant - one of the best I've had. I got the basic one. Everything was really delicious, especially the service.

We sat in the patio and it's a really cute space. Also, the fact that this restaurant takes care of their employees makes me like them even more.
author: Namrata J.

description:
Zazie is a popular brunch place with a long waiting list and no tips required. It is cozy inside, food is good, service is nice & polite.

I had a french toast, two slices. It was quite good, with walnuts & apple something in between. There was a nice maple syrup on the side.

My husband had pumpkin pancakes. He wasn't a fan because they were a little dry. However, it was a good brunch.

The only thing is that I do not recommend coming on Sunday in between 10am-12pm cause the wait list is insane. Zazie is nice and food is good, but after such a ling wait anything would taste good.

It is very refreshing when tips are not expected. The menu is a little pricier but it comes from the good place. As a result, servers are really nice and energized. 

Zazie is nice, give it a try!
author: Julia G.

description:
TL;DR: If you have time to kill, a must-try spot for brunch.

Kept seeing Zazie pop up in my recommendations, so thought I'd give it a try. NOTE: If you have an appointment or some schedule to keep to, you might want to skip it, it's a long and somewhat unpredictable wait even on weekdays. This is also NOT a place to visit with a group size larger than 4.

It's pretty cramped and small inside, guests have to shuffle around as new guests come and go. It's busy and bustling so the noise quotient is on the higher end, which may not be to everyone's liking. 

The menu is pretty standard fare, with fresh/zesty spins on traditional items. I ordered the Mexican mocha and tuna sandwich off the brunch menu. The mocha arrived in a ceramic bowl, piping hot and sprinkled with just the right amount of cinnamon on top. The tuna sandwich was fresh, crisp, and bursting with flavor and hit the spot. Don't leave without trying the jam sitting in a jar on your table, you'll regret it, trust me. I would definitely return to try other items on the menu. Zazie should also consider investing in a somewhat larger space in the future given the growing crowds and wait times.
author: Naveen H.

description:
Absolutely worth the hour and a half wait on Monday for a large party table in the patio. Efficient and exceeded expectations. There was some bill confusion with our large party but the hospitality they showed was really impressive for how much they manage during the morning/brunch shift. 

We all enjoyed our food and the mimosas were a great deal for the city market.
author: Jennifer L.

description: This place is perfect for a first date, 10 year anniversary, and everything in between. I came here with friends and we sat on the back patio and had a great time. Get the potatoes! They'll change your life.
author: Melissa M.

description:
COME EARLY IF YOU DON'T WANT TO WAIT! (You've been warned!)

The first time I came, I ordered the Niçoise salad and thought it was just ok. This second time, however, I ordered their more classic Avignon scramble (with tomato, zucchini, and eggplant) and thought it was seasoned and cooked perfectly!
 As a big eggplant fan, I loved that the eggplant tasted caramelized - almost like baba ganoush! And while eggplant isn't usually used as an ingredient in egg scrambles, per say, I highly recommend you try this dish if you're looking for a more vegetable-heavy or healthier dish.
author: Connie X.

description: Far more expensive than expected. All the entrees are around $30 tips included. The back patio would be nice, but we had to leave early because there were rats. We have seen at least 3 rats trying to get on the tables. One of the he girls in our group freaked out seeing the third rat - undernstenbly. The staff did not blink and proceeded to explain they do the get near the customers without apologizing, nor they provided any discount or anything for the experience. 100% not going again. Entitled.
author: Vittorio B.

description:
LOVE! I have gone to this restaurant for many years and every time it gets better and better. The service is great, the ambiance is exceptional, and the food is even better. I like that there is no tip (workers are given health care and high living wage) so it's stress free. 

The only issue is that this is a very popular restaurant so the lines can be very very long. Try weekdays for breakfast, or be early.
author: Summer A.

description:
Came around 10:30am on a Monday for some solo brunch and found seating immediately.

I got two slices Tahiti french toast (choices of 1, 2, or 3 slices at varying prices), which was absolutely fantastic. I was a little skeptical at the seemingly steep price, but I soon did not care for anything. The bread was cut into thick slices which were slightly crispy on the outside and extremely soft on the inside. There was a banana mash mixture with walnuts as a filling sandwiched between the two pieces, slices of fresh banana on top, a mini metal pitcher of syrup, and a dusting of powdered sugar. Drizzle some syrup over it all, cut a piece of the toast, layer on some banana mash, and complete the perfect bite with a fresh banana. Honestly some of the best french toast I have eaten. Not so sure about the savory items, but I hope to be back!

It's a very warm atmosphere - waiters are extremely friendly and they truly care. One table adjacent to me asked their waiter where the best donuts were, and he proceeded to relay his own suggestions, as well as going to the back to as a cook for some more suggestions. The lady sitting in front of me seemed to be a regular and was welcomed by who I believe was the manager, and they had a nice exchange.

By the time I left around 11:30am, there was a line of hopefuls waiting patiently for some tasty brunch food.
author: Gina L.

description:
Amazing service and amazing food. Came for my boyfriend's birthday and wow so good. Loved the wine, the ravioli, and the hot chocolate dessert which is basically a cup of delicious gooey mousse and toasted marshmallows. Soooo good! Will be back!

It just felt like home :D
author: Monica J.

description:
Great outdoor seating. A little cold out but their outdoor heaters kept us warm. Great service. Our cups were never empty and our hearts were always full. Waiters were all really helpful and kind. They were great about refilling coffee and water. Nice ambiance - music playing in the background, vibes caressing the wooden walls. 

If you're craving breakfast food that is a little fancy this is the spot. Banana pancakes were light and fluffy and all the egg dishes were flavorful and well seasoned. Just the right balance of sweet and savory in one breakfast. I highly recommend splitting something sweet and savory so you get to experience all the flavors this restaurant provides.

Only con is how early you have to get here if you don't want to wait in the long line (got here at 8:30).
author: Bito M.

description: Best breakfast in San Francisco! Found this place few years ago and we loved it !! Best service from Mario. People are super nice and friendly. Food has the best flavor! I would give 6 stars if I could ;)!
author: Nancy A.

description: Oops. Forgot to take a before photo. But as you can see it was hellza scrumptious. 1000% worth the wait. I got the eggs Benedict with wild salmon, capers, and red onion. You can choose a salad or potatoes. We also shared some French toast stuffed w banana and walnuts. Didn't even need syrup! It was about an hour wait on a Sunday at 1PM. You can wait at the bar next door or Peet's - just write it on the board. I came to check in multiple times and decided to wait by the door when I saw my name was getting close. They're house tea is sooo good and caffeine free - so not getting an overload from my coffee this morning. I'm gonna buy some to take home.
author: Jenny M.

description:
Food is delicious. Home fries are amazing here. 

I sat in the back patio area. For some reason, the service I received was really poor today. The waiter forgot to bring the coffee for both my table and the table next to ours. The server brought my husbands drink out pretty quickly, but didn't bring mine until I asked  . I waited for my food to arrive first to see if he would bring it together, but he didn't so I knew forgot. I would have enjoyed my coffee too if I had it earlier, since it was a chilly day. The ladies at the table next to ours had to do the same. 

Also, the male host is a nice guy, but I felt he favored parties of women. I saw him offer free drinks to groups of ladies who were waiting, but not to other parties with males or even a couple like me and my husband, even though we had been waiting much longer. 

I'll still go back, because the eggs benefit and home fries are just so dang good here, but I hope to encounter much better service next time.
author: Christine L.

description: The breakfast was awesome had French toast good Lord the wait wasn't long and the hospitality was magnificent . My friend had the Newyorker breakfast it was sooo much food be prepared to take some home can't wait to go back
author: Jacqueline S.

description: I was wrong, I was so wrong. Zazie has officially topped Mymy in my book for the best brunch in the city. I switched to the pancakes this time from the benedicts and the pumpkin miracle pancakes rocked my world. They were quite possibly the best I've ever had. Those pancakes combined with the cozy interiors and living wages for their employees, I'm sold. I'll definitely be a new regular here soon!
author: Patricia K.

description:
Still my favorite brunch place. It's a convenient location in Cole Valley, right off the N Judah. Nowadays, I usually make my own french toast and eggs but sometimes you need a day with your friends and gather at a good brunch place. The wait is a bit long but it is proof of the yumminess. French toast, ricotta pancakes, eggs Benedict are just some of the items we order. Bring a sweater or jacket just in case you get assigned outdoor seating. There are heat lamps but SF weather can be rather cool. 
It's also a delight to go on Tuesdays for free corkage nights. We went a while back and had a nice dinner. I also like the idea that it is no tip Bc they build prices to account for employee benefits.
author: Antoinette L.

description: Yummy!! Heard a lot about this brunch spot, and was ready to wait the expected 45 minutes to try a bite.  When we first got to the restaurant, we put our name on the list, and debated walking around a little bit.  After hearing the host call for people, and then passing their names if they didn't respond, we decided to sit around.  Good thing because the 4 tables for two people that were in the front of the restaurant are on a first come, first serve basis.  We ended up waiting a whole 5 minutes before we ordered.  I had a double order of the French Toast Tahiti, which was delicious! The Divorcee Eggs Benedict was also quite good.
author: Run.It.Off V.

description:
Finally brunched at Zazie! It was a random weekday so I didn't expect there to be a full house! We still managed to get a cute 2 person som table on the patio. The patio is adorable and I highly recommend it if dining for brunch or dinner on a nice night.

I had the BLT on the lunch menu because it was a very hot day, the breakfast items although delicious sounding seemed on the heavier side. 

The BLT was definitively delicious, bacon was crispy and the toppings blended together nicely with the delicious focaccia. I do think it's a tad on the pricy side $17 with it just coming with a salad - but then again it's Zazie and it's developed that sort of a following! 

I'd love to go back and try a few other things!
author: Priya S.

description: If you get one thing on the menu, get the rabbit pasta.  It is one of the most beautiful things I have ever tasted.  I'll be stopping by Zazie any time I'm in the city just for this.
author: Cindy L.

description: Best eggs Benedict my girlfriend and I have ever had. Friendly staff and a beautiful venue. Thank you for the great brunch!
author: Chris J.

description:
Best breakfast is an really long time. 
I had the "eggs en fonte" with chorizo added...perfection!
author: Brian D.

description:
A bit pricey, but the quality of the food is excellent. In addition, even if the menu prices are a bit higher than other places, there's no need to tip! They apparently pay their employees a competitive wage, give plenty of benefits (dental, medical), and give paid time off. If you want to support any local business, Zazies is the place.

I got there for late brunch, just around 2:40pm. There was no lineup so I was seated immediately. I got the divorcée benedict and the french toast tahiti. The benedict was very good. I wouldn't say it was amazing, but I really enjoyed how there was some roasted garlic in the dish. It paired surprisingly well with the benedict and the potato wedges!

The real star of the show was the french toast though. It was probably one of, if not, the best I've ever had. The walnuts were crunchy and delicious. The caramelized banana was paired perfectly with it. A must try if you ever eat here.
author: Desmond C.

description:
Let's start off with saying that there's a reason why Zazie's consistently is listed as one of the best brunch places in the city!

I used to live in Cole Valley, and this was my go-to brunch spot to impress. Zazie doesn't take reservations for brunch, so the wait can easily be over an hour. Pro tip to cut down the wait - get there at 8:30-8:45am at the latest for weekend brunch. You'll end up waiting until they open at 9, but it's likely that you'll end up getting seated in the first round when they open. I also don't recommend coming with a group of more than 4 unless you want to wait forevs.

Now on to the food. My two favorites are the Albert benedict and the miracle pancakes. The benedicts come with their house potatoes which are AMAZING. They come with baked cloves of garlic which are a dream for garlic lovers like me. I normally don't like pancakes but Zazie's miracle pancakes are the exception. The flavor changes according to what's in season, but they're always incredible.

As most people have also said, Zazie is tip-free so the price you see on the menu you pay (plus tax). So don't be alarmed if you see the menu prices are a little more expensive ($15-$20ish per dish), but honestly that's not too crazy for San Francisco. Definitely a must try for SF brunch lovers!
author: Tracy C.

description:
Come during the week so that you can get a spot easily. 

It's a hearty place to get good comfort food with a friendly staff. 
They serve brunch throughout the week, which is amazing.

And on Monday, it's PUPPY NIGHT!
author: Theresa D.

description: Had a lovely dinner here tonight with my parents who were visiting in town. I spend a lot of time trying to find restaurants that they will enjoy when they visit and am happy to say that the response on this one was really wonderful. They really enjoyed the food and experience dining here. I really appreciate the top notch service and professionalism of the staff. The table was already prepared for us when we arrived (on time!) for our reservation. The expansive menu has something for all different taste buds and all of the items we ordered were delicious. I especially loved the fresh made pasta dish.
author: Alice H.

description:
I love Zazie. 

The first time I came, I thought it was only okay, but I think my opinion was colored by the hour and forty-five minute wait I endured before sitting down at a tiny, cramped table. Since then, I've 1) tried to come at less popular hours (9:00 am, 2:00 pm) and 2) accepted that long waits are the reality of Zazie, and it's made its way to my list of favorite SF brunch spots. 

The best way to enjoy Zazie is to go with a friend and to split a combination of sweet and savory dishes. I typically like to order a 2-egg eggs benedict (I love the Eggs Divorcee and Eggs Florentine) with their signature garlicky home fries, single miracle pancake, and slice of French toast. It's admittedly a lot of food, but I love having the variety, and all of the dishes are amazing.
author: Kelly R.

description:
Love this restaurant ! The only downside is the wait.
Very popular for breakfast /brunch. They also
have dinner.You can make a reservation for
dinner.
   Breakfast with a French twist Delicious.
author: Gayle G.

description:
Great lunch & brunch options! 
Tried the bean and kale soup- super!
Bagel with salmon also amazing
The ambiance is by far the best around on the back patio
author: Katie S.

description:
We arrived at 9am on a Thursday and it was pretty crowded, but we luckily got a seat right away. 

I ordered a French Toast Tahiti, which was stuffed with caramelized bananas and walnuts. (1 piece ~ $10) The sweet bananas were perfect with the French toast along with the crunchy walnut cream. 

I also tried the Miracle Pancakes which was made from bread pudding (2 pieces ~ $17) It was very light and fluffy, melting quickly in my mouth! Still, I enjoyed the French toasts more than the pancakes.
author: Megan L.

description:
Great breakfast and service! Highly recommend!

Had eggs Benedict with bacon and avocado and they had a non potato side open with a nice little green salad. The hollandaise sauce was outstanding.

My wife had some scrambled eggs with the House potatoes and they were amazing. Fried and crunchy. 

Coffee came timely and even gave me a to go cup for my walk back to Golden Gate Park.
author: Mike W.

description: Cute restaurant in the city. We had the New York and Avignon. Of course we had to try the buttermilk pancakes. Everything was delicious! We got there right before the morning rush and sat out in back. It was raining but it's covered with heat lamps. Great service. Can't remember the gal's name but she had a nice smile and was very helpful. Metered street parking available. Love this area, so take a stroll after your grub.
author: Elle K.

description: Very charming! There was a wait even on a weekday morning! Great atmosphere!
author: Allison Z.

description:
The food here is nothing short of amazing.
The chef himself came out and gave us a rundown of the menu and daily specials.
When I first saw my plate I was a little bit disappointed at the amount of food, but boy was I wrong!  Everything was perfect.
author: Edward U.

description: Came for breakfast around 11 am and the line was insanely long.  We waited over 1hr for a table.  We got seated in the garden in the back which was really unique and cute.  We ordered pumpkin pancake with 2 eggs and 3 bacons.  Also ordered ham with scramble eggs served with toaste and salad.  We had coffee and orange juice.  Breakfast came out to be around $50.  Restaurant does not except tips which was interesting.  Overall we had a good breakfast.  We used public transportation to avoid parking hassel.
author: Sydney T.

description: Went for brunch here today around 12:30 on a Friday and there was about a half hour wait, which is not bad at all compared to the wait I hear they have on the weekend! My friends and I split the miracle pancakes, which were pumpkin pie themed this week, and some egg dish that was unexciting enough that I don't remember the name, but they were good. I think I'm just more of a sweet brunch person, which brings me to the pancakes! They were amazing!! I love all things pumpkin and pancakes, so combined it was great, but most importantly, the pancakes were perfectly done. They were fluffy and light yet very filling, and I was completely satisfied! We also ate outside, which was great that they had that as an option.
author: Sonia S.

description:
Super trendy brunch- we came at 8:50am on Labor Day and there was already a line extending along the block. But we didn't have to wait more than 10 minutes past opening (at 9am) to have our party of 6 seated in their outdoor area which is BEAUTIFUL and a lot less crowded than inside. Patio seating is first come first; good for the couples.

It's pretty widespread knowledge that it's a no tip restaurant, so prices are naturally a lot higher. I got a Divorceé egg Benedict with home fries and the food was very good, not amazing though. If you like garlic then you'll love the fries because they come with whole roasted cloves of garlic - mmmm. It was everything I expected out of a brunch dish. Presentation worthy of making my snapchat story viewers have FOMO, I had the quick surge in excitement before piercing my fragile poached egg, and the large satisfaction of seeing the yolk released onto the entirety of my plate. And when it was all done, I felt slightly bad looking at the pool of oil on my finished plate. 

Our party of 6 also shared the Miracle Pancakes- 3 reasonably sized cornmeal Pancakes with a small dollop of lemon curd and some sliced strawberries. I think that they could have been less stingy with the toppings, but each table comes with really good raspberry jam to make up for it.

Our food took a while because it was busy. But I imagine it's always busy. Service was good and workers are all really friendly.

I had a gud time. =(^.^)=
author: Yenny Z.

description: As always, another great dinner at Zazie's.  We love this neighborhood spot.  Great service, great food, and fun atmosphere.  Last night we had the best starter, grilled figs on chèvre toast with well dressed arugala.  I had the most delicious squash raviolis, my husband had the polenta cakes with a side of brocolini.  So good, plus Tuesday night is free corkage.  We love this spot to take friends, to me so SF.
author: Carole W.

description:
I always love trying eggs benedicts from different restaurants and this was one of the better eggs benedicts I've had in SF so far! I tried the florentine (portobello mushroom and spinach) and my friend had the Pierre Noir (bacon and tomatoes). The eggs came out runny (just how I like them!) and the potatoes are delicious. They cook them along with garlic cloves, which become nice and soft afterward. 

Overall, Zazie is a wonderful brunch place. Prices are a little high, but the experience is quite pleasant. Try to get there early though to avoid lines! My friend and I arrived a little before 10am and ended up waiting for ~ 1 hour to get seated.
author: Kris C.

description:
Zero complaints! 

The service was quick and efficient. We did wait a little and grabbed a coffee a Luke's local across the street which ended up being fine! This is a no reservations spot so be prepared to wait. Luckily you can snag a coffee at Luke's (recommended). 

My friend and I snagged the first come first serve spot outside in the front, they had a heater on so it was perfect. 

We both ordered 1 egg of the benedicts. I ordered the prosciutto with roasted tomato. It was good, the tomato was too much for me so I put it aside (that's a personal taste thing, it was cooked well) and the eggs both poached nicely. 

We also ordered a slice of the orange cinnamon batter French toast, which was so good! I wanted more. 

I really loved that you could choose 1/2/3 eggs or French toast pieces. It made brunch very customizable. You also do not tip as the price reflects everything included!

Worth the wait!
author: Samantha R.

description:
They have so many egg Benedict options, including the choice of 1,2, or 3 eggs which makes sharing easier. 
We had the crab cake Benedict and florentine Benedict both of which were delicious. 
Also got the sampling trio of French toast and two different types of pancakes, which was very sweet and good to share. 
Expect a wait but it's worth it. The $12 mimosas don't have much alcohol though and service was pretty avg.
author: Miranda S.

description:
Really amazing brunch. A really complete menu with all the classic options really well made. We had eggs benedicts, and a soft scramble, both really good. 
The back patio is lovely. Loved this place
author: Maria P.

description:
I love you I love you I love you I love you I love you I love you I love you. I think this in itself is enough to describe the experience I had at Zazie. But it wouldn't be a very good review...

AHHH Zazie has been on my list for the LONGEST time. My friend and I were walking around Cole Valley trying to find the establishment, and right as we were about to pull up Google Maps, we saw a hella long line...without a question, we knew we'd found our destination. It was a Monday morning (holiday), and the line was sooooooo long!! We put our name on the list, and ultimately, I think it took close to 2 hours to be seated?? You can specify where you want to sit (which may take longer). We asked to be seated in the heated outdoor patio area (which was absolutely beautiful and had the coziest, homiest, brunch-y vibes!!)

The food:
- Fontainbleau scrambled eggs ($16): This came with portobello, shiitake, porcini, spinach, and fontina. I chose wheat for my toast and home fries as my side. I LOOOVE scrambled eggs!! They're my favorite kind of eggs, and Zazie did it right!! The eggs weren't overcooked and were super light and fluffy and had the perfect texture. I am also a hugeee sucker for mushrooms, so I really enjoyed this dish!! THE HOME FRIES. AHHHHHHH. Home fries are hands down my favorite brunch food. I absolutely loved Zazie's!! Some of the best I've ever had!! The texture is just PERFECT. None of that mushy all over potato business. Crispy on the outside and just the right amount of mashed potato-like softness on the inside!! The home fries came with roasted garlic and an absolutely divine seasoning!! I asked for hot sauce, and the server came out with a green sauce that they make in-house (I think). Smother the potatoes all over in hot sauce and...*drools*

- Florentine eggs benedict (3 portion for $21): This came with sautéed spinach and portobello mushrooms. My friend chose the salad as her side. The dish itself is served on an English muffin with lemon hollandaise. I kinda really, really, really don't like eggs benedict...I don't particularly like my eggs poached, and I REALLLLLLLY don't like hollandaise. But I genuinely enjoyed this dish?? The eggs were cooked just right--nice and runny when you cut 'em down the middle, giving you that good ol' #yolkporn!!

- Pain de Mie French Toast (2 portion for $16): We chose the version of the dish that came with fruit. This French toast is made using an orange cinnamon batter, and mannnn, is it DELICIOUUUS!! I can't handle too much of anything overpoweringly sweet, but this was just amaaazing!! The French toast was super fluffy and flavorful, and it came with a mountainful of seasonal fruit (ours had cantaloupe, honeydew, strawberry, and pineapple). Drizzle it all over with syrup or add some of the delicious jam they have on the table!!

You have the option of ordering things in 1/2/3 sized portions, which is really cool, especially if you're not feeling super hungry but want to try more stuff. It's also really helpful if you're with a bunch of people and planning on ordering multiple things so you can try a lot of stuff off the menu!! They also had a bunch of really creative mimosa flavors!! I don't think they do bottomless

Bottom line: Don't let the line scare you. It will be WORTH. Put your name on that list and talk a walk around the neighborhood, stop by La Boulangerie for a nice warm soy latte to combat that freezing cold SF weather (I am a weakling). There is a two card max per table. Kinda really pricy, but I guess that's what you can expect from hipster brunch places in SF...you can definitely taste the quality!! And they don't take tips. The price on the menu includes living wage, revenue sharing, paid sick leave, insurance, parental leave, and 401(k)!! Pretty rad!! I will definitely be back!! I WANNA TRY EVERYTHING ON THE MENU. Move over, La Note!! I HAVE FOUND MY NEW FAVORITE BRUNCH PLACE. I would wait 2 hours for you any day, Zazie. I love you
author: Kithumini J.

description: I have been eating here for nearly 20 years and it is still the best breakfast in the city. The most flavorful coffee, Greek scramble scrumptiousness​, and if you can get a table outside, you've hit the jackpot.  Don't arrive already hang-ry, as there will surely be a wait for a table, but don't give up, I promise it is worth it!
author: Cameran L.

description:
Two words: crab benedict. The crab was fresh. The hollandaise sauce was decadent. And the eggs perfectly cooked. The only negative was how expensive it was. At the time of writing, 1 crab benedict was $19. Add a second one and it comes to $29! That's right, $29 for a pair of crab benedicts. Ok, I get it. Crab is expensive, especially if it's fresh. But do the math, and if a benedict is $10, then the potatoes are $9!! Really?? $9 for a side of potatoes (that are really really good, btw)?? If you look at the other benedicts, the potatoes actually cost even more ($10 to $11). So, bottom line, the benedicts here are expensive. But you know what?? The crab benedict was soooo good, I think I would pay for it again. Now, when I went, I only ordered 1 (because I'm cheapo and benedicts are generally pretty filling) but I think when I return, I'll have to order 2 (my poor wallet).

We also had the french toast tahiti, again, only ordering 1 piece. At $10, it was reasonable especially since it was quite filling and a pretty good size. So this place is definitely good but the wait was pretty long. I would come back and at least you know, you don't have to pay tip (because it's already included in the food price).
author: Benjamin L.

description:
It only took me four years to finally eat here but it was worth it. Two eggs Benedict divorcee for me and the same number of the crab Benedict for my compatriot, split with a side of buttermilk pancakes. Very friendly staff and excellent philosophy of paying their servers livable wages (tip included) makes for a great spot for brunch.

Downside is the long line (at least an hour and a half) makes it a hard weekend spot, thus the four years of half committed attempts.
author: Christophe C.

description: Zazie is so cute. Found out about it through a friend that lives in the area. There's always a wait, but not for long. Their eggs Benedict are divine. Pancakes are also pretty good. While there, make sure to try the latte. Any latte. You won't be disappointed!!!!
author: Ali R.

description: Been WAY TOO LONG since I've eaten here. Happy to be back. Nothing has changed in over 3 years.... cozy atmosphere, amazing food, great servers and I LOVE that they pay living wages, give benefits & a good life to their employees! NO TIPPING!  ;)
author: Donna S.

description: My breakfast was amazing had buttermilk pancake and there French toast. The coffee is really good. Cozy nice place to relax.
author: Robyn G.

description:
First time trying this restaurant and it won't be the last.

Waiting to be seated did take an hour but it's Saturday on memorial weekend. 

For my beverage I had the Aztec mocha, it had cinnamon and chili very unique flavor, I've had Mexican chocolate before but never like this.

For my meal I had the Florentine eggs Benedict that had spinach and mushrooms and oh my goodness it was delicious! They serve the meals with house potato's that are seasoned to perfection! My fiance had their egg omelette special that had chicken apple sausage and loved it!

Other than the wait everything was excellent.
author: Mayumi H.

description:
Tipping is included in the prices, the food is beautiful and straight forward and the patio is serene. 

What else do you want?
author: Jennifer L.

description:
Honestly the wait for a party of two really wasn't too bad , we probably waited only about 15 mins or so but their waiting list offers you to check if you're going to look around at stores or go to the bar next door . I find that really accommodating . ALSO they have outdoor seating for if you have a furry companion with you which I LOVE . I have a great appreciation for animal friendly restaurants .

Now onto the food . Although I felt like we waited the longest for our food to come out , once it did though .... omg . I was that person that was heavy breathing and almost ugly crying because I was so hungry and really didn't expect the food to be so amazing . We ordered the caramelized banana pancakes and I forgot which eggs Benedict we order but it had prosciutto and tomatoes AND IT WAS SO GOOD . The food was so well seasoned , I literally wanted more after we finished our plates . I'm coming back next week lol .
author: Carmen V.

description:
Classic brunch spot in SF! 

I've always wanted to try Zazie and see what the hype is about, but usually there's always a line out the door. Finally came here on a weekday morning and was fortunate enough to only wait about 5-10 mins for a party of 2 around noontime. 

[AMBIENCE] - There's a back patio to the restaurant and I'd highly recommend try grabbing a seat back there rather than the front portion of the restaurant. The ambience in the back is very nice :)

The first thing listed on their menu is that tipping isn't necessary since all the prices are fixated to account for it. They also provide good benefits to their employees, which is always nice to know a business actually cares and are grateful for the backbone of their restaurant.

[FOOD] We ordered the La Mer Benedict (w/ Dungeness crab) [100% RECOMMEND] and the Un, Deux, Trois (sub french toast instead of pancakes) [98% WOULDN'T RECOMMEND]. 

The Benedict was delicious in every way from the pairing of avocado to their hollandaise sauce, to their perfect poached eggs!! 

The Un, Deux, Trois was just alright...  Not great but nothing bad to say... my only complaint would be that the bacon was kind of rough and dry to eat. I'd probably wouldn't ever order again or recommend. 

[CONCLUSION] The food was good, but didn't blow be away. The staff is very friendly. It did take a really long time to get our food but its understandable since their kitchen is so small.

In conclusion, I'd probably come back if I was in the area and there wasn't a wait. However, I wouldn't go out of my way to come here nor would I wait in line for for than 20-30mins.
author: Zizi W.

description: Great for date night. The ambiance is cozy and the waitstaff is very friendly. With that said, I respect the way the restaurant owners take care of their employees. There is no tipping. Everything is baked into the total and everyone is fairly compensated.
author: Cari S.

description:
I am in love with this place. I really like brunch food items and this place rocks for that.
Living in east bay it's hard to visit this place but I never miss any chance to go here.
My favorites are eggs Benedict which is called florentine, miracle pancakes ( each one of them is amazing but their poppy seed pancake is fantbulous), cream cheese coffee cake (it's so soft, creamy and totally yummy). I just love all these dishes here. They are perfectly cooked and proper tasty.
The service here is very good too. Everyone is very friendly and cool. The wait times can be a lot because the place is really popular. The best bet to get a seat is to come as soon as they open.
The awesome part of this place is that it is tip free.
Surely try this place if you are around the area.
author: Mimansha B.

description: A great brunch place with awesome staff and friendly service. The food is on point. It definitely gets crowded on the weekend, but it's worth the wait! I came on Labor Day weekend and saw a huge crowd of people waiting outside, so I made the mistake of going to Cafe Reverie down the street, where I had an absolutely awful meal. I was so salty about this experience that I actually came back to Zazie the next day, and I'm so glad I did.
author: Evan O.

description: I went to Zazie on a Sunday afternoon and had to wait about an hour. I tried one of their omelettes (the one with tons of mushrooms in it!) and it was so delicious. I also tried the cinnamon orange French toast and was a little disappointed- it didn't taste orangey at all! The food overall was solid brunch food, but I'm not sure if it's worth the long wait.
author: Amanda F.

description:
Usually not one for brunch/breakfast restaurants, but this place is an exception! The food is delicious and the service is great. We got the Tahiti French toast, eggs, turkey sausage, and homestyle potatoes!

Definitely recommend the potatoes! It's extra delicious with the garlic on it.

The tables at the front are first come, first serve. Not required to tip too.
author: Jim G.

description: Basically as advertised. Service was great. Food was unique and fun. The experience is probably worth it, but for the price you can find exquisite if that's what you are seeking.
author: Justin B.

description: As always, delicious food and excellent service! Super accommodating for us and our baby!
author: Kelly M.

description: Delicious food at a beautiful restaurant with a great atmosphere! Employees were super nice and attentive. We even got to keep a zazie magnet as a souvenir after asking our waiter if we could keep it :) i had such a nice time and would definitely come back.
author: Kristen D.

description:
Yummm! I got the divorce eggs benedict. My friend ordered a veggie scramble both were really good. The back porch is picturesque and filled with space heaters. Don't be worried if its a cold morning. 

The wait staff is amazing and I appreciate that they build the tip into the cost of your meal. Definitely worth the wait.
author: Katelyn S.

description:
Love the place!! It's looks like asmall tiny tiny place in city! As we went to their patio, after waiting for ~40 minutes I felt like I was transported to a different place. Very nice and cozy for sure. 

They had special menu for the day and immediately my eyes feel on lemon ricotta pancake with Meyer lemon curd and raspberry coulie. I knew what I was going to order.  It was really amazing and I loved it. My husband ordered something which had side of house potato fried! ( they forgot about getting fried on the side, as I don't eggs and did not want the fries to touch the egg. Made me a little upset and had to order new fries)This was one of the best garlic potato fried I ever had. Baked with oil and garlic coated so beautifully , LOVE IT. 


TIP: there are few tables outside where they are available first come first serve! You do not need reservation for the same. 

Would definitely try this place again!
author: Roojuta L.

description: This restaurant belongs to the fast food industry sector. From the moment we entered it was obvious that the first sitting should leave the premise in about 2 hours. Food was bland and boring, not a single dish worth of a "wow"!
author: T O M.

description: Experience of dine was an awesome top notch!! Service was humble friendly... and food delicious .
author: raja g.

description:
My husband and I came on a Monday morning a few days before Christmas, not expecting a huge crowd outside waiting. But alas, there was a crowd. Luckily we were only a party of 2, so we actually didn't wait too long. We were seated in about 20 minutes in the heated patio out back. 

We ordered the 3 Egg Divorcée Benedict (bacon, fontina and avocado) and a 2 count French Toast Tahiti (Caramelized Bananas and Walnuts) with the intent of sharing. That way we get the best of both worlds--savory and sweet. We opted with the home fries to go with the egg dish and though I'm not a big fan of home fries (I prefer hash browns), these were good. The eggs were perfectly cooked and the whole thing was just delicious. We also loved the French Toast Tahiti. Loved that the bread wasnit soggy and the filling in between slices was great. If you're a French Toast lover like me, I don't think you'll be disappointed with this one. 

I ordered the Chai Latte with Almond Milk. It was warming and just perfect for a cold winter's day. I loved all the spices in it! 

If you're looking for a gift, I'd suggest a gift card from Zazie! My sister who lives in Washington DC sent me a Zazie electronic gift card via email for my birthday and we paid with that during this visit. I just showed them the card I received in my email and voila, we're all paid up! Thanks to my sister and Zazie for another wonderful experience! We'll be back!
author: Hazel C.

description:
We got here 20 minutes before they opened on Saturday and managed to get seated in the first wave. Many of the people who arrived 15 minutes early did not (dang that line grew fast) - so if you're averse to waiting in line I'd definitely plan on getting there early!

We ordered eggs benedict (The Divorcee) and their Tahiti french toast (stuffed with banana and some other goodness). Both were delicious! The home fries that came with the eggs benedict were amazing - crispy exteriors, soft potatoey interior and tons of garlicky flavors. Five stars for those potatoes alone. 

The service is very friendly, and I appreciate that Zazie is committed to providing fair wages to their staff. It's tip-free, so everything is included with the menu pricing. I think this shows a commitment to workers that is rare in the restaurant business, and also imrpoves the experience for the diner as well. 

All around good stuff! I'd definitely eat here again.
author: Lauren C.

description:
Man, sf has some of the best eateries, even though your wallet is crying at the end of it. XD 

So we came to zazie on a Sunday for brunch and man the line was long. Luckily there is a list and you write your name down. However, there are 4 tables out front that are first come and first serve. Luckily, I was able to swoop in and get us a seat in 10 minutes or else we would have waited over an hour.
