So buttery and creamy they seemed to melt in my mouth. Not overly heavy and filling though, so I did not end up feeling like a beached whale at the end of brunch. 

Definitely a solid brunch place, and I will be sure too return to try other dishes. Also nice that tips are built in to give workers living wage and benefits.
author: Hali M.

description: Came here on a Friday around lunch time and there was a line outside. I put my name down for a table and was seated rather quickly. I had the miracle pancakes- poppyseed with lemon curd and strawberries. They were amazingly delicious, and I relished every bite. The service here was really nice, efficient and friendly. I liked the cute decor as well. Will be back.
author: Su L.

description:
I have made a full, glorious circle. I tried my first Eggs Benedict at this place, courtesy of my friend taking me here. I thought it was good (it was my first time, didn't know what to compare it too). After 2 years of eating around and being an SF local, I came back to Zazie's and HAVE REALIZED THE GLORIOUSNESS OF THIS PLACE, as I've eaten brunch at so many places now, I have expectations now, compared to my past naive little self.

Their egg benedicts are really great. The english muffins aren't tough and stale, but rather soft and toasty, able to be cut with a butter knife. The eggs and hollandaise sauce are perfection. The potatoes with the roasted garlic.....impeccable. One thing though, the french toast slice was okay. It was dry and not soaked through in the inside, and I could've done without it and saved my wallet $8. But now I know. The prices aren't too steep, and since tip is not recommended, a pretty good price point.

I ruv you Zazie's.
author: Hanna M.

description:
This place is great for brunch!

This is one of the first restaurants I ate at after moving up to SF and will always have a nostalgic sentiment whenever I think about this establishment. It was a particularly beautiful day and we ate in the cute eating space just behind the place. I don't remember what I ordered but I do recall everything tasting amazing and fresh. 

Every other time I've come here I got the La Mer and it's by far my favorite thing to get, albeit a bit pricey since I order enough of these to feed a small bear. Seriously though, the way the perfectly poached egg tastes as it oozes out its yolky goodness onto the toasted English muffin....mmmm, it's just like umami heaven. 

If you want to make your experience stress free, just come before the crowds appear. This means you need to show up for a table around 9am on any given day. There may still be a few people waiting at that opening hour but they should be able to seat you quickly. Show up much later than that and your wait time increases exponentially. 

Overall, love the food, love the service, love that you don't need to tip because they pay their employees a living wage already! What's not to love?!
author: Sam L.

description: Delicious! Try the Bretagne! Cooked to perfection and would go again! Highly recommended!
author: Taylor H.

description:
A solid and very popular brunch place in Cole Valley. We visited Friday morning at around 9am, no line or wait. There were still tables available when we left around 10am, so it seems to avoid the massive crowds come on a weekday morning! Parking was still a bit difficult, street cleaning on 1st Friday of the month didn't help.

The brunch was solid and tasty but not mind blowing good (considering the popularity). I had the divorcée poached eggs (3 eggs), all eggs were perfectly poached and the hollandaise was good. The potato fries and muffin were a bit soft. My wife had the miracle pancakes which were quality but nothing crazy. Cappuccinos were served in a nice cup and were pretty good.

Inside is slightly cramped but nothing uncomfortable. This might change when the place is packed though. Looked like only one bathroom which was very small which was a bit of a challenge with a curious toddler!

Service was nice and friendly, even chasing after us after we left stuff behind.

It was also nice to have not worry about tips and know that employees are being treated fairly!
author: Tristan L.

description:
A typical San Francisco brunch locale and honestly, pretty much fell in love with it! I am not a huge brunch goer,  but this place has definitely hit the spot for me. Firstly, the French influence is a nice touch to the menu and also, this place does NOT require tip, which is such a refreshing change. We came on a Saturday at around 10:00 AM and for a table of two, we only waited about 30 minutes, so not too bad. 

FOOD: Eggs Valence was featured in their special seasonal menu. With fingerling potatoes and the delicious mild hollandaise smothered on top, this was to die for. The secret of a perfect eggs benedict is the perfect yolk running through and Zazie's chefs perfected the make the egg. Not under or overcooked, but just right on the slightly toasted English muffin. A definite win on the make of the eggs benedict. 

SERVICE: Standard. 

If I am make it all the way over here in SF, I would consider going to Zazie again. Although I am not a brunch-goer on the weekend, I can definitely respect this French-inspired brunch local favorite!
author: Albert H.

description:
The food here was amazing - an overused description - but it still holds true. 

We were seated in the back on a covered deck with heaters. It was warm in a cold SF evening. The servers all had great attitudes joking with us and smiling. We ordered the mussels to start. They came in a buttery creamy garlic sauce that made my tongue sung. The staff brought extra rolls so we could soak it up and when we ran out of sauce. They brought  more ;-). 

Two of us ordered the seafood stew called " " it came was full or potatoes ripe tomatoes and fennel as well as three kinds of seafood. My honey had the lamb over couscous. Great comfort food! And the other guest ordered duck breast. 

It was all delicious and even though we were all full we ordered the strawberry rhubarb crumble with vanilla sorbet and the Mille Fielle - sorry I can't spell in french - a crispy delicate pastry filled with whipped cream and fresh fruit. 


Try it - you'll love it!
author: Sheri C.

description:
If I could give this place 0 stars, I would. 

This was truly the WORST food-service experience I have ever been subjected to. 

The setup:

Zazie does not take reservations for Sunday brunch so our group duly arrived early and waited for two hours. There were six of us, one of whom was a barely-standing 85-year old woman with a walker. She waited sitting in the car until the host told us the table was ready. He was made fully aware of her difficulties walking. 

Now for the "fun" part:

1 - The host decided to seat us on the patio vs. the main dining room, which meant grandma had to climb a staircase

2 - There was a bit of confusion (seemingly handwriting-related) and the host thought there were 5, not six. He sat us at a table for FOUR (that's right, not 5) and when we didn't fit demanded that if we didn't accept this table we had to go back down the steps and wait.

3 - When we tried to explain that the 85-year old woman with a walker can't easily walk down the stairs, stand around for an unspecified amount of time, then hop back up the stairs again, he got agitated and aggressive, saying "well that's just the way it is".


Could we have made due with a table for 5 (as the host himself thought was the case) and squeezed around? Yes.

Could the host have offered to sit grandma on a chair and have her wait off to the side without having to do laps up/down the steps? Yes.

Could the host have seated us in the main dining area, having known we are with an old and disabled person? Yes.

Failing all of the above, could the host AT LEAST approach the situation with understanding and respect for a disabled senior? Clearly.


The food was fine, nothing particularly special that can't be had at a countless similar restaurants all around SF and certainly not worth the shockingly bad service. Perhaps this is what happens when the incentive of a tip is removed from the equation (as Zazie does).

Never again.
author: Ilya S.

description: Brunch for two here will burn a huge ass hole in your pocket. A single "La Mer" Benny costs $19, two for $28! That's $19 for ONE egg, people! Holy shit! Apparently, crabby eggs are a rich people thing. Luckily, I don't brunch often or else I'd be broke.
author: Suany W.

description: Obsessed. I ate at Zazie 5 out of the 7 days I was in the city. They're famous for their brunch (which is to die for--try a magic mimosa), but don't sleep on dinner. Everything I ate was wonderful. The price point is fair and they are tip-free because they pay all of their employees a living wage. If you're in the city, you owe it to yourself to try Zazie.
author: Liz S.

description: The server lost our order! Food for 3 tables that were sat after us got their food even before we did. They were a party of 2, 4 and 4 yet they seem to have their food ready before us. It's not even busy--it's Wednesday. When we asked the server she said it's gonna be 20-25 minutes. (We were already  waiting for 30 mins.) Then she goes to the back and just started preparing the fruit bowl which should have already been done 30 minutes ago. Sure they say you don't need to tip but the service is just crappy. They don't really live up to their "reputation." 45 minutes later, the server admitted they lost our tab. Not even worth the wait!
author: Markee M.

description:
This place has a lot more seating than the storefront makes it seem. They have an amazing backyard patio which I'd easily prefer over the indoor seating.  Came here for brunch and only had to wait about 45 minutes for a table of 4.  It's a bit strange, but they seem to seat people based on party sizes of 3 and below or 4 and above.  Kind of works out well for larger parties.  

We were seated in the backyard, it felt a lot more open back there.  What I really think is cool about this place is that you can order a lot of their brunch entrees by 1, 2, or 3 pieces!  This is an excellent option.  It's great for sharing or if you just aren't too hungry.  I ended up with the Monaco Benedict which had prosciutto and tomatoes provenceles.  I loved every bit of it.  Mines came with a lot of Hollandaise sauce, more than my friend got on his benedict.  One of the eggs was cooked really well and had a very runny yolk.  The other was a bit overcooked.  Still a great benedict, the tomatoes added a lot of flavor.

I really enjoyed this place.  If you're coming here for brunch though, expect a long brunch here.  While the wait to get in wasn't too bad, the wait for our food was actually equally as long.  They get very busy here, but I think it was worth the wait.  They also offer quite a bit of unique things here to spice up their brunch menu!
author: Bryson L.

description: Was excited to go for breakfast, it was  pretty crowded and we didn't get in because it was too long of a wait. But we were lucky to get dinner there. Place is very cozy and with truly French spirit, the design Steak and lamb were delicious, and our waitress was very nice too.
author: Nadia K.

description: I took my wife to Mother's Day dinner here. Great ambiance on the patio. Great service and amazing food!
author: Jared D.

description: Breakfast food is amazing. Staff is extremely nice and chatty. Highly recommend
author: Alex W.

description:
We got here at 8:45 AM, and decided to grab one of the tables out front since they are first come, first served. 80% of the people waiting in line made it in while the other 20% had to wait about 45-50 mins. 

Chocolat Chaud: 2/5
I don't know why I ordered this. Just normal hot chocolate, nothing spectacular. 

Albert: 4.5/5
This dish consisted of perfectly poached eggs, crispy bacon, cheese, and salsa. The nice tart flavor was perfectly balanced with the white cheddar cheese. The hollandaise sauce was mild and not overbearing like most places. The salsa gave the dish a different dimension. It added a light, refreshing taste. The dish also came with home fries. They were crispy without being burnt. The roasted garlic paired with the potatoes were fantastic.
author: Tammy D.

description:
Zazie is a great place to come for breakfast and brunch.  I found this place on my yelp app and was not disappointed.  When I arrived about mid morning, there was already a long wait list.  The quoted wait time to sit inside was longer than the patio.  I opted for the patio because I was simply hungry and didn't want to wait longer.  The outdoor seating has patio heaters which was a  huge plus.  Seating at Zazie is a little tight and limited.  If you are coming with a large group this place might not be for you.

I ordered the poached egg, Monaco.  The Monaco comes with prosciutto and roasted tomatoes provencales (see my pic).  This was served on top of an English muffin with their house sauce and pan fried potatoes.  You have an option to order this with one or two eggs.  I got mine with two eggs.

All quoted items on the menu includes tips.  Zazie is a "tip free" restaurant, which is cool for those who don't like to tip.  I still left one because I felt the service was phenomenal.  My waiter kept my coffee filled and was on point with his service, which is one of the reasons why I would return.
author: Peter C.

description:
I was really excited to try this French brunch place and to see if it was anything like the French brunch place La Note back at Berkeley. The servers here were all very friendly, and we got seated in the cute outdoor patio.

I ordered a quite an expensive buttermilk pancake, so I was expecting it to be really good. It was nice and crispy on the outside and soft on the inside. Honestly, it was not anything special and I was quite disappointed. This place is a "no tip" restaurant, but you can definitely see that the prices of the food are raised because of this. My friend and I sat outside and the ambience was really nice. Overall, it was a nice ambience and the food was decent but it was definitely not worth the high prices, so I don't think I will be coming back.
author: Catherine S.

description: Really don't get the fuss... slow service, over cooked cold eggs - I ordered the italie and there was no basil on it. When I mentioned that to the waiter he simply ignored me and never brought me any. The toast was bread and the mimosa soap... don't get your hopes up too high
author: Jazzy P.

description: Cannot believe I haven't been here before! The backyard seating is really pretty and the food is great. They have an extensive mimosa list which i really appreciates. I got one of the Benedict's and the lavender mimosa - will def get again!
author: Pratika M.

description:
I'm choosing to leave two stars because the service was nice but the food was mediocre. This was my first time to Zazie and had built up an image of tasty, delicious food but that's not what was delivered. 

I ordered a hot chai latte (perfectly hot) but then I ordered the Un, Deux, Trois which served you French toast, two eggs, and three pieces of bacon. When my food arrived it was cold. The syrup had a layer of film on the top, the eggs were room temperature to the touch, and the French toast was soft (no crunch) and also luke warm, and the butter served was hard and stiff - not spreadable. The bacon was crunchy and tasty, but also not warm. 

I don't find myself coming back, the wait wasn't worth it. Maybe it was just a bad day for them but I was not impressed.
author: Christopher S.

description:
From the moment we were seated in the window with our small dog I was transported back to Paris . Everything about this charming restaurant is authentic . Classic French cuisine is served by friendly staff without any of the pretense that often accompanies such esteemed restaurants .  Our party of four began our meal with a chilled bottled of Clos Palet Vouvray , a light and fruity accompaniment on this unusually warm San Franciscan evening .  Figs Figaro was our starter along with Salade Toscany , both sweet and crisp and savory . But the absolute crown jewel of the meal was the Moroccan Lamb Tagine . All but one in our party ordered this divine entree , which arrived steaming to the table , the aroma of all the spices of the Silk Road before us , succulent braised chunks of lamb falling apart with just the thought of a fork , beautifully spiced couscous and eggplant supporting this dinner of kings . The portions arrived in oversized deep platters , generous and satisfying .  The lone defector ordered the Bourride Zazie, a Provençal fish stew steeped in a melange of redolent white wine and herbs  . I hate cliches but I died and went to  heaven . And if the food wasn't enough , in true Parisian fashion dogs are welcomed on Monday evenings , there is a charming heated patio in the back , and long ago the restaurant adopted a no tipping policy opting to employ excellent benefits for their staff instead . 
I can't say enough about Zazie . I can't wait to return .
author: Orly F.

description:
My boyfriend wanted to one up me and take me to Zazie's for brunch. I guess I'll have to give it to him this time. Zazie's was good. 

Located on Cole St., there's no doubt that Zazie's was going to be busy especially on a Sunday afternoon. Parking was also hell so I should mention that. My boyfriend and I circled a few residential blocks before finally parking 3 blocks away. But the weather was nice so the walk wasn't too bad. 

Zazie's has a wait list posted on the window near the door so be aware of that. Don't just stand around with the people outside waiting. There are four 2-seater tables outside that are FIRST COME, FIRST SERVE. So even if you're number 20 on the list and there are other couples before you, if you grab a table out from then you're good. Seems like a dick move really, but that's what my boyfriend and I did. And it was a good thing, too, because the manager ended up calling my boyfriend's name for a table right when we were pretty much done eating so if we didn't swoop in then we would've had to wait a good 40-50 mins just for a table. 

Service here was okay. The waiter we had wasn't overly friendly but he worked efficiently and the bus boy was nice enough to clear the table when we first sat down even though he already had a lot of plates in his hands. There's no tipping involved here because they all get paid a living wage which I've never heard of before but sounds pretty darn awesome!

My boyfriend ordered their miracle pancakes (which changes flavors so I'm not quite sure what to tell you) but it had lemon curd and strawberries on top and it was good. Their sides are a tad expensive for one egg and sausages. I got their Tahiti French toast with caramelized bananas and walnuts and it was delicious but ended up being too sweet towards the end. I think if we were to come back we'll try their savory dishes instead. 

Overall, Zazie's in. Boyfriend 1, girlfriend 0.
author: Venus L.

description:
Another great brunch spot in SF. They don't want you to tip since it's already included in the price meal! I went on a weekday which is the key if you don't want to wait. SF brunch over the weekend is always a waiting nightmare.

My sister thinks they have the best simple eggs benedicts. I also really enjoyed their Gingerbread French Toast. Atmosphere is cosy and a rustic feel which I dig.
author: Kathy L.

description: I love Zazie. It's always a treat. My husband treated me to a delightful birthday brunch today and we were well cared for by Katie. The food was delicious, as always, and it feels good to support a restaurant that supports its staff with fully funded health and dental care, matched 401k plans and more. I wish more restaurants would build this into their prices and take quality care of their teams.
author: Leigh F.

description: The La Mer eggs Benedict were amazing! And the mimosa was very refreshing. I would totally recommend this place if you're in the area.
author: Vee L.

description: Such a great spot for breakfast and brunch! We were so impressed with the gluten free pancakes, scrambles and home fries. Go on a weekday for shorter lines!
author: Jen P.

description: Not only is the food amazing, but they pay their workers living wages with retirement funds and paid vacation time. Im going to come here every time I come to San Fran. It's well worth the wait. I want to support establishments like this. Plus the outside garden area is beautiful!
author: Erica G.

description: The food was fine - typical brunch food that you can get anywhere else, with a slight French twist. But I don't think it is worth such long wait times. I waited for 1.5 hrs for a table for two (!!) for brunch on a Saturday. Ok to try once. I wouldn't return here.
author: Shalini C.

description: As someone who has been to many brunch spots, I was excited to try a hyped up place like Zazie. I went on a Friday morning, and was surprised at how long the wait was considering that it was a weekday, so definitely be prepared to wait (for three people we had to wait about 40 minutes or so). I was a fan of the scenery, I thought it was cute how they turned a house into a restaurant. If the wait isn't long or you don't mind waiting, I would recommend sitting in the back patio, it's more spacious than the front/inside the restaurant. The workers were also very friendly and had so much patience, so the service was great. I got the Cannes scramble and it was really good, I would recommend asking them for the habanero salsa to pair with it. The chai latte was also very good, but keep in mind that it is LOADED with cinnamon. Would definitely go back.
author: Melanie A.

description:
Our party of 4 got to Zazie's at 930am and there was an hour wait. The location gave us the chance to grab coffee next door, make a quick stop at Twin Peaks and make it back in perfect time! 

We started with the blackberry sorbet mimosas  refreshing, fruity and so perfect to get a bottle to share! THE best poached eggs I've ever had. The home fries were on point: crispy on the outside, soft and buttery on the inside!! I want to come back...tomorrow :) SO GOOD.
author: Christine P.

description:
Awful service, horrendously overblown food. Came for a birthday with a party of 6 including an elderly senior citizem with a walker. We waited as appropriate for over an hour. When our turn came, not only did the staff seat us at a cramped table but refused to allow us to reseat to the table immediately to our right, which had enough room and was paying their bill just as we were getting seated. The tension was thick (especially as they refused to give grandma and her walker any semblance of courtesy or hospitality.) We gave in and cramped around, and the manager was so rude he and my husband nearly got into a physical situation. We only stayed because we weren't the ones hosting the get together and it wasn't our choice. As punishment for being "difficult" they served literally everyone else on the patio before us, including parties larger than ours who arrived later. 

Want to know about the food? It's completely forgettable. Don't fall for the hype. This place is a junk experience, spend your money literally elsewhere and you won't notice a difference (in fact, you'll definitely have a better experience. )


Off to research ADA compliance and file a request for an audit of this sh*thole.
author: Maya G.

description:
The wait is worth it, so stick around!! 

My friends and I came here a few weeks ago to have brunch. It was typical SF weather and the line stretched around the block, but we waited anyways. 

This place is super cramped! Get ready to get close with your neighbor! There's literally no room! We were a party of three and we sat at this tiny table. It's very warm and rustic inside. I love how their ketchup is in this little container with a spoon! 

I wanted to try the miracle pancakes but it was sold out. Instead, I ordered the gingerbread pancakes with lemon curd. Now I'm not a big gingerbread fan, but this pancake was something else! I could have eaten a stack of ten! The lemon curd was such a nice touch on every bite. And this also came with poached pear. Let's say it paired perfectly with the pancakes. 

Everything else was just delicious. Even the mimosa! And I know this place gets busy, but I thought the service was really good. I can't complain much about this place, well except there's no room to stretch your legs. Eh a walk though the streets of SF will give you a good stretch! 

Definitely coming back for more!!
author: Quyen H.

description: There was line and we had to wait about 15 minutes. But it with it. We have ordered italian omlet and we loved it.
author: Cameron J.

description:
Seeking an EGGcellent brunch? Catch the Mr. Burns reference or nah? Anyways, no need to look any further. Visit Zazie for thee perfectly poached egg. It's all about that lavish, flowing runny yolk paired with their ambrosial hollandaise sauce. 

I ordered the Monaco (prosciutto and tomatoes provencales), which I highly recommend. Every component resulted in a flavorful experience. The poached eggs dishes are priced according to how many eggs your order, from 1 egg up to 3 eggs. 

Tables are tiny, you may feel a little cramped because of the narrow venue, but who honestly really cares if the food is good. 

Come here for the no frills brunch. Good food. Period. 

+ TIP-FREE. What whaat? Zazie treats their hard working employees well 
+ Build your own mimosa 
+ Wine and beer
author: Merica S.

description:
the only way I can understand the good reviews is:

Everyone writing it is rich, and doesn't mind spending $20+ dollars on simple, everywhere-breakfast items.

The cost ruins it for me.
Foods a'ight.
author: Henry B.

description: One of the best brunch spots in the city!! Delicious deep fried potatoes with garlic. Super friendly staff!! Back patio is worth the wait!!  I love the atmosphere of the restaurant, wow worthy!!!  Jack, our waiter, was incredibly sweet and super helpful navigating the many menu options. He helped me, A VEGAN, find the perfect brunch!
author: Sarah F.

description:
I'm unsure why it has taken me so long to review Zazie because I used to come here all the time when I lived in the city, and I love returning whenever I visit! They've got indoor and outdoor seating, so it's particularly nice on a sunny day.

Zazie is a very solid brunch spot conveniently located right next to the Carl & Cole stop.  My favorite is the French Toast Tahiti.  It's absurdly declicious and perfectly rich.  My boyfriend doesn't even like bananas, but this is also his favorite dish at Zazie! 

Only setback is that the wait (particularly on weekends) is very long. It's not uncommon to wait over an hour! I also wouldn't recommend coming here with a large party.  

Otherwise, come to Zazie for what is (in my opinion) the best french toast in SF!
author: Tammy T.

description:
Meh. 

This place is very hyped, but I found my meal quite bland. I ordered the Croque Monsieur and was très underwhelmed. It was soggy and had no flavor. 

If there was béchamel sauce under the blob of cheese, I could not taste it. Served with 'home fries'. 'Home fries' are great with an American breakfast, but very out-of-place with a Croque Monsieur. Give me some "freedom fries"!

I can't imagine any reason to try this "French" (not French) place again. 

Adieu!
author: Anna G.

description:
Wow! I am sooooo happy we decided to go to Zazie for brunch on our weekend trip to San Francisco! I honestly do not have enough good things to say. I was a little worried about the wait when I heard they do not take reservations, but it worked out okay. We got there at about 1:00 and the wait for 2 people was about 45 minutes. However, the seating outside is 1st come 1st serve, so we were able to snag a table in the patio. The weather was not too bad that day, but what's great is that they have heaters above you keeping you warm as you enjoy their awesome food!

To start off, they have so many flavors of mimosas!! I had no idea what to order, but I stayed simple and got the one with mango juice and it tasted awesome! We also ordered the cream cheese stuffed coffee cake because of the many pictures of it on Yelp! It was good, not great. I definitely expected more because of the hype, but I found the cake as a whole kind of dry. The cream cheese part though was super yummy!

We ordered the Spanish scrambled eggs with soyrizo and added avocado and the Italian scrambled eggs also with addd avocado! The food came out relatively fast and tastes amazing! Each brunch entree came with toast and either home fries or salad. We opted for the home fries, but I found them a little greasy for me and they have pieces of whole garlic!  Overall, they were still good! The fresh raspberry jam on the table was amazing!!! I could not get enough of it. Another thing to note is that Zazie does not accommodate any substitutions, which is not a big deal because everything on the menu is already crafted perfectly!

In my opinion the food here is worth the wait! If I were to go back and I had to wait 45 minutes, I really would not mind because it is amazing! One of the best brunch places I have ever been too :)
author: Anisha K.

description:
FOOD = 5 (solid brunch fare, will be back for more!)
AMBIENCE = 5 (the back patio is especially lovely, like having brunch in your own home but nicer)
SERVICE = 5 (super friendly)
LOCATION = 4 (street parking is difficult during weekend brunch hours, so I would suggest dropping a friend curbside to get in line while you park!)
WAIT = 3 (horribly busy during weekend brunch hours, so plan accordinly. STILL TOTALLY WORTH IT. there are a few shops to browse nearby while you wait, but not much.)
CONCEPT = 5 (paying fair wages while eliminating tipping has paid off... prices are still reasonable, staff are happy, and service is great!)

RECOMMEND: eggs benedict, pancake sampler
author: Allison T.

description:
Hot damn this place is busy. Came in at 9:30am on Saturday morning and the place was packed! It opens up at 9:00am so try to sneak in around 8:55am to avoid the lines :) 

We came with our border collie and waited for the open seating in the front of the restaurant.. took about 20 minutes! The waiter also came out to encourage us to "be aggressive" which was nice because no one gave us any flack for bolting to the first open table :) Breakdown below, you know the drill:

Un, deux, twois: one pancake (substitutions available), two eggs, and bacon makes this the perfect breakfast treat!

Gingerbread pancake with pear: If you're a gingerbread cookie fan, this pancake is for you! Applause for the unique flavor combo. 4/5
Egg whites: 4/5
Bacon: Awesome bacon with flavor that packed a punch. 4/5
Mocha: Served in more of a bowl than a cup which was cute and fun. This was an a-okay mocha. 3/5
Service: The staff was friendly and the service was quick! 4.5/5

Definitely recommend!
author: Nicole W.

description: Zazie was amazing. The eggs Vincent was a brunch special. I enjoyed it very much but what surprised me was the home fries. The crust on the potato was very crispy but the potato wasn't dry at all! The miracle pancakes were very very fluffy and filling. When I put down my finished cup of coffee they were here right away to refill my cup. Make sure to ask for the house made habanero sauce! The habanero sauce was great. There were pieces of roasted garlic in the home fries which were a nice surprise. My experience here was exceptional.
author: Orion L.

description:
If you love brunch and you're in SF you must make the trek to Zazie...it's that simple. And quit huffing about having to wait - if you want food this good you need to put your big kid pants on and suck it up. 

We were fortunate to be here on a Tuesday, waited about 20ish minutes and got a patio seat in their mini garden. In fact, this whole place is Alice in Wonderland  small... including the I-might-actually-be-on-an-airplane sized bathroom right in front of the kitchen and next to the dude washing dishes. Truth.

Ohhhh but the brunch! We started by popping a bottle of champagne and started adding mango juice for a little different version of a mimosa. You have to love a place that has a dedicated brunch drink menu longer than some restaurants' wine lists btw. 

As the dedicated Elites that we are we (of course) took Yelp recommendations to heart and split both the La Mer and the Miracle Pancakes. The La Mer - eggs benny meets avo and crab - was delicious and worth it. But the pancakes.... the only miracle is that we could stop with one order! Fluffy, flavorful, and melt in your mouth foodgasm. No wonder when I asked our server her opinion she cut me off mid sentence and gave me her undoubted verdict. So I will pass it on to you: GET THESE PANCAKES!

They run a well oiled brunch machine at Zazie. It's tiny, so service is quick when you get seated. No table is left unoccupied for long and they also make the math easy by saving you from adding a tip. How fantastically European. Can't wait to come back!
author: Bridget W.

description:
Best damn brunch in the bay area. I wake up early to beat the crowds, which form right at opening time, understandably.

My faves are their miracle pancakes and ridiculous french toast. Everything is on point.

I love that they have a no-tipping policy and treat their workers well. That's worth paying a bit more for.
author: rik p.

description:
I finally got to try Zazie today! 

We came at 10am and the wait was only about 20 minutes for two. #winning 

Among the two of us, we shared the La Mer eggs benedict, French Toast Tahiti and a mocha. All were delicious. 

However, I have to deduct a star because all thee eggs from our benedict were overcooked. I had my phone ready to Snapchat the oozy, egg-yolk drippin'-down-to-the-bread-goodness (#eggporn). However, to our disappointment, there was no ooze at all.. not a single drop. That's like the best part of an egg's benny. It would be a crime for this to happen anywhere else, but it was still so good regardless. Their potatoes are also bomb as well, probably due to the garlic they fry with it.

Since it was still really good, I'll probably be coming back!
author: Laverne N.

description:
Went here based on the fellow yelpers recommendation. We waited about 20 minutes for a party of 3 on a Friday morning. We were seated inside. They have a rear patio, so I recommend that if you have time to wait around, then request for a table on the patio. On the menu they advertise that the don't require tips since the employees are treated fairly with medical packages, 401k etc. I was truly impressed by this and you can tell by the servers attitude that they are happy there. Great customer service ! 

We had the divorcee eggs benedict, miracle pancakes and un,deux,trois (substituted the buttermilk pancakes for miracle pancakes). The eggs benedict were just ok. In the roasted potatoes I found a whole garlic which was really random. It was not even peeled, which made me question how they would get any flavour from it. The miracle pancakes were amazing !!! So fluflly, light and yummy. I also got the cafe latte which was served in a large bowl. It did not come upto par. I would skip the latte next time.
author: Nitya Z.

description:
I hate to give 3 stars to a restaurant with such good food, but the overall experience barely rated that many.

The good: the food is wonderful -- basically classic French with a California touch -- the wine list is interesting and well-priced -- and the venue feels very accommodating (crowded, French, warm, inviting. friendly). They have a policy of no tips, which I completely approve of.

The bad was the service. Mostly the problem seemed to be in the kitchen. We waited 30 minutes after our salads were removed before the entrees were served, and they trickled in over 10 minutes. The waiter was not terribly attentive, and it took some time to get another glass of wine.

Dessert was the same problem. The four of us ordered 3 desserts and 2 coffees. The first coffee arrived after 5 minutes, then a dessert, then the second coffee, and finally, perhaps 15 minutes after the first coffee, a second dessert arrived. It was only after waiting another 10 minutes we figured out that the 3d dessert wasn't going to come (the waiter hadn't heard us, or forgot). At no time did the waiter ask if we had everything and if everything was OK.

Luckily we really enjoyed each other's company during what turned into a 2.5 hour meal. But it would have been painful if we weren't all great friends.
author: Alan H.

description:
great food but the line was s long

at first i didn't understand why there is such a big line but after the first bite it hits you lol
author: Anne C.

description: YAAAAAAS!!!! Met a friend here 15mins before opening and we were 4th in line and were seated in the first wave. I am so glad we didn't have to wait but if we did it would have been worth it because the food is THAT good. This place is super cute inside and the menu is pretty big. We both decided on the crab Benedict and the miracle pancakes and a side of bacon of course! Everything was fantastic. Loads of fresh, delicious crab and the miracle pancakes were amazing. When you take a bite you get a burst of several delicious flavors and a little crunch from the cornmeal. One of the best breakfasts!
author: Andreea M.

description:
The food was pretty amazing here, got here early for brunch and luckily did not have to wait. On my way out, there was a large wait list with 10+ people waiting outside. 
Ordered the La Mer and the Gingerbread pancake. 
The pancake is large and thick! You can order up to 3, but I ordered only 1 and I was pretty full. The gingerbread was very flavorful and even though I don't get pancakes much, I would totally get it here again! The pancake had a cooked pear on top.
The La Mer is pretty much an eggs benedict with dungeness crab, avocado, and onions! Comes with choice of home fries or salad. This is one of the best egg benedict I've had! 
On top of the delicious brunch, the service was great also!

I'd recommend coming early if you do not want to wait because the restaurant is very small. Felt a little cramped while eating.
author: Andrew S.

description:
"A tour de France of food" - Benson M. 
"Absolutely fan-tas-tic" - Frenchmen friend 
"Cute date spot" - Random Elite Yelper  
"A French wonder" - Wannabe Zagat 

Zazie is a true hidden gem located within one of San Francisco's many lovely neighborhoods, Cole Valley. 

Just like most French restaurants, Zazie offers a great selection of quality wine that will sure to make your evening wonderful.

Next up, we have savory entrees and dreamy sweet desserts that will sure to blow you away. For example, with duck legs cooked to perfection and crisped to chip-like crunch, there is nothing that can beat that combination. 

Overall, I definitely recommend Zazie as a must visit when in the city. The service is by far one of the best and the food is to drool for!
author: Benson M.

description:
Saturday brunch at Zazie had been on my wishlist for a while but I was never patient enough to endure the long wait times. One fine Saturday , however, thanks to the chilly weather my friends and I were able to get a patio table right away! (the ones at the front of the restaurant are first come first serve). Ordered french toast, eggplant sandwich, red pepper pesto sandwich and the griddle flight. Everything was delicious but the pancakes on the fight- these were dry. From the inside, it is a cute restaurant but a Little cramped I would say. Tables are so close to each other you couple practically have a conversation with your neighbor. They have additional seating in the backyard which was nice.
Fun fact -look out for this board they've maintained with notes written by cole valley residents from when Zazie was closed for renovations.
author: Reema B.

description: Excellent food! Came on a week day around 1sh so the wait wasn't too bad, looking forward to go back and try more stuff on the menu!
author: Delphine L.

description: long wait but the eggs Benedict was worth it.  We arrived around noon on a saturday so we expected to wait for a brunch place, but we just had to awkwardly stand on the sidewalk for what seemed like 45 minutes and then eventually one of the first come fist serve patio tables opened up so we took it.  We got the french toast and the eggs benedict.  This place was a little over priced and i don't think the french toast was $17 good, but the eggs benedict was really good.
author: Geena G.

description:
There's a big sign on the door that says "ouvert." That's French for open. I speak French. So I wandered through the door. Chairs are on the tables. Doesn't look too open.

"Can I help you?" says some guy who obviously works there.

"Oh, the sign on the door says 'open' in French," I say innocently. 

The guy storms over, rips the sign down, and barks at me: "I had a long day and I'm sorry the sign offends you so much!"

"It doesn't offend me, it just confused me."

No apology. He storms away.

I guess next time I'll know better than to walk into a restaurant that says "ouvert" on the door. My bad?
author: Roger N.

description: Stumbled across this cute place and we loved it! The staff was very friendly and efficient and the food was delicious! Huge bonus for being able to tailor the size of the meal to your appetite (ie one or  two or even three eggs Benedict! Genius!)  Be sure to check out the back patio but any of the seating is fine. Definitely recommend this place!
author: Christy D.

description:
If you don't want a long wait time, there is an option to wait in front of the restaurant for outdoor seating, which is first come first serve. That being said, they have a beautiful garden patio if you're willing to wait.

The service was average, but it was quite busy, so it's understandable. Although not super attentive, they were still friendly.

We ordered the St. Trop, Monaco and a sweet French toast with strawberries. The two poached egg dishes had very nice texture and mouth feel. The oozing egg yolk and prosciutto (I had the salmon) was well balanced in flavor.

Not worth the hype though :/
author: Soohyun Y.

description:
Super awesome service
Happy employees hence a happy environment
Nice options for strict vegetarians 
Delicious food
We ordered home fries- delicious
Plate of roasted veggies - delicious
A vegetarian sandwich- good
Mocha- delicious
Soup - delicious
Best part- They treat their employees very well with health insurance, paid time off, 401K
author: Rohit P.

description:
This place is overhyped. We came on a Friday late morning around 10:40ish, outside front seating is first come first serve which is nice. But we decided to wait on the wait list to sit inside or the indoor patio. We were seated in less than 30min, we ordered the Tahiti French toast, miracle pancakes and Poached eggs:

Miracle pancakes: these will run out so come here early!! and they change their pancakes from time to time, but they were delicious. Nice texture and very fluffy. 

Tahiti French toast: one slice is more than enough to share and they were very dry. Good thing they had syrup and some house made jam to go along with the toast.

Pierre Noir poached Eggs: order this with the potatoes!!! potatoes had nice texture and seasoned just right, I wish they gave a bigger portion. YOLK PORN!!!!the yolk flowed out exactly how poached eggs should be. but other than that, it's a regular egg Benedict. 

I don't know why people spend hours waiting in line for this restaurant, there's nothing special. Sure the pancakes are pretty good but not the best I've ever had. I don't see myself lining up for hours on a weekend, it's too much work for mediocre brunch.
author: Vanessa Z.

description:
I wanted breakfast. Not wanting the usual places that deliver, I looked through Postmates and found Zazie. I've always wanted to go here, but was always deterred by the wait, so I figured this was the next best thing. I placed an order for brunch on Wednesday, November 11th at 11:36am. Our order arrived less than an hour later, at 12:26pm. Prices below are what I paid using Postmates which are the same as their online menu.

*Baguette ($3.50): Smoked salmon, cream cheese, red onions and capers (+$11.50)
*Fontainebleau (scrambled eggs): with portobellos, shiitake, porcinis, spinach, fontina, Salad, Whole wheat toast ($15)
*Mexico (scrambled eggs): with chorizo, white cheddar, roasted peppers and salsa, Home-fries, White toast ($15)
*Sarah jane's griddle flight: a sampler sized portion - 1 buttermilk, 1 ginger bread, 1 french toast ($19)

I really like their portion sizes. They are perfect for me as I actually finished my mushroom and spinach scramble minus the toast. The roommate thought their portions were on the smaller side, but I'm not a huge fan of ginormous plates of food, so I was happy. The scramble was filled with quality mushrooms and fresh spinach. The cheese made it all come together. Yum! And I adored the salad. A tiny bit overdressed for me, but still super delicious. The griddle flight was also a delight! Though the gingerbread was a little denser than I expected, I loved the flavors. The roommate gobbled up his scramble and the smoked salmon baguette.

I can only imagine how good their food is in the restaurant, but even when delivered, their food is mighty tasty!
author: Elena N.

description: This place is beyond amazing for more than just their food. We waited for a little over an hour since we had a huge party. Zazie is a cute little breakfast spot in Cole Valley and I loved the atmosphere it delivered. I can't remember what I ordered but everything I tried reminded me why I love breakfast/brunch so much. Starting the day with good food and good people is the way to go! I love how they accommodated our party of maybe about 10, including a little toddler. Usually, places like this won't go the extra mile and will have the party sit at different tables. Well-worth the wait, guys! Try it out!
author: Ashley P.

description:
Hella overrated and not worth an almost two hour wait. I still don't understand why it's so popular. The food was not very warm when they came out and the drinx were also meh. I ordered the eggs benedict, which I admit, is quite basic - but I was shocked at how it tasted like every other eggs benedict I've had in life (except for the one I tried to make, which was nasty af). It's a nice place to take your rating-obsessed-brunch-spot-visiting friends though bc it feels very "SF brunch."

will probably be back with such friends.
author: Juliana P.

description:
This place is poppin, which was expected by the amount of yelp reviews. They explain the wait to be "if there's 6 people before you, add 3 minutes to each table" to calculate your wait (you write your name on a waitlist) It's like you'll wait 1-1.5 hours.

However! If you're observant like my friend who was with me, the seating outside (two tables of 4 spots) is first come first serve. There's a sign outside but it seemed like most people weren't reading it. So awesomely enough, we got to sit down right away :)

The service was friendly and decently fast. Not lightning fast, but certainly not slow. 

Three of us ordered some form of eggs benedicts and the 4th ordered the miracle pancakes. Mine was the Divorcee benedict - you can choose the amount of eggs (1, 2, or 3) which I thought was kinda neat! They didn't really blow me away. I wasn't a big fan of the hollandaise sauce, too rich maybe. The english muffins weren't as toasty as I would like. The home fries were really good. Overall, good meal, but nothing out of the ordinary in my opinion.

I took a bite of the miracle pancakes and they tasted really good with the lemon curd.
author: Kelly G.

description:
Come to Zazie for weekend brunch and you'll inevitably be greeted by an imposing crowd of people with the exact same idea. Fear not, it moves quickly.

The menu offers a great selection of breakfast favorites, plus some twists on classics. If you can't decide which griddle items sound best, opt for the flight (you can sub the Tahiti French toast for an extra charge if you want to really go wild). Their hollandaise is lemony and perfect, if you decide to go in a benedict-ly direction. Potatoes are fine, but if you've been spoiled by Plow's breakfast potatoes, don't bother--these don't hold a candle to them.

Zazie falls into the miserable failing of so many breakfast places and serves fake syrup, which is such a downer, but they do have maple syrup available for an extra fee.

Don't miss their breakfast cocktails, like the pamplune spritz (rosé with grapefruit and peach essence, topped with champagne for a little bubble action).

Prices initially look a bit high, til you realize that they don't accept tips--the menu prices include profit sharing, insurance, 401(k) with matching, and paid sick leave for all employees, so what you see is what you pay.

Zazie is a solid brunch option, but not the most exciting.
author: Dara M.

description:
I'm critical when it comes to SF brunch reviews.

As every Bay Area associated-person knows, brunch is a thing in the city. People are OK with waiting over an hour for a foodporn benny or a special french toast...stuffed, sprinkled, or fried...whatever form it comes in. So excuse yourself if you can't handle this review. We waited an hour on Saturday brunch, which is typical for SF when you "do brunch." That wasn't a problem, since I've waited over an hour at Plow in Potrero Hill before. But if you're a brunch spot with that long of a wait, you should be blowing my mind. Zazie was delicious and all sorts of French-cute, but the small portion sizes and our "over it" server was not the business.

For our two-top, we shared a single LA MER (crab) benny, which was disappointing. We paid $17 for a sad, small plate (pictured below)...at least fill the plate up with homefries so it kind of looks like it's worth $17. Our favorite was the special pumpkin miracle pancakes, which weren't too sweet...and topped with a scoop of real pumpkin on top. The special omelette that weekend was a great combo of squash, goat cheese (I don't usually like goat cheese, but it was a GREAT pairing) and greens. We were extremely satisfied with the food, but we felt like the La Mer wasn't worth the $17. ONE EGG doesn't cost that much, even though the egg price has risen recently.

Service is "barely there," which is great if you're looking to chat with your brunch partner(s) and don't want any interruptions. Our dude was pretty chill, but being a server myself, I was glad that I didn't have to tip him for his lackluster performance. I hope Zazie's system of paying their employees a great wage is working out for them...this guy just didn't seem too pumped to be at work.

Lastly, their restrooms need more work. There's a tiny one wedged in the back of the house across from the kitchen window...so if there's a line (which there always is for women), then you'll find yourself standing in the space of the servers/kitchen/BOH, and just feeling in the way. This is probably an infrastructure detail they can't fix since SF is so tight for space. But it's not convenient. In all, I wouldn't make a special trip to come back to Zazie, but I'm glad I tried it and checked out their French-esque brunch theme. Back to the SF city hunt to find more brunch spots.
author: Jodi H.

description:
Why can't they make the entire plane out of the same material they use for the indestructible black box?

Why are there locks on the doors of 7-11?

Why can't all restaurants be tip free, and reward their employees with a decent wage?

I was impressed with Zazie.  Impressed with their food, impressed with their service, I was even impressed with their sliding restroom door!  You can't go wrong with poached eggs or the French toast for a nice brunch.  If you're so inclined, brave the elements and sit in the back patio.  

I'd frequent this place more often if I could find a parking or if it were closer to the office!
author: Ron L.

description:
A San Francisco brunch classic, but you have to get up early to wait in line. I recommend going 10-15 minutes before opening to put your name down. After that, the wait could be 30-60 minutes. Parking is hit or miss in that area, so give extra time to find parking too.

I like that Zazie includes gratuity in all its prices and service is pretty consistent. An added bonus is that they really take care of their employees - 401k matching and health benefits. That's pretty awesome. No wonder everyone is so cheerful there!

In terms of food, they've got a lot of options. From sweet to savory breakfast items, and also lunch options. I got an egg scramble, which was pretty good. I definitely recommend eating the toast with their homemade strawberry jam. That was actually the best part of the meal.
author: Sherry L.

description: Excellent experience!! Warm service, delicious food, and a fun enviornment. Listen to the waitstaff!!! The pork chop was best I have ever had. Eat outside any month of the year with their heatlamps. Best French neighborhood restaurant in SF!
author: Brennan W.

description: Super cozy atmosphere, lovely waitresses who can really read body language. You also don't tip!
author: Nina A.

description: This place is a locals Secret. Discover foods that will transport you to another country. It has a wonderful and romantic outdoor/heated area in back to have a lovely and cozy eating experience. Always a pleasure.
author: Celeste S.

description: Probably the best Breakfast / Lunch / Brunch place in San Francisco. Great atmosphere, friendly well-trained staff, and good menu selection. A little wait is worthwhile.
author: Johann F.

description:
My hubby found this restaurant for brunch from Yelp. We were so hungry that we didn't want to wait at the beginning, but:
-tips: there are four small tables in front of the restaurant, and there's a piece of paper stated that you were more than welcome to take those tables without waiting when they were available. Instead of waiting for a long time, we decided to take the table. 
-waiting: normally people have to wait half an hour and up. 
-parking: side streets parking is available on Sunday without paying.
-service: although we were sitting outside, we had been serve right away. Our waitress came and ordered drinks for us, then we got some suggestions on the orders. Nice. 
-Genevieve was the scramble egg with ham and avocado. Every single bit was so good. I wish the portion a little bit more. 
-Monaco was the egg Benedict was perfectly made. The grilled tomatoes would made the egg Benedict not that heavy. The potato sides was a bomb, they either pan fried or baked with garlic and other herbs. Just a good sides that I had had so far. 
Good brunch experience, waitress told us their dinner was pretty good also. We will come back and try nextv
author: Karmen S.

description:
Came at around 10am on a rainy Sunday with a friend, and there was already a huuuge list of people waiting to get in. WHO WOULD WAIT FOR BRUNCH ON A RAINY DAY?  We would.  My party of 2 was whole page away from being called so we stood waiting for about 40 minutes before we were sat, so not too bad.

The place is very nice and bright with a cozy feeling, and all staff members were friendly! 

The menu was very easy to read and had a little section about the treatment of their employees, which is something I think is great to consider when eating out. 

Food:

Magic Mimosa
Bourgogne Mimosa
St. Trope Eggs Benedict
Monaco Eggs Benedict

The magic mimosa was a special for the day, and I'm glad we chose this mimosa (& the bourgogne) since it was different from your usual grapefruit, orange, and cranberry mimosa. I preferred the magic mimosa because of the presentation and light taste, but depending on my mood I may crave the "darker" sweet bourgogne next time.

Zazie gives the option of 1, 2, or 3 eggs for your eggs benedict dish. We opted for two, with a side of home fries. We were both a little surprised to see smaller eggs, but it filled the both of us up pretty well. My friend loved her St. Trope,  and I enjoyed my Monaco. Like a good eggs benedict, the eggs were done nicely . The home fries were delicious, and included whole cloves of garlic - just like how Eats prepares their home fries. The garlic was done well here, but I prefer the crispiness of Eats' potatoes. 

Overall cute vibes but I probably will not come as often since it's a little out of the way for me. For thise who have never been I definitely recommend trying out Zazie and exploring the area.
author: Sherry Y.

description: This place is amazing from the food to the service this is definitely one of the best breakfast / brunch places I've been too...the coffee cake was really great also had the mimosas with sorbet at the bottom of the glass which was pretty incredible
author: Harrison P.

description: Really yummy La mer Crab Benedict! I love that you have the option to choose 1, 2, or 3 eggs and you have that option with French toast too, 1,2,or 3 pieces of toast. Beware they are fairly big pieces of French toast. A little spendy but it's because they don't expect tips and there is no tip line on your receipt. Would recommend.
author: Aivi P.

description:
Brunch is my favorite meal so was excited to try another brunch place ~
Came here around 11:30 and there was a long line and a whole page of people signed in before me .
Aftet walking around the neighborhood came back and was seated soon ~ i think it was around 12;30 more or less?
I got the florentine benedict ~ can never go wrong with spinach mushrooms and a poached egg . 
I love how here you can order 1 slice of french toast or pancake or 1 egg as it makes sharing easier and gives you the opportunity to try various dishes
Shared a french toast with banana and walnuts (forgot what its called) with my friend and the walnut helped capture what could have been an overly sweet french toast
I also got the mimosa with white peach sorbet which was wonderful as well.
The interior is cute , service good and the food was yummmmy ~
author: Julia K.

description:
We love love love this place. Felt like we walked into Europe with different languages all around us! Also no tipping, all the servers are paid built into the meal cost. So cool. 

Our waitress was awesome. I loved the chai and omelette, ham! They have outside heaters which is really nice. All the food tasted so fresh. This would be our regular breakfast spot if we lived in San Fran.
author: Darrelle G.

description:
I have been here a couple of times, both for breakfast/brunch and dinner.  The food is great but definitely on the pricey side (which is not too unexpected for French food).

Most recently in 06/2017, I visited Zazie and had their prie fixe dinner menu which consisted of:

Appetizer
-Pâté de Volaille
---The chicken pâté was provided with one slice of levain bread lathered with the pâté and included a side salad.  As far as the pâté itself, it was very creamy and smooth and had a good depth of flavor.  It did not taste wild/gamey and did not have the metallicky/organ taste that some pâté's have.  The levain bread was made well and had a nice toasted texture to it.  I wish it was just more than one slize of levain with pâté given the normal appetizer costs $13.  The side salad was a nice addition to help cleanse the palette.

Entrée
-Truite Meunière
---The trout was very flavorful and the skin had a nice crisp which worked well together with the crunch of the almonds.  Unfortunately the portion size of the trout was pretty small and I wish they had maybe given a bigger fish or some additional hearty sides to go with the dish because the side salad provided with the dish was much bigger than the fish itself.

Dessert(s)
-Decadent Vanilla Crème Brûlée
---The crème brûlée was very small portioned and the consistency was pretty typical of a crème brûlée.  The thin layer of caramelized sugar on top provided a nice crunchy texture to offset the soft texture.

I do like how they have now employed the no tipping rule as this is how it is done in other foreign countries as well so the waiters/waitresses are not paid by tips with a low base pay.  The staff was great and attentive to our needs and accommodating for a baby in the party.  I would definitely recommend checking this place out, but maybe not on a regular basis unless you want to break your bank.
author: Lawrence E.

description: We have had 2 wonderful dinner experiences. Staff both times (different waiter/waitress) fantastic. Food both times wonderful! Great little spot on Cole
author: Kelsie D.

description:
I love Zazie! It's my neighborhood brunch place, so I've been fortunate to eat here quite a few times. If you really want to experience Zazie without the two-hour long wait, go on a Friday morning! Unlike a few of the other brunch places in SF, Zazie serves brunch all week long. If you can only go on the weekend, sign up on the sheet and kill time at the Cole Hardware across the street. 

I've been to basically every single brunch hotspot in the city, but Zazie is one of the few I've been a repeat customer to. Aside from being conveniently located near me, the menu is diverse and they've got a lot of good options to choose from. Zazie's Miracle Pancakes are the best in the city. Make sure you go early enough in the day so that they don't sell out!
author: Charles L.

description:
Zazie--a cute little French cafe/restaurant nestled in one of the cutest little neighborhoods in the city, Cole Valley.

And also one of the finest little brunches in the city :)

The first thing you'll notice is a great ambience. It's a little bit of a squeeze, but it's pretty reminiscent of a French cafe. They treat their staff EXCEEDINGLY well (full benefits, can you believe?!) and it shows in the service. The servers are all humorous and attentive and everyone works with a huge smile. Really sets a good time for the great food. 

If you can, try to get seated on the back patio for a great dining experience

One of the unique points of Zazie is that for their benedicts and sweet options, you can choose how many eggs or slices you want. Feeling like you want half and half? Order one egg for your Benedict and one piece of toast :)

On to the actual benedicts, the Saint Trop (smoked salmon), Florentine (spinach and mushrooms) and La Mer (lobster) are all divine. The potatoes are baked crispy, and the eggs ooze yolk for that perfect creaminess

If you're looking for a sweeter breakfast, try their gingerbread pancakes with lemon curd and poached pear. Incredibly fluffy and not terribly sweet either. Or their French toast Tahiti. 

They've got a nice selection of mimosas to top off your brunch :) grapefruit is my personal favorite.
author: Jay P.

description: Had salmon Benny was good with side bacon girls had some scramble and French toast, super long wait but there's a bar next door that caters to waiting people. I ended up stumbling into Zazie after putting down some drinks for an hour and a half.
author: Scott S.

description:
When I first looked at this menu I was shocked at how expensive everything was, but Zazie is unique in that they don't accept tips - it is essentially included in the price so all workers, regardless of position, are paid more equally. They also receive health benefits and insurance, so kudos to you for fair worker treatment!

The food itself is stellar as well. My Florentine benedict came with a good ratio of spinach and portobello mushrooms, and the egg was perfectly runny. The house fries were tasty, with crispy smaller pieces and fluffy larger pieces; while a little saltier than I'm used to, I loved that they included a whole clove of garlic as well (if you read my reviews, you know I love garlic). My friend ordered the Albert benedict with bacon, white cheddar, and homemade salsa fresca, which she demolished. I like that you can choose whether you want 1, 2, or 3 eggs for poached eggs, so you can pick your portions or try some of the more expensive options if you're on a budget. 

Service here is efficient and all the workers are friendly and polite, holding doors for customers going through the narrow hallway. It was crowded inside the restaurant, but the back patio proved to be a pleasant dining experience as well, with festive decorations and heat lamps. I will definitely be back to try the rest of the menu!
author: KC W.

description:
Pretty good!! I enjoyed it.

My girlfriend and I got here right at opening and there were already around 4 or 5 other parties waiting. While we were seated right away, I can definitely imagine the giant crowd that is mentioned in other yelp reviews. So be sure to come early, or expect to wait if you come later. 

Not gonna lie the names on the menu were hard and I really don't remember what I ordered. I just know I got scrambled eggs and I don't remember which nationality I chose to model them after, I just know they were tasty. My girlfriend also got the benedicts and a slice of French toast on their challah bread. I never tried the benedicts but the French toast was good too. 

The service was very friendly and you can definitely tell there are a lot of regulars there. I guess I'm only giving it 4 stars because if I had to wait in line, I'd rather wait for Mama's on Washington Square. It's just a preference thing, but if I were you I would definitely try Zazie, I think it's great. 

I also really like how they provide their employees with decent wages. I've worked in a restaurant before and it was a lot of hard work with low pay, glad to know Zazie treats their employees well.
author: Kyle L.

description:
I absolutely LOVE this place! The food, the atmosphere, the staff, the restaurant's philosophy. One of my favorite places in the city. I've been here for both brunch and dinner and neither one disappoints.Try to sit outside if possible!

For brunch, I've order the St. Trop eggs Benedict and the Pain de Mie French Toast, and both were incredible. I also LOVE the roasted potatoes that come on the side of the egg dishes.

For dinner, I've ordered the Pasta Printemps (minus the prosciutto) and the salmon, also both amazing. I don't really think you can go wrong at Zazie!
author: Sinead G.

description: I love eating breakfast here! The setting is adorable and it is a great place to bring friends or family. It is definitely easier to eat hear on weekdays because it is a 10 min wait vs 30 min.
author: Ravina Y.

description:
On a recent Sunday we decided to stop by here to see what all the great reviews are about. We came by at a busy brunch hour, and the wait time was approximately 1.5 hours. Luckily about 40 minutes in, we spotted a patio table open up, which is first-come-first-serve. Being the incredibly busy restaurant that this is, it takes the waitstaff quite some time to get around to everyone's orders so don't expect the fastest service even once you have the fortune of being seated. Considering the hectic environment, the staff truly are doing their best, however. The food is a little on the higher end of the $$ category, but they pay their staff a living wage so you don't have to leave a tip (though I'm sure extra cash would be appreciated). 

The food is absolutely incredible, especially their breakfast items. I also ordered a Zazie spritzer, which is honestly really over-priced for the amount they give you even considering the living-wage situation. We also tried their burger, which was fantastic. Their fried potatoes which come with the eggs and can even come with the burger are to die for. Their eggs benedict are fantastic as well, though they weren't my favorite item. Their french toast was delicious but a tiny little bit too rich for my taste. 

Overall, I recommend this spot for anyone who is a visitor or a local to SF. While not the best brunch location in the Bay, it's definitely top 10.
author: Nikki T.

description:
Came here at 9am- first come first serve seating open outside. Wait for inside was 1hr wait. We ordered the French toast tahini, the miracle pancakes, and the baked eggs with spinach mushrooms polenta and tomato chèvre sauce. Home fries were perfect and came with roasted garlic (mmm). Coffee was excellent also. 

Food here is very good but not worth an 1hr wait IMO. Come here early
author: Diane W.

description:
Everyone in the BAY should patronize this wonderful establishment....why? For the mere fact that they TAKE CARE OF THEIR EMPLOYEES. It's written on their menu that they do not accept tips because each employee is offered paid PTO, full health care benefits and pension plans; which is incorporated in the prices of the food. 

Another reason why everyone should come here is the FOOD is incredible!!! Seriously it's as good as it gets. I've been here a number of times and the food is consistently delicious and the staff is more than friendly even when it gets crazy busy. 

After +3000 reviews what else can be said?!?! Beautiful, charming Parisian cafe....one of my most favorite brunch spots in my most favorite city.
author: Caye Q.

description:
It is one of the brunch place in the city! Restaurant opened at 9 and I got here st 830am. Already 15-20 waiting. Put my name down. I got my seat around 9. But if you come at 9. I can't grarantee the seating luck.

They have quite a lot seating but kitchen was relatively smaller. But yes they are good and they should be very busy. I ordered a crab meat two egg egg benefit, Genevieve egg scramble( with avacado) and one piece of miracle pancake, which is pumpkin spice flavor with fresh cream today. It was delicious!

Scramble egg - Black Forest ham with soft silky egg, along with fresh creamy avocado and it was very good. 

Egg benedic - flavorful yummy and the crab meat was lightly butter-- hmmm yum yum 

My favourite spot so far!
author: Stephanie H.

description:
Was informed a night before to come here for brunch and to come EARLY which was no joke. We had arrived an hour after they opened (10AM) and the line was ridiculous but we put our name down and then walked around for a half an hour and surprisingly our seats were ready in about 10 minutes after that., maybe because it suddenly started pouring and people just cleared out.

We ordered "New Yorker" scrambled eggs (because I'm from NY) and Monaco Eggs Benny. The scrambled eggs were amazing because the smoked salmon was already cooked with the cream cheese. Even the toast was made just the right temperature. The Eggs Benny were good but the best part was the potato wedges we got for the side. They've gotta be the best potatoes I've had in all of SF AND NYC. must get!!! I had the Zazie Mimosa which was alright but next time I'll try their special one on the special menu. Heard miracle pancakes here were a miracle but we weren't pancake people unfortunately. Highly recommend!!
author: Emily L.

description: Super tasty Gingerbread pancakes w Pears & lemon compote. It's usually very busy on the weekends and for good reason, it's really good food! I've been going here for years and like the flavors and quality of food.
author: Christopher D.

description: Very nice brunch place, pancake with a little bit lemonade is very tasting. Also, they all have good looking, as all French food do.
author: Simon Z.

description:
Coming out of town looking for brunch.  Make I go to yelp and see wassup.  Hey look it's Zazies, pretty good review from over 3k reviews.   There is no way the food sux;  at the very least, average.   After all, numbers don't lie.

Numbers lie.  Especially in San Francisco.  I wonder if these are bot reviews.

Advise, don't waste your time waiting in line.
author: Gbade O.

description: We stopped in and were seated immediately. Walked into the back of restaurant and there is a nice covered patio area. I ordered the classic French toast and my fiancé got the Banana/Walnut French toast. The banana and walnut toast was on another level. Caramelized banana upon French toast with banana puree with walnuts mixed inside. Quick service and one thing to note is the restaurant has a "no tip" service added. "Our menu prices include a living wage, revenue sharing, paid sick leave, fully funded health & dental insurance, paid parental leave, and 401K with employer match" which is refreshing to see in the restaurant industry. Would recommend. #thingsnickeats IG @quicknickk
author: Nicholas L.

description:
Oh Zazie! I dreamt about you last night in my sleep...
Was it because it was 9 of us and we all decided to try you on a BUSY Sunday morning?
Was it because it was an hour and a half wait in order to finally try your food?
Was it because we received complimentary Miracle pancakes ($9) for our wait...  
Was it because I received exceptional customer service that I can't help but BRAGGGG!!
Or maybe...JUST maybe it's because YOU ARE AN DAMN GOOD 5 STAR BRUNCH!!

So a group of 8 of my friends and I decided to start our morning with a great brunch at Zazie. I have YET to hear about this place before finally coming and when I had seen all the people standing in front of the restaurant at 10A.M. I knew this place was quiet popular.

Mario, the general manager explained to us that it would be an hour wait if we wanted to sit in a group. AN HOUR WAIT!! I was SO not pleased to hear that but I totally understood. I explained to him that we were celebrating birthdays and needed to be seated together. He explained that he was a man of his word and if we waited at the Peet's Coffee right by the Zazie restaurant then he would come get us in an hour.

A little after an hour our table was FINALLY ready and Mario called us! Yayy! We had a great seat in the back patio (which is such a nice area) I truly recommend seating in the back if you can! We even had complimentary Miracle Pancakes on the table waiting for us for our wait! SAY WHAT?? Could this get any better? HAHA YESSS, I'm not nearly done explaining!  

We finally ordered our brunch and I must say that everything looked SO DELICIOUS!!! If I had room to taste everything on the menu I think I probably would! Our server Servando was amazing at taking our orders and making sure we were well supplied with water. 

I ordered:
~ La Mer- which comes with hand-picked Dungeness crab, avocados, green onions w/ home fries and French Toast Tahiti stuffed with caramelized bananas and walnuts.

Everything was so delicious! I definitely recommend mixing and matching on your brunch and trying different items!

**JUST A TIP**- No tipping at this restaurant! I was so surprised when I had seen that on the menu! I think this is the first restaurant I have been to where you don't tip! Noiceee!

THANK YOUUU for Mario (General Manager) and our lovely server Servando for the great hospitality and there is NO doubt in my mind that I will be back for another brunch day or better yet. Trying out the dinner menu!

This is definitely a place I would recommend! The wait is well worth every delicious bite!
author: Porsche C.

description: One of the best brunch places I have been to yet! We all loved every single dish and look forward to going back!
author: Josie W.

description: Really yummy French toast! The mimosa was a bit small for $13, but they don't take tips since they pay their employees good wages so it's a wonderful establishment! The wait time can be a bit long but it's so worth it! Not like the other tourist traps!
author: Ashley J.

description:
1 1/2 hour wait for a table for 9 and so worth it!!!!  Met up with my Yelp friends to celebrate a few birthdays and Mario the GM took care of us. Said they only have 1 large table to hold us or we could split up...we decided to wait. The booth was very comfortable for us. We had a plate of pancakes waiting for us and they were sooooo worth it. Miracle pancakes as they are called. 

Our group ordered a mix of plates but I loved mine, the Monaco Benedict with crispy potatoes. Also shared the Tahiti French toast which was amazing. It didn't need the syrup but try it with their homemade raspberry sauce!  Also ask for their homemade hot sauce it's spicy!!!

Ask to sit in the patio it's cozy and lots of lush greenery. 

Tipping included in price of meal. Street parking only.
author: Stephanie T.

description: I have to say that this was probably one of the best breakfasts I have had in a while. Since I was by myself, I didn't have to wait too long for a table. My server was very nice and friendly and helped give me some good recommendations on what to get. I ended up getting the Monaco which was absolutely heavenly. The eggs were poached just right and there was definitely enough hollandaise. The roasted potatoes on the side were just the right amount and the roasted garlic cloves that were thrown in there were a wonderful addition. I was a bit shocked by the prices by then remembered that tipping was optional and the food was definitely worth the price. Plus it's walking distance to all of the stores in the Haight. I'm definitely going to try and come back every time I come back home.
author: Tara C.

description: Huh? I've frequented Zazie a few times over the years--mostly because friends wanted to go. I've found the spot to be cute and the staff friendly. But with a wait like this every weekend, I still personally haven't been converted.
author: Yad L.

description: A really cute place to go for breakfast! Lots of options and the food is fresh and tasty! The prices seem expensive, but the price already includes tip so it balances out.
author: Kianna C.

description:
Cute venue with lots of French murals and posters that draws quite the crowd for weekend brunch - likely because there's just not many places for brunch nearby. An egg dish, for example, came out lukewarm, and not terribly tasty at that, while a mimosa wasn't anywhere near as fruity as advertised. Service was similarly lukewarm, although I do appreciate the fact that they now pay their workers fair wages here, while also keeping prices very reasonable. 

Yet another example of a place benefiting from an outsized reputation solely due to the fact that there aren't many other places like it nearby.
author: Vincent L.

description: I have had better service at Chipotle. I know the reviews are amazing, so maybe I went on a bad day, but I believe leadership's attitude trickle's down. Their owner, Jennifer, or at least she said she was the owner was very rude. Food was average, but she left a bad taste in my mouth. So many better places in San Fran, sad I spent my perdiem there.
author: John F.

description:
Miracle pancake - 3/5
Divorcee benedict - 4/5
Stuffed french toast - 2/5
Gingerbread pancakes - 5/5 - Pear puree and gingerbread flavors are great together. 
Croque monsieur - 3/5

Overall, Gingerbread pancakes are "as good as it gets."
author: Mark O.

description:
Very cute place with super service and delicious breakfasts. Benedicts, scrambles and for sure the French Toasts are very tasty. 

The back patio seems to be the best place if you have a choice. 

Can get rather busy at times, which is a testament to the food. 

Well done...
author: Millard M.

description:
I don't understand how this place has such high reviews. The concept is great - tip is included in the menu price and servers get a living wage. Execution was not. 

My boyfriend and I each ordered a drink and a brunch dish. Total bill for an unsatisfactory meal was almost $70. The real kick to the stomach was the food was average and the service was lacking. The server rarely checked on us as we waited 30+ minutes for food.
