For Sunday morning brunch, the line is more than a little ridiculous but I have to say the back patio area seating brunch experience may be well worth the two paged wait list. 

The back patio area it outdoor seating enclosed by bushes but the top covered so you wouldn't have to worry about applying sunblock while out there. I think it's just nice to eat outside with the green around. And not so squished like it appears for the indoor seating. 

When you order you can also kinda choose how much food you want, and there are different prices accordingly. For example you can order two or three pieces of French toast - and it would cost either $6 or $8 depending on the size. Which makes it nice for sharing...or not. My friend ordered three piece for his smoked salmon Benedict so that he can have two for himself and one for me. 

FRENCH TOAST TAHITI- looking at pictures I was dying to try this, and found it was a little too sweet for me. It's kinda like having dessert for breakfast, but I did like that there's a lot of banana inside. 

SIDE OF POTATOES- if anything, this is what I will order and only order. Like just three orders of their potatoes. It is soooo good. It's super crispy on the outside and super soft on the inside with nice garlic flavors and not drenched in oil or anything. I was craving it for a week after. 

I love the waiter that was serving us. Very pleasant dude that seemed like he actually enjoyed working there and always willing to help out with a quickness.
author: Jane K.

description:
This place was definitely worth the wait. 

We arrived at around 9:15am and there was already a long line... and they open at 9! There was a sign-in sheet and we were on the second page. Inside, garden view or first available? We chose first available. From the outside, it looked really small. Tables on each side of the door in the front with heaters above. And inside was narrow from what I could see from the outside. About 45 minutes later, we finally heard our names. They took us all the way to the back which to my surprise was more seating and it was so cute! I guess this was the garden view. It was like a large covered patio. It was a drizzly morning so they had the heaters on. I'm glad we had a chance to dine out here. We ordered right away. I ordered the "La Mer" which was basically eggs benedict with dungeness crab and avocado ($18  with one egg). My boyfriend ordered one egg with Aidell's chicken-apple sausage breakfast. Both of our dishes also included home fries and those were our fav! Perfectly roasted with roasted garlic. We actually ate the garlic on toast. It was so buttery and delicious! My crab benedict was good. It didn't have that much of the crab taste. Maybe if I had 2, I would have tasted it more. My boyfriend enjoyed his dish, as well. It was the perfect amount of food because it made our tummies happy but not overstuffed. 

Service was great! Waiters were quick to fill our waters and grabbed whatever we needed. 

I would recommend this place to anyone. But try to sit in the garden area, it's totally worth it!
author: Michelle N.

description:
We live nearby and eat here nearly every weekend. The service is fantastic and the food is amazing. Personally, I adore the miracle pancakes with eggs and bacon, but my boyfriend loves the sandwiches (tuna is his favorite). 

Though we usually come for brunch I actually think dinner is where Zazie really shines. Their menu is wonderful. I love their ravioli, everything is well portioned, plated, and feels special. The dinner service is especially attentive. We always indulge in desert (sometimes we come in just for desert ).

The brunch is wonderful, but dinner is spectacular. We  come for special occasions and love the creative menus on days like Valentine's. Zazie keeps us coming back.
author: Sarah C.

description: Famous place. Nice, very kind people. No tip. Food was great, but not excellent. Nice brunch place in SF
author: Sung H.

description: The menu is full of amazing choices. The service is great! Get there 10 minutes before opening time and you might just get a seat! The long wait time is completely understandable, so if you're willing to wait for great food, service and atmosphere...  Zazie is the place!
author: Liri S.

description:
This is a great restaurant with delicious food and amazing management.

The foods ordered :

* Eggs Benedict Florentine
   - Eggs were tender and poached to perfection
   - Mushroom was the highlight. So flavorful
* Miracle Pancakes (2x)
   - Soft, warm, and delicious
   - Lemon sauce was a perfect companion
* Zazie Spritzer
   - Perrier with cranberry and orange juice (?)
   - Refreshing

The food was delicious, but the cherry on top is the management's commitment for transparent pricing, refusing to accept tip, but instead including disclosing all costs (employee paid leave, medical leave, 401k matching, etc.) and including them in the upfront cost of the food. I can definitely support this.

Thanks for the delicious brunch!
author: Jon Min C.

description: Long wait around fellow brunch lovers slowly transitions into tight seating with a lively kitchen for a sound track. You'll get should food, quick and efficient service, but nothing that will wow you. They are known for their brunch and no tip policy. Don't skip vegetable heavy dishes here, produce quality is great.
author: Kendrick H.

description: Pretty good! First experience:no wait on a Tuesday morning. I love the aesthetics, service is great, food wasn't mind blooming but good.
author: Edna V.

description:
Probably the tastiest meal I have ever eaten in SF.

I  selected Zazie because I wanted a French restaurant for an early dinner in the Haight area and it read well. I was able to make a res ( something  you can't do for brunch) and we were seated promptly ,despite our party being incomplete, in a window booth. Service was excellent; hot fresh rolls were served with a dollop of french butter,the waiter guided us through the extensive menu. We were intrigued by the bourride, a sort of stew with salmon,mussels,prawn and the waiter encouraged that selection. Two of us went for it and,although it looked small as it arrived, was delicious and perfect. The taste of the ingredients coalesced with a sauce that gave the dish unity; it wasn't like eating a piece of fish,a prawn etc, it all came together with a subtle spice on top. WOW. This will be a place to return to,especially for an early dinner.
author: Charles R.

description:
Be prepared to wait; bring a book.

Sure there is an incredibly long line (all the time) at Zazie, but that's when you know it's going to knock your socks off! Zazie is the perfect place for brunch. It doesn't matter if you are going to enjoy a meal outside on the patio or inside because the food is the real reason you are making the hike! 

After waiting an hour, our name was finally called. Every minute we waited the anticipation grew greater and greater! Needless to say, I was so ready for some awesome food my exceptions were high and Zazie lived up to the exceptions! 

The thing to get is their Miracle Pancakes. The flavor is seasonal and is constantly switching. I tried the Gingerbread with a poached candied pear on top...OMG, incredible! Along with these, they also have a to-die-for omelet. Again, the omelet switches everyday and I couldn't imagine this ever being bad. 

The staff is friendly, efficient and on their toes. I'm not shocked that this place isn't a "five star" solely due to the wait, but trust me the wait is worth every last crumb!
author: Kendal Ann M.

description: Absolute must visit for brunch! I had the French Toast Tahiti with roasted bananas and walnuts. It was sweet, rich and incredible. My wife got a side of French toast with home fries. They pay their employees a living wage. Feels like a French cafe!
author: Bobby K.

description:
I have been wanting to try this little neighborhood gem since seeing a spot review on Bay Area Check Please!  First of all, the neighborhood of Cole Valley is charming, quaint and worth time spent roaming the shops.  This restaurant lived up to my expectations.  How can you not love a restaurant with a Non-Tip policy.  They offer full benefits and live able wage for their hardworking staff, adjusting their menu prices to reflect, and voilà...total of your check is the total of your check.  

We were seated quickly...service was attentive, food was deliciously good.  We started with the charcuterie platter...which had pate, salmon salad...both were tasty and spread on toast, amongst other treats....devoured quickly.  My husband ordered the juicy pork chop and his exact words were..."best restaurant ordered pork chop I ever have eaten".  I enjoyed the hanger steak with a creamy mushroom sauce...it did not disappoint.  We finished my birthday celebration meal with a sampling of two desserts...both tasty and enjoyed.  We will return.  Thanks Zazie's for making my birthday dinner such an enjoyment.
author: Nancy M.

description: Zazie is amazing. The food and atmosphere is cozy & charming. The staff is beyond friendly. And the food is addictive. Tips are included. The back patio is beautiful. You can't go wrong sitting inside either. The miracle pancakes never disappoint. Things that are easy to miss but you have to try: mimosa with mango, homemade cream cheese coffee cake, and BLT. Miracle pancakes, burger, scrambles & benedicts are also nothing short of delicious. I go here minimum 3x a month.
author: Abigail S.

description:
YES! Zazie is at the top of my list for favorite brunch places in SF. The brunch here is superb! 

Asides from the menu the server hands to you, be sure to check out the special menu on your table! The bf and I may have over-ordered...but here's what we ordered! 
- Tahiti French Toast
- Miracle Pancake 
- Omelette on the special menu 
- St. Trop Benedict (basically a smoked salmon Benedict)

I enjoyed everything we ordered, especially the Benedict. My bf loved the omelette and says its the best he has ever had. Another one of the reasons why I loveeee Zazie is because you can customize your order with however many eggs you want (1/2/3) or however many pancakes/french toasts you want (1/2/3). This is great if you want to try other items on the menu or if you have a small appetite! 

Not only is the food delicious, but Zazie also treat their employees well with paid-sick leave and health benefits. Of course, this is why the menu prices are a bit steep. But hey! It goes to a good cause. They're also serious about their no tip policy here. There isn't even an option on the receipt when you pay with card, AND they emphasize it on the menu! 

When my friends come visit SF, I'll definitely bring them to Zazie :).
author: Fanny H.

description:
Came here with a friend on a Thursday afternoon and there was absolutely no wait. We got seated after a waiter noticed us walking in, which was pretty surprising considering I've read all these reviews about how ridiculously long the waits are. If you're trying to come here, it's best to try to see if you can make it on a weekday to avoid the wait times! :-)

We ordered the Monaco eggs Benedict with two eggs that came with their home style fries and the challah French toast. I thought the Monaco was quite delicious. There was something different about their hollandaise that I really liked. It was extremely smooth. I don't really know how to describe it other than it was good. The challah French toast was okay. I didn't think it was anything special. I actually thought the bread was a bit dry, but it wasn't god awful.

The service was great. Everything was prompt and we were helped when asked. 

It's worth the try, but I'm not sure if I would wait to eat here considering there are a TON of brunch places in San Francisco/Bay Area...
author: Stephanie H.

description: Great brunch - definitely recommend! We had just landed in Frisco for vacation and did some some research beforehand so we knew we wanted our first brunch at Zazie. It did not disappoint! It was a beautiful day to sit in the surprise back patio area, and they were super nice about us having our carry-ons with us. Our server, Sarah Jane, was amazing! She clearly knew her stuff and gave us perfect recommendations based on our tastes and hunger levels. I also asked for an espresso to be brought halfway through our brunch (bougie, I know lol) and she brought it over right on time, despite how busy she was! She made our experience great just as much as the delicious food. We like to try new places all the time but we might be back during our 3-day stay!  (rank of what we ordered: Mexican scrambled eggs with soyrizo were better than the Eggs en Fonte, but both really good!)
author: Mohammad R.

description:
If you can spend away, go ahead. Are you on the budget and looking for something that'll fill you up? Not the right place. 

I ordered a Florentine with 1 egg and a side of the salad for $12. I find this place slightly overpriced and overhyped. I'm a small asian chick and I didn't get full from their entree. Decent food, but overpriced. 

The dude calling out the names could also smile a bit just for service. He seemed like he didnt wanna be there.
author: Rimski C.

description:
Sorry if you read my previous review, I legitimately made a mistake and misread Zazie's as ZUZU's in Cambridge. This place, on the other hand, is where I go to relax and enjoy my first meal when in San Francisco. I can't recommend this place enough. Everything here is made to taste better than the next dish. One time I came in and they had realized cherry's that simmered in wine for a whole day, and it topped the french toast that didn't soak it and mushed it but it as just paired perfectly, not invading the bread's space. The flavors here are genuinely going to be the reason to come back.  The wait can be long, but really if you flew in here for 5 hours waiting a bit longer is no real problem. Your first and your last meal here and going to be breathtaking. They also sell their pancake flour, so you can try to relive the moment that your tongue tasted, cherished the sweet, savory food of Zazie's.
I extremely HIGHLY recommend this place. Get their french toast, or their poached egg, with tomatoes, and their pancakes all in all you can't get enough. Again if you read that I had a bad review of this place it was because of a misreading on my behalf,  Zazie's sorry about that, I love your food way too much!
author: Juan S.

description:
Free corkage on Tuesdays. I repeat: Free. Corkage. On. Tuesdays. 

A girlfriend suggested Zazie for dinner, knowing both of us would bring wine wherever we'd go
and lots of it. Before meeting her there, I perused the menu on their website and read about Zazie's tip-free environment. They price their menu items to incorporate good wages, 401k, profit sharing, and health insurance. This prompted me to see just how high their food was priced, only to find that it is no more expensive than most restaurants in SF serving this kind of high quality food (entrees range from $19 to $31). 

We started with the Assiette de Fromages (cheese plate) and the Asiette Charcuterie )meat plate). Both came with lots of toast points/bread and each cheese and meat was a healthy portion. I loved having olives, cornichons, dried figs in syrup, and a heaping pile of mixed greens with a lovely dressing served alongside the meat & cheese. The salmon rilletes was the best I've ever had!

Our waitress warned us when we had initially sat down that the kitchen was down to one pork chop. We told her to hold it for us after we read that it was served with their savory bread pudding (which can also be ordered as a lone standing side dish). The pork chop was fantastically seasoned, huge in size, and simply delicious. But, the real show stealer was the savory bread pudding, consisting of challah bread, fontina cheese, and bacon. It was one of the best things I have consumed in 2015. It was so good that I brought a side home for my better half. Everyone should get to experience this dish!

Albeit very full, we decided to split a dessert and opted for the Cuit de Chocolat Chaud - "baked hot chocolate" topped with a massive layer of golden marshmallows. Very decadent and it reminded me of a grown-up s'mores rendition. 

Zazie's ambiance is very European, it is dimly lit and the main dining room is very cosy. The staff is warm, attentive, and fun. We left will our bellies full of good food and wine (we only polished 2 of our 3 bottles off that we brought). I will be back here to try their brunch soon, but dinner was definitely outstanding!
author: Anna R.

description:
Not worth the hype.

We took a lyft out to Cole Valley on a Saturday morning and the line was ridiculous. It was our first time in the neighborhood so we didn't mind strolling while waiting. We got seated after about an hour and split the La Mer. It was good but Eggs Benedict always is. I would not make the trip out again.
author: Jane H.

description: This place is great! We walked up for dinner and the weather was a little chilly and they said we could be seated immediately if we sat outside. As soon as we agreed we were pleasantly informed they had a heat lamp AND super warm fleece blankets. So good service aside - the food was amazing. The steak and pork chops were some of the best. I want to come back every time I'm in San Francisco especially since I haven't had their brunch yet!
author: Jaclyn S.

description: Best brunch of my life--and no, I'm not being hyperbolic. They find a way to bring fresh and unique flavors to be what could be a basic breakfast item. I highly recommend any scramble and their miracle pancakes. Be prepared for a long wait and have to stand around to hear your name.
author: Laurisha C.

description: So, so good, we sat here for hours and had a three course breakfast. Best brunch options I've seen and so I just couldn't chose one.
author: Gunnar M.

description:
Amazing!! 
The wait was well worth it. Started off with a mimosa with a scoop of white peach sorbet and black current. Really refreshing and a pretty color. Ordered a poached egg with smoke salmon. Heavenly. The waiter was good and the staff was nice. Only downer is the one bathroom. Definitely recommend this place!
author: Janelle S.

description:
Brunch is my favorite meal combination. Like many breakfast places Zazie has a great menu filled with eggs, potatoes, pancakes and French toast. 

But what makes Zazie stand out? 

To be honest I don't know. 

The ingredients were cooked well and tasted nice and fresh. 
My Avingnon scramble with egg whites was delicious but it wasn't anything to rave about. The other egg dishes at our table were the same, good but nothing too remarkable (eggs any style w/bacon, poached egg florentine and an egg special). 

The French Toast Tahiti was a whole other story. These were the fattest most overwhelmingly sweet but somehow very good slices of bread I have ever eaten. The caramelized banana and walnut spread made these stand out and could have been eaten on its own. 

The line is out the door even before the doors open so get there early to put your name on the list. If you happen to see a line go up to the list and see how long the wait is before turning away, people usually hang out in front giving the illusion it's too busy to visit. 

Service is friendly and attentive. 

Worth the experience at least once, maybe twice depending ;) 

Enjoy!
author: Katy F.

description: Oh man the food was delicious. Good portions and good quality good. The organic coffee was also good. Definitely worth going there for breakfast. The prices include tips. It was packed when we went. Tables are very close to each other and there is outdoor seating.
author: Arlind M.

description:
Amazing in every way! We went for brunch. Just be sure to call early and secure a spot. It's always packed!! 
Mimosas were amazing as well.
author: Michael A.

description: We ordered the italia scrambled eggs and the noir benedict eggs. The benedict eggs with the hollandaise sauce are awesome. Very nice place and great taste!! We would definitely come back again!
author: Marta D.

description: Delicious brunch, drinks, and especially French toast. The weekend wait can be over an hour, but it was still 20 minutes on a weekday. A few people brought in coffee from the Peet's next door and the restaurant didn't seem to mind. Service is fine, the seating is a little crowded, and the food is the selling point--there's no bad option on the menu.
author: Lauren B.

description:
pretty good place for brunch.
this place doesn't accept tips but it means each dish is that much more $$
wait was not bad.
the bread pudding pancakes and benedict were solid!! however, the gingerbread pancakes were dry and dense and i would definitely pass on them.
the one caveat is that they don't serve maple syrup with pancakes but the corn syrup based pancake syrup. you would think they would serve maple syrup when charging $10/pancake but nope!
author: Priscilla P.

description: The brunch is really good. I loved the French toast Tahiti and it was soo good I finished all of it. The genevieve scrambled egg was also delicious. The coffee cake was really good too it had a sweet filling. However when the filling was gone it didn't taste as good. The setting was very nice especially the garden area. I would definitely go here again.
author: Denice Arielle M.

description: It's a good go-to breakfast spot with a lot of options from  eggs to burgers. There are vegetarian options and though prices may seem a bit high, they don't accept tips so the prices average out to be comparable to similar places.
author: Justin H.

description: Expect a long wait. Lots of people but not too crowded at all. The food is excellent and creative but service was extremely slow.
author: Kira W.

description: Friendly service and food is on point definitely going back to try new plates. Just one suggestion French toast with banana and walnuts  taste great but don't go easy on the nuts next time please .
author: Roberto Z.

description: Ate lunch there today. They do an outstanding job. Good food, attentive wait staff. And they pay their staff enough that they don't need tips. Adequate wage, health care, retirement funds ... gee, such a concept!
author: Clyde V.

description:
Zazie is quite hyped up. Some reasons for this are valid. The owner is a woman and they pay their employees excellent salaries and benefits. The prices are reasonable given tip is included in the fees. Having traveled extensively in Asia and Europe, a no tipping policy is refreshing to see in the U.S. The back patio is a nice hangout spot in a city that is surprisingly lacking in outdoor restaurant space. 

Zazie is very middle of the road in terms of taste of food. This is quite disappointing and leaves me wondering if popularity can influence people's perceptions of quality so easily. This has been proven about wine in research studies. People find expensive wine tastes better when they are told it is expensive wine. However, when they are blinded to price, people often prefer the taste of less expensive wine. (As a non drinker, this is more fascinating than utilitarian.) Everything is filtered through our mindsets. 

Lastly, Zazie is yet another example of the deleterious effects of social media. Nothing is hidden. The owner went on a rant about children. While nobody likes ill mannered children, this is more a reflection on the parents inability or unwillingness to teach manners. Children who cry are not ill mannered. They have valid reasons for this. I always feel for parents traveling with children on planes. They are viewed so negatively and it's unfair. One would hope the owner would rethink her views on house arrest for new parents. 
http://m.sfgate.com/news/article/Zazie-restaurant-owner-apologizes-kids-Facebook-6614956.php
author: Zak R.

description:
Oh... man. Zazie is simply deeee-lightful. I've only been for brunch but I feel like I am missing out on other amazing meals based on the pictures I've seen here. 

Plan to wait. Even when I've come on weekdays, I've waited 15-20m for a seat. If you're not in a rush, definitely put your name in for the back patio - it's picturesque and completely adds to the experience. 

The menu has a really nice variety of gourmet breakfasts - from eggs baked with polenta, spinach, mushrooms, spicy tomato sauce and goat cheese, to fancy orange french toast, to the most amazing gingerbread pancakes with poached pears and lemon compote. There are always specials to try, and interesting mimosas to drink. 

The service is average and the restaurant itself can feel a little cramped, but the food makes it all worthwhile. There are also plenty of places to browse and explore around the neighborhood while you wait, or before/after your meal.
author: Catie F.

description: Zazie's is definitely a decent choice for brunch! Prepare for a looong wait and sharing the same air with the tables next to you because it's poppin and cramped in there. It also seemed like if you were friends with the guy handling the wait list, you could get seated right away/have tables reserved for you. Kinda annoying but whatever. We waited about an hour but it was our fault for coming at practically prime time on a Sunday. We got the Crab Cake Benedict, Smoked Salmon Benedict, and two cocktails. The cocktails were alright, but they really hiked up the price of our bill at around $13 each. The benedicts were good, a little better than the average benedict. The potatoes were crispy and yummy, and I did like how they put whole cloves of roasted garlic in there because I looove garlic. However, I felt like they definitely could've put more potatoes and felt that they kinda skimped on them. Overall, a solid brunch, but too pricey and too long of a wait time.
author: Alyssa W.

description:
Sunday morning, long wait, smaller restaurant. I recommend arriving 1 hr early then grabbing a cup of joe & taking a stroll around Cole Valley or the Haight. Concept of no tip was ideal, less work for large groups & it's for a good cause!

I'd come back for their "home fries" any day...you know those kinds of potatoes that are seasoned perfectly w the skins slightly crunchy? Ya those are the ones. 

Ask for hot sauce because they will bless you with their house habanero sauce. I think it's made w tomatillo & it reminded me of a spicy tomatillo green sauce you would get at a taqueria. Great w their dishes! 

I got their "New York"- smoked salmon scramble w green onions. I didn't expect their smoked salmon to be cooked but it surprisingly was tasty in the egg scramble! Unfortunately they don't do substitutes so I had to pay +$2 to omit the cream cheese & add avocado. 

Overall food was yummy, filling & service was quick. I guess they have to be since they have customers flooding the front waiting to be seated (:
author: Alyssaaa S.

description:
Well worth the wait. Sign your name to the outdoor clipboard and browse the Yelp reviews. That's exactly what we did. So...I made my order based on the reviews:
We ordered the bottle of bubbly and juice (black currant) to assemble our own mimosas.

Three of the four ordered eggs Benedict. I ordered the Le Mer: succulent crabmeat with a lemon hollandaise. Splurged with the new potatoes with roasted whole garlic cloves.

After our mimosas were empty I asked for a cup of coffee. You know it's a great place when the server asks , "Do you want regular?". Many of our fellow diners were sipping decadent coffee drinks out of ornate cups that looked like bowls.

The place has a true San Francisco vibe. Inside dining area is surrounded by brick walls and the backyard patio and street front tables allow for ample people watching. However, most of your attention will be on the tastiness and savoring of each dish.

(Interesting that $1.50 is added for each person dining to pay for the employee benefits...interesting indeed.)
author: Kathy F.

description: Delicious food. A bit pricey, but tip is included. Wanted to wait for the garden outdoor seating and were told it would be 45 minutes. Ended up being only 15, and well worth the wait.
author: Sierra D.

description:
One of my closest girlfriends wanted to come here for the longest time and we finally decided to hang out on a Sunday morning so we could come here.  They open early so get there early if you can. Put your name on a list near the door, but if you can grab a table by the front of the restaurant, those are first come, first serve.  Instead, we decided to wait for the inside, which is actually a bit bigger than expected, but they do pack everyone in there. Lots of tables of two! 

We ended up ordering the gingerbread pancakes to share and I ordered the la mer benedict.  The pancakes are amazing. It comes with this great and delicious lemon curd and the pears are poached.  Probably some of the best pancakes I've ever had.  Definitely have to come back for them or maybe even try and make my own someday. 

La Mer benedict is really delicious.  Crab, avocado and egg is a great choice.  If you love a good eggs benedict, this is the thing you should order. 

Overall, love the restaurant and definitely is a repeat location for brunches. 

Protip: get there super early! Also, order the pancakes!
author: Nina Y.

description: Great brunch experience at zazie. I got there around 11 put my name of the list for two people. About an hour later we still hadn't been called and a first come first serve spot opened outside in the shade so we grabbed that. The service was nice. Pretty cool that they don't accept tips and their prices reflect this already! I'd like to see more of that. I ordered a magic mimosa ($12, quite pricey but worth it for a treat yourself brunch), and the challah French toast with fresh fruit. Both items were delicious and satisfying after waiting for an hour. I'll be back!
author: Cameron R.

description: The food is wonderfully fresh, the backyard patio is sheltered with many nicely planted areas.  I really like the fact that most of their menu items can be ordered in different quantities.  It's great to be able to enjoy a smaller portion instead of wasting food or bring home leftovers
author: Sheila F.

description:
Very cute french brunch place. Be prepared to wait in line and finding parking is normally difficult. The Tahiti French Toast was thick and sweet, the nutty blend with banana is perfect, I didn't even need maple syrup for it. The La Mer Crab Benedict is also fabulous, I love the roasted potatoes they make here because its crunchy on the outside and well flavored. 

Even if there is no reservations available, I think the wait isn't too bad if you have company with you.
author: Stephanie C.

description:
When my friend and I found a parking place right in front of Zazie (and how often does that happen!) we decided we were fated to have lunch there. Normally, it's so crowded I wouldn't try, but this time we even were seated immediately. Wonders never cease. 

We both had the poached eggs over spinach - but without the hollandaise sauce. Excellent!  Eggs perfect, spinach tasty and the roasted potatoes were outstanding.  We sat outside in the back, which is pleasant. 

As always, I marvel at their bathroom - it has to be the smallest one in the entire city. They should post a sign: size 8 and under only. 

A fun lunch:  friendly service and delicious fresh food.
author: Karne N.

description:
Great brunch place to attend when the weather is right.  They have an outdoor patio that's decorated like a garden.  The wait is always long but if you don't mind waiting then wait until you can be sat outside.  I would recommend everyone try it at least once.

Positives - Food presentation, staff, friendly location, bacon is delicious
Negatives - The food is is surcharged to take care of the staff but that's normal in SF.  The wait is not worth the meal unless you don't care about waiting at least an hour.
author: Ted Y.

description: The best pancake I've ever eaten is the Magical pancake, which yesterday, was a fine cornmeal pancake with lemon curd and fresh strawberries on top...it even beat out the whole wheat macadamia nut pancakes at Charlie's in Maui!! The Eggs Benedict La Mer was extremely tasty- they used very fresh crab and the eggs where cooked perfectly!
author: Kim B.

description: One of my favorite go-to breakfast/brunch spots. Cannes and New York are my favorite! Very cozy/homelike atmosphere but can be a loud place as it's a small place with usually a full house. Wait time is ~10-15 before 10:30 or so. Their coffee is delicious! No tips required! The tables are small and very close to one another though.
author: Honest R.

description: Not a professional establishment. Unfortunately, I waited 45 min to be seated just to pick up and go due to poor customer service from manager. It's extremely busy and hectic, manager did not handle the stress well after he incorrectly seated my party of three then escorted us back out because he had another party of three ahead. We were as understanding as can be, but manager dared to insult us when we asked how much longer the wait would be after humiliation of escorting us out. It was his mistake and he spoke to us as if we were giving him a difficult time. It was worst experience, never going back. Manager also treated his staff poorly and rudely. So uncomfortable to see and hear him treat them poorly when they were more apologetic for our experience. I would also have to say that food isn't very French either, it's more American w/ slight French twist. Really only thing French about it is the owner that's from France. Ridiculous.
author: Grecia G.

description:
One of my favorite brunch spots! I like the variety I just don't like the wait to get in. But that's how you know it's good!

Tahiti French toast: 5/5: amazing French toast! It's soaked through with egg and it's got good flavor! It's cool that they have some sort of paste in between the bread. And there's a yummy carmelized banana on top!

Benedict's and scrambles here are pretty decent too! They let you choose how many you want in terms of 1/2/3 eggs. The only thing disappointing is if you get potatoes with it they give you more roasted garlic than potatoes. OverAll, a great brunch place that should be tried. Oh yeah, it's not a good idea to come in a big group because seating is limited. Group of 4 or less is great. Any bigger the wait might be a lot longer 

Total for 2: $38
author: Stella J.

description:
I've had this place bookmarked on Yelp for almost a year now, and my only regret is not coming here sooner. Many friends have raved about Zazie, and all the five star reviews are well-deserved! Like most other San Francisco brunch places on Sunday, expect to wait at least an hour. Put your name down on the sheet, indicating whether you want to sit inside or on the back patio. There is also seating on the front patio, and those seats are first come, first served.

The inside of the restaurant is cramped by cozy. The service was absolutely wonderful and even made my hungover morning enjoyable. My friend and I split the Gingerbread Pancakes, and I ordered the Fontainbleau. 

THE PANCAKES, OH MY GOD. To be honest, I do NOT like pancakes. I generally can't stand the texture, and they are usually dry. Zazie's Gingerbread Pancakes are amazing. They are huge, thick, and slathered with lemon sauce and topped with a roasted pear. The flavors go perfectly together. Not too sweet, not too gingerbread-y, not too much.

The Fontainbleau was also excellent. I mostly ordered this because I love mushrooms. I'm glad they did not overly season the actual eggs. My favorite part was actually the potatoes. SO GOOD. Best potatoes I've ever had at a restaurant.

Overall... yes. This restaurant is everything it's cracked up to me, so pick a date, and head here with a friend to start tackling their extensive menu! An added bonus (that seals the five star deal) is the fact that gratuity is included. Love restaurants that do that. Next time, I'll have to try their delicious-sounding mimosa varieties.
author: Stefanie C.

description: The wait was roughly 1 hour. The atmosphere is very pleasant. We are not pushed to leave the place, like other restaurants during rush hours. They also included tips in the menu so they are cheaper in comparative to other European style brunch. The food was average. But, the people there are nice; well manner waiter and other customers. These are expected in any restaurants in Paris. To maintain it here in San Francisco, it's probably not easy. Something to keep in mind.
author: Vincent Manjin L.

description:
No tipping! Why can't everyone follow this logical model?!
Food is great, my group ended up sharing the brunch items with friends due to large portions and so many delicious items, including their seasonal pancake flavors.
My croque madame was okay but I prefer the more breakfasty items.
The outdoor seating was super cute and comfy, perfect for our girl's day out!
author: Tina K.

description:
Bomb eggs Benedict Monaco, light yet lots of flavor.

Super good Bloody Mary, not that bloody and packs a punch.

Super good pumpkin miracle pancakes, wow!!!

Service was 3.5 stars, not bad but not close to as good as the food.

Tip included in all prices but it does reflect that. A great thing about the menu, purchase 1,2 or 3 of anything.

Recommendation: make a eggs Benedict flight or ability to mix and match without being way over charged. Highly recommend :)
author: Josh J.

description:
Went to brunch here for the first time the other day &... Omg I fell in love with the place! It's so cute on the inside & the food is so good! I got the st. trop Benedict with French toast! It was delicious! 

Went on a weekday so there wasn't a wait! :)
author: Lucky P.

description: We go seated outdoors and the environment was super cute. I ordered the pancakes that change weekly (don't remember what they were called) but they were sooo good.
author: Jackie L.

description:
Decided to come here on a Friday afternoon for some brunch. This place is so cute! From the brick walls with art, the bookshelves, to the spiral staircase.. this place indeed looks and feels very cozy. 

I really liked the environment here. Everyone seemed to have huge smiles, both waiters and customers alike. All the customers seemed to be engaged in hearty laughter and great conversation and the waiters are extremely cheerful and acommodating. 

Since I am a huge fan of benedicts, I got the Pierre Noire. You have a choice of choosing 1, 2, or 2 eggs. I decided to go with 1 and split a Miracle Pancake.

I loved the benedict! The egg was cooked exactly the way I liked it. Still mostly liquidy *__*. The potatoes on the side were seasoned to perfection, with garlic being one of the huge flavors. Although I don't usually like garlic, I really loved these potatoes. However, I wish they gave more potatoes.. because about half of the "potatoes" were actually giant garlic pieces that looked like potatoes. By the end of my meal, there was a pile of garlic that I didn't eat. I think this girl next to my table had the same problem and when she addressed it, the waiter promptly brought her a plate of potatoes. 

The Miracle Pancake was good.. but not amazing. It is basically a bread pudding pancake with grilled banana on top and whipped cream. I guess I liked the idea of it.. but in reality, it wasn't too special to me.
author: Sandy Y.

description: What an amazing brunch! The two standouts were definitely he Tahiti toast and the potatoes. The Tahiti toast is huge, one slice is more than enough for a meal. I also tried one of the poached egg dishes which was good but pretty normal, the hollandaise was a little too lemony for me. It had a side of the home fries though which was BOMB-- very garlicky. I love breakfast food so I am predisposed to like this place. My dad got the oat creme brûlée and it looked awesome, but I was too engrossed in my food to try any. Definitely prepare to be full for the day. We got to the restaurant at around 9:20 on a Saturday and had to wait around 30 minutes- not too bad for city brunch, definitely was more crowded when we left then when we got there.
author: Karen D.

description: Very disappointing. After we ordered, we waited 30 minutes for our food. My daughter's eggs arrived totally cold. I mentioned it to the waitress and she did take the charge for the side of fruit off the bill to compensate. The rest of the food was mediocre.
author: Jaime A.

description: Only stars earned were for atmosphere. I don't get the buzz about this place, at least not for the food. Our meal arrived cold, flavors were basic and boring. Drinks took forever. Staff was rude. Skip this and go to Padrecito or try the delicious chicken fried in waffle batter at Sparrow.
author: Celie H.

description: I have eaten here for years and years and I love the eggs blackstone and the ambiance of this cute brunch spot! Lovely patio, great strong coffee, and fast friendly service.
author: Michelle T.

description: My husband and I recently had breakfast at Zazie restaurant. It was a Monday afternoon and we had a sumptuous breakfast. My husband ordered the Mexican scramble with Chorizo and I ordered the Italian scramble with Cream Cheese with a side of Chicken sausage. The home fries were wonderful with whole cloves of garlic cooked perfectly. The eggs were also equally as wonderful with onions and other items that made the eggs rich and tasty. The thick pieces of toast with rasberry jam ( on the side) were delicious. I wish they had fresh squeezed O.J. but my husband was pleased with the juice. The coffee could have been stronger but it was adequate. The service and ambience was wonderful and we liked that they gave us a bottle of water at our table. It was a little pricey but the tip is included. Next time, we will order the French toast and pancakes at Zazie. It is worth the wait!
author: Donna C.

description:
Two things I love about this brunch spot: the outdoor garden and their French Toast Tahiti. 

Zazie gets extremely crowded so I recommend coming early or expect to wait an hour+. Or you can sit in front of the cafe which is first come first serve. Zazie's is a bit on the pricier side, we ordered the La Mer - which is the poached egg (what they're known for) with dungeness crab and you have the choice of 1/2/3, eggs which the price increases between each are huge $18/26/34. I personally do not think brunch food is should be this highly overpriced. 

I recommend coming to Zazie's purely for the ambiance/decor, and they have amazing service (tip is already included in their pricing).
author: Karen C.

description:
Just a quick preface: BRUNCH is hands down my favorite meal of the day. EGGS are probably my favorite food. I'm not too particular when it comes to the classic late breakfast/early lunch meal, but I know when I've eaten something extraordinary. And this was extraordinary.

This place has been on my list for awhile and I'm so happy I can now say I've experienced Zazie. A rainy and cold Sunday was brightened by the food, staff, ambiance, and setting of this awesome place. I want to go back. Literally, right now.

In classic lazy Sunday fashion, our initial brunch plans turned into late (2:30pm) lunch plans. But, brunch was still ingrained in our minds so we went for the Genevieve scrambled eggs (with ham, cheese, and avocado), home fries, and the egg/bacon/pancake combo. Gingerbread pancake?? I've never had one...and holy ---- it was amazing....with a pear on top. My scrambled eggs?? SO GOOD with the ham and avocado. The homefries?? I can't speak...a great combo of garlic/onion/salt/pepper that came together perfectly. 

Other stuff:
-Cool backyard patio that I'd love my house to have one day. Lights, nice wood, ivy, awning, heaters.
-VERY accommodating staff (they got us a table even though we missed our name being called).
-Amazing food.

That's all I need to say. DONE.
author: Tyler J.

description:
I knew from previous experience to come early to Zazie's, so I arrived around 20 minutes before they opened on a Sunday and there was already a line forming. Fortunately, when the doors opened, my friend and I got seated right away. 

I order a single French toast with fruit and a single Gingerbread pancake. My friend ordered an Un, Deux, Trois and substituted the buttermilk pancake for the Gingerbread pancake because I kept raving about it. 

Our order came and everything looked amazing. The French toast was pretty good, but the gingerbread pancake was perfect. The sauce and the pear they put on top was so flavorful that I didn't even have to use syrup. 

The service was pretty good and my friend and I left satisfied. I will be coming back!
author: Lydia H.

description:
Sorry Zazie. You didn't impress me. Overpriced. Overcrowded. Overhyped. 

My friend and I came on Valentine's day for brunch and it was the most horrible idea, because the waiting list was 3 pages long!!!! Apparently it's not that much better on a regular weekend.

We ordered to-go and I got the Tahiti French Toast (1 piece for $9). It came in a sad plastic tray and it was such a sad, tiny slice, although the taste was not too bad. There was mushed banana with walnut in between the french toast pieces. The banana was caramelized but it didn't have a crunch to it. Not too impressed. And how so expensive?! I need at least 2 pieces to be full, but who pays $16 for 2 pieces of french toast?! 

In addition to the seating in front of the store, there are also outdoor seating in the back. Everything was super crowded and is there NO ELBOW ROOM. 

Not sure if I would want to come back again...
author: Wendy F.

description:
Foods are too oily overall....
And meat menus are better than fish.
the appetizer mussel was not how I wanted... It didn't need to be that creamy and sour.. 
Maybe good for brunch only? I'd try brunch sometime.
author: JS P.

description:
Pretty tiny french place, but their dishes are amazing. My friends and i were seated in the patio area since everywhere inside was full. The patio area was very romantic and lit up with heaters at each table. As it got colder into the night, automatic shades stretched out over the patio to seal in the heat. My first impression of this place was the authenticity and the friendly french lady who served us. I think her name was Elsa. She was very attentive and personable and helped us order the dishes she thought we'd like. 

My second impression was based on the menu...the prices. This place is a little pricey so i recommend this place if you wanna impress your date on your classy taste of food. Between us the dishes included mac and cheese, cream of mushroom soup, niman ranch burger, and the pasta. I got the salmon. That was all 80 bucks including the 1.25 each for the bread they give at the beginning. There was four of us so avg... $20 each. Ill admit my salmon dish was delicious. I enjoyed the sauce and the spinach and other veggies that were served cooked in this parchment paper. They are environment conscious (recycled coasters between cup and saucer) and just recycled materials used in general from decor to restaurant supplies. Good find, but the price will match the quality of food all too well
author: Nessa R.

description:
I wasn't really hungry when I came here , but when I saw the menu. I just had to try something. So i decided to go for something light but not too light and tried the polenta. It was probably the best well made polenta I ever had. Cooked well, creamy, yet holding its form. the tomato sauce, mushrooms, and spinach was a nice compliment with the dish.

I also really liked how everything aside tax was included in the menu prices. yes you don't need to tip, but you can leave something extra if you wish. Never thought i see a receipt without a tipping option.  

I will be back to try the other items on the menu. Especially two desserts that caught my eye, but didn't have the stomach for that night.
author: Myron L.

description:
Update: Came here on Oct 25th. So disappointed. The miracle pancakes lacked flavor, were smaller in size than yesterday, missed a cooked pear from the order yesterday. Not good. 

Food is amazing here. Get a miracle pancake. I've been here twice and this time had the miracle pancake which was pumpkin spice with real pumpkin. Absolutely delicious. 

Salads are also wonderful but seasonal, so that's a bit of a downside. 

Plenty of indoor and outdoor seating but fills very quickly. 

A little on the pricey side. Also sometimes service falls short in terms of filling coffee cups. 

Beautiful warm decor.

Servers didn't know the soup of the day. I've been here three times and each time they don't know. That is disappointing.
author: Chhaya N.

description: What an amazing breakfast!  Here in SF On a family vacation, and after a few too many meals in the touristy fisherman's wharf area, we are looking for something local and authentic. And did we find it. Fantastic Parisian, coffeehouse feel with great food to match. It was a Monday morning, so no wait. Our waiter was super accommodating. We shared the seasonal poundcake to start and it was delicious. They are known for their eggs Benedict specials but I ordered the fountainbleu scrambled eggs (contains mushrooms, spinach and cheese) with a side salad. My wife ordered scrambled egg whites with gluten free English muffin and bacon. Both were delicious. The restaurant may be a few dollars more per entree than others but it's totally worth it for 3 reasons: 1) the food is delicious, 2) Price includes tip (can leave extra cash if you prefer) and 3) they include healthcare/dental benefits, 401(k), and paid parental leave/time off for their entire staff. This made everyone take extra pride in their work and it comes out in the food and experience. Will definitely come back next time in SF.
author: David F.

description: I love this place for brunch! Yes you are going to wait forever in line but I feel that's normal for a good brunch spot and well worth it. Usually not into sweet stuff so I was surprised how much I like  the French toast with caramelized bananas and walnuts. I've had all the egg options as well and have never been disappointed.
author: Lindsey G.

description: This was my first brunch in San Fran and it didn't disappoint! It's located in more of a residential area which is nice if you haven't seen the colorful houses yet. The place was packed but we got an adorable window seat. All of our food was fantastic. We had the banana French toast, the eggs Benedict and a scramble that were all to die for. The atmosphere is quaint and lovely.
author: Lindsey P.

description: While visiting the Bay Area, this place was on our to-do list. All the excellent reviews are spot on. I stopped by with my wife and about 6 other friends, we ordered completely different items and tried a bite from everyone's plate. Everything on the menu was exceptional!! The only reason I wouldn't give them a 5 is because of the long wait and small table area. But in many cases that's a good problem! Excellent food, excellent service, be prepared to wait.
author: Dan C.

description:
I went to Zazie for brunch on a weekend morning, so I had to wait about 30 minutes. For brunch, you must sign in on a clipboard, and eventually, they'll call your name! To note--Zazie's prices include tip (they don't accept gratuity) so though the prices may seem a little steep, they're not as bad as you might think.

I ordered the eggs benedict Florentine and asked for a few tomatoes provençales on the side. The hollandaise sauce was probably the best I've ever had, the potatoes were seasoned perfectly, and the tomatoes really added a nice touch to the dish. I also had a bloody mary, which was just OK. I dined alone and was texting my French friend throughout the meal. She asked to see the brunch menu, which she found very funny because it's not traditionally French at all. But the whole idea of brunch is American and not French anyway (they don't really do eggs or potatoes in the morning, oatmeal is foreign to them, etc.). So I'd say Zazie brunch is mostly American with some French flair. Their dinner menu looks a little bit more "authentic French" but is definitely still American-French fusion.

All that pretentious "FYI" info aside, I very much enjoyed my brunch at Zazie, and I'd say it was well worth the wait!
author: Emily G.

description:
We went here for Sunday Brunch, and got there early because we knew that there will be a lineup, mostly locals. It was definitely worth the wait. 
We loved everything about the place, pick any dish, any dish, you won't go wrong.
author: Umesh W.

description:
Just came here for Sunday brunch. They open at 9am, we got there at 8:30 when there was already a decent line but we did make it to the first round of seating. So you could probably get there at 8:45 and still be in the clear for minimal wait time! 

They have outdoor seating in the front of the house (no waitlist required, first come first sit), indoor seating, and back patio seating (with space heaters). 

I had the seasonal gingerbread pancakes - delicious and large in size. Others at my table ordered the Tahiti french toast (highly praised!) and eggs benedict looked great too! 

Great dining experience, would come again at opening.
author: Lexy C.

description: The restaurant opens at 9 am, and when we got there at 8:30 there were already 15-20 people waiting. We were seated quickly, but the service was slow, and it took over an hour to get our food that was mediocre. Definitely over-hyped!
author: Saba M.

description:
Food Quality- 5/5
Service- 5/5
Experience- 5/5

My girlfriend took me here for my 1st time for late brunch. I was very impressed with my overall visit here at Zazie's. There was about a 10-15 minute wait until we actually got seated, not too bad considering it was lunch time. The whole staff is very friendly and professional with the way they work. Even though it was busy, we did not feel rushed at all. 

I ordered the Albert: W/ 2 Poached Eggs on top. It was so good!! Definitely would recommend getting this menu item. 

I will be for sure returning in the near future.
author: Dennis L.

description: Very popular place, though was not impressed. Wait is very long, on the order of hours. The manager type person in charge of seating is not polite. There is nice patio seating in the back, though the wait for that is even longer. Interior itself is quaint though not exceptional. Food was good, particularly their pancakes and french toast. Portion size is moderate. Prices are high, we paid over $70 for two people for breakfast food. There are many other options in the city, strongly consider them.
author: Mikey J.

description:
Went here on a Sunday during peak brunch time.
Parking was pretty hectic. We did not see a garage anywhere si street parking is the only option.
You won't miss it as there was a crowd of people waiting to be seated outside.
They have a list that you sign up on right by the entrance on the left window.

The outdoor seating is minimal but you don't have to be on the list in order to sit outside. Outdoor seating is first come, first served. We didn't find this out until we  saw a couple of girls went & just sat at the table that just left. So just FYI!

We only waited like 25 mins tops with about 13 parties in front of us so it was really quick!

The utilized their space as far as their seating is concerned. We were seated at a two person table that was perfect for us since we are two smaller/shorter people but if we were taller, it would be a problem.

Their menu states that there is no TIPPING. I took a picture of their little message that they state at the top of the menu. It's pretty much stating that the prices are set at what they're set at in order to take into consideration all that tipping would go towards. Pretty interesting & cool. First restaurant I have been to with that way of thinking. I dig it.

Alright, water is provided upon request as we are in CA & the drought is real.
They give you glasses & a bottle of water so that you can pour it yourself.

What did I order?
I ordered the Fontainbleau Scrambled Eggs which is their term for omelet I believe. It had portabellos, shiitake, porcinis, spinach & fontina. I asked for fruits on the side instead of the hashbrowns but I should've just asked for the hashbrowns with the fruit because I was charged full-priced any ways. I guess their menu was right in saying there is no substitution. OMG, it was BOMB though. Sooooo yummy! So much flavor! I loved it! 

Ketchup & Jelly are on the table in a little container that had a mini-spoon, super cute.

Overall, it was a great place to have a last-minute brunch.
Try it out for yourself!
author: Camille C.

description:
I came here for dinner on a rainy Friday (without a reservation) and luckily didn't have to endure a wait. Zazie is well-known for brunch, which I haven't had yet--so I'll be back for sure.

It's unfortunate that I didn't take any pictures; however, it wouldn't have mattered as the food was inhaled almost instantaneously. I had the Boeuf Bourgignone which was so freaking tender & delicious. Minus the slight condescension by the waiter's tone that we were just ordering Beef and Chicken (and none of the other delicious entrees), I was quite pleased. 

And aside from the price point (tip is included) the portions could be larger relative to the amount of food received. But I barely can gripe about that.

Eat here. Highly recommend!
author: Juan T. K.

description: Visiting from Cleveland. Had the Mexican scrambled eggs with an extra pancake. Outstanding. Some general advice..if your from the Midwest and seeing some restaurant prices that are a little shocking is going to bother you, don't come to San Francisco. Whip out the credit card and enjoy!!!!
author: Richard R.

description: Came here for brunch on a Saturday, and it really does live up to the hype! We got in line at 8:45, and we were lucky and snagged one of the tables out front that is first come first served out front. For the other seating you have to put your name down on a list. 15 minutes before opening was perfect- we would've gotten seated right away even if we had put our names on the list! We decided to try 3 dishes between the two of us- we got 2 of the divorcee eggs benedict, 2 of the french toast tahiti, and 3 of the miracle pancakes (they were bread pudding that morning)! Everything was awesome- I like to think of myself as somewhat of an eggs benedict conoisseur, and I have to admit these were amazing! The hollandaise was rich and creamy, eggs perfectly poached, and the avocado, cheese, crispy bacon combo is to die for. The home fries that came with the eggs were also awesome with sweet pieces of caramelized garlic cloves mixed in with the potatoes! The french toast and the pancakes were both great as well. The french toast was sturdy and hearty, and it came with a banana walnut mixture sandwiched between the two slices giving an extra layer of flavor. The bread pudding pancakes were also super unique with a great combo of the breadiness of the bread pudding intermixed with the fluffy pancake. I personally liked the pancake a little better, but the boyfriend preferred the french toast, but order either and you won't be disappointed! The food is all great, and what makes the meal even better is this restaurant is strictly no tips, so the price for the food is what you pay, making paying the bill at the end easy! Overall, loved this place and will definitely be back!
author: Rachel D.

description:
The perfect place for brunch. I quite enjoyed my experience here at Zazie. 

My boyfriend and I arrived on a Monday at noon after exploring The Haight and was seated immediately. Per our suggestion, we were seated in the back patio, and it was beautiful. The perfect patio, because it was enclosed with a roof, and also had heaters all around. Service was amazing, and we were asked immediately if we were served yet. 

The boyfriend ordered the Monaco (eggs benedict) and I ordered the Miracle Pancakes (Lemon ricotta flavor). The food arrived after 15 minutes. 

Let's talk about the food:

The miracle pancakes were definitely to die for. I'm usually not so hungry during breakfast/lunch time, so one pancake definitely hit the spot for me. It came beautifully, the pancake with the perfect amount of lemon ricotta on top, a dollop of butter, and maple syrup on the side. This pancake was the first of its kind to be tasted with my taste buds. I expected the pancake to be fluffy and light, but this one was different. Instead, it was dense and rich, in a good way. The lemon had the right amount of tangy and light, which complimented the rich pancake. However, the syrup sealed the bite, as it gave the bite the right amount of sweetness. Overall a perfect pancake.

I can't give the eggs benedict a thorough review because I only took a few bites, as I was full from my pancake. However, from watching my boyfriend eat it, I'm sure it was great as well. It passed the egg porn test, as the yolk was oozing out of the egg in the most elegant way. LOL.

I don't know if it was worth the wait that would have happened if we came here on the weekend. We got very lucky. 

If you don't want to wait, just come during the weekday.
author: Harmony C.

description:
Just got back from my long trip in Vietnam and Zazie was the first restaurants I went to back home. I'm glad I came here! I left stuffed.

There's a ton of people that come here in for Brunch, my party came around 11-12PM and there was already 20+ parties ahead of us. Not to worry though, the wait time wasn't that long. An employee checked our names on the list and said it would be about a 45min wait and he was about right. People come in and out pretty quickly. Also note, you can sit outside in the back where the shaded patio is, inside, or the front of the restaurant (sunny). While waiting you can go to the front door and read the menu and how they treat their employees. The employees get full perks here so there's no need to tip. 

In Vietnam portions aren't as big, so when I got back I was still on that mindset. I ordered the eggs benedict with bacon and avocado with 2 eggs (you get an option of 1,2 or 3). Also ordered some pancakes (3 stacks?) with strawberries. When the food came out, I thought, crap, I ordered too much food. 

Eggs Benedict (Bacon, Avocado):
The eggs were cooked to perfection, nice and runny the way I like it. The hollandaise sauce had a sour taste that was a tad more distinct than i'm used to. It was different, but wasn't bad. The bacon was crispy and the avocados were fresh. Overall the eggs benedict was really good. The meal also came with potatoes on the side (you can get salad if you want). I wish they had crispy potatoes or hash browns instead. I didn't care of the potatoes that much. 

Strawberry Pancake: 
I really enjoyed the pancake, I thought it was the best part of the meal. I only had a couple of bites because I was stuffed, but the pancakes were delicious! It was perfectly fluffy, wasn't too sweet, and the yellow sauce they put on top of the pancakes give it a whole different flavor. It didn't taste like your typical pancake. 

Zazie is a great brunch place!  It's a bit pricey, but considering how well they treat their employees I don't mind paying a little extra. Also, sit in the back patio if it isn't too cold outside. The patio is pretty and nice.
author: Allen C.

description: Tasty brunch. Honestly won't allow another croque monsieur inside my mouth unless its better than than this! (Tough find) Try it!!!
author: Antigone S.

description:
This place reminds me of my favourite brunch place in NYC. 
What makes it stand out: 
1) they have a no- tip culture, the food is priced to provide for the things tips and surcharges are normally used for. There isn't even an option to tip on the receipt.
2) The "divorcée" dish was previously named after the owner's ex-husband until they divorced.
3) Lots of appropriate sass. (See pics)
4) bring an umbrella! There's not a lot of places to hide under if you don't like rain and are waiting for a seat.
5) Go early, wait time is long, sign your name on the list immediately. Then grab some coffee at Peet's.
author: Honey R.

description:
Hands down the best poached egg and lemon hollandaise sauce I have ever had!  This is the second time I've eaten here.  You definitely have to be prepared for a long wait, the first time I came the wait was around 1.5 hours so we ended up going somewhere else.  But it's definitely worth it.  I suggest arriving right when they open at 9AM.  It's located in the one of the cutest neighborhoods in the city, Cole Valley.  Parking isn't horrible but be prepared to do a few laps around.  The restaurant is on the smaller side but there is also patio and front table seating.  I came here for girls brunch (table of 3), I think its better for smaller groups.  

Customer Service:  Excellent!  Definitely got the parisian vibe from our server.  Though it was crazy busy I never felt as if I needed to ask for anything, he checked in on us when needed.  

Food:
*Florentine Poached Eggs (x2) - Its awesome because you choose how many eggs you want (up to 3) and they adjust the price from there.  The hollandaise is bomb.com, its so light and subtle but tasty.  I'm sure this is what it's really supposed to taste like compared to other restaurants.  The poached egg was cooked perfectly.

*Miracle Pancakes (x2) - My 2 friends and I shared these.  I believe it changes slightly each week, but we got bananas with this amazing pecan syrup.  Yummmay, it was so good.  

*Hot Chocolate - It tasted like I was drinking a chocolate bar, great quality and not too sweet.  Also had fresh whip cream.

Overall Review - A MUST TRY in SF.  My favorite brunch spot so far :D
author: Brittany S.

description:
I've been to some of the must go to brunch places in the city, but still have yet to head to Zazie after having it in my bookmarks for so long.  When we were driving there, I knew I've been craving some poached eggs, but also heard so much about their carb heavy french toast and gingerbread pancakes.  I've been craving poached eggs, especially since they can be a little tricky to make at home..always go with your gut instinct/craving, right?  

About a minute after being seated on the patio I finally decided on two poached eggs, but the dilemma was which one?  I wanted the crab one, but crab season was over, so I went with the Monaco, which was a proscuitto and tomato provanceles.  He went with the two egg St. Trop which consisted of smoked salmon, cream cheese, capers and red onions.  We both also chose the side of home fries over the salad, after all it's breakfast NOT lunch..haha.  

After some time, our wonderful eggs were presented in front of us.  They tasted as good as they looked.  The eggs were perfectly cooked as the yolk oozed from them as it was punctured, coating my wonderfully salty delicious proscuitto on top of the english muffin.  The hollandaise sauce was nice and light, we didn't taste any hint of lemon though.   His eggs were cooked just as well and the salmon was so fresh.  The cream cheese, red onions and capers worked well with the salmon and the drizzle of hollandaise sauce as well.  We thought it was a little odd that cooked pieces of garlic with the peels on were thrown on to our plate with the home fries.  We cracked open some of the garlic and it didn't have much flavor to them nor did it give the home fries any flavor either.  In fact, the home fries were a little on the bland side.  

Loved the cute patio with those awesome space heaters.  I'd prefer a seat on the patio too as it's a little cramped inside.  Service was a little on the slow side, but not bad.  Glad I finally got to try Zazie.  I saw that they have lemon ricotta pancakes on their menu...dare I say you may want to try them if you don't feel like heading over to Plow?  As for me, I think the next time we come back, I may be trying that crab poached egg, hopefully in crab season!
author: Cat C.

description: Love, love, love this spot! Waited about an hour to get a table and ended up sitting in the heated patio. My dad ordered their house blend coffee and I got the hot chocolate- man, was it perfect! The whipped cream and the decadent chocolate were perfect for the rainy day! The waiters were really kind and downright hilarious and served us with a smile. We ordered the Omelete du Jour and the French Toast Tahiti, both of which were scrumptious! The Tahiti is definitely a must have, especially because of the caramelized bananas layered on top. I would come back to San Francisco just for another brunch at Zazie :)
author: Sneha K.

description:
I was doing some urban hiking and found this gem. It's one of the better brunch places I've been on to SF.

Of course we had to split the gingerbread pancake and the La Mer poached eggs. The last bite of both were as delicious as the first.

Inside of cozy and quaint. Apparently they had outside seating, but it was a little chilly outside so we opted to stay inside.

The staff was wonderful and attentive. 

It's a place worth visiting.
author: Nichole K.

description: Good food but shitty service.  The host was really rude. Also took forever to get our order taken, drinks, food and then just for the check. Our waiter checked in with he two parties next to us and never once asked us how everything was or if we needed anything. Thank goodness for the busboy who got us out to go boxes and cleared our plates. I'm glad they say on their menus that they don't expect tips because the waiter sure didn't deserve one nor did he get one. Tipped the bus boy because he was he only one who actually was helpful.
author: Samantha N.

description:
Zazie's is the epitome of cole valley - absolutely charming. 

The backyard patio is lined with wooden benches and leafy walls. It's the perfect place for a carb filled brunch with girlfriends. Speaking of carbs, order the gingerbread pancakes!

Unfortunately, there is quite a long wait... especially if you have preferences for sitting outside!
author: Xinxin W.

description: There is a list on door where you can write your name down and they will call your name when it is your turn. Extremely delicious food but extremely steep prices.
author: Amir L.

description: I've been hearing about the breakfast at this place for about two years and I finally got to go. It did not disappoint. I imagine if you had one day to live and you have three final meals to choose and you choose Zazie for breakfast you would not be criticized too heavily. The atmosphere is relaxed and classy. The little touches are evident, eg bottle cap magnets that hold the check against a piece of metal. I had the croque madame (ham, gruyere, sunny side egg on challah) and it was delicious. We had a miracle pancake (flavors rotate) which was perfectly fluffy. Two tiny downsides: the fact that they pay there staff very well means it's expensive, so you (I) couldn't go here every day, which sucks. Second, one of our dishes didn't come out as hot as we would have liked. I know, life is tough.
author: Nick D.

description:
You want to do a quick brunch Saturday/Sunday morning at Zazie??

Bwaaaa Haaaaaa Haaaaa.

This place is sooo popular it aint going to happen. Prepare to wait at least an hour.

Zazie is a cute little place smack dab in  cute cole valley (basically part of the Haight). Their food is pretty stellar.

 French toast Tahitian with caramelized Bananas and Walnuts....omg good. You can order 1,2 or 3 pieces. One is pretty generous.

Their eggs dishes are really really good as well. The poached eggs Pierre Noir (served on an english muffin, bacon, tomatoes Provencal, and a light hollaindaise sauce) is rock star good. The eggs are fresh and taste wonderful, free range. The home fry potatoes are a mixture of russet and red potatoes and are tasty as well not oily...great with their ketchup. Toast is wonderful bread!

I really think you cant go wrong with any dish here. The Salmon sandwich something I thought would be mediocre had a lot of fresh Salmon on fresh bread and lovely onions and greens.

Oh as for the wait. Go during the week...still a wait but at least you will have time for the rest of your day.

Parking is  really hard...look up in Ashbury heights!

Now to go back and check out their Dinners!!!
author: David G.

description:
I went to Zazie's on a Friday morning, for breakfast; This is my second time, the first time was several years ago, way before the waiters were paid a living wage and tips was a must. Now, this lovely place/owners have graciously/human-kindly, found a way to pay their employees a living wage, grant it, no one is going to be running out to buy a house on Broadway at Pacific--huh this being SF, not even the aves!-- but still, I highly respect a business that supports the people who help to run, their business.

Now this being said, I ordered the New York with potatoes, which did not taste, like they were a week old along with salmon...that was fresh along with a salad, since I am trying to keep the hips at a nice curve...I opted out of the toast! The coffee was perfect.

The vibe was casual and relaxing and the waiters were chill and attentive, without being all in your business, as your putting food in your mouth. 

I will be back....
author: Valerie D.

description:
It's not as if Zazie needs another review, but lets do it anyway.

Like many of the highly rated brunch spots in San Francisco, Zazie has been on my list of go-to's for quite some time. I believe we picked it to celebrate my BF's birthday. We visited on a Thursday morning around 11am, and (not) to our surprise, we had to wait a little over 30 minutes to be seated. We weren't in a time crunch, so it was fine.

And fine it was, especially after having that amazing brunch. Basically - it's worth the wait. I ordered the French Toast Tahiti (stuffed with caramelized bananas and walnuts [$9/$15/$20]) *Side note:the three prices pertain to the amount of servings.* The  birthday man ordered the La Mer (poached eggs w/ hand picked Dungeness crab, avocados, green onions [$13/$19/$25]) ... THE GARLIC WITHIN THE POTATOES IN THIS DISH WAS MY JAM. 

One of the best brunches I've ever had in life - we literally didn't leave a smidgen of food on our plates! 

Minus one star because they don't take brunch reservations, but do take dinner reservations (which you can do here: http://www.zaziesf.com/reservation/)

Regardless of this, I'd like to come back and try more of their brunch menu: specifically the gingerbread pancakes,  build your own mimosas, and dinner, too!
author: Kathleene E.

description:
This brunch restaurant was truly a San Francisco feel. Right when you walk in, everything is decorated in a very artsy and modern way. Including the people dining  as well, I have to say. I went with 2 friends for our first time up there visiting and we decided to sit in the backyard section of the restaurant, since it was a sunny day in SF. And WOW it was so pretty , plants and vines everywhere and the tables were wood and it felt like I was in a fairytale almost. The waiter came right away with water in a glass jar and gave us our menus. We all ordered different things but I believe I got the best dish. I ended up ordering crab and avocado Benedict's with a fresh greens salad. The wait was about 20 minutes, so not so bad. When the food came I have to say presentation, alright, taste fairly good though.

 This place is an overall awesome place to go dress up nice and eat, the place is beautiful and there's so much air to breathe in while you sit and chat as well. The costumer service was wonderful and this place is DOG FRIENDLY!!! How cool is that. The taste and quality of the food was very good and this place was just a very unique experience for me. If you're in San Francisco make sure to check Zazies out for fun and artsy place to eat!!!
author: Gabriela A.

description: I will eat my body weight in brunch food here. We had 3 different kinds of mimosas, split the French toast and Monaco eggs benedict, and I plan on coming back with more friends here.
author: Christine A.

description:
I have been on a French brunch kick and this place totally fit the bill. Came on a Sunday with a party of 3, was about a 45 minute wait even at 1pm. They have a heated patio garden and the front outside tables are first come first serve but I am a pansy and just moved from San Diego. This SF chill has been killing me. 

Anyway between the three of us we had the Gingerbread Pancakes, the Croque Monsieur , and one of the poached egg dishes. Everything was good. The potatoes that come with eggs are crispy and come with whole garlic cloves! The gingerbread pancakes are light but thick with sublime lemon curd. And the croque monsieur was the real showstopper- so much cheese! We also got a round of bloody marys- very good but does not come with many pickled veggies (I always like a lot).

One interesting thing about Zazie is they don't allow tipping and include everything in the flat price. Which is pretty cool and great for their employees but just know it definitely hikes up the price. I mean $9 for one specialty pancake? Yikes. We racked up a $90 bill for 3 at brunch. Good thing it was delicious!
author: Miriam M.

description: The staff was incredibly down to earth and friendly, and the other diners were quite social as well. The food didn't exactly blow me away, but it was good. Parking was a total pain in the ass. Overall, it was a good brunch experience.
author: Ireland F.

description:
Zazie is located near many different public transportation lines so it's relatively convenient to visit if you don't have a car.

I came the Wednesday before Thanksgiving with 2 other people at 11:00AM. It took a total of 1.5 hours to wait, order, and dine.. so not too bad!

My group ordered a Zazie mimosa, 3 smoked salmon poached eggs, and 2 seasonal pancakes. Water is available upon request.

Outdoor seating is available.
author: Danae L.

description:
Well this is one of my favorite breakfast I've ever had. I got the Mexican scramble and it was delicious. It was a chorizo scramble and had the perfect amount of flavor mixed with heat. The potatoes on the side were great as well.

There were actually whole roasted cloves of garlic in the potatoes which made for a great  spread for the bread. I mashed up the cloves and smeared it on the bread. Best decision of my morning.

Can't wait to be back and eat out on the patio.
author: Evan L.

description:
I wasn't sure what to expect when I stopped by Zazie for brunch before a long morning of urban hiking around Twin Peaks...but I discovered a marvelous French bistro/cafe.

At ~9am on a Saturday morning, Zazie was already filled to the brim with people, but I was lucky enough to snag the last available 2-top in the small, cozy dining room.  The decor and atmosphere felt very French -- a little slice of Paris plopped in the middle of Cole Valley.

For breakfast, I decided to have poached eggs "la mer" style (dungeness crab, onions, and avocados) on English muffins with Hollandaise sauce -- in other words, a crabcake benedict.  And this benedict was absolutely perfect.  I'd never had a Hollandaise so light and flavorful.  And the crab?  Cooked to perfection.  The poached eggs came with crispy breakfast potatoes -- complete with freshly roasted garlic cloves!  Total yum.
