The desert, creme caramel, was mediocre though it looked good. That's about it, though. I'll stick with their brunch if I decide to give them another go.
author: Gabrielle D.

description: Tonight's dinner was amazing. I had John as a server and he was great. I love eating at new places and this was recommended by AAA's Via magazine of 'must places to go in SF'. There was no disappointments here. I like it when a waiter can tell me what they like and order it for me. To be honest, I try at every restaurant for the waiter to pick my meal and they never can... It's like they are scared of disappointing me. John had no problem and I couldn't have been more satisfied with eating the Braised Pork. AMAZING! I will 100% be back to try something else.
author: Claire G.

description: The wait was surprisingly not that long on Saturday morning at 11a.  We took the Muni here since we read on yelp that parking was difficult.  It's right next to the Muni stop.  We waited about 45 minutes and sat inside.  The La Mer crab/avocado benedict was pretty good (but a little bland).   The Tahiti French Toast was really good.  I'd definitely come back to try their other dishes.  Service was quick and efficient.  The prices are a little steep.
author: Chris L.

description:
My roommates and I went here for dinner because our favorite Ethiopian place in the sunset was closed.  My first impression was that I really liked the atmosphere in the back where we were seated.  String lights, heat lamps, wooden benches.. it's pretty romantic.

I ordered the corn cakes that came with avocado, salsa and sour cream.  I thought it would've been a spicier, per the description on the menu, but I was pretty content.  I finished the entire dish.  We ordered the strawberry-rhubarb crumble, and that's where the meal fell apart.  The dish was lukewarm to cold and mushy.  I expect texture in this dessert.. It seemed like they baked them in masses and let them sit.

One of my roommates was going to order another dessert,  the Baked Chocolat, that had marshmallows. She maintains a kosher diet, so she asked about the ingredients in the marshmallows.  The menu describes them as "golden marshmallows."  The waiter informed us that they're Kraft marshmallows.  The dessert was $8.  If I'm paying $8, I want my marshmallows house made.

Our waiter was really nice, attentive, and made sure we were welcome.  Because of that, I'm willing to come back again.
author: Vira P.

description:
Brunch is my favorite meal of the day and SF is known for awesome brunch spots such as as this place. Zazie serves classic French brunch that is flavorful, delicious, and provides a very cozy atmosphere with its artwork as decor. They have two tables for outdoor seating so it's great to be able to bring your doggy with you for brunch, given it is also a dog friendly neighborhood.

My favorite dish? Hands down the eggs Benedict. They're eggs are poached to perfection with a good ratio of hollandaise sauce to enhance the flavors of the egg benedicts. Their French toast are also very amazing and definitely portioned to be shared with 2-3 people.

Can get quite busy on the weekends so highly recommend coming early.
author: Wendy Z.

description: Busy but solid brunch spot. Get there just before they open on the weekend or late mornings/early afternoons on weekdays.
author: Mariah N.

description:
This was my 4th visit to Zazie and my 2nd time for dinner.  The last time I visited here for dinner was to celebrate my sister's birthday last year.  It went so well with my family that I decided to come by again to celebrate my birthday.  Though for my birthday, they had a special menu since it was on New Year's Eve.

We arrived there about 15 minutes early from my reservation and we got seated immediately.  The two things that really stood out for us on the menu were the Steak Au Poivre and the Dungeness Crab and Artichoke Ravioli.  Everyone at the table ordered the Steak Au Poivre while I ordered the Ravioli.  The funny part about that was that in the weeks leading up to that night, I kept telling myself that I wanted a good steak for my birthday.  Well, I had so much good beef from the Christmas parties a week earlier, that by the time it came to my dinner at Zazie, I wanted a change of pace by ordering the Ravioli, and yet everyone at my table ordered the Steak.

Fresh Dungeness Crab and Artichoke Ravioli w/ Grilled Prawns, caramelized leeks, wilted arugula, white wine, and shaved manchego
(http://bit.ly/1lmutGu).
The Crab and Artichoke filling was really delicious, really light, and almost refreshing in a way considering, that earlier in the day I had my Birthday Food Crawl around the city.  Because of that, I was actually able to slow down and enjoy the Ravioli instead of attacking them at full force.  It was a great choice!

Steak Au Poivre - Grilled Niman Ranch NY Strip w/ portabello brandy cream sauce, white truffle mashed potatoes, and grilled asparagus
(http://bit.ly/1tpambH)
Luckily for me, my mom and my sister couldn't finish their Steaks and each cut off a generous portion for me to taste.  So essentially I had Surf n' Turf for dinner!  Their Steaks were perfectly cooked and the brandy cream sauce just made it even better!

Last Sip - White Peach Champagne Sorbet and Black Currant Syrup
This was a very refreshing and sweet Champagne cocktail and it complimented my meal very well, especially with the Ravioli.  

Once again, another very satisfying and successful visit to Zazie.  Even though they're more known for their brunch, I highly recommend you come and try them for dinner.  I'm glad I made the decision to celebrate my birthday here and I will be looking forward to visiting Zazie again in the near future.
author: Rodney H.

description:
I can definitely see why this place is so popular. We arrived on a weekday around 8:15 AM so we were one of the two tables occupied in the restaurant. By the time we left, almost all the tables were completely occupied.

Service was average and food was pricey but I like how they pay their employees a living wage and emphasize "absolutely no tipping" on the menus. 

We ordered two gingerbread pancakes with Bosc pears and lemon curd (with a side egg), the Croque Monsieur, and Divorcee Eggs Benedict (avocado, bacon and fontina cheese). 

To drink, my husband and I had coffee and my brother had mango juice.

When our food came, they accidentally put my egg on top of my husband's sandwich even though I had ordered it with my pancakes. This was remedied by my husband who plopped the egg on the side of my plate. 

The dishes were well prepared. Portions were generous. I could have just ordered one pancake and still been able to share with the rest of the table. I did wish they were more generous with the toppings though. I would have liked more pear and lemon curd. The gingerbread pancakes were too one note to be eaten solo especially since I ordered two.

The boys enjoyed their dishes (the clean plates being the evidence).
author: Grace C.

description:
Came here with a friend because we saw the good reviews for it and we were excited for the food! When we got there it wasn't too bad of a wait and we thought outside seating meant the literal four tables outside in front of the restaurant but there is actually a patio like area in the back which was nice for a sunny day. 

We ordered the New York as well as a French Toast and they were both delicious. We also got the Zazie spritzers and we thought a large size would be a big glass of the drink but it was pretty small which was probably one of the only disappointments. But otherwise the food was good and came out in an orderly fashion. It was a little bit cramped since they try to accommodate as many people as possible and finding a server is a little hard but otherwise I would say come for some breakfast food.
author: Angela S.

description: Every time I eat here I die and am reborn. I would like to thank the miracle pancake and bowl of coffee
author: Nicole A.

description:
My friends and I were super lucky when we got here because we only had to wait about 15 minutes before we got our table (on a Saturday)! I like this place a lot. It was surprisingly bigger than it looks because of the outdoor patio. 

The food here is great! I got the La Mer and I will definitely be getting it again when I come back. I also got a mimosa. It was one of their specials. I do not remember what it is called, but it had mint in it and reminded me of a mint julep. That was very tasty as well. 

The service is great and I will definitely be back for more! As with almost everywhere in San Francisco, you'll be circling for parking for quite a bit so drop off someone in your party to put your name on the list.
author: Breniel L.

description:
A friend and I have started a lovely 5K + Brunch tradition and Zazie was up next, after four of us ran the Hot Chocolate 5K. (http://www.yelp.com/biz/hot-chocolate-15k-5k-san-francisco#hrid:AT3MPRetwjqtv1uWWVcKiQ) 

There was a wait when we arrived around 10 on a Sunday but we got our name on the list and I certainly didn't mind hanging out and enjoying the beautiful weather. We asked for first available but after slithering through the crowded main dining room, I am glad that we were seated at a cozy, yet comfortable, table on the back patio. 

We started with a large quantity of water and then ordered a bottle of bubbly with two juices (orange and cranberry) to share. After enjoying our food, we also decided to order a round of bloody marys for good measure. The drinks were all delightful. 

I'm a huge fan of food with poached eggs on top so I was happy to see an entire dedicated to that category. I went with the La Mer because I certainly couldn't resist crab, avocado and green onion, topped with a poached egg, all on top of an english muffin. I opted for a green salad on the side. For many of their dishes, they offer the choice of one, two or three eggs. I decided one would be just fine. (Although I could have easily eaten more...it was so delicious.) My brunch companions all seemed to enjoy their respective dishes as well. No food got left behind. 

Service was fantastic from the host to our server to everyone else. 

There are many more places that I would like to visit for brunch. However, I would also return here in a heartbeat.
author: Emily J.

description:
We waited almost an hour to get a table but it was SO worth the wait! Brunch at Zazie was just phenomenal. We managed to get a table in the patio in the back and it was lovely and cool on the exceptionally warm day! 

We ordered one of the scrambles (New York : with wild smoked salmon, green onions, and cream cheese), poached eggs (Albert : with bacon, white cheddar, and homemade salsa fresca) and French Toast (Tahiti : Pinkie's challah stuffed with caramelized bananas and walnuts). Everything tasted amazing and so fresh! The scramble was delicious and had a very generous serving of salmon. Poached eggs were definitely the best I have tasted so far! The eggs were super creamy and cooked perfectly and the salsa fresca, so fresh! The French toast really stood out too. Can't wait to go back for some more!
author: Shriya P.

description: Really good French bistro food, the 3 course is a great deal!  Loved the fresh baked bread and fish was delicious.
author: Lizzie B.

description:
3.75

Pretty tasty breakfast (but nothing out of this world) with insane wait times. Pluses? Up to date on technology (get with it, San Fran!) with iPad app check in and text/call notification. Still, we had to wait over an hour for Sunday brunch (thankfully the area semi-window shopping friendly).

Our group was seated at the window (as there were five of us) and while the restaurant felt a bit small, it was still very comfortable. We ordered the Florentine, La Mer, St. Trop, and some of the famous gingerbread pancakes for the table. The egg dishes were fairly standard and the gingerbread pancakes while good weren't too remarkable. I found the pear (served with the pancakes) to be the star of the dish. 
At no point during our breakfast were we ever like, omg, wow we have to come back. The drinks, especially the mimosas, are definitely recommended though.

Good service, good food, super long waits.
Shrug.

(Sit outside and throngs of people waiting to get seated will watch you eat.)
author: Jan P.

description:
Gingerbread pancakes + La Mer poached eggs. Yum and yum! I love the gingerbread pancakes. The subtly spicy, sweet, and gingery pancakes paired perfectly with the lemon curd and bosc pears. Definitely a must try! And the La Mer poached eggs--poached eggs, dungeness crab, avocado, and hollandaise sauce over an English muffin? Decadent!

I went on a weekday around 10 AM, so there was no wait. If you plan on coming later in the mornings (read: any time after they open) on the weekends, plan on brunching elsewhere. The first time I attempted to dine at Zazie, the wait was so unbearably long that my party and I settled for La Boulange instead...which wasn't shabby, but it was no Zazie.
author: Audrey T.

description: I've been here twice now and both times were awesome! The first time I came, I was with a girlfriend and we shared the gingerbread pancakes and some eggs and sausage. We had to wait for a bit, but the staff is super friendly, the interior of the restaurant was charming, and the food was worth the wait. The latest visit was with my family and we sat on the back garden patio. The heaters were nice and the environment very cozy. The group had the salmon breakfast sandwich, a BLT, the gingerbread pancakes, and the La Mer Benedict. All were fantastic! The eggs were fresh, the sausage tasty, and the sandwiches beautifully crafted. The side salad and home fries are always tasty too! A must-go!!
author: Tiffany K.

description:
Must come here! The food and service were amazing!

First arrived seeing crowds outside. Put my name on a clipboard on the wall and waited for around 15 minutes on a Saturday at 9:15 AM- quickly was sat and impressed that it did not take forever! 

Was walked to the very back of the restaurant to a cute patio area which I would kill to have in my own yard- ivy with lights hidden inside it, beautiful wood deck, outdoor heaters to keep us warm in the fog, and enough space where I wasnt sitting ontop of the neighbors at other tables.

Server quickly came where I ordered the mango mimosa- yuuum! Was impressed with the large selection of mimosa's! You can make your own, too! 

Food came out quickly- about ten minutes, with a beautiful presentation. I ordered the alberto poached egg and my boyfriend the lemon riccata pancakes. All I have to say is AMAZING!! Great quality food, well made and tasted so good!

Server was very friendly and was prompt with meeting our needs. 

5 stars for service, quality of the food, and the overall atmosphere of the place! I think I just found my new favorite breakfast spot!!

Thank you, and you bet I'll be back for more soon!
author: Melissa R.

description: I have only been to Zazie for brunch but can I just say I still have daydreams over their Gingerbread pancakes. Quick service, expensive menu. I do not give it fivestars because of the super crammed atmosphere and sassy staff but brunch menu is superb!
author: Brianna R.

description: Great brunch restaurant in San Francisco. We had a dog and set outside at patio, which as first come first served. Ordered the egg benedict and pancakes and shared. The benedict was super good while the pancakes were just okay. Highly recommended this place.
author: Raymond K.

description:
I try to stay away from popular brunch restaurants that don't allow reservations. However, if i do plan on going to one, i make sure to beat the line and not wait around for hours. Zazie opens at 9am on the weekends. I wasn't exactly sure where it was located on Cole St but i saw the line and knew i should scout for a parking spot asap. Note that i got there 20 minutes prior to opening time! 

I'll have to agree with the bulk of yelpers here and recommend...

La Mer, Eggs Benedicts: They make a perfect poached egg here at Zazie's. I get so much joy breaking one and watching the egg run to create one delicious mess of everything. They top it with a respectable amount of crab meat. I ordered two eggs and had a side of ...

Gingerbread pancakes: It smells and tastes like Christmas! 5 stars for one of the best pancakes i've had. It's unusual and they top it with butter, a poached pear slice, and lemon curd. (Dab a little of their raspberry jam to it as well)

What you should take from this review:
1. Make the first round of seating - the preferred patio seating on sunny days will be taken by those standing in line before it opens. Anyone coming in after will be seated inside.
2. Come before 9:30am
3. Your whole party must be present to be seated (ahhh!)
4. The two front tables outside of the restaurant are first come, first serve. You sit there - it's yours!

One star taken off due to my coffee mug staying empty for long periods of time. They are small mugs! I need several refills :(
author: Samantha L.

description:
My only complaint about Zazie is I wish it was much closer to me. 

I've really enjoyed their brunch and felt it was worth the inevitable wait for a table each time.  They're quite a popular bistro in the neighborhood and do a good job with each of their menu offerings but I recommend their egg creations for brunch (they have a variety of poached eggs (e.g. Benedict) options with their delicious lemon Hollandaise, for example).
 
Whether you sit inside the cozy interior or outside on the patio, service is professional and attentive.
author: Saminda W.

description:
This has been one of my favorite brunch spots in the city for years!

I love the French Toast Tahiti, Miracle Pancakes, and Dungeness Crab/Avocado Benedict. Since I have a small appetite and I usually can't finish what I order for brunch at other restaurants, I really appreciate how Zazie let's you order based on how many pieces of French toast/pancakes or the number of eggs that you want. That way I don't feel like I'm being wasteful. 

They also carry a wide variety of mimosas, none of which disappoint. Lastly I love the homey atmosphere and attentive service. 

I would just recommend coming here as early as you can. If it is after 11 (even on weekdays), be prepared for a long wait!
author: Heidi Q.

description:
This is my favorite breakfast/brunch place in San Francisco. The food and service here is amazing. This is a must for anyone visiting the city. 
I highly recommend the Le Mar (crab Benedict) and the Tahiti french toast with bananas and walnuts. 
Sooooo good!
author: Sam A.

description: Worth the wait, we had pancakes, omlette with goat cheese, and onion soup, everything plus service were great. I also liked their patio, very cozy. Also I am very supportive of tips free policy. Will likely visit again!
author: Inessa R.

description:
I came to Zazie on a Sunday and had almost two wait.Be early to avoid the wait.Cool bar next door if you have to wait.Bar has a good Bloody Mary

Good prompt service once you're inside.I ordered Eggs Benedict and was not disappointed at all.Everything was spot on.Im looking forward to returning but getting there early next visit.
author: M B.

description:
Had Sunday brunch here at opening hours and it was good! Beware of long lines on a Sunday - we were party #15 on the list so we were afraid that we wouldn't be seated. But our friend arrived and we sat in the nice outdoors back area (which was actually nice because it was a rare sunny day in SF). 

I tried a little bit of the mimosa and had a poached egg with prosciutto and cornmeal pancakes with lemon curd. The egg was good, the lemon hollandaise was a little too sour for me but I guess it balances the saltiness of the prosciutto. I really liked the pancakes, the texture was great as I loved the crunch of the cornmeal and they were pretty big. My friends for the French Toast Tahiti and it was quite flavorful and rich. 

The pancakes were really good and I definitely want to come back and try their other varieties!
author: Steven V.

description: Waiting time of more than an hour on a Sunday when you are very hungry is no fun but the cute corner we sat in and the delicious food for a reasonable price made up for it! My friends went for the good looking and rich gingerbread pancakes and pancakes with fruits while I had a bagel with cream cheese, scrambled eggs and a huge bowl with fresh fruits! It makes sense to combine sides as I did if you do not want to decide for the one or the other thing :)
author: Insa N.

description: This place was recommended highly to me by friends and I'm so glad I went! The wait on a Monday morning was only 30 minutes for my party of 5 and we really enjoyed the menu options and service :)
author: Sera L.

description:
So I've been to Zazie twice now and I really want to say I love it but...I don't. Given all the brunch food options I've definitely had better. It's located in Cole Valley, close to the UCSF campus so you'll often see students there. The wait is always pretty long (30-40 minutes), probably because it's such a tiny restaurant, but I can't say it's really worth it. 

Seating: Like I said...long wait. There is patio seating in the back and they have two tables up front which are first come first serve. 

Food: The first time I had the French Toast Tahiti which is french toast stuff with caramelized bananas and walnuts. It was really intense. They say the bread was soaked in orange cinnamon batter but I found those flavors missing. Wish the cinnamon flavor was stronger. The second time around had one of their specials, Eggs en Fonte, which was basically a saucy polenta and egg dish. There was a piece of polenta in a tomato, spinach, mushroom sauce topped with a sunnyside egg. I found the dish to be lacking in flavors and had to add hot sauce to give it a kick. 

Drinks: Had a coffee special the first time...supposed to be pumpkin spice latte-esque but the coffee taste bitter, almost burnt. Couldn't get myself to finish even half of it. Plus at almost $5 was not worth it. The second time around we got a build-your own mimosa deal which was perfect for 4. Wish they gave a larger amount of juice though.
author: Alysha F.

description: Had the ravioli with mushroom special. The wine sauce was flavorful and to die for. Could use more truffle oil. The pancake sampler was perfect for 3 people to share. My sister ordered a bloody Mary and it came out stiff.
author: Yen D.

description:
We went here for dinner, and I really wish I had tried this place for brunch, as was my intention when I bookmarked it. The brunch looks amazing, but I wanted a special family dinner for new years day, so I decided on this as I have been wanting to try it and I am really all about the vision of paying a living wage vs the tipping structure. Plus, I love french food so...why not?

The atmosphere was very nice...I really like the decor. And the service was great. The biggest thing about the physical aspects of the place is the bathroom. I was actually shocked when I went in there. It's a very tiny bathroom that is literally tight in the kitchen pass area and walk through from the outside patio. Very clean, so that wasn't the problem, just small and didn't feel very private.

Now, the food. Started very promising with the dinner rolls and soups. The french onion and tomato fennel soups were amazing. I wish I'd gotten a bowl of that with the dinner rolls and called it a day. I seriously recommend!

For entrees we got the hangar steak, winter pasta, and saumon en papillote. The hanger steak was pretty decent and the best dish.

The pasta was just boring and the butternut squash very al dente for my liking. Bland and bland. But a healthy choice!

The salmon was very overcooked and a bit strong smelling. I was very disappointed. For me, there is nothing like a well cooked salmon at a nice restaurant with a nice cream sauce, but that fish was really not good.

Desserts were also only ok. the best was the creme brulee - it was pretty good.

So, for me, disappointing and pricey for the quality we got. I will update with a (hopefully better) review once I try the brunch.
author: Tracy C.

description: Best brunch in town. Mario is the best too! Their dinner is also good if you're looking for French. Our favorites are the Monaco poached eggs and the beef bourguignon or salmon for dinner. Worth the wait. Friendly staff and consistently tasty.
author: Amanda C.

description:
We went for brunch on a weekday (still had a 20 min wait) to try out their Eggs Divorcee (eggs benedicts) and omelet. We got the benedicts with real crab meat (Le Mer) and they tasted spectacular! The eggs were poached perfectly and the flavor was very balanced. We weren't fans of their "fries" as they were just bland large potato cubes covered in oil. Would definitely go for their salads next time. Their omelet was rather small and light on the flavors but it was still pretty good. I guess they are supposed to be "healthier".

If you're craving for some semi-fancy breakfast/brunch food, give this place a try. They have a good number of selections but the prices are a little on the higher end. Beers are served in frosted cups and their mimosas look rather refreshing as well. Nice place to start off a morning.
author: Aron Y.

description:
Zazie a quaint little French place that has a bring your own bottle night once a week.. So wine in hand we loaded into a taxi cab and traveled from downtown to that Haight area to try a little French food! 

Man this place is small and naturally i found myself seated right in the path of all the servers, so my chair was getting bumpped about every other minute!  OH well!  That's going to happen in small places. 

Being the only vegan in the bunch, the small menu was not looking to good for me until I spoke to our waiter who said we will make you something special!  ZING ZING!  BONUS POINTS FOR HIM!  

And yes they made me a beautiful stir fry type meal that was pretty delicious!  It was not the most flashy meal but, I enjoyed that the staff went out of the way to get some food in my belly!
author: Patrick T.

description:
We came here for dinner. Zazie is a French bistro, cute and cozy. This place is definitely a neighborhood gem! Amazing food and service! I recommend reservation or expect to wait over an hour. Parking is also a problem in this neighborhood.

The service was great however at times we felt a little rushed. But she was attentive and professional. She also speaks French if you like to order in French.

Le Canard - grilled Maple Leaf duck breast with mashed garnet yams, wilted spinach on top, and port fig reduction. This duck is out of this world delicious. 

Coqau Vin - slowly braised chicken with root vegetables, and red wine over fresh pasta. This is a classic chicken in wine. It had a nice flavor and the meat is very tender. 

Zazie Niman Ranch Burger- with tomatoes Provençale and Yukon gold potatoes. Grass-fed premium beef patty was pretty awesome.

For dessert Cuit de Chocolat Chaud, their signature "baked hot chocolate" with golden marshmallows was perfect with a cup of coffee.

This is a great place to eat, great service and we will be back soon.
author: Jeannie C.

description: Went here for brunch and had to wait long for my order. Two group that was seated after us had got served first and was eating 10 minutes prior to our dishes coming out. Messed up on order and had to wait 10 extra minutes. The place was too small. French toast was not cooked. Price was overpriced. Would I come back? Maybe
author: Scott P.

description:
Bloody Mary was the highlight- super spicy! My friend went for the ginger mimosa. Drinks were a bit expensive for the serving size

Went with some friends and got the flight of pancakes/French toast along with our meals. Was so much food and so worth it.

Gingerbread pancake was a bit bready for my taste. I preferred the buttermilk.

Good service, food came out quick, and only waited 30 min or so to be seated for Saturday brunch. Will be back!
author: Sharon R.

description:
Zazie's brunch is on point in so many ways!!!

LONG WAIT, but WORTH IT! -- We went next door to the Irish pub and had drinks while we waited and the host/head server was kind enough to come next door to get us in person on the back patio even when our table was ready (at least an hour and a half...though it was Sunday afternoon and we had a larger group, so was expected by the veterans in the group).

BEST POACHED EGG DISHES I've had! -- The Albert and Florentine were my favorite.  I had the home fries and absolutely loved the ROASTED GARLIC CLOVES they come with! Bacon on the side completed the fries for me.

GINGERBREAD & MIRACLE PANCAKES were INSANE! -- Unique and delicious!!

CHALLAH FRENCH TOAST WAS INCREDIBLE! -- Beware ordering too much... because you will not hold back once you taste this french toast.

PEAR SORBET MIMOSAS WITH LAVENDER SYRUP were DREAMY! -- Good portion, beautiful lowball champagne glasses, perfect balance of bubbles & flavor!

Back patio was a gorgeous set up with heaters and foliage... definitely would prefer to sit back there... inside was tiny and crowded with mostly two tops.  This is not an easy spot for large groups.

Our server Megan was A-mazing! (and amazingly patient and kind with our very lively table, full of questions at the end of her day)
author: Wendy C.

description:
Delicious food. Standard brunch place wait time of 1+ hour. Standard brunch prices. Super friendly staff. Pretty outdoor patio seating in the back.

Their Eggs Florentine (with spinach and mushrooms) and Eggs Monaco (with prosciutto and tomatoes provençales) are super tasty and filling, comes with a side of home fries or a salad. I love that you can order different portions; you can select 1, 2 or 3 eggs - really big draw since not everybody wants the same amount of food. Also tried their special lemon ricotta pancake which was great. 

Great service: We missed our name being called on one occasion and when we notified the host, he immediately got us a table in the next few minutes even though there was still a long line. Will totally come back.
author: Megan L.

description: Not good. Under seasoned. Ridiculous wait. Been for brunch and dinner. Why is there such hype???
author: O.R. L.

description: Really cute little brunch place. Looking at the list, we expected to wait an hour or longer, but it only took 40 minutes. The food was delicious and the eggs benedicts were beautiful. The prices were reasonable considering that tip was included. Staff was friendly and quick. The mushrooms on the egg Florentine were scrumptious. Would eagerly return here if in the neighborhood again.
author: Christine K.

description: The food was delicious! And not bad price either. Would totally go here again. I went 2 days after Christmas around 10AM for brunch with a friend. We had a 10 min wait, so it wasn't so bad. We got seated at the garden patio; it was so cute and cozy + heaters. The decorations + plates and everything were very pretty. Food was awesome, again. Though I thought since it was Tuesday it wouldn't be much, it was crowded! Service was great and they are very friendly. Coming back here!
author: Sofia C.

description:
Sorry, but I am no longer going back to Zazie. I was matching my receipts with my credit card statement and noticed that I was charged more than what I had written down on my receipt. Obviously my tip amount was changed and the server name on the receipt shows Servando. Purely an unethical act. Don't think you can get away with it thinking most of your customers don't keep their receipts. Because I do. My five star rating has dropped to one star because of this.

This is a note to everybody to keep your copy of your receipt because things like this happens very often. Don't be a victim of fraud.
author: Tiramisu W.

description:
Came here on a Friday night for diner, around 9:15pm and were seated within 10min. The French server was very nice and ordered our drinks right away. The prix-fixe menu is a safe bet  and gives you enough choice. Mu husband got the duck and it was cooked parfaitement! It is on the pricey side (total of $120 for 1 prix fixe + 1 duck + 1 desert + 1/2 bottle of wine) but you don't tip. 

Only disappointment: the desert that came with the prix fixe - I had no crumble on my too sweet strawberry/rhubarb crumble :( (2.5/5) 

Will be back again
author: Margaux M.

description:
Zazie is a pretty amazing brunch place, but worth the wait? Not really... Like many brunch places in SF, the experience usually gets tainted by the ridiculously long lines especially if you're not mentally prepared for it. I've been to Zazie 3 times, and I've been disappointed only one of those 3 times (coincidentally when I had to wait a while). 

The first time I came here, we didn't have to wait very long because we decided sitting outside would be better than standing outside for even longer waiting for an indoor table. We decided to share the crab Benedict and the French toast Tahiti and they were both amazing! Had to try hard not to eat more than my share because me and my bf had just started dating at the time. It was a great experience.

My second time here was not so great. I let my bf drag me here in my post-Bay to Breakers drunken/almost hungover state, which was a big mistake. Not only did I have to miserably wait in line for almost an hour self-consciously under the hot sun, I also made the mistake of ordering from their sandwich menu. Don't do it! Stick with the eggs bennies, French toast, and pancakes! I mean it wasn't horrible but the Croque Royale IMO was not satisfying and is not worth $14. 

Third time here, all was right again. I came with my coworker during work hours for her good-bye brunch when there was no wait and played it safe and ordered the eggs benedict with avocado and prawns, French toast Tahiti, and a mango mimosa. (I ate all that..?) Just as good as I remembered it the first time. 

TLDR: highly recommend their eggs Benedict, French toast, and pancakes, avoid the lunch menu unless you don't mind pricey small portions, service is good, and be prepared to wait on weekends!
author: Stephanie G.

description: It wasn't bad, but I have to say that it wasn't anything spectacular either. I feel like I paid more for the ambiance as opposed to the food, but I'd definitely go back.
author: Trisha V.

description: Love this place. The staff are friendly, food is super flavorful and portions are hearty. The interior makes you feel you have stepped into a small town restaurant somewhere in France. It's a perfect balance of romantic and cozy.  I can't wait to go back.
author: Melisa O.

description: Such a unique and cute cafe. The service was excellent and the food was delicious! These were the best breakfast potatoes I've ever had in my life! My fiancé had the oatmeal brûlée with caramelized bananas and loved it. Only complaints, as there aren't many, is that the coffee is served in a large bowl with no handle (and the bowl is hot) and the bathroom is tiny.
author: Luis And Jennifer S.

description:
Meh. Went here for brunch on NYE. I realize the holiday may have had something to do with the extreme wait, but we waited about 45 minutes for a party of three around 11:30 am. When we finally got in, we were starving. 

The food was meh, a little cold to be honest, and it took 1/2 hr to get a pot of tea that we ordered first thing. The best part was probably the baguette I ordered to start with because I was so hungry after the long wait. 

I do like that they are "tip-free" and thought that the prices were very reasonable considering this. 

Considering there are so many other great brunch places in the city, I probably won't be coming back.
author: Chenise T.

description:
Tip for San Franciscans like myself who reaaaalllyy don't like waiting for food (but will do it, so long as I am not starving to the point of grouchy) - come during the first week of the new year!!!  Everyone is on new year hangover, and the line was only 30 minutes at prime time.

Gingerbread pancakes & french toast tahiti stood out especially. 

Drool - can't wait to go back.
author: Adele Z.

description: Came in for dinner. Delicious food - had a cheese platter, the ravioli, and wife had the beet salad and fruit crumble. Everything was awesome. Great service. Very cute venue. Very French in style :)
author: Michael W.

description:
Do not underestimate their gingerbread pancakes! The short stack with fill you up fast. Worth the price and wait! 

Take my money, Zazie!
author: Ryan K.

description:
I love, love this place. Only "shitay" thing is that you must expect lines. I recommend putting your name down & walking down the street to grab a cup of Joe & then by the time you return..should be much closer to your sitting time. :) 

My favorite place to sit is outside on the patio, its adorable, makes you feel like you stepped into a secluded small cottage in the middle of france (or something like that). 

Things to order...everything. I had the benedicts, yummm...french toast...yumm....place is on point. When you get a chance...make it over for brunch, you will NOT regret it, promise!
author: Priscilla N.

description:
First of all, holy cow what a wait! I understand that anywhere you go for brunch in San Francisco you will have to wait your fair share of time before being seated, thus my friend and I were prepared for this. But gosh did we wait, almost 2 entire hours. Luckily we hadn't seen each other in almost a year so we had a lot to catch up on and talked while we waited. Towards the end we were getting very irritated and hungry. 

We finally managed to get seated in the back of the restaurant, which looked like a mini French botanical garden. I ordered their ham, cheddar, and avocado scramble and we both shared their pancake special: lemon poppy seed! The food was very good but gosh was the pancake to die for! I would definitely wait in line just for the little piece of heaven in my mouth again. 

I'm glad there is a Peets Coffee next door to get a bit of a caffeine fix while waiting. Make sure when you go there to have lots to talk about with who you are going because there will be a long wait, but trust me this SF brunch divinity is worth it.
author: Gladys L.

description:
So elegant like a brunch place in the Village. 

Been around since I was a teen. I bring my kids here now and it is still as good as ever.

I wish they would bring back this sandwich that was basically a baguette drenched in olive oil and filled with trout or duck goodness from 1991.

Pancakes in ever gingery lemon curd and pumpkin variety -yes! French toast -yes!  Bowls of coffee, chai and chocolate yes yes yes!!!

Where I learned to cherish roasted potatoes.

Usually a wait. That is ok. Cole Valley is cute and it is always a fun, sweet experience.

The service is always nice despite how clearly crazy busy they are.
author: Amy S.

description:
Maybe I was insane to pick a restaurant  for Mothers Day that doesn't take reservations for brunch but, thankfully being the wise mother that I am, I decided that my family and I should get to Zazie's early.  Good thing we did because getting there 1/2 an hour early got us 3rd on a long, long list.

We all really enjoyed our food.  My daughter had the Un, Deux, Trois (1 pancake, 2 eggs & 3 pieces of bacon - how can you go wrong with that).  These might have been the fluffiest pancakes we ever had...and that's saying a lot as my husband and daughter love them some pancakes.

My husband and I had poached eggs - he had the Pierre Noir (bacon & tomato provencales) and I had the La Mer (Dungeness crab & avocado).  The eggs were cooked really well and I love crab & avocados.  

This is a place I 'd sure come back to for brunch again.
author: Rose A.

description:
The only thing Zazie about this place was its name. I found this place based on the the number of reviews at 4 stars, so i decided to give it a try. I love the neighborhood its in, having these little neighborhood places all over sf is what i love. Came in during brunch time - waited 15 mins (it was semi busy). 

When seated - staff was generally nice. Ordered the ginger pancakes with bacon and eggs. The pancakes were huge, but that was the only thing that impressed me. Some people love the sponge texture stuff, but this really felt like i was eating a sponge. Really rubbery and chewy. It had a hint of ginger. I guess it threw me off guard since it didn't have the texture i was used to like kitchen story or milbrae house of pancakes. Bacon was overcooked and eggs were a little runny. 

After our meal it seemed like it took forever to get our checks. In the end i would probably give this place another try. I wasnt fully dissatisfied, but maybe i did not like it on a technical level.
author: Ryan R.

description: Excellent, relaxed, and progressive spot where the servers are fairly compensated, i.e. tips are not necessary since the owner has factored a living wage into the payscale. Nice and modern. And perhaps more important for Yelpers: the breakfast was excellent. A Mexican scramble, with chorizo, plus breakfast potatoes, and wheat toast hit the spot.
author: Will V.

description:
I've been here twice and for both occasions, I ended up getting the Un, Deux, Trois (pancake, eggs, and bacon) and replacing it with the "special" pancake. You can also choose to get the french toast with this order.

GINGERBREAD PANCAKE W/ BOSC PEARS + LEMON CURD
Omggggg *droooooool. This was so delicious! I'm not a huge fan of gingerbread but this was amazing with the subtle gingerbread flavor. It's topped with bosc pears and lemon curd. For at LEAST one bite, combine the lemon curd with a slice of bosc pear with the pancake and just close your eyes and enjoy. I was alternating between pancake + lemon curd and pancake + bosc pears but when ALL three are eaten together in one bite, oh man. It was so very pleasant.

MIRACLE PANCAKE W/ RASPBERRY SAUCE + LEMON CURD
There was orange zest in the pancake! And raspberry sauce. AND lemon curd. This was my first meal here and my first time experiencing their lemon curd. It's so good... and the subtle orange flavoring in the pancake was simply delicious.

Bottom line, that lemon curd. You don't need the heavy syrup when there's lemon curd!
author: Sandy T.

description:
Lines are long if you go during prime hours but the food is well worth it!

I always get eggs benedict here because you just can't go wrong with those.

The patio seating is also nice and makes for a nice touch.
author: Andy V.

description:
Je taime Zazie. 

I just wish it wasn't so popular - it's ridiculously difficult to get a table outside in the back, and often hard to get a table at all.
author: San Fran R.

description: Overpriced. Underwhelming food. Great service from host, server and busser. Thank you for your hospitality!
author: Mayra L.

description: Their brunch is DELICIOUS! I came on a Tuesday around 1pm. No wait, not even for outside! I would recommend not coming on the weekend because there's usually a 2 hour wait. Hit this spot over your lunch break - bring your boss (they'll love it). I've been here for dinner and didn't absolutely love it or the price. The good thing about their Monday night dinner though is that their back patio is dog friendly and you get 50% bottles of wine if you have a dog! All in all, come for LUNCH and do it DURING THE WEEK!
author: Ashlyn R.

description:
If you pick one place in San Francisco (or the world for that matter) for brunch, its Zazie!  Simply delicious and such a sweet cozy place with outdoor seating that's super cute for any occasion.  They don't take reservations so go about 30 minutes before you start starving and head next door for outdoor ping pong and they'll get you once your reservation is up! 
They are known for their benedicts- The eggs albert is my absolute fav.  Also, try the mimosas.  They serve several wild flavors.  The result is pure happiness.  I've been going here for the last 15 years and its my longest visited and most favorite restaurant in San Francisco.   I would give a million stars if the choice was available.  Thank you Zazie, my second home.
author: Monica P.

description:
This is a fantastic place, albeit a bit on the very-pricey side. If you live in SF, take Muni to get here, since the neighborhood is not car-friendly.

The staff here is super-professional, and breakfast is scrumptious. Bring a book on weekends, though, there are a lot of people that want to eat here, so the wait can often be long. It's worth it, though, a least once in your life.

I took off a star, due to the prices, which are too high, but if you want budget food, don't eat out.
author: Jim S.

description: Very nice brunch spot in a good location. Outdoor seating is a bonus.
author: Paulina F.

description:
This small cafe has quite the wait to get a table, up to an hour at peak times. Once in, the food is great, the service is good and the price is accurate for the quality. They also have a no tipping policy (they pay their staff appropriately from their profits as others should). 
The New York scrambled eggs, which comes with scallions and salmon, was as good a brunch as I have had in SF. The French toast and pancakes were good & those that I dined with enjoyed the Mexican scrambled eggs and the poached egg options. The menu gives you the flexibility of potatoes / fries / salad with each dish and an option to choose how many eggs that you want. Great place.
author: Barry O.

description:
Visited Zazie for brunch and left a very satisfied customer. (Only one star off because their coffee is not very good.)

Shared the coffee cake with some friends, and we were all impressed with how delicious it was, and a super generous portion.

But really my favorite thing about Zazie is that I can order 1 egg benedict, as in I can get half an english muffin with a poached egg. And you can mix and match the various eggs benedict options.  In fact, you can pretty much order anything on their menu as one item! It's pretty awesome.

Prices are very reasonable, service is friendly and fast, and there's a cute outdoor patio area.
author: Margaret I.

description:
As a former waitress, I love the living wage/health insurance/no tipping policy at this restaurant. That was the first thing that made me want to go here. Then I took a look at their menu, and...yeah. Sold.

We came here when they opened for dinner at 5 on a weeknight, so there was no wait. Sat in the beautiful intimate little restaurant and had the sweetest French waitress. Wonderful service.

The food was delicious. We started with the bread roll, which was crusty and warm and the little scoop of butter was perfectly soft. Have to appreciate the little things, right? My Fish Soup Provencale, with tomato, fennel, huge chunks of salmon, and mussels, was fresh but filling, and my husband's trout was perfectly cooked. We both also ordered a glass of one of their (cheaper) French white wines.

Simplicity of entrees with fresh ingredients and cooked perfectly...that's exactly what we wanted, and that's what we got. Plus with their values in the right place, no way could I give this little restaurant anything less than 5 stars.
author: Nicole O.

description:
I had an awesome time here for brunch with my friends despite the 2 hours wait. Yes you heard that right...2 FREAKEN hours! Thank god there was a bar next door to keep us entertained. The host was even willing to come get us at the bar when our table was ready. Talk about good service! 

We got lucky and scored nice seats at the patio in the back. The weather was perfect..not windy at all just a little cold but they had the heated lamps turned on. Our waiter was super bubbly and friendly but the service was a bit slow as expected since it was a full house for hours. But our waitress still handled us well. And I don't think we were easy...we were a group of 5 girls, super buzzed, loud and VERY hungry. 

I'm a huge fan of Benedicts so I loved the fact that there were a lot of diff selections to choose from AND you can also opt for 1, 2 or 3 eggs!  We tried the La Mer (crab and avocado) and the St. Trop (smoked salmon and capers) Both were good but my fav is def the crab benny!  Also ordered a bunch of other stuff to share including a panini, omelette, salad and French toast. All were good and not to mention a ton of mimosas flowing our way. :)  if you have a group of 4 or more, just order the whole bottle of champagne with the juice on the side. Better deal! 

Yes I will come back but No I won't do the 2 hour wait anymore. I don't think any brunch place is worth the 2 hour wait.
author: Cathy M.

description: Decided to stop by on a Sunday morning and the wait was terrible. Got there at 11AM but didn't get seated until 1:15pm. The food portion was decent for its price since tips are included. They messed up one of the pouch egg on my eggs benedict. One of the egg was cook perfectly but the second one was overcooked and was half the size as the first one. The food quality seems to be inconsistent. Overall food was average except for the overcook egg, but not worth the 2 hour wait. But I guess this place wins best brunch I ever had by default since I never eat brunch.
author: Steven W.

description:
******************************* 934  *******************************

       We came here for brunch and it was my first time in Cole Valley. I've never ventured out this part of town. An hour wait, I would not do it, but my friends insisted on shopping around, so that was a good thing.

       The host/manager that called people name on the waiting list was actually very nice. He told us estimated time to come back and when we came back he greeted us nicely. That's impressive after all morning dealing with MADNESS here.

- Pierre Noir: with bacon and tomatoes provencales - Served on an English muffin with  light lemon hollandaise, with home fries potato chunks. It was quite good, oh well anything with bacon is good yeah!

- Valence: with roasted eggplant and spicy tomato-chevre sauce (no hollandaise) - Served on an English muffin with salad - I enjoyed the eggplant and the egg was perfectly poached! 

- Croque Madame - grilled black forest ham and gruyere sandwich made in the traditional French style  topped with a sunny side up free range egg - rich but darn tasty!

     Service was quick and efficient. I just didn't like how tiny from the table to the next. Wish we had the outdoor patio, but after an hour, I wouldn't care ;-) Would I come back, if I'm in the area, but I wouldn't go out of my way, because there's so many brunch choices in San Francisco that's closer and more accessible to us.
author: Manda Bear B.

description:
Wonderfully cute spot in the heart of Cole Valley for brunch! Went with a couple friends on a random Monday morning and still had to wait about 20 minutes, but luckily there's some shade on the sidewalk. (hmm a parklet would be pretty awesome here!) Not sure I would've waited 1+ hours though.

I ordered the divorcee (eggs benedict + avocado + fontina cheese + bacon), which was amazeballs. Also found myself eyeing my friend's tuna nicoise salad (very generous portions of tuna). Love the no tip policy so there's never awkwardness.
author: Grace W.

description:
Excellent dining experience!

I had the eggs benedict with salmon and spinach. It was absolutely delicious. I ordered some ice tea as well which was not great but nothing to really complain about. Our servers were gracious and friendly and made our brunch very enjoyable. It was a wonderful day and we were lucky that we got seated on the patio at the back of the restaurant.

The unique thing about the restaurant was that there was no tipping required. The menu detailed how the staff was well compensated and offered competitive 401k options and insurance plans. I definitely preferred this compared to the alternative of figuring out how much to tip.

The wait was a little long ~30 minutes but that was expected considering how many people must enjoy eating here. Would definitely come back!
author: Tejas P.

description:
I simply love this place. I would recommend you to go also in the evenings. They have great food, good portions and the personnel is super nice. 
If you go for brunch put down your name for the patio go for a walk and come back.
author: Giulia P.

description:
I dedicate my 400th review to Zazie.
Came here the other day after the long awaited opportunity to give this place a try. This place has been a major hit here on Yelp, as well as on the 7x7 list. I just had to try it out for myself.

Came on a random Thursday afternoon and got extremely lucky with parking at the corner.. although meter.. but still lucky since we all know it is a living hell to find parking in this area.

My friend and I decided that we wanted to definitely try out the infamous La Mer eggs benedict and I was eying the St. Tropez eggs benedict.

The La Mer is the dungeness crab eggs benedict with a delicious hollandaise sauce. There were big chunks of crab (although not a massive amount like Mama's gives) visible to the naked eye. 

The St. Tropez is the smoked salmon eggs benedict which was really good.. maybe because I LOVE smoked salmon and it just went really well with everything.

Both dishes came with potatoes which were delicious.. crisp to perfection and also were fried with HUGE chunks of garlic cloves.

The place wasn't too packed that afternoon... yet I didn't receive the exact amount of customer service I was looking for.. I wasn't asked once if everything was okay.. nor was my water jug refilled. **BIG DEDUCTION of one star IMO**

Although the dishes were fairly good... I prefer Mama's.. even if I have to wait much longer than I did at Zazie.
author: Tiff C.

description: Unique menue and tasty food. As other people already said, gingerbread pancakes and challah french toast are the best. Tahitti toast i did not like, too oily for my taste. Service was good and we'll definitely be back.
author: Brook R.

description:
The first time I came to Zazie over a year ago was for dinner, which I remember was quite impressive.  Last week, I took my visiting grandparents here for a weekday brunch.

First, let me say that the service played a huge part in the overall experience.  Both the host/manager and server were so warm and friendly, giving the restaurant a cozy, welcoming feeling.  

The food was good, as expected, although my particular dish of choice wasn't as impressive.  I believe it was called the Salade Alaine, which was a basic salad with smoked salmon and a mustard vinaigrette.  It was decent, although I am sure there are much better choices on the menu.  My grandmother ordered the Ahi Tuna Sandwich (with tomatoes provencales, aioli, greens and sun dried tomato pesto), and my grandfather ordered the French Toast Tahiti (challah toast stuffed with caramelized bananas and walnuts).  Both of them were extremely delicious and I couldn't keep my fork out of their plates! :)

Altogether, I really enjoyed Zazie, as did my grandparents, whom are very picky and judgmental when it comes to good food.  I am excited to be back!


P.S. Their house-made tea is absolutely delicious - you must try it.
author: Juliana K.

description:
I've had Zazies bookmarked for some time now and today was the day to go. I assumed an early Tuesday morning would have no wait. My sister and I arrived and snagged one of the last 2 tables inside the restaurant! Score! 
We looked over the menu and I got the bacon, poached egg on an English muffin. The side were home fries, salad and something else I can't remember. I told the waitress "I'll take the home fries please." She asked "what kind of potatoes would you like?" I had to stop and think for a sec is there another potato on the menu? Apparently she wasn't awake yet either cause home fries DUH! That was something to laugh over during breakfast... I also shared the pancake of the day w my sis which was poppyseed w Meyer lemon and strawberries. 
Overall breakfast was ok MINUS the burnt to a crisp piece of home fry I received that was totally inedible. 
Would I wait in the line for this place? Big fat NO! Lots of other places to hit up before I come back. Food was standard.
author: Liz N.

description: Amazing brunch! The eggs Benedict with crab and avocado was incredibly delicious! The pancakes were large and fluffy. We had a brief wait for a table but it was well worth it. Can't wait to come back.
author: Hy H.

description: Visiting from the east coast and found this place as it is near golden gate park.  The food, atmosphere, and service are all top notch.  The funky European vibe was perfect.  We sat on the patio and the staff accommodated two little ones in our party.  Tres magnifique!  I ended the meal with a Cafe au lait and felt like I was in Paris.  Thanks to all for a really wonderful evening!
author: Kayla D.

description:
Finally crossed this one off the foodie bucket list and my goodness was it worth it. 

I love absolutely everything about Zazie. The rustic-cozy outdoor patio? Yes. The homey and cute Parisian bistro-esque interior? Yes. The epic brunch entrees that keep you craving for more? Yes.

I don't think it's possible to go wrong with anything over here (literally everything we had was amazing) but just in case, here is a list of my recommendations: 

1. Griddle Tasting Platter: This is such a good deal because you get to try gigantic pieces of the Challah Orange Glazed French Toast, the infamous Gingerbread Pancake and the classic Buttermilk Pancake. All three of them are unique, fluffy and thoroughly delicious - definitely a must order. 

2. Fontainbleau Egg Scramble: Oh sweet baby jesus, this will cause a yummy spasm in your tummy. The trio blend of portobellos, shitakes and porcinis take this scramble to new heights. And the truffles are perfectly complemented with some delicious spinach and fontina cheese. You simply HAVE to order this unless for some inexplicable reason, you have some unresolved beef with mushrooms. 

3. House Special Bacon and Avocado Omelet: This is the first time I've felt so healthy while gorging on bacon. The omelet tasted so organic and fresh that some disillusioned part of my brain was convinced that it's such a healthy entree. I mean, there are avocados, right??

4. House Special Pomegranate Mimosa: Zazie's mimosa menu is quite extensive so I'd highly recommend giving it a once over. We ordered the pomegranate mimosas are were more than pleased! They were deliciously fresh and contained quite a surplus of actual pomegranate pieces. 

Perhaps the only potential irksome tenet of Zazie is the infamously disgruntling wait that's almost always north of an hour. Weekends are awful. However, if you head here during the weekdays, perhaps on a light workday or when you have the day off, it's not bad at all. That's the trick. 

Happy Brunchin', Yelpers!
author: Priya S.

description: This place was crowded with lots of people waiting outside on a Saturday morning. La Mer was very good. Gingerbread pancakes were ok, nothing extraordinary. I recommend this place for weekend brunches, especially for excellent poached eggs!
author: Haein C.

description: 3.5 stars rounded up! Decided to try this place out on a Saturday morning. Luckily I snagged a table for two in the front so my boyfriend and I did not have to wait. We both ordered the La Mer with two eggs, two pieces of French toast Tahiti, and a latte. The highlight of the meal was definitely the hollandaise, but I thought $20 was a bit pricey for the poached eggs. I also enjoyed the French toast but I was way too bloated from my huge latte to finish it. I think zazie is a nice place to try out but there are other breakfast spots just as good, and for a lower price. Next time I do wanna come back for the dinner menu!
author: Michelle H.

description:
Food is good, service is OK.

We ate an early dinner there recently with some friends.  We were fortunate enough to eat on the back patio (very nice, well-heated), where there is more room than in the awkward main room.  

Several at the table raved about the vegetable soup.  My onion soup was good enough.  The burger was small and a little dry - not bad, but below par.  The selection of wine and beers was good, especially for a small, reasonably priced restaurant.

Service was not terrible, just annoying.  The waitress visited us rarely, but when she did she would run up and start talking loud and fast, no courtesy moment to let someone wrap up a sentence.  There was no enthusiasm, no warmth, just an exaggerated accent and an inexplicable rush - we were just about the only people there.

In many other cities Zazie would rate 4 stars.  If you're hungry and in the neighborhood you'll get a reasonable meal here.  But don't cross town for it.
author: L B.

description: Generally unimpressed with hyped up brunch places in the city, but Zazie's French Toast Tahiti was showstopper.  It also helped that we only had to wait 15 minutes!
author: Christine A.

description:
A big shout out to Courtney M, who found Zazie and "yelped" me about it... She was in charge of picking a dinner spot to meet up with a mutual friend visiting SF. Well done, m'lady!

Zazie is an unassuming little spot in Cole Valley (which I had never been to before) that will "wow" even the harshest critic. The inside is nothing to write home about, but the outdoor patio is what's up. It's quite large and extremely quaint. And you can dine out here anytime since they're well-equipped with heat lamps. We were almost *too* hot if you can believe it. 

The menu is comprised of traditional French fare, all of which sounded delicious. Sure, I was more than a little hungry and a few glasses of vino in before ordering. But I love French food regardless, so this was a special treat. I went with the trout and a side of mashed potatoes. They paired nicely (really, anything goes with potatoes IMHO) and I ate almost the entire thing. 

What really gives Zazie the full 5-star rating is the dessert. OMG, the dessert. Our table split some sort of chocolate creme brulee and lemon souffle. Still thinking about those tasty little concoctions. Could eat 'em anytime.

Also, our waitress was extremely nice, even when an extra guest who wasn't part of our reservation showed up and joined the table. She was extremely accommodating, had a wonderful sense of humor and didn't rush us out of there, even though we were the last table in the restaurant on a Sunday night. Props to her and the rest of the Zazie staff for being so nice. 

Have a GF coming to town this weekend and am thinking about taking her here for brunch since all the reviews for this place say brunch is also tasty. We'll find out, won't we?
author: Abby S.

description:
Zazie is kind of too popular.  I ordered the mix of both kinds of pancakes and french toast, along with some regular Zazie Mimosas.  The food was good, but the wait staff is pretty much just there to shove food down your throat and get you out the door so the next wave can come in.  The inside is very cramped, and the patio is small.

If they had a little more space this place would be five stars because they wouldn't have to be so focused on rotating people through the restaurant.

Brunch is top notch, but be prepared to wait 30 minutes to get a table.  You will likely also feel rushed and pressured to eat quickly.
author: Matt U.

description: We ate out on the patio.  Cool evening but the heaters kept us toasty.  Wonderful food and atmosphere.  Highly recommended.
author: Joseph P.

description: It's the first time we've been here.  The experience was worth the line.  We sat outside at the backyard, interacted with very friendly staff, got free mimosa for our anniversary and most importantly, the food was wonderful!  Waiting for the next opportunity already.
author: Revital G.

description: Definitely has that overrated vibe, but after living across the street from here for four years now, it really never disappoints. You have to get the lemon pancakes and the croque madam. I also really love their eggs Benedict. A secret is that, while brunch gets all the attention, their dinner menu is also totally great. Zazie is just one of those Cole Valley gems.
author: Maz A.

description:
Tried to relive my Parisian days coming to brunch here, and Zazie didn't disappoint.

First off - yes, it is incredibly crowded, you WILL wait for a table (especially if your party is greater than 2), and it's not cheap.
Second - parking takes a little time to find, but the area is mostly residential and should provide some heavenly free parking if you look long enough.
Third - Service is wonderful.
Fourth - Brunch is served all week! Hallelujah
Fifth - NO SUBSTITUTIONS (though I feel like allergies can do something for you if you might, you know, die)

Before I get carried away with counting off, let me just say that I loved the handful of Zazie experiences that I've had. I love the crowded ambiance (Just like Paris! Though this might not be intentional...) and the cute spiral staircase by the front door. It's not too loud so as to have to shout during a two person conversation, but really, how intimate a conversation do you expect to have with another guest a foot away from you?

Favorites that I recommend:
French Toast Tahiti ($11 for two pancakes) these caramelized bananas and walnuts are to die for.
All things eggs, because they poach and scramble a mean egg.

Thing that you may like, but I wasn't wowed:
Gingerbread pancakes; good, but not enough fruit (the lemon curd, etcetera) to balance it out.
The mimosas ($6/glass) are just so pricey considering the amount of bottomless mimosa spots in the city.

A solid four stars from me.
author: Colleen M.

description:
Yum! Get here early, because everyone is on to this amazing brunch spot. We got there 30 mins after they opened and there was already a wait. The wait is worth it! Whatever you get, make sure it comes with pancakes. Those pancakes...

Prices are reasonable, service is friendly, I will be back.
author: Kristin F.

description: Overall, it's a great spot for brunch. It's a small restaurant, but very cozy. I was a little confused on whether to take a seat or wait for some one to assist us. I recommend to just stand by the door and someone will greet you. The food was good and I enjoyed that we have a choice on how many pieces per dish. This allow me to add a few other sides dishes and taste the French toast and pancakes all in one visit. I visited on a Monday and waited about five minutes. I would recommend this to a friend. I love the location.
author: Edi G.

description:
I have to say I was very excited about this place given all the great reviews.  It was an ok experience, and I probably won't be backs gain. 

Pros: Ridiculously cute French themed cafe. 

The food is great! I got a custom omelet - salmon and red onion and capers.  Delish!  

They got my order wrong, but immediately fixed it with a short turnaround time and gave a discount on the wrong order. 

Cons:  Be willing to wait.  I went with a half hour wait, and it worked out great to go to Pete's a few doors down to get some tea and chat.  Apparently only waiting 30 minutes for a seat is great.  It can be as long as an hour and a half! 

Because of the volume of customers, there was a bit of a lag in service. 

It was a bit pricier than other cafes. 

It was frustrating to wait so long and have to wait a little longer to fix my order. 

Even though portions were decent, still left a bit hungry. 


Assessment:  Even though the food was great, not sure it's worth the wait and the more expensive food prices, or slower service due to the high volume of customers, though I'm thrilled to have the Zazie experience.  I would recommend everyone try it at least once- because the food really is great. Who knows you may disagree with me and keep on going back.  :)
author: L K.

description:
I got the Monaco poached eggs, and I had to interrupt my friend from talking to say "this is sooo good."  I think they butter the English muffin which is genius.  I also love not having to worry about tipping.  Let's just take care of our servers right!!

I'll be coming back next time I'm in SF!
author: Kelly H.

description:
Champagne bar, heavenly pancakes and crispy bacon. I couldn't ask for more and Zazie delivers it over the top. 
This place is definitely worth the wait and I appreciate their sign in system. The tables outside are first come first serve and great to swoop in on if there are only two of you.
author: Paige S.

description:
Hubby and I came here twice, first time was for dinner, not too impressive.  Second time was today for brunch.  I like the brunch a lot better.  I got the Florentine pouched egg with crispy home made potatoes.  Very flavorful!  I love for the fact that you can choose 1, 2 or 3 eggs.  Most other places come with two eggs, and were always too much for me.  One is the perfect portion for me plus a cup of butter squash soup, so yummy !!~

They are also one of the first restaurants in SF to start a no- tipping policy.  So, the price may seem high at first, but you don't have to worry about tipping, so that was nice.

I would definitely come back again for brunch.

BTW, we got seated right away, no line!!  But it was a rainy Friday morning, and the restaurant was full.
author: Lolipop W.

description:
Finally had the opportunity to try this place. Came early sun for brunch and got quick seats inside.  Patio was full, which is expected considering a rare sunny sf day. 
Started w a bowl of almond milk double Capp, which was tasty.  Got 1 la mer (crab meat, avocado eggs Benedict with salad and 1 lemon ricotta lemon curd pancake.   i appreciate the option of 1, 2, or 3 of the eggs and pancakes.  allows the indecisive to try it all.
Salad was nicely dressed... Not overly oily but a nice coating for flavor .  Eggs were poached nicely.  
Pancakes were soft and light.  Like the bits of lemon rind with each bite.
Side bacon was crispy and satisfied my pork eating buddy. 

Service was definitely very chill and relaxed.  No rush, calm, and cool.
author: Linda T.

description: I ordered the omlette du jour having seen photos here on yelp. I was dissappointed to only get a few slices of sausage in my omlette. The bread was just regular supermarket sliced bread and I didn't get any avocado. To top it off I had a hair in my omlette. They comped my meal which I appreciated but its still disgusting. For a place with so many great reviews I was very dissappointed.
author: Helen H.

description: Im never eating here. Called twice to check if theres no wait right now they said no wait and when i got there 5 min later the waiting list is more than half a page full! They shouldn't say no wait when theres a bunch of people waiting outside! Not even going to bother waiting. Other places have better service than that. Zero star if i can.
author: Potatoe Q.

description:
Taste: 4.5/5
Environment: 4/5
Value: 3.5/5
Service: 3.5/5

Overall, nice bistro and would like to try their dinner menu. A little pricy tho.
author: Angus L.

description: Pretty much everything you can want from a breakfast place.... Always a line waiting to open , cute and cozy inside ( and out) and yummy!!! The lemon ricotta pancakes( when available) are amazing!! But then there are the bread pudding pancakes or the gingerbread pancakes with lemon curd and pear.. Eggs Benedict in multiple ways , the divorcée is my favorite ( avocado bacon and cheese)  and you must order the mango mimosa to wash it all down! Feeling chilly? They have a deliciously creamy chai latte and is served in a bowl which makes it more fun and cozy to drink :) it's a perfect breakfast spot !!! Giving it 4 stars because I would like the prices a little cheaper but that's just me :)
author: Brianna L.

description:
Zazie bedazie!  Sunday morning brunch with my roomie!  Adventures in the city while the boys are away!  I love brunch so I searched Yelp and Zazie was really popular.  I also based it off where I wouldn't mind looking for parking.  Gotta stay away from the tourist spots!!  There were so many people waiting outside.  We put our name down and waited.  patiently.  They had 2 tables in the front that were first come first serve.  We watched while their food came out..  and got hungrier and hungrier...  We jumped on the next table that opened up in the front.  

Food was amazing!!!  I ordered the mocha and the mango mimosa.  I ordered the eggs benedict with crab.  I love that they give you the option to order 1, 2, or 3 eggs.  I know it's more worth your money to order more eggs but I can't finish it.  We also wanted to try some french toast so we ordered the tahiti french toast as well.  Both were delicious!  

I thought the service was great.  The guy calling people knew his regulars and started talking to them.  He knew which people were waiting next door and walked over and told them that their table was ready.  Our waiter was amazing and really friendly.  Zazie had such a warm feel to it.  It made me all happy just to be out on a Sunday for brunch.  Definitely a go to spot now.
author: Chrissie O.

description:
Everything about this place is great.  I love the staff, food, ambiance and location.  The wait for your table would be unbearable, if it weren't for Finnegan's Wake, next door.  Get warmed up with a Bloody Mary and before you know it, your table will be ready.  

But for the love of God, puppies and apple pie, please don't be a "lingerer".  The place is a busy restaurant, not an internet cafe.  Be mindful of others waiting for a table as well as the staff that earns a living from serving meals, so don't "make a day of it".
author: Ted T.

description:
We live less than a block from Zazie. They make great neighbors. 
I love their breakfast but the secret is their dinner is even better. We enjoy the patio often where our groups of 5 or 6 are accommodated with a quick call. The free corkage night is our friends group favorite. My favorite is the Mac and Cheese but anything on the menu is well worth the experience.
author: Sarah C.

description:
Cole Valley -- a thin slice of prime SF real estate chalk full of artsy, mom-and-pop style joints. As I hear it, biz owners in this particular neck of woods positively teem with community gusto, and not without reason. This neighborhood boasts some of the Bay's best places to nosh.

Among the throng is Zazie -- a real jewel on the Cole Valley bill. 

Zazie does brunch the way brunch wants to be done. With quality ingredients, finger-licking recipes & divine french flair. Oh and fancy, day-time drinking options. Because what is brunch, really, without booze in a flute glass?

Fancyface & I strolled into Zazie on a particularly sunny, friday afternoon with peckish stomachs in tow. We placed our names on the wait list outside, only to be escorted moments later to the last table in a full house. Awash with savory aromas and stylish SF patrons, we made our way past the scrumptious plates of early-afternoon goodness to our seats. 

The wine list featured a slew of fresh twists on the classic mimosa. I went with the Austriche -- an elderflower syrup & champagne  duo. **Crazy. Refreshing.** The subtle floral notes and slight citrus overtones of the syrup mingled perfectly with the familiar fizzy tang of bubbles. 

Next up, I ordered the Fontainebleau scrambled eggs with intentions of starting the day on the right foot ... & with portobellos, shiitakes, porcinis, spinach, and fontina cheese, I surely did. Then again, I've never met a shroom medley that I didn't like. The portion was perfect and came with a lightly dressed mixed greens salad. 

Fancyface ordered the La Mer. A poached egg breakfast with fresh hand picked dungeness crab, green onions, and haas avocados. Them eggs made their way into conversation at least two times later that day. The breakfast of champions by all accounts.

Our laid back lady server was well informed on the in's & out's of the menu and was able to recommend/confirm excellent choices. A minor finding in service might just be a lack of attention to Fancyface's empty coffee cup. In all fairness, they were closing the kitchen relatively soon and getting a lot of orders still in.

We'll definitely be back again to explore more of the brunch scene, try their lunch/dinner options & to snag a spot on their choice back patio ;)
author: Shirene N.

description: I loved the food and the atmosphere. We signed our name on the little list and waited for about 10 min. Parking was a little hassle but we found a spot a few blocks away. We sat down at this small table that felt crowded but the food was great. The potatoes that came with the Greek scramble were incredible, lots of garlic which I loved.
author: Brandon S.

description:
Great options; for most items you have the choice of 1/2/3 pieces or eggs. Love being able to mix and choose if I wanted to.

Standout dishes on this trip: Divorcee Benedicts & Gingerbread Pancakes.

Overall thoughts : solid brunch place, the wait wasn't TOO bad (but I already used to the SF brunch lines). Great outdoor seating in the back patio, perfect brunch spot on a warm September morning.
author: Stephanie K.

description:
Came here for brunch and like most/all brunch places in SF its small and busy.

I do like that they offer half portions here and tip is already included in the prices. I got the:
-Monaco: benedict with proschuitto. I love proschuitto so this was a yummy combo. The potatoes are super yummy here too.
-Tetian french toast: thought this was okay a bit too soggy for me
author: Phuong K.

description: We choose Zazie for our wedding based on Yelp's review and we were not disappointed at all. We planned everything in two weeks with Jen's precious advise. She and her staff are amazing. The food was delicious, what else?
author: Sophie F.

description: If I can, I would give zero star! Don't you dare to call someone a liar when you don't have any proof and YOU ARE WRONG. There was 4-5 tables ahead of us, so I went to use the restroom. My two other friends got seated during that time. The co-owner (with glasses) said to my friends, "don't lie. Not all of your parties are here. Your friend is not in the restroom". Not to question how can he tell if I am actually in the restroom or not, but this kind of customer service is NOT acceptable and Unprofessional! When we asked for hot water, he gave us attitude too and said, "what, you can't drink cold water". This is racism! Will never come back again! No matter how good the food is!
author: Mei Y.

description: Stopped at Zazie for brunch, my oh my was it fantastic in every way. There was a bit of a wait on a weekday morning, so I can only imagine the weekend wait, but its so worth it. The staff was so nice, we chose to eat in the garden in the back, it was so charming, tres French, I just loved, loved the atmosphere. The food was spectacular as well. Since it was brunch & I was on vaca I had a cocktail the Le Metro, so refreshing  ooh la la delish! Had the poached eggs Florentine, so very yummy. They come with potatos and they had roasted garlic in them I love roasted garlic!!!  The prices are reasonable and the portions generous. I will certainly come back again on my next visit, cant wait!!!
author: Karen R.

description:
This place is BOMB.

Came here on a Monday for brunch and got seated RIGHT AWAY. Service was exemplary and our server is always smiling taking my requests. 

My friend and I shared a mocha, the gingerbread pancake and the albert poached eggs.
