The words of sorry and argument from the curly haired French accented woman over whether she had asked us if we wanted any more water after they ran out of iced tea, all the while I was wondering why there was no water on the table were totally unacceptable. Not to mention, while I knew they had moved to a no tipping policy due to their employee arrangements, my ability to tip for service and quality was taken away from me and I much would have enjoyed expressing my displeasure through my ability to tip accordingly. I always, having been a server in my past, tipped very well when it was warranted. Tonight, it was not. Walking out unfulfilled on what was supposed to be a special evening left me irritated. Could I have chosen another restaurant? Absolutely. You as a restaurant only get one shot a year at New Year's Eve... it should be perfect. It should be orchestrated and made to be perfect. Perfection just doesn't happen. Was it perfect? No.  Was it close to perfect? No. How the hell can you "run out" of iced tea at 6pm on a major restaurant holiday and how can the food be suffering in quality including temperature and portion and no one notices or takes issue with that? Very disappointing.
author: David J.

description:
We waited a little less then an hour on a Sunday morning for party of 2. Good thing Peet's is just a few doors down, because we needed the caffeine pick me up from our weekend extravaganza's.

I heard this place was better then Mama's, but from what we tried, I'd still say that Mama's takes the cake on Zazie. Still, the food was good and the quaint setting has a lot of charm to it. We tried the Banana Walnut French toast which came with very thick slices of toast and this amazing walnut, cinnamonish-butter spread and topped with one small caramelized banana cut in half.

The special this morning was a bacon, cherry tomato and goat cheese omelette, that we added spinach to. It was delicious and was recommended by our waitress. Our coffee cups never went empty, and the food didn't take too long to arrive after we'd ordered either, so 5 stars for the service.
author: T P.

description:
pros: best service of my life, great vibes on the heated patio, reasonable wait time (if we call 20 minutes on a Wednesday morning reasonable),  no tipping because of sound labor practices paying their employees a decent wage plus benefit

cons: the highly recommended miracle pancakes (poppyseed with lemon curd) weren't very memorable the bathroom is so small that I literally bounced off the sink and every enclosing wall trying to stand up
author: Cailin H.

description:
This little french restaurant really is as good as it gets. We went for breakfast and ended up ordering lunch because looked so good. But Frankly EVERYTHING looked good, especially the hollandaise sauce!! We were there thought because we had hear about the "miracle pancakes" -made with stone ground cornmeal and topped with lemon curd and fresh strawberries- though so we got one to split. Our sandwiches were awesome -I got one of the specials my friend got the Brigitte- but the  pancake... OMG! SO GOOD! We will be going back just for the pancakes! 

Pros: 
The food is so good! Try the miracle pancakes!!! Lot's of organic and natural foods too!
The people were amazing. Everyone in the place was happy, friendly, and working hard.
NO TIPPING! That's right it says so on the menu! They pay their staff a living wage, give them full benefits, 401K the works.
Cute setting! The garden in the back is where I want to sit next time but the whole place is super cute. 

Cons: 
Space is tight. People are packed in here and that's no joke! So, be prepared to pretty much be sitting with strangers. Fortunately everyone is so happy to be their everyone we met was happy. 
The bathroom, there is one, and it is in a weird spot. When a line forms you literally have to stand outside and to get to the #1 spot (Sorry, I had too) in line you have to stand in a doorway which is weird because people are going in and out it. I finally just started opening the door for the staff because it was easier to work together then to get crushed by the door repeatedly. 
The price: OK that no tipping thing is awesome. BUT the way they afford to do that is by charging a little more. I felt like it just about broke even with what I would have paid anywhere else with tax and tip but maybe a little on the high side. 

So, GO, EAT, ENJOY!!!
author: Lisa L.

description:
BEST BRUNCH/BREAKFAST I'VE EVER HAD! 

Came here at around 10:30 and had to wait about half an hour for a table for 2. The food took awhile to come out, but it was too early to be too hungry anyway. I got the Albert and Miracle Pancake. I love how you can choose your portions! 1, 2, or 3! I chose 1 of each of mine. The Miracle Pancake was delicious! Albert was delicious as well. Its a eggs benedict with bacon and salsa mmmmm. And now, the star of the meal, the POTATOES! SO GOOD! Why? Because they put whole garlic cloves with them.. omg I love garlic! I just wish the wait wasn't so long so I can come at a later time. But nothing they can do about that.
author: Lina C.

description:
Food is 10 stars here. Always out of this world delicious. I've only had brunch here but have always enjoyed the sweet pancakes and flavorful omelettes. Love their mimosas along with the great glasses they're served in. Service has also been very friendly and nice. 

One star off because I tried booking a graduation dinner here and the lady who I emailed emailed back assuming it was brunch and was very stern and disregarding about "no reservations" well, maybe if you read your email correctly I was trying to give you a ton of business with a 20 person dinner reservation. Sad for you guys, work on your email etiquette! 

Pro tip: You will wait forever usually, and I've sadly never had the opportunity to eat on their back patio, but front outside tables are first come first serve so bring your table sniping aggressiveness!
author: Alexis T.

description: My favorite brunch place in sf. Great patio seating area, perfect for a sunny morning . Loved their drinks and eggs benedict.
author: Vasini G.

description: Loved our visit and the pierre noir, tahiti french toast was super good and our server was very friendly and great!
author: AnneJoy E.

description: Great spot for brunch! I got the magic mimosa which had Meyer lemon sorbet and mint in it. Delicious! I also got the gingerbread pancake, eggs, and sausage. The gingerbread pancake had lemon curd on top of it with a slice of pear. It was really tasty; however, a little too sweet for my liking. The service was really great and the waitresses were friendly. Overall a great experience.
author: Hana K.

description:
This used to be my favorite brunch place in SF. It was the place I'd take friends from out of town to eat at after fangirling over how awesome their potatoes were, how cute and cozy the atmosphere was, how much I loooooved their french toast. And, to be fair, it's all true, and I really wish I wasn't too proud to never go back.

Long story not really short, after scouring the internet for places to brunch at for my birthday, I decided on Zazie, long line be damned. I knew 12 people was a stretch, considering how small the restaurant is (even with the patio in the back), but I saw other Yelpers mention their large parties in past reviews. I called the restaurant to confirm they would be able to accommodate us at the set date and time and to find out how we could make the situation easier for them. The guy on the phone sounded very friendly and confident that they could take the party without any issues. 

As discussed over the phone, I showed up an hour early to put my name down and indicated what time my party would arrive so they would know what to expect. The outside was crowded as usual. About five minutes later, the host came out and loudly demanded to know who was in the party of 12. I walked up to him to quietly discuss it and, when he saw me, said (again, very loudly and rudely), "No, I can't do it. I just can't do it." I told him I spoke with someone days earlier about the situation and he cut me off with, "No. It doesn't matter who you spoke with. I can't do it." 

Aweeesoooome I've just been dissed in front of a crowd on my birthday.

After shutting me down and not giving me any options, I asked him what exactly he COULD do. He said he could break up the party into 2 tables, but we wouldn't be seated near each other nor at the same time (he wouldn't even look me in the face during this entire exchange). Uh, ok.. I settled on that for a moment. Then I frantically Yelped all the restaurants in the vicinity who took brunch reservations (not a whole lot, I'll tell you).. Luckily, Squat and Gobble on Haight was available, so, 10 minutes til birthday time, I called all my guests to inform them of the schedule changes. Half the people had just gotten off the bus or parked.

I understand 12 people is a lot, especially for a small place. But there needs to be some kind of policy or clearer communication within the restaurant to prevent these kinds of situations. I work in the restaurant industry and I've been a hostess in the past. I know things get stressful during rush hours, but being condescending and humiliating customers isn't going to make things any better. I can take angry and annoyed, but rude is instant Black Out List status.
author: Liz M.

description: Zadie really doesn't need another review but I just have to express how enjoyable my experience was. I was on a short trip to San Fran so I didn't have much time to explore different restaurants but I'm glad I was able to try Zazie. The wait wasn't bad at all but that might be cause I went on a slightly gloomy weekday. The food was yummy and their coffees are huge. I'd love to come back when I'm in the area again.
author: Susan L.

description:
My boyfriend and I are on a mission to hit all the top brunch places by neighborhood. Thus we trekked out to Cole Valley from North Beach and arrived at Zazie a little after 10 am, which we were strategically aiming for to avoid a wait. This was the way to go! Earlier will definitely help you avoid the wait if your party is small. We put our names down and I was afraid we were still going to wait a long time but our names got called about 5 to 10 minutes later. Success! 

Had the La Mer (eggs benedict with crab and avocado). Very delicious. My boyfriend had the Albert (eggs benedict with salsa, white cheddar, bacon) and he was also very happy. He ordered a side of the Tahitian French Toast, I ordered a side of the Diablo French Toast .. .DONT JUDGE US haha. The Diablo was a special, it was french toast + cherries and whipped mascarpone. It. was. awesome. Service was quick and friendly. I love when a restaurant lives up to its hype and I was pleased with Zazie!
author: Anna J.

description:
not sure i'd come back here. The food was good, but the 1.25 service fee per person? It's kinda odd to see that. I mean I get it if you want your workers to get 401k, health insurance but just roll that into the prices of the food. It's the first restaurant has done this and at first I thought it was a joke until the bill came. 

I would most likely try another place before coming back here.
author: Toby I.

description: We just had dinner and it was great! If you can, sit outside on their back patio. It's cute and a little less crowded than the dining room. The food was excellent! We started with a cheese plate, which featured the different cheeses, walnut levin, and figs which were hands-down the star of the appetizer! I had the summer corn cakes and BF got the lamb tangine. Both were delicious and had lots of flavor! Do yourself a favor and leave room for the cheesecake (goat cheese, creme fraiche, ginger crust, lemon curd and raspberry puree). So good! We've been here for brunch before and it was equally fantastic (just get there early). Definitely one of our favorites in the neighborhood!
author: Cara R.

description:
Great place to come to for brunch. Great variety of tasty food.

They have outdoor seating on the back patio (dogs not allowed) and a few tables at the front that are dog friendly. There is always a queue at this place at weekends so suggestion is to come early if you would like to try - unfortunately they do not take reservations.
author: Stephanie B.

description:
Poppyseed / sour cream pancakes with lemon curd and strawberries, seriously delicious. Side of potatoes came with whole roasted garlic cloves. Perfect. Mango mimosa was fresh and sweet. 
Sat outside in front to be part of the city waking up. Also visited the deck out back, very peaceful.
author: D R.

description: This is my boyfriend and I's FAVORITE, GO-TO place for breakfast. We always come super early at least 30 min before opening so that we are first in line and beat the ridiculous crowd.  But even if we had to wait it would definitely be worth it.  They have the best Benedicts we've ever had and we've tried them all.  The mushroom and the crab cake Benedict are my favorites. The gingerbread French toast is also AMAZING!! The lemon sauce they put on top can be a little too over powering so I just eat it with syrup.  We've also had the French toast which came piled with lots of fresh fruit! But if I were to choose between pancakes or French toast I would choose pancakes.  The creme brûlée oatmeal is also something I think everyone must try. Such a simple dish but soo delicious! I've never had anything like it before.  They also have pretty yummy cocktails and drinks.  I've had their alcoholic spritzer that was I think lavender flavored? And also a chai latte that came in a HUGE mug it was almost like a large soup bowl! Super generous. We are never disappointed and always leave with happy tummys
author: Linz C.

description: I've been here more than a handful of times now and each time have been lucky enough to come when there wasn't a line outside. That being said, I would totally wait 90+ minutes in line for this place, because their food is AMAZING!
author: John V.

description: We had to wait for 30 minutes but the wait was well worth it. The pancakes with the maple syrup are the best pancakes I've ever had.
author: Abhishek S.

description:
Something seriously went wrong with our brunch here. So excited to dine at this much talked about establishment off the beaten path, we were greatly disappointed in the food served.

The restaurant itself was no doubt charming, quaint, and had the appeal of a French cafe. The waiting time, also as expected, was lengthy as we waited slightly over an hour for a table. We were seated in the rear patio, which was a world removed from the crazy crowd of people in the front of the restaurant, as well as the hustle and bustle of the narrow interior of the restaurant. 

We ordered a variety of things to share:

- challah french toast with orange cinnamon batter: My standard benchmark for comparison is french toast. Zazie, what happened to your french toast!? The bread was so, so dry. Clearly looking like it hadn't been soaked in the egg batter, it was a huge disappointment to all of us at the table. We didn't even bother finishing one of our fav brunch dishes. Sad face.
 
- gingerbread pancakes with bosc pears and lemon curd: Quite the opposite to the challah french toast, the pancakes were loaded with flavor. The flapjacks themselves were well flavored with ginger, and the topping of lemon curd and pears provided the moistness needed for the dfish. A single pancake was gargantuan. Beware of portion sizes.
 
- Fontainbleau scramble with portobellos, shiitake, porcinis, spinach, fontina: Solid, but nothing special. I make the same scramble at home and it has a lot more flavor. Zazie needs something to set this dish apart from the ordinary. Sadly, I couldn't find that differentiating factor. 

As much as I really want to, I can't say that I'd bother coming back here for brunch given the meal we had in relation to the wait time. It simply wasn't worth waiting for. Friends suggest dinner here is a better option, so perhaps I may give it a shot at some point...
author: Mansi A.

description:
Great little find for us! We walked from Pacific... what a lovely little French Bistro.
The outdoor seating in the back was amazing, relaxing and romantic.
The food is off the hook good! I had a rabbit that was so tender! Mediterranean roasted vegetables plate rocks!
The chicken liver on toast was to die for! We will be back. So the above paragraph was one of my first times here, from here on is my updated review: Tonight I had the Mediterranean roasted vegetables again as an appetizer and then ordered the Cassoulet Paillet which is an incredible dish and perfect for a winter meal. It is comprised of white beans in a shallow broth with two types of sausage, then topped with an astounding crispy duck leg and hand cut larger breadcrumbs. My wife had a blue cheese dressed beet salad with an amazing trout for her dinner. I am telling you Zazie is such a cool and amazing place to eat. Very 'Country French'. Even though we arrived a bit early before they had opened, a very nice guy opened the door to tell us it would just be a few more minutes. Then he asked if we had reservations and what name it was under. When we only said our last name he without looking at a thing already knew who we were, and that we had requested the window table for four people. Even though it was just the two of us they reserved the table just for us! They have outdoor seating as well.. a few tables out front on the sidewalk and beautiful covered area in the back outside, which is great on warmer nights, or perfect for breakfast and brunch.

Amazing food, amazing ambience, amazing service!
author: Kirk M.

description:
Awesome cafe for brunch! I came with my brothers right when they opened in the morning so service was great because the waiter paid so much attention to us! 

I had the eggs Albert and the gingerbread pancakes. Both dishes were great! The egg Albert was a bit too big of a meal for me to finished.. But I definitely forced myself to eat everything because it was so good. 

The gingerbread pancake is a must try at this cafe! The pancakes are thick and lightly sweeten. You can taste the gingerbread flavors in the pancake, it was pretty prominent but I didn't have a problem with that! I couldn't finish the pancakes so took them home and got some pancakes for dinner! Mmmm!!
author: Nguyet T.

description:
Food: 5 stars
Portions: 4 stars

My sister recommended this place and man, let me tell you, my girls and I were glad we listened! There was a little wait, probably about 15 minutes or so at 9:45 am ish. 

There's actually a lot on the menu, too many for me to choose, but that's only because everything sounds so good!!! I forgot what my friends got, but they had poached eggs on them and they were soooo good! 
I definitely remember what I got! How can I forget the light, fluffy, slightly creamy lemon ricotta pancake* with a sweet raspberry sauce and the warm** gingery cinnamony gingerbread pancake with lemon curd and a poached pear on top providing that extra bit of moisture and sweetness to that single bite... Delicious! Neither of these needed syrup because they were already so good and moist! MOIST! Yes! The SARAH JANE FLIGHT, or whatever the sample of pancakes was called, was soooo good! No freakin' joke! It also came with a buttermilk pancake with butter. That one is not as special or anything out of the ordinary, but it was good too. I'd see if you could swap the buttermilk out for one of the other ones... All this, 3 delicious pancakes, was $13 and enough to fill me up! It's a little pricey and the pancakes weren't huge, maybe 5-6" in diameter, but they were oh so scrumptious (: happy day!!!

*Miracle pancakes
**not in temperature but a feeling, kind of like Thanskgiving!
***I think the pear was poached
author: Angie Y.

description: So over hyped. Not worth the wait or the money. The servers were nice, but the food was only mediocre and I could have made better food at home. I got the greece scramble, it was ok but again i could have easily made it at home and better. The potatoes tasted like frozen ones from the grocery store. My friend got one of the poached eggs, it supposably had avacado on it and when he got it there was literally one small slice on each. Overall will not be going back, maybe on a weekday when there is no wait it would be ok but not worth the hour wait.
author: Zoë C.

description:
Had dinner here at the newly renovated back patio the other day. Even though it was a classic cold and foggy San Francisco night, the patio was warm and cozy. We had the French Onion Soup (very good), the mussels (very good), some cooked fig dish (meh), and the steak (very good).

Overall it was a great experience. Nice setting, service, and food.
author: Alexander K.

description: Best brunch I've had in the city in a while. Cute place, friendly service, and amazing food. Worth the wait!
author: Hetal P.

description:
Some interesting facts:

1. Surprisingly vegetarian friendly.  My personal fave is the fountainbleau egg scramble (w/ portobello, shiitake and porcini mushrooms, spinach, fontina cheese).  Beware though, they do not kid around with the butter - but fortunately, don't overdo it.  Side of potatoes are always divine.  

2. The cream cheese coffee cake (often overlooked) is amazing! Get one to go.

3. The french toast will put you in a food coma, so plan nap time accordingly.  I highly recommend the Tahiti (w/ caramelized bananas and walnuts).  

4. You will wait for weekend brunch; at least 30-45 minutes. The good news is that it is well worth it, and that there are some interesting stores nearby to help you pass the time.  Two tables in the front patio are first come, first serve.  

5. And in honor of brunch traditions, I have to mention the fruit, granola and yogurt bowl.  Not the best I've had in the city, but definitely a tasty option nonetheless if you want to go for a lighter, healthier option.  

Happy Brunching!
author: Gev M.

description:
Ginger Pancakes!!

The food is great! I got the Beet Salad and it was deelicious! (To be honest, you really have to love beets to order this because it was an overwhelming amount of beets lol). The house fries were zesty! The fries are more like mini potato wedges, but they cook the garlic to perfection, you can actually eat it as a whole without getting that nasty garlic taste in your mouth! Ginger pancakes has just the right amount of sweetness. I personally do not have a sweet tooth but I thought the pancakes were soo yummy! There's definitely a wait but it shouldn't be too long. If you get there and no one is occupying the outside seats, go ahead and take it because its first come first serve! Good deal.
author: Lauren H.

description: First time going to Zazie. Had the best brunch with a friend. My friend got the pumpkin pancakes and La Mer poached eggs with house fries. I had the gingerbread pancake and the poached egg with salmon with salad. All great choices. Ambiance is really charming and warm. Will come back.
author: Yuva C.

description:
It was one of the top-rated brunch spots on yelp so I had to give it a try.  Overall, I was a little disappointed for how all the reviews were raving about this place.

Service: Great.  We put in our names and got coffee, and when we came back, they had already called us and our name was crossed out.  I talked to the host and he un-crossed out our names no questions asked.

Atmosphere: Great.  Love the back patio.

Food: Pretty mediocre.  We had the eggs benedict La Mar (with crab) and one of the scrambles.  Both dishes were a little cold.  The benedict was solid but nothing amazing, and the scramble may have been slightly overcooked.  The sides (home fries and wheat toast) were standard fare, nothing special.

The menu is pretty great because you can choose your portion size, but they do that thing where they charge you an extra $1.50 per item for employee healthcare benefits.  I do love that they treat their employees well, but I feel like doing that separate fee is just a way around not marking up the price of their food.  Why not lower your menu prices further and charge a separate fee for paying for rent of the restaurant space?  All businesses set prices by factoring in a number of input costs, and it seems a little disingenuous to pass on an input cost to the customer in the form of a "non-food fee". 

Anyway this place was A-OK, but nothing to write home about.
author: Max P.

description: My family and I were able to grab outside seating for brunch after about 30 minutes of waiting. The seating was a bit tight but they provided us with a corner table which had room for a high chair. In the outside seating area they had heat lamps and generously adjusted them by request to accommodate our comfort. The wait for our food wasn't very long considering they had a packed house with a line outside. I ordered the mexican scrambled eggs which were packed with large chunks if chorizo. The scrabbled eggs came with a side of roasted potatoes and garlic. Both the food and the service was excellent! This restaurant has a no tipping policy and instead provides their servers with a competitive benefits program. If you factor in not leaving a tip the prices are very reasonable,  depending on how generous of a tipper you usually are that is.
author: Joshua W.

description: For a place with 4 stars and so many yelp reviews, this meal was very underwhelming. $18 for a single poached egg with very little crab is way overpriced. The hyped pancakes were decent at best- mushy/ no texture. The best part of this meal...probably were the potatoes. The service was good, but for the price and wait this place is not worth it.
author: Frances W.

description:
My wife and I just finished brunch at Zazie's.  We chose to eat here for two simple reason's. 

1) it's our 21st Wedding Anniversary and wanted to spend the day doing things that make the must do list while visiting San Francisco.
2) Zazie's is the highest rated Breakfast and Brunch Restaurant  in San Francisco.  They proved this today with quality and service.  The prices are great considering gratuity is included.

Zazie's is a friendly and delightful place, and must do!

Most people say the wait is long, but worth it.  God must have blessed us, because we only waited 5 minutes. :-)

Thanks Jon for your service! 

From San Diego, Ca
author: David R.

description:
Can I give six stars? Seven? Ten? A hundred? Zazie deserves the maximum available stars in the universe. That is how good this place is. Not just good - amazing!

Zazie is my go to spot in the city when I want something that I know will be delicious with no chance of disappointment. If I want to impress someone - I take them to Zazie. Why? Because Zazie is consistently the one of the best restaurants I have ever been to. Tucked away in a side street next to the busy haight, you can notice it from afar by the huge amount of people waiting to eat there. All other restaurants are empty but Zazie is always bursting with life. 

Staff is super nice and treat you like you are special every single time. Atmosphere is lovely and romantic and the food is amazing. To the stars. Their eggs, the meats and fish, potatos, pancakes and their mimosas are guaranteed to blow your mind. Everything tastes great. And the prices are very affordable. Especially for this kind of a quality. 

If you haven't yet been to Zazie, go now. It's going to be a meal to remember.
author: Laima K.

description: I was traveling to San Fran for a few days and this brunch place has got to be the best in town - also the best I've had even with all the good brunch places in NYC. A group of us (4 people) lined up on a Saturday morning around 8:30 AM and there was a line forming already. It wasn't particularly long. Zazie has a great organized system where they have a sign up sheet posted on their storefront and when it gets close to 9AM (the time they open) they will post up the sheet. The outside seating is opened and is first come first serve. There is a separate sign in sheet for the backyard patio. When it turned 9 AM, they started calling people from the list and were seated. We sat by the entrance which was well lit. The MIRACLE PANCAKES is a must try. Honestly, the best pancakes I ever had. Poppyseed pancake mix with lemon curd on top with strawberries. It was so delicious. Their egg Benedict's were pretty good even though I am usually not a fan of the hollandaise sauce..but Zazie's did an amazing job! Definitely a must try if you are going to twin peaks the same day. It is not a far walk from Zazie's!
author: Vicki W.

description: Yum!  Just yum. Every time I come here it's spot on delicious. Perfectly poached eggs. I don't like sweets but I hear & have seen how amazing the ginger pancakes are. Next time I come here I'll bring a pancake lover so I can finally have a taste!
author: Kendra S.

description:
Zazie had great reviews when my friends and I were looking for a brunch place in San Francisco. We decided to try it out and we're really glad we did! 

The line was quite long, but the tables outside are first come first serve so we were fortunately able to sit down much quicker than intended. We ordered mango juice, cranberry juice, Monaco poached eggs and Un, deux, trois (One buttermilk pancake, two eggs, and three strips of bacon). 

The drinks were extremely small for their price.
However, the food was AMAZING. We finished it within 10 minutes.
The Monaco poached eggs are basically egg benedicts. It was so delicious! It is honestly one of the best egg benedicts I have eaten in my life. 
The un, deux, trois was very good as well! The pancake with eggs, bacon, and maple syrup tasted very good together. 

I would definitely visit here again.
I would actually say that I might visit San Francisco again because of this brunch place!
author: Catherine Y.

description: Reserved a table on open table and arrived only to be told they don't take reservations. Pathetic!
author: David B.

description:
So bummed! Our experience here was just mediocre.  We visit SF about 4 times a year and have never had a negative experience with any restaruant but I guess our luck just ran out!  

We chose to go on a friday morning because of the good reviews, maybe we just had high hopes? First of all, there was a small wait which is normally not a problem, except a guy showed up after us and asked for the manager.  The manager came out (who was also the host) and they had a whispered huddle...like we couldn't see them? and that party was seated before the rest of us.  Not cool.  

The bathroom is within 2 feet from the open kitchen window which I find pretty gross.  Also, our silverware AND glassware was dirty, like lipstick on the rim dirty.  The interior decor is hideous and our service was unfortunate and lacking.  We needed a coffee refill for over 10 min which pisses me off more than anything.
The food was fine.  I had the La Mer benedict.  It was properly cooked but I can't say it was anything special.  My husband had an omlette which filled with veggies.  

In a city with amazing food at every corner, I wouldn't recommend going out of your way to eat at Zazie.
author: Leland F.

description:
Excellent autumn french toast! The squash cubes were covered in a sweet glaze and went surprisingly well with it all. No real need for syrup; the toppings on this dish are plenty and sweet. Alas, they did run out of pumpkin pancakes by 1:30pm.
Protip: shortest wait ever (even none at all!) on Thanksgiving Day for brunch!! I love that so few people actually have parents living in SF; loads of parking and few waits for the people still lingering in the city.
author: Linus W.

description:
Met up with a group of girls and waited about an hour for our table.  The menu had the usual brunch fare, like benedicts, pancakes, and croque madame, but all with a variety of different twists and options.  For example, you could get cornmeal pancakes or gingerbread pancakes.  You could have your eggs with all sorts of different toppings, and you can choose between 1, 2, or 3 eggs.  I really appreciated that you could just get a 1-egg benedict!  Their salads are delicious too.  The service was excellent as well.

TLDR: Charming brunch spot in Cole Valley.
author: Carol L.

description: This place is absolutely charming! I started with a hot chocolate and it was huge! Pretty much the size of a soup bowl... But it was delicious! I ordered the weekend special because the waiter said it was one of his favorites, which was oatmeal pancakes topped with bananas and a little whip cream, they were amazinggg! Perfect amount of sweetness! I recommend trying their daily specials, it won't disappoint.
author: Francesca M.

description:
A long awaited visit to Zazie and I was not disappointed! Came here on a weekday for brunch..well more like a late lunch. Came just in time before their brunch/lunch hours were done. There was still a 10-15min wait, but I think that's pretty short considering. 

I got their french toast. Super yumm, a little on the sweet side, but that's sort of expected. My friend got one of their savory dishes (forget what), but it was good too. 

I will definitely be back!
author: Chris K.

description:
If you couldn't already tell, this is one of the best breakfast/brunch places in the city. Gotta get there early though, as the wait grows pretty quick...if you're able to go during a weekday, that may be better. 
They have a couple tables up front and also a patio in the back and you have to sign your name into the list posted on the window as they don't have a hostess up front.
Definitely have to check it out at least once!!
author: George M.

description: Finally, a brunch place that isn't overhyped! We got here right as it opened at 8am, so we avoided the crazy wait time. The Le Mer benedict was amazing, and I love the roasted garlic that comes with the home fries. The Tahini french toast was a total sugar rush (in a good way), and the gingerbread pancake was soft, fluffy, and had just the right amount of that gingery taste. Definitely planning on returning here sometime!
author: Kazu O.

description:
Zazie is great for a neighborhood eat, though I doubt it's worth hitching all the way out to Cole Valley if you don't live close to it, especially given how horrible parking is around cole valley.

The $25 3-course prix fixe is hard to beat. Their wine selection is great - had one of the best merlots I've ever had. The duck was cooked to perfection but I didn't really care for the slightly underdone potatoes that came with it.  Appetizers, desserts, and my friends' entrees (hanger steak, Poisson en Papillote) were all enjoyed by all.
author: Alice Z.

description:
Perhaps my cousin hyped it up too much before we went to eat here, but I was a little disappointed. Zazie is still amazing, but between the long wait and my high expectations, it's not good enough to warrant 5 stars.

Besides that, however, the service was great and the food was pretty darn amazing. Everyone in my party ordered some version of their poached eggs and they were all amazing. I loved my St. Trop - so delicious. We also ordered the mix of pancakes (Griddle Flight) and the French toast was perfect. The one that stands out the most in my head was the gingerbread pancake though - not my favorite one, but it had a really distinctive flavor. If you like gingerbread, it might be right up your alley.

Come here at least once for the hype when you have a free weekend. Not sure if I'd be willing to wait for 1.5+ hours again, but if I'm ever in the area again, I'd definitely stop by.
author: Trisha V.

description:
Zazie is super good! 
I have had breakfast, brunch, lunch, and dinner at Zazie, and I have to say that the breakfast/brunch entrees are the best!

Eggs Benedict HEAVEN! So many options for egg benedict, it's almost ridiculous. From crab to vegetarian, you name it! Also I love that you can add avocado to anything.

If you're feeling skinny, definitely try the challah bread french toast. Some of the best french toast I've ever had! The challah bread gives the toast the texture of dense cake, yet so soft and fluffy. 

***The breakfast potatoes (which I don't even care for potatoes) have whole cloves of roasted garlic in them !!! *** Fantastical.

Try to snag a seat on the patio at Zazie if it's a nice day out. Typical, cute French bistro style.
author: Alexandra C.

description:
Good food and environment. A bit expensive  but service included. 
Love the French soup, and the bread reminds me of Argentina.
author: Ines L.

description: Well worth the wait for brunch.  Always consistent.  I know.  I lived 2 blacks from the place for 3 years and would consistently eat here after an eventful Saturday night.  Fair price. Flavorful bistro food with an attentive staff.  Sure to be a staple of San Francisco for decades.
author: David S.

description:
TOTALLY worth the ONE HOUR long wait! lol

I've never had eggs benedicts this good. 

We ordered the crab egg benedicts. Wowzers. I think it's in their hollandaise sauce, or maybe it was the chunks of whole crab. Who knows? Dear...IT WAS AMAZING. 

We also ordered some bread pudding french toast--also AMAZING.

Service was great and we got the whole family at the outdoor back patio. Super cute. 

Must try of SF!
author: Jeanette K.

description:
Ohh, so amazing!! I came here with a friend who works at UCSF after one of my circus classes at the circus center and had such a hard time picking out what to eat! I finally decided on the mushroom scramble and also ordered one of their poppy seed sour cream pancakes. It was so delicious!

My mushroom scramble had three types of mushrooms so it was very rich in flavor and it also featured spinach and gruyere. The spinach was perfectly cooked and it had more bite to it because it wasn't super baby spinach. Everything was perfectly cooked. It came with a robust serving of salad and some toast, on which I spread their homemade raspberry jam.

The pancake was also soooooooo good. I can never make a sweet dish my complete meal, which is why I opted for just one. The cake itself was so light and fluffy, with just the right spring and the poppy seeds gave it a delightful crunch. The lemon curd and the strawberries on top just sent it over.

I would definitely come back again; it's now on my places to visit! Apparently there is also really nice out door seating in the back of the restaurant which I failed to find!
author: Christina K.

description:
What a magical, enchanted, secret garden of a back patio!! With heat lamps at every table and twinkling fairy lights and private little booths! 

Just based on that, I would already give this place 5 stars. And then the food and the service were amazing too, so congrats, you get 5+ stars :) 

We split a bunch of appetizers for the table, which were all delicious. I'll have to go back to try some of their entrees sometime. We got the cheese platter, roasted veggie platter, mac and cheese, and the kale with squash and parmesan. Loved them all. Our server was charming and silly and hilarious, and didn't rush us out when we were finished with our appetizers and just shooting the shit for a while. 

It's on the pricey side, but worth it for that patio experience. I will be back for sure!
author: Vanessa M.

description:
Great service
Great food options you can have a single, two, or three egg bennies -very easy to share
We got discount on our bill for using an app - super happy camper 
The wait wasn't too bad for 4 ppl on a Sunday (45mins they have a formula )
Overall good food, good service, and really nice outdoor patio in the back
author: T t.

description: this is probably our third time here. the food is excellent, but i think the portions got smaller?
author: Justin L.

description:
Uggh...brunch. Zazie for brunch is soooo brunch. Put your name on the list, walk around for an hour, wait some more...

The food is great, you read the reviews and see the pictures. 

It's a scene, a brunch scene. You're considering brunch, why not go all-in, right? That's what we said and it's safe to say we got what we expected. 

The poached egg dishes are the real deal, and I still deeply regret not getting that 3rd egg. I also wish I would have ordered some sausage. 

I would say "go there hungry", but it doesn't really matter. By the time you're seated you'll be hungry
author: Marcus C.

description:
I was really disappointed when I came here for breakfast.  I came just for the gingerbread pancakes...and I won't be coming back for them.

They were super dry and not very sweet.  However, if you do end up enjoying the pancakes, they are freakin' huge!

Too bad, I was really hoping for a delicious, stuff my face breakfast.
author: Ali B.

description:
Incredible breakfast spot!! I don't think I've ever felt so satisfied from a breakfast/brunch before. 

We started with mimosas which they have a substantial selection of different mixes of juice and champagne. I opted for the one with white peach sorbet and black currant juice. Omg this was probably the best mimosa I ever had. The sorbet floats on top giving a luscious light peachy flavor with champagne, as you get to the bottom the sweet black currant is a deeper and welcomed aspect opposite the peach. I am a mimosa lover I must confess and this was open of if not my most favorite mimosa so far, reminiscent of a Bellini but with much more provocative flavor.

My bf ordered the La Mer Benedict and I also ordered a Benedict but with grilled prawns and salad greens. Omg I finished my entire plate, rare for me since I am a light eater. We also tried the eggnog challah French toast which was especially decadent. 

Will be returning as soon as chance presents the opportunity.


Word of caution though, this place is small and has an intimate appeal which is favorable but also means this place gets packed fast and you will easily get stuck waiting for 30 mins or more, although it is worth it, try to come early and during the weekdays to avoid line an get better parking.
author: Nikki M.

description: I used to live nearby so I quickly learned to avoid this place on the weekends because of the 2 hour long waits... when I work from home during the week however, I rush over when it opens to enjoy their yummy breakfast food.
author: Wes D.

description: This place was really good and really cute. I ordered the French Toast Tahiti and a chia latte with almond milk. Both were pretty good. There is a bit of a wait on weekends and the service was a little slow but otherwise I would definitely go back or recommend to a friend.
author: Lauren G.

description:
Zazie might very well have the best brunch in San Francisco. The menu is so unique and the combinations are delicious! This is one of those places where you put your name on a list outside and wait an hour to be seated. However, it is WELL worth the wait.

I came here on my birthday a few months ago and we sent one person ahead of time to put our name on the list. We lucked out with a table on the back patio and had a lovely morning. 

Highlights:
1. GINGERBREAD PANCAKES
2. Cozy garden patio in the back
3. 8 varieties of mimosas
4. Can bring in your own coffee

Lowlights:
1. The the wait is usually quite long 
1A. That there isn't much to do around the area while you wait

Tip: Go with a close friend or group of friends that can keep up conversation for a while!
author: Ashley P.

description:
Had dinner with friends who are family. We had reservations do no problem getting a table mid week. 
For an appetizer our table of four shared the cheese plate. It was just right portions for the four. 
For entree The polenta with shrimp or chicken was fantastic. One person thought the polenta was a bit salty but it balanced well with the Gorgonzola cheese and greens on it. I had a cheese and mac side. The pasta shells were cooked correctly and it was really cheesy. 
The salmon in paper (poisson in papeote or whatever it is called in French) was definitely the best of the 4 excellent entrees. 
The wine list is varied and reasonable. 
We shared the bread pudding (ginger and orange) for dessert. It was wonderful with well firmed bread chunks, outstanding ice cream and a really nice taste.
author: Kay P.

description:
Best breakfast I've had in the US. And it's in a rather random part of town... Very unsuspecting.

I would suggest you try one selection from each part of the menu, especially if you are in a group of three or more. The various scrambled eggs, the oatmeal Brulé, the French toast, and the bread and jam are off the charts. They have organic pure maple syrup in, and each one of their other ingredients is pure excellence. This is the Tartine version of breakfast. Will not disappoint. Bacon is the only lake thing.
author: Tony A.

description:
I want to give them three stars but their quality in brunch and their mimosas won't let allow me to.

We arrived on Sunday for brunch, the busiest day for brunch businesses. My boyfriend and I put our names down on the list. One complaint would be the host, I forgot his name was but he was doing favors for his "special" customers. There were multiple parties that arrived after us, saw him... Hugged him... And I swear one blonde kissed his arse so hard (e.g. tugging on his arm, rubbing his arm, wrapping her arms around him) just to get the next table. And it worked. Please play fair. A pregnant woman and her party arrived before us and she still wasn't seated by the time my name was called up. (End rant)

The food and mimosas were phenomenal. I ordered the chorizo scramble and it hit the spot. The potatoes, so flavorful and the garlic smacks you in the face, and that's the best part! They had a ginger mimosa as a special and I love how the ginger lingers and tingles for a while. I couldn't stop at one glass, I had to get another.
author: Melissa T.

description: So here's the deal: this place has amazing lunches and dinners but the brunch is just not worth the wait. I don't get it.  It's just pretty good brunch foods--when you're looking at 45 minute waits and a crowd in the sun on Cole street you would think the food is incomparable.
author: D D.

description: Awesome homefries  Poached eggs with smoked salmon and capers are comparable to New York's. Long wait, but we were able to snag the front without signing up.
author: sandy a.

description: The food and service was well worth the wait.  A group of friends and I were visiting San Francisco on a girls weekend and decided to stop for brunch before heading home.  The wait was about a hour but the food and service were awsome.  I can't remember the name of my meal in French but it was the one, two, three.  It included one pancake, two eggs and 3 bacon.  The food didn't take long to come out and it was filling and delicious.  My friends all enjoyed their meal and raved about the Ricotta pancake with the lemon curd.  We will definitely be back!
author: Natasha O.

description:
Solid brunch place with interesting takes on traditional offerings. 

A friend and I shared gingerbread pancakes with lemon curd & a slice of pear,  poached eggs Florentine with spinach, portabello mushrooms, & their lemon hollandaise sauce, and an order of apple chicken sausage. I'm not going to lie, although I always crave eggs at breakfast, my main intention this time was to try the hollandaise. I was clearly expecting more. Unlike myself, I actually enjoyed the pancakes most (the lemon curd added a nice, tangy kick and complement to the sweetness). Portions are generous - we ordered one of each, and it was more than plenty.

Service was fantastic (especially the host juggling what felt like at least ~15-20 waiting couples/groups at any given moment like a machine). Yes, the line was absurdly long. I waited an hour this first time, arriving just shy of 11 a.m. (I didn't actually know this would be the case when I chose it nor when I arrived & had I not been waiting for friends anyway, I probably would have left.) Would I do it again? Probably, in a few moons, out of sheer curiosity, & with a few more Bay Area brunches under my belt for comparison.

If you're lucky, or alternatively, a creepy table lurker, the few tables outside are first come, first serve. Otherwise, bring a good book and/or entertaining friends.
author: Sushmita M.

description: I have been to this place a bunch of times already, but today was the first time for dinner. Other times have been for brunch, which they are really popular for. I'm a big fan of French food so my expectations were high and luckily Zazie didn't disappoint. Excellent food, also for the price, which is in the high end. Had my favourite desert, Creme Brûlée, and it was on point! Ill definitely recommend this place!
author: Nils S.

description: Wow. Amazing food, service, and brunch specials, as well as the environment and ambiance! We had perfectly cooked poached eggs, as well as creative craft mimosas and everything brunchy and delicious!! Must-go if you are in San Fran. Well worth the long wait.
author: Kimberlee O.

description:
Brunch at Zazie is one of my top 3 favorite things to do on a sunny Saturday, and is a delightful treat for guests who do not expect such a quaint and delicious experience in the middle of San Francisco. 

Ashamed to say, I first found Zazie by accident. During my first months in San Francisco, a friend and I were jonesing for a good Bloody Mary, and Yelp pointed us towards Finnegan's Wake in Cole Valley. Upon walking up to Finnegan's, the line underneath the adorable yellow awning at Zazie intrigued us. A quick glance at the menu and a peek into the cozy and elegant (and did I say cozy?) interior suggested we may have just found our new favorite brunch spot. 

"An hour wait?!" you ask? No problem. Put your name on the clipboard out front. (And yes, sitting out back IS worth the wait.) Then either note on the clipboard or tell Mario - the host of all hosts - that you are waiting "nextdoor" and head to the somehow-always-empty backyard of Finnegan's Wake. The Bloody Marys do not disappoint, AND there is a ping pong table in case the brunch drinks and morning-after-recounts don't keep you occupied. 

While I admit the anticipation of the Zazie brunch is half of the delight, the food has impressed every time. Friends have raved about the croque madame, the challah french toast, the la mer poached eggs, and the sandwich brigitte, among others. Go, sit, drink, sit some more, eat, and enjoy!
author: Julie B.

description:
Awesome spot to have dinner w/ friends or for a date.
Super patio w/ heating lamp - Get the salmon, it's really good!!
author: Guillaume M.

description: I started to write my name on the waitlist. I didn't even go inside the doors. Then the guy asks are you with your dog? And I replied yes. Then he proceeded to tell me, in the rudest tone ever , "if you want to eat with your dog first come first serve in the front". Of course I was going to eat outside, I was with my dog.
author: Leah P.

description: Cute brunch place. Wait is ridiculous. Food is seriously overpriced, like seriously! They said no tip, but felt like 35-40% tip was built in the food price, oh well. Food is ok. Ordered the 30+ dollars eggs Benedict, good amount of crab, the pouched eggs though, one is well done, one over cooked, another one barely passes as pouched.
author: Hilary L.

description:
I looooooove Zazie! Great service, delicious food, cute back patio area...what more can you ask for? The wait is generally long, but get there before they open to put your name at the top of the list and you should be fine.

Also, they don't have many vegan options, but still a good spot overall.
author: makenna n.

description: Delicious Bloody Marys. The wait is a little long sometimes but I usually snag a seat in the front where it's self seating
author: Lisa L.

description:
We went to dinner at Zazie on a Saturday night (we made a reservation a day in advance). I wasn't sure what to expect because most of the reviews were about brunch. 

Our experience was wonderful! We had a kind waitress who was attentive and made sure we were taken care of throughout our meal. We started with the cheese plate appetizer. I could eat this for dinner every night! I'm not a cheese extraordinaire, but can safely say that we sampled a brie, a mild blue cheese, and gouda. It came with thinly sliced, toasted walnut bread and fig spread with whole figs. 

For our meal, I had the Niman Ranch burger cooked medium rare with a homemade brioche bun and roasted golden potatoes. I added gorgonzola to the burger - it was perfectly cooked and delicious. My husband had the boeuf bourginon and it was also amazing. 

Would highly recommend for dinner! I want to go back on Tuesday when there's no corkage fee and/or Monday when you can bring your dog and sit on the patio (and get $10 off your meal!).
author: Ramsey M.

description:
The food isn't anything great.
The huge number of positive reviews for this cafe is misleading. (and the long lines and wait)
The food is severely overpriced for what you are served.
I ordered the Mediterranean roasted vegetable plate.
I don't know what I expected but for 14 bucks I didn't expected a bunch of mush that was microwaved, salty and oily. The plate was hot. 
I guess a lot of people are fine with the extra Employees benefits charge of $1.25 per customer, but it came as a surprise to me.
Overall, Not worth it at all. I can only imagine their eggs are the only fresh thing.
author: Nona T.

description: Tried their Scrambled Eggs New York style, French Toast Tahiti and Chocolate Chaud all of which were good. People say it's a little expensive brunch place but hey it's a 0 tip restaurant as they include the tips in the menu price. Be prepared to wait for some time to get in, we waited for about 30 mins even on a rainy Sunday!
author: Aritra G.

description:
I am in love! This is THE cutest brunch spot! Especially if you end up sitting in the back patio! I almost felt like I was in New York. There is many vines growing up along all the walls and it just felt so homey! Only downside for me was that I was wearing a pretty thick sweater and the sun just happened the beat down on me during the entire meal :(

Regardless, I still thoroughly enjoyed my time here! I came here on a Thursday for brunch and luckily only had to wait a few minutes to get a table for 3 in the back. I like that the menu isn't too large so you end up wasting so much time trying to decide what to order. 

For my meal, I started off with a mimosa featuring black currant and white peach sorbet (I forgot the name sorry!!). Mmm, it was pretty strong for someone on an empty stomach but so satisfying and sweet! As for food, I ordered the Un, Deux, Trois and substituted the regular buttermilk pancake for a lemon ricotta pancake! Such a great decision. The pancake had the perfect amount of tartness from the lemon and the ricotta made it extra fluffy and soft. It was quite a large pancake as well so it was perfect that there was only one piece. It also came with 2 eggs and 3 strips of delectable bacon!! I can almost smell this great meal just by writing this review...YUM! 

If I find myself in SF again, I will definitely want to pay Zazie a visit again so that I can leave with a greatly satisfied stomach :)
author: Katie H.

description:
I am so happy to have found this little gem in SF. I came here this past Saturday for brunch with my friends and the ambiance was fantastic, wait totally worth it (~15 mins), service great, and food exceptional. 

I ordered the Pierre Noir (1 egg poached with bacon and tomato provencales, served on an English muffin with lemon hollandaise and a salad). I ordered home fries to go with salad and the entire dish was perfect. How perfect? BEST POACHED EGG OF MY LIFE perfect. Yes, it needs all caps it's that mind- blowingly good. 

I also had one of their weekly specials which  was challah French toast with fresh vanilla whipped cream and poached cherries (off the hook amazing). It was much larger than I expected but so delicious and worked out great as I shared with my fiancé. Overall, all dining companions thought all their dishes and brunch cocktails were spot on. 

Also, as a note, portion size here was exactly right. I love that I can order one egg and one slice if French toast. 

Highly recommend. :)
author: Gabrielle D.

description: So delicious. I've eaten quite a bit of pancakes in my life but I am not joking when I say that the (lemon) Miracle Pancake is the best I've ever had! I think they change the flavor so get it while it lasts!!!!! It's miraculous.
author: Jasmin I.

description:
Another enjoyable lunch at Zazie! Conveniently located near UCSF, perfect café to go replenish yourself after a blood drawing! 

Sorry if I ruined your appetite.

I was tempted to order the ranch burger again since it was so good, but went with the "omelette du jour" with apple sausage, mushrooms, pesto, etc... while it was tasty, it was too oily for me (-1 star) but other than that the dish was great. Side salad and whole wheat toast and butter comes with it (or you can substitute the salad for home fries). There is jam and ketchup on the table for your condimental needs. Plus, organic coffee! 

Overall wonderful, quaint French café. It's good to come for a late lunch as they can get crowded at rush hour. Don't have anything bad to say about the service this time around.
author: Julia F.

description:
Fantastic eggs Fontainebleau: light, fluffy, and gently-seasoned. They were decidedly "French", and I enjoy saying "Fontainebleau". I liked all the crispy garlic cloves it came with (though I suspect my dining companion was less than enthused about my breath). 

The banana pecan French toast is worth talking about. Not overly sweet, but certainly approaching that territory. The banana was my favorite part of the whole shindig -- very bananas fostery.

I wasn't wowed by the gingerbread pancake - gingerbread taste was subtle and easily drowned out by the accompanying lemon curd (which had too much of an acidic bite for me). Leaving the cake unadorned tasted oddly dry, so I toughened up and ate the damn curd anyway. Not my favorite, but given how popular the pancake in question is, I think this is just my personal taste

As any of these reviews will tell you, the line is way long. I'd be willing to wait in it maybe twice a year for their toast.
author: Ryan D.

description:
Best french toast ever!!! 

Probably my second favorite bloody Mary anywhere!

The staff is uber friendly. Our server was willing to sell me the sauce on the frech toast or would try to see if they would sell me some. 

Must come back on a beautiful rare sunny San Francisco, day!
author: Amber D.

description:
Went here for my bday brunch and it was amazing! We did have to wait for 45 minutes for a table, but it was definitely worth it. The place is small, but it definitely has character. I wish the weather was nicer when we went so we could've soaked up the sun in the patio out back...more reason to stop by again!

Anyway, I ordered the "La Mer," which was a crab benedict that came with a side salad, and it was sooo good! Just order it and you'll know what I'm talking about! Wash it down with a mango mimosa like I did, and you're good to go! ;)
author: Fallon P.

description:
I would say 3.5 

It took us about 6 years from our initial attempt to conjure up the patience again to try a Zazie brunch. The first time 6 years ago, the wait for a table was incredibly long for a party of 4 and so we refused it and went somewhere else since we were starving. We figured now since we live close that we should have another go. This time for a party of two the wait was only 20 minutes.  

On nice days I highly recommend to wait for an outside seat in the back patio. I wished we requested one but we were hungry and didn't want to wait any longer than we needed to. 

We ordered the Italie scramble with potatoes and a wheat toast and an order of French toast with carmelized bananas. I washed it down with a small $9 mimosa that hardly tasted of champagne. Quite honestly food was good but nothing out of the ordinary and was quite run of the mill; definitely not worth the at times lengthy wait. I really don't get what the buzz is all about.

With so many brunch options in the city I don't think its worth the long line for it. At least we are nearby and didn't make a special trip for this. I see some folks made it out here from as far as San Jose and probably waited an hour or so before they were seated. Ugh, I can't imagine driving 1+ hour and waiting another 1+ hour to be seated and wait anywhere from 20-30 minutes for the food to arrive before you can start eating and the realizing it was just as good as their local hometown favorite. 

I would come back but perhaps for dinner when there's a shorter queue and more low key.
author: Esther A.

description:
In a word - overhyped.

The wait is insane at all times of the day all week long. I'm pretty baffled that a brunch place can have a 20 minute wait on a Tuesday. Certainly a quaint little cafe spot with a strong menu and good drinks for brunch. 

The food is good and definitely high quality, but it's not blow your socks off, life changing, pancake stuffed with bacon, sausage and gold dust good.
author: Milan T.

description:
The other day I had lunch at Zazie for the first time and it was absolutely delicious. The cuisine is Provençale, and I happened to be there with my French friend who said the chef "must really be French because this is very good and very typical." (I have no idea if the chef is actually French, but the stamp of approval from a real French person was enough for me.) 

I had roasted trout with tomatoes in a tasty broth topped with goat cheese. The sides were a simple salad and potatoes. My friend had the moules mariniere and she loved it. As others mentioned, it is very crowded so either go early, go on a weekday or be prepared for a little wait (it's worth it though). 

I will be back to try their dinner!
author: Gwyneth J.

description:
Came here for Sunday brunch and they were able to accommodate us even though our wait time pushed us over their closing time. The staff there were all very friendly and genuinely humorous. 
The cool part about Zazie is that you can order their poached egg/ (kind of like an egg benedict) or their french toast by pieces. This allowed me to taste the best of both worlds because I can order one piece of the poached egg and one slice of the french toast without having too much food or spending too much money. The price was beyond reasonable considering their quality of both food and service. I got the tahiti french toast, which was pretty amazing, and their florentine poached egg.
A side of potatoes was only $2; the portion was extremely generous.
The bloody mary was made with sake and is pretty popular. We also got the mango mimosa (called Sunshine), which was in my opinion the best tasting mimosa I've ever had.
Will definitely come back.
author: Vicky H.

description:
I've been here for dinner and brunch, both times with a pack of girls. The service is always nice and ambiance whether indoors or out, is delightful.

At dinner,  I liked the Provencal fish soup and its well balanced flavor. 

Brunch was even better. I had eggs benedict which were very good, cooked just right and the sauce wasn't too salty as I have frequently encountered elsewhere.  Also from tasting friends' plates the waffles and french toast were also great, light and fluffy.

Just a satisfying experience and not too pricey for what you get in portions, quality, service and ambiance. Waits are crazy for weekend brunches, but worth it andits in a nice at strolling area so its a great date spot or brunch with the girls or special occasion get together
author: Lauren K.

description:
Wondering where to dine on this beautiful Monday morning, we stumbled upon this quaint little French Bistro in the this quaint little Cole Valley neighborhood. 

Absolutely no line when we arrived at 9:00 this Monday morning and found parking directly in front of the restaurant!  It was truly meant to be. 

Ahhh... coffee.  We were in dire need of this magical liquid and we were promptly presented with it.  

Sipping the coffee and transporting myself to France with the help of the decor which consisted of brick walls and various French items, I was in European bliss. 

After scouring the regular menu, I then noticed the specials and quickly decided on the Eggs Divorce - Poached eggs with crispy bacon, avocados, and melted fontina and home fries http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/gqVl3RprESEqkIPeJH0yOg?userid=gHQ7f1swFlFU8LT2v8EWTQ.

The hubby ordered the Eggs en Fonte Grilled polenta cake with spinach, wild mushrooms, spicy tomato chevre sauce and two over easy eggs baked in a cast iron skillet with home fries http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/gqVl3RprESEqkIPeJH0yOg?select=vTmHjI2F2LfBqaxhBmkwYQ.

The Eggs Divorce was sheer happiness in my mouth, and their interpretation of my dear friend Eggs Benedict rocks!  

Ok, hubby didn't ask if I wanted to sample his dish.  He is quiet and looking quite content.  I can't take it anymore! So, I quickly stole a bite and was in polenta heaven.  The spicy tomato chevre sauce tied all of the components together into a heavenly explosion in my mouth!  I also thought the presentation of this dish was appropriate and quite homey with the cast iron skillet. 

I was truly impressed with this warm, calming bistro as I am sure everyone lining outside was as well. I tried to ignore the growing line as we finished the last of our lovely breakfast and savored the last drops of our coffee.  

Truly a gem in Cole Valley and all of SF!  Shhh... don't tell anyone else, l really don't want the line to be any longer the next time I am here. 

Food - 5 Stars
Service - 5 Stars
Ambiance - 5 Stars
author: Cathy S.

description:
Ugh this place is seriously good eats for brunch! Came here on a sat afternoon and what do you know... there's over an hour wait (just like every other really good food place in SF). But I don't go to SF as often as I should, so my friend and I end up putting our names down and start walking around in the rain to kill time. Ended up going to Cafe Reverie, which is a great place to kill time and they have killer Chai lattes but I digress...

I really like how this place separates out the food.... so for example... you can order one pancake, or two pancakes or three. Or you can order one french toast, two french toasts, or three... and you can even do it for the egg benedicts (they call them poached eggs)! Well the inner fatty in me came out and I ended up ordering all three. So I got a two pancakes of their season lemon ricotta pancakes... one french toast.. .and one of their bacon benedict with house potatoes. They were all amazing. Seriously if I go again... I'd probably do the same thing except maybe try the gingerbread pancakes (and maybe try to get more)! 

The one that made the biggest impact were the pancakes! It's one of those explosion of flavors you're like "wow... that was good..."... so yes they live up to their hype... and if you get a poached egg, then it cuts down the sweetness with some salty not that you really need it all that much but it makes quite a great combo. And the french toast was really good too... but the pancakes and poached eggs were that much better... even the friggen house potatoes were above average! Well cooked and great seasoning. 

The servers were really nice and it wasn't the most cramped place in SF but was nice and quaint. Def one of my favorite brunch places... 5/5... you won me over Zazie! So do I recommend? Absolutely!
author: Michael K.

description: Where do I start? Wow! Our brunch was as mind blowing as brunch at Prune, Gabrielle Hamilton's restaurant in the East Village in NY! Must haves- the Bloody Mary, the croque Madame, the stuffed pancakes, the eggs Benedict (la mer with fresh crab), I'm sure EVERYTHING is divine, we ate here 3 times this week. This is a no-tip restaurant, they pay living wages, with lots of benefits, and the staff seemed SO happy. The service was exceptional, the ambience is cheerful and warm, we can't say enough. Please eat here!
author: Ronaldo B.

description: Great place with lots of atmosphere. Excellent service and a good vibe. None of us took the Prix Fixe and we started off with the figs and goat cheese appetizer which was outstanding. I had the homemade pate which was served on delicious bread - normally I prefer my pate stand alone but again, this was very tasty. For the main we took the pork chops which were excellent and cooked to perfection. I had the French provencal fish soup which I can highly recommend. All this together with some good wine made for an enjoyable evening.
author: Thomas C K.

description:
I've been wanting to try this place for some time, but I've never had time on the weekends to wait along with the brunch rush. I took a day off from work and took my friend out to brunch. We got a table inside immediately and the server got us coffee while we viewed the menu. I had seen photos of the French Toast Tahiti and knew I wanted to try it. My friend ordered the La Mer. My French Toast was delicious! The carmelized bananas and walnuts added a nice flavor to the bread. I tried a small taste of the La Mer and the crab was perfect!

This place is so cute! Outdoor tables, inside tables and a patio in the back with more tables! My friend was so impressed with the food that she made an online reservation for dinner with her husband! I'm glad I finally tried Zazie. Next time I'll bring my dog and we'll sit outside and enjoy the morning sun! And, yes, I'll probably take another day off!
author: Allie L.

description: Lives up to the hype. One of the best Benedict's I ate. Pancakes were moist flavorful and not overtly sugary. Coffee was great as well not burnt/old tasting like at most places. Service was great as well. Would come again.
author: Ruby V.

description: Get the Divorcee eggs benedict! OMG best eggs benedict ever! (Although, my friend get more turned on by the salmon one... I will never understand that guy). I guess you can't really go wrong with their benedicty things.
author: Maryne G.

description:
The majority of the reviews that you'll read for Zazie will be about the brunch. Yes, the brunch is great. I live right around the corner, and have been to Zazie probably 15+ times in the past year, and only one time was it to go for brunch. The wait is really long for brunch, so we got there really early and the wait was non-existent. Read the other reviews if you want to hear what the brunch is like. This review is for Zazie's amazing DINNER!

Dinner at Zazie is a completely different experience from the crazy feeling that accompanies the brunch. At dinner, you really feel like you are being taken care of by the amazing staff. They take the time to talk to you and really get a sense of what kind of meal experience you are looking for that evening. The wine selection is good, and on Tuesday nights you can bring your own bottle with no-corkage fee. Amazing! The menu is seasonally based and rotates. You can always count on finding a delicious fish and steak option. My personal favorite is the lamb tagine. Their appetizers (go for the moules manieres) are really tasty, and the desserts are sinful. 

Dinner at Zazie is one of my favorite activities in my neighborhood. It's got such a great cozy vibe that is almost lost at brunch. Sure, you can't beat that eggs benedict and french toast, but try dinner. You won't be disappointed.
author: Kaitlyn N.

description: Ok, so this post is SUPER late and I really really apologize for not having written this sooner as I had promised the manager due to my wonderful experience at this food establishment.  The manager at the time (May 2015) was a Hispanic gentlemen with a name that started with an "M."  I apologize for not remembering but I want to say it was Manuel, or Mario or something.  Again, really sorry for forgetting.  BUT!  This general manager was incredibly sweet.  I was super hungry, by myself and arrived about 30-45 minutes before closing.  I believe it was 2pm, the morning of the Bay to Breakers race in SF.  He sat me immediately (because I was just one person) and they served me right away.  I appreciate the sense of urgency and also the service.  My servers name (I hope he is still there so that he gets a chance to read this review) was Patrice, and I will never forget it.  He was kind, attentive, friendly and all smiles while he took my order and continued to check up on me.  His recommendations were wonderful.  I had the 1/2 order of Crab Benedict from what I remember, and a half order of the Tahitian stuffed French Toast.  Pretty sure the benedict was able to be order as a half portion as well.  The side of the benedict with the potatoes, and whole cloves of garlic and cippolini onions was ABSOLUTELY DEE-LISH!  I thoroughly enjoyed these potatoes and have had no others potatoes quite like it before then or after visiting Zazie's!  Complements to the chef!  Whoever is the hiring manager here obviously seeks out talent with respect to all the positions of employment here.  This has become an SF brunch spot fav of mine and I thank you for existing guys.  Once again, thank you Mario? and also PATRICE!  You guys BOTH made my day with how sincere and genuine you were in your demeanor and mannerisms.  Much love!
author: The Grubbin' M.

description: Our four time here and everything is delicious, we are from oakland and we come all the to San francisco to eat breakfasth, its worth the wait...If your in the area come check it out!
author: Angelica J.

description: Excellent atmosphere and food. I got the coq au vin and it was delicious. The portions are just right, not too big. The fig appetizer is a must get. You can get three appetizers for $18. It might be worth it to just get the figs and musselss seperately because the sampler of three has smaller portions. Our waitress was adorable and had a french accent! She was very attentive. Would definitely go again. Eat outside on the patio!
author: Katie D.

description: There will inevitably be a wait for brunch at Zazie's on the weekend but its worth it! Line moves pretty quickly and if you can hold off for a table in the back garden it's even better. The food is consistently good, last time I got the Fontainbleau scrambled eggs with hash browns. The miracle pancakes are a must and great to share with the table.
author: Tracy S.

description: We had a great breakfast there, the home fries are delicious as well as the pancakes. First place I've been that doesn't allow tipping, I truly believe it made the service better
author: Pat P.

description:
It was Christmas Eve and my boyfriend and I found Zazie on yelp. From all the reviews and pictures fellow yelpers provided, we assumed that it was breakfast food served the whole day. Wish we researched a little more :(

But since we already sat down, we decided to stay anyway. We were seated in the heated outdoor patio, which is prettier out there, and thoroughly heated throughout the area. I ordered the Braised Niman Ranch Beef Shanks and my boyfriend, the Cassoulet Piallat (duck leg) both which our server recommended. 

The dinner roll were pretty good, but they only served one per person. I didn't ask if we can get another serving, but I should've since we were starving waiting for our food. Our dishes came and it looked delicious, my beef melted in my mouth and the sauce was to perfection. But I wish the food portions were bigger, for the price of $21~. I was fine, but I think my boyfriend was still hungry :(

Would definitely come back here to try their famous breakfast :)
author: Harriet W.

description:
I had brunch here and wow. I came here before, couldn't get a table for hours and ended up eating elsewhere. This time, though, I was ready to stick it out! We finally got seated after 2.5 hours (I was with a big party) crammed into a small side table.

Loved: the lavender mimosas and the eggs guillaume (prosciutto + asparagus with poached eggs).
author: Carleen W.

description:
Zazie is such a quaint little brunch place! It is small-ish, until you realize they also have outdoor patio seating in the back - which is where we were seated. I'm thankful for that, because the inside looked a little cramped! 

Here's what I got:
- Miracle Pancakes
- French Toast Tahiti 

You can choose how many pieces of french toast or pancakes you want (1 to 3). So I got one piece of the miracle pancakes and one of the french toast tahiti. My bill came out to be about ~$15 (including tip). 

Now, I feel like I should preface my review by saying that I usually am not a big fan of eating a sweet breakfast. I'm more of an eggs and bacon breakfast kind of gal... But for some reason, Zazie's pancakes and french toasts were calling my name. And boy, am I glad I listened! 

The miracle pancakes were the FLUFFIEST pancakes I had ever had. There were poppy seeds in the batter - who knew simply adding poppy seeds could make a pancake so delicious?! Also, there was a dollop of lemon curd and a handful of macerated strawberries sitting comfortably on top. THAT LEMON CURD. Oh. my. lord. That lemon  curd was so GOOD. I could eat it all day long... I would definitely order this again if I have a chance to come back again!!! 

The french toast tahiti was also quite good. It was stuffed with caramelized bananas and walnuts. There were also two slices of caramelized bananas on top. mmmm. I love bananas. However, my only complaint is that it was just a TAD too sweet for my taste. And I also felt like the bread was sometimes a little dry... But overall, still good!
author: Polly H.

description:
Because nothing in life is perfect...but everytime we come here it's near perfect.  Great food, great hosts...nice location. Just come a few minutes early to get your name on the list.

We come here from brunch btw.
author: Hoover A.

description:
Went here for Valentine's Day. I was initially quoted a wait time of about 1hr 20mins, but we got our table in just under half an hour. We went to Peet's next door for a coffee while we waited. 
We opted for the patio which was well made. My wife ordered the pancakes and eggs, I ordered the Fountianbleu with home fries. The pancakes and scrambles were very good. The home fries are flavorful. Our waiter was very enthusiastic and helpful with any questions we had. We were still working on our coffee during our meal so I didn't get a chance to try any of their drinks. 
I liked the fact that Zazie provides a living wage to all their employees so that they are not dependent on tips from possibly temperamental patrons. 
The only thing I didn't like is that they don't do substitutions in any of their dishes.
author: R B.

description:
I love their gingerbread pancake with lemon curd, poached pear and maple syrup. It's nicely spiced and the citrus of the curd goes so well with it.  Very fluffy too. The fried potatoes with chunks of roasted garlic are delicious...I've never eaten whole garlic by itself before. It's so delicious!  The cappuccino is just alright.

You can't make reservations. The wait was around 15 minutes. If you're in a big group it can be even longer. 

Crowded, but it's a charming, warm atmosphere. I like the Mucha inspired art inside.
author: Tes Y.

description: Great food done the right way!  The duck was super be with the great crispy skin and the tender, moist, rich meat was succulent perfection!
author: Curtis L.
