description: This restaurant was me and my wife's first date over 10 years ago and we continue to visit not just for nostalgia but there exquisite French bistro food. Whether it's Classic mussels or fish prepared just perfectly, all menu items are prepared with delicate care to traditional French preparation with fresh ingredients. A lovely outdoor seating area awaits on beautiful days and their brunch is worth the wait. Sometimes I think I can make a meal just if the warm popovers they serve alone.
author: David M.

description:
Zazie.. . Zazie. . Zazie. . I have been waiting to try you for a long, long, time & finally that day has passed and the reviews are ALL RIGHT (Well the good one's at least). Zazie is amazing. I like to take the tips into consideration especially if I am going to a restaurant for the first time. We went on a Saturday morning, which I highly recommend especially since we got there 10 minutes before it opened and were the 10th on the list to get seated. 

Once we got in, we were able to sit wherever it was available and were quickly greeted by our waitress who was kind and friendly. After much research we were all ready to order. I had the Monaco which is poached eggs, with proscuitto and tomato with house potatoes and my boyfriend had the French Toast of Tahiti. Both entrees were AMAZING! These two were both highly recommended and our fellow yelpers are right! These two are definitely the two entrees to try! The French Toast Tahiti; which is stuffed with caramelized bananas and walnuts and the poached egg Monaco with Zoe's proscuitto and tomatoes provencales. The French toast of tahiti isn't too sweet and has the right amount of everything. The Monaco's combination of proscuitto and tomatoes is to die for. The proscuitto is cut so thin that it isn't too salty! Also, if you decided to try something else that doesn't offer the House Potatoes, do yourself  a favor and order it on the side! It is yummmmy!

Can't wait to go back!
author: Chantal Noelle T.

description:
Heated patio, mussels, chicken liver and brandy paté, sparkling wine, local sustainable fish and "hot chocolate" cake with marshmallows for dessert.

Mondays are dog friendly - dogs get free treats and their owners get $10 off wine so I'm going back to Zazie tomorrow with my husband and our yorkie.
author: Elma C.

description:
Awesome place

Great and creative food... Fantastic attitude from staff every time

Wine list is so so, could use 1-2 more high end options 

Sit outside on the heated back patio... Way more space
author: Sunset W.

description:
To be brief: absolutely delicious brunch but a pain of a wait.

For the food, I ordered coffee, the Bloody Mary and two poached eggs Florentine.  Coffee was actually surprisingly good, thought it was going to be a basic cup of coffee but it was rich without much bitterness and good enough to drink black. The Bloody Mary was pretty standard, nothing remarkable but paired well with the eggs and home fries.  For the main, I've got to say I've never been a hug fan of hollandaise though it can be good on occasion.  This is the only time I've enjoyed it this much, the hollandaise was the best I've ever had. Eggs were poached beautify and the spinach and mushrooms were savory but not too heavy or rich. Overall, fantastic food.

For the wait, it was over an hour and we went on a rainy ugly day. I can't imagine how bad it would be when it was nice out. I'd recommend noting 'Finns' next to your name on the sign in sheet and going next door to Finnegan's Wake for a pre-brunch drink. Shortened it nicely for us.
author: Samantha G.

description:
Today we enjoyed breakfast / brunch at the patio in the back at around 10am. It was such a nice day to enjoy breakfast outside. the patio area is a nice hidden spot to enjoy the food. 

We ordered:
1. French toast with the bananas and walnut. Sorry I forgot the name but this is probably the best French toast I've ever tasted. I loved it. You can choose how many bread slices you want. two was plenty for us.

2. Omelet du jour: it had caramelized onions, bacon, wilted arugula, and feta goat cheese. it was okay. Interesting mix for a breakfast. I liked the first bite but each bite afterwards tasted a bit different each time. It came with toast and a salad or fries. 

You can order poached eggs like a Benedict and they charge different per how many eggs you want. I wanted to try this but the price for one already started at $10. 

Ambience and service: excellent. You walk pass the small kitchen to get to the back patio. It's cute and everyone is pretty nice.
author: Chelsey O.

description:
I love this place!! The atmosphere is so warm and the service is awesome. I went on a Saturday at 11am and the wait for two people was almost 20 minutes which was not bad. We ordered the gingerbread French toast, a side of home fries, and the pancake special of bread pudding pancakes with grilled banana and whipped cream. All the dishes were on par. The bread pudding pancakes were perfectly gooey and I loved the home fries as well. 
I've been here twice now and I would definitely recommend it to everyone!
author: Brianna L.

description:
On our last trip to San Francisco from Seattle, we decided to try Zazie based on its wonderful Yelp reviews. The menu looked pretty killer and both my boyfriend and I are suckers for a good benedict. We got there before opening and waited, then waited a little bit more (not nearly as bad as Portland!) as the host seated everyone quickly and systematically. I was impressed. We were seated back on the patio, which was gorgeous. They have heat and string lights, making it perfect for any season. We ordered a couple cups of coffee, a half order of the crab benedict, a gingerbread pancake, and a mini baguette. 

We received our coffee promptly and it was quite tasty. Then came the baguette. This is where things started to go downhill. The baguette was toasted (which the menu made no mention of) and that would have been just fine had it not been cold and almost stale by the time it arrived at the table. Okay, maybe it was a bad day for baguettes. It could be worse! Next up was the Dungeness Crab Benedict. This looked promising, but it too was disappointing. The crab was beyond minimal, the english muffin tasted like it had freezer-burn and the hollandaise was almost unpalatably sour. At this point, we just hoped the gingerbread pancake could salvage the breakfast. Unfortunately, it did not. It could have been good. It was not far from being good! As we got further into the pancake, it just became drier and drier. We left most of it behind. 

Maybe the kitchen was having an off day, I don't know. The only good thing about this visit was the service, which earned it the second star. The host was efficient and our waitress was very kind (although, she seemed distressed, as though perhaps we were not the only ones upset that morning). We won't be going back, though.
author: Lori P.

description: I came here on a thursday during brunch time and the wait time was roughly 30-40 minutes. You can choose to either sit at the bar, inside or outside. We were seated inside. Our waiter was absolutely fabulous. He gave us his recommendations and was very polite and patient with us. One thing that I really liked about Zazie is that you could choose whether you want 1,2, or 3 eggs in your Benedict. We got the Crab Benedict and the Salmon Benedict. Everyone always raves about the crab but I found it to be just alright. It didn't seem like anything out of the ordinary but the Salmon Benedict was delicious. I suppose I was expecting something magical from the magic mimosa (mint syrup & coconut sherbet) but I guess the name just sounds better than it tastes. The portions were a bit smaller than I expected especially for the price. I'd recommend this place when there's no wait.
author: Lauren C.

description:
Had a perfect Monday night at Zazie. We were a group of 6, celebrating a birthday. We lingered for 3-ish hours over wine, apps, mains, happy birthday-singing waiters, and the uber-delicious Baked Chocolat Chaud dessert... (what you'd get if s'mores and a soft gooey brownie got together and had a love child.) 

Great service. Our waitress was very friendly, engaging, attentive -- and her recommendations were on point. 

Loved the outdoor garden seating. With heat lamps, a warm & cozy atmosphere, and at least 7-10 unbelievably well-behaved dogs(!) -- Monday is bring-your-dog-to-dinner night for $10 off a bottle of wine.
author: Ihno L.

description:
Came here with a few friends for Sunday brunch. We arrived at around 12:30 and get seated by 1:15; not super terrible (although I guess it helped that we were expecting a long wait), and the area was nice enough to just hang around and talk.

I ordered the Monaco (proscuitto and tomato provencales) Poached Eggs (2 for $14) and we all ordered one Challah French Toast with fresh fruit ($6) to share. I thought the poached eggs were pretty good; nothing to really complain about, although I do wish the egg yolk was a little more runny rather than just soft. I only had a bite of the french toast, but thought it was decent too.

I did like the service though; everyone was really friendly, and despite the fact that they were continually busy, I felt like we were taken care of really well and never had to wait too long for food or to get a waiter to come by. The guy calling the names off the waiting list was also always present; even if he didn't have an empty table to fill, he still came out to direct people to the waiting list and make sure that everyone was aware of how the list worked.
author: Cynthia S.

description: Zazie had really good food, with an adorable back patio and great interior. They have a note on their menu saying that tips are unnecessary as they treat their employees well, (vacation time, benefits, etc.) which I thought was really cool. Minus one star for 2 reasons: 1) I went on a weekend for brunch and fail to believe any food can really be worth a 1.5-3 hour wait. If you don't go on a weekend, it's most likely a lovely experience. 2) The brunch cocktails were disappointing. I went with 2 other people and no one's cocktail was above a 6/10. Would go back, just never again on a weekend.
author: Amy S.

description:
Holy mother of god, that wait is ridiculous. However, the La Mer poached eggs were totally worth the wait. I liked that you can pick the number of eggs you want. 

The resto is a little too busy for my tastes but the food is excellent.  Do go.
author: Mona M.

description:
Yea this place is yummy, but pricey, and I've never had anything here that was mind-blowing or anything. I've only been for brunch.

The best part about this place, the reason why I'm always stoked to have brunch here, is that you can spend your 1-1.5 hour wait in the bar next door drinking the best bloody mary in town and they'll come get you when your table is ready. I mean if you go out to brunch anywhere especially yummy on a weekend in SF, you're going to have to wait at least that long typically. Why not ease the pain (And your hangover)? That alone justifies the price. Location, location, location.

I recommend the crab cake or salmon benedict. The tuna sandwich is also pretty yummy. If you and a few people in your party want a mimosa, don't order individually, get a bottle and share.
author: Sarah W.

description: We looked everywhere for a nice brunch place and finally found this one. It's a very cute little French place with back seating. It's somewhat hippie but is perfect for Sunday brunch. The food was delicious with a taste of organic and freshness. I highly recommend this place for a nice tasty brunch that gives a relaxing European feel.
author: Doan T.

description:
Came here on a Tuesday afternoon and there wasn't much of a wait- maybe 10 minutes or so. We also scored a sweet parking spot! WOOT!

Anywho, got seated outside- AWESOME! It was a perfect SF day and got to soak in the sun. 

Me and my sis started off with lattes. Hers hot, mines iced with soy. Delish. I got the Eggs Divorce with mixed greens. MmM! I love me some bacon! It was crispy and did not get soggy from the hollandaise sauce. My sis got the French Toast with fruit coulie. Delish as well. Mom got an egg skillet. It was great veggie dish!!

Overall, the service was kinda spotty- slow because we were seated outside....BUT! the food was great and I loved the atmosphere.
author: Angela D.

description:
Honestly, one of my favorite spots in the city.. I come up with any excuse to come here for brunch. I love the decor and if it's warm enough I definitely recommend sitting otuside. The owner is super nice and knows everyone from the neighborhood, which is helpful if you want them to overlook the fact that you cheated with that whole line thing and went home during the wait. 
Their poached eggs are all amazing, but I personally always get the eggs divorce. Also, my family loves their miracle pancakes. But if you aren't in a breakfast mood, the Croque Monsieur is pretty darn good.
author: Rachel E.

description:
Let me start by saying that if you come here on a weekend, expect to wait at least an hour to get seated.  Our party of 6 waited 1.5 hours, but oh my gosh, this place is sooooo good!   Well worth the wait, but next time I think I'll go earlier.  

I had a the poached eggs Monaco-style (with prosciutto and provencal tomatoes), and they were absolutely delicious.  This dish was similar to an Eggs Benedict. The Hollandaise sauce was the perfect viscosity, and the poached eggs weren't too runny or too hard.  It was so perfectly poached, it was so easy to eat this dish.  It came with home fries too (much like skillet potatoes).  I also had a Bloody Mary, which also tasted good.  Not too spicy, and like everything else here...perfect.  I had a taster of my friend's French Toast Tahiti, and that was also SUPER tasty.  The right about of fluffiness and sweetness in one.  

The restaurant is pretty small (hence the long wait), but the food is unbeatable.   The service is pretty good too.  Fair priced and totally worth it!  I would totally recommend you come here if you're in town.  Otherwise, you're missing out!

On a side note, they do charge $1.25 per person on each bill to be able to contribute to employee benefits and medicals plans.  Just an FYI for those of you who don't like to up-charged for things not related to your meal.
author: Diane V.

description: This is for sure one of the best breakfast places in San Francisco. I have always seen the super long line up on the weekends starting at 8:30 AM when they open. That's why we always go early on the weekdays and enjoy their great food without the hassle of waiting for hours to get in.  The ambiance is really cute and cozy. My favorite dish is their Florentine eggs benedict which comes with mushrooms and spinach, and of course crispy hot potatoes with garlic cloves. The garlics are incredibly tasty! Their coffee is always strong and great to have it filled up.  There is a reason for this place being so popular, and its their amazing service, homey ambiance and incredible food!
author: David L.

description:
Dazzled.

First by our extremely friendly and personable server. Best dish of the night might have been the hot water to mix with my cold remedy packet. Thank you.

Next by the rolls of bread and the accompanying beet salad. Latter had an impressive amount of beets, former was an indelible combo of warmth and taste.

Then by our fish soup, braised chicken with fettuccine and kale with squash on the side mains. Both were rich and satisfying and full of flavor. 

Last but not least by the "signature" baked hot chocolate topped with the most impressive layer of marshmallows ever seen. Soon it was enthusiastically eaten.

Brick walls and eclectic art gave the space plenty of character. Cost of about $40/person also gave it plenty of value.

Delicious.
author: Jason B.

description:
Where my girls and I can come enjoy good food and talk girl talk. 

FOOD: I had the sorbet black currant mimosa which tasted like a dessert for adults. Sweet, savory and seductive with the bubbles that follow. Then I had myself a portobello mushroom and andouille sausage omelette. Very flavorful and really good portions. It came with a side of toast and roasted potatoes-not burnt! 

SERVICE: There was a long wait for brunch, however the guy who took are name was very fast when seating the customers. The service here are extremely fun! Our waitress joked with us as well as gave her truthful opinion on what to eat. Love the honestly. Very attentive when it came to refilling drinks/bread/condiments etc. A+ on this service. 

PRICE: The drinks are a bit pricier than the food. Your brunch food would cost between $8-$15. For the atmosphere that it brings, I think it's worth the money. 

OVERALL: Really good spot to play catch up with friends. Both breakfast and dinner! They have a really decorative courtyard if you want to choose to sit outside. I recommend this restaurant to all my friends. 5/5 for sure.
author: Isabel N.

description:
Came here twice on a recent trip, once for dinner and once for brunch. We love discovering these places tucked away in these neighborhoods (thanks Stanley). Wish SoCal had more of the same. 

The memorable - awesome French onion soup, mac & cheese (kids loved also), chicken liver pate, and a charming back patio. They have a great prix fixe 3 course dinner for $23, a great value. The gingerbread pancake did not sound appetizing to me but way exceeded my expectation. The lemon curd on top was a great compliment.
author: Pete F.

description:
Awesome new reservation system!!! Just punch in your name, party size, and seating preference on the touch screen system hanging at the front door and you're added to the waiting list. You can also add your phone number and track the waiting list on your phone! Genius!!! 

The food at Zazie is consistently good. Went for brunch this morning and the Mexican and Fountainbleau scrambles were delicious. I love their potatoes, and their mimosas are absolutely tasty. The back patio is great to eat at, but this morning the heat lamps were on full blast and it was sweltering back there! We finally got a server to turn one off, but the heat from the other lamps was simply unbearable! Not a fan of sweating and eating!
author: Vicente G.

description: The pouched eggs and gingerbread pancakes are amazing! But, the pancakes are really big so 1-2 will probably be enough for brunch.
author: Ricardo C.

description:
Every dish here was just yummy yummy yummy!  I'm definitely coming back!  
I had their:
1)  Pinkie's Challah French Toast - One of the best french toasts I've had
2) Soup du Jour -  It changes and made fresh each day.  I forgot what the soup of the day was but I have to say it was a bit salty but really yummy
3) Fontainbleau Scrambled Eggs - The taste is out of this world!!
4) (ordered togo) Bagel with cream cheese, basil, and tomatoes  - Ate it the next day and was still delicious!! 
5) (ordered togo) Zazie's Niman Ranch Burger - My boyfriend really enjoyed it
author: Paige L.

description:
LOVE THIS PLACE! Found this place via 7x7's 2010 Big Eat List. 

Came here on a Friday during lunch time and found that there was still a wait to sit in the back patio area. Since the boy and I were super hungry, we decided we couldn't wait, so we were seated promptly inside. The decor inside of Zazie is super chic. Zazie is filled with french posters, there is also cute little loft - not for customer use though. But it's still cute. =) 

The boy ordered a B.L.T. sandwich, and I ordered an Egg ________ (insert a french word, I couldn't pronounce). They were both delicious. LOVE LOVE LOVE LOVE LOVE! The boy allowed me to have some of his B.L.T., and it was super yummy. My egg dish was BOMB! I wish i had ordered one more egg. (Two instead of three). 

Cute brunch place. I'll be back with friends, and when I'm 21 to try all their mimosas. NOM!
author: Stephanie W.

description:
I almost gave this place 5 stars. It was Thursday around noon and the wait was not too bad. We were sat in a nice little corner and Katie was our server. When the food came out it looked great and tasted great. 1 Gingerbread pancake and 1 Tahiti French toast. My friend got the divorceé poached eggs.  All very delicious! But then as I got closer to finishing my French toast my friend notices a piece of crab in the bottom. Disgusting. It smelled very fishy too.  At that point I couldn't eat anymore. Minus 1 star. 

Katie came over and checked on us in what seemed like forever as we waited for the bill. I mentioned about the crab and she says, "Are you okay with that?" Im my mind...Seriously!? Fishy seafood in French toast. No thanks. She wanted to make sure I wasn't allergic. Ok thanks I guess. Not smiling.  I gave her a chance to redeem the star I took off from the kitchen staff error thinking she would remove that from the bill, but to my dismay I was charged for spongebob square toast from under the sea. Tsk tsk. Minus 1 star again. 

Loved the food and presentation but thought that could've been handled better. If I should have been more vocal about it, fine. Blame me, but I think it's just good customer service if you want them to recommend your place.
author: Tyrone C.

description:
Came here july 3rd and got lucky with no wait. i usually see a long line which is never appealing for me. 

the service here was really slow but clearly the waiter was going as fast as he could

I got the la mer which was alrite but i've definitely had better in the city. also, there's no one someone would get just one egg and two eggs is priced at $19 which i think is a bit high. 

my friend got the scramble with mushrooms which were good but needed more flavoring

we sat in the patio and the tables are just way too close to each other. i felt like i was part of the argument the couple next to us was having during brunch

all in all, i think this place is overrated
author: Janet Y.

description:
Awww man, I'm so disappointed. Based on hearsay, I was super excited to titillate my taste buds with Zazie's hyped up fare. Unfortunately, not much titillation went down...at least not enough to warrant tackling the weekend crowd. 

As a note to the weary, this place is a battle-zone on weekends...yes a BATTLE-ZONE. Consequently, I was banking on an opportune weekday to present itself before attempting to venture here. And that opportune weekday finally appeared in the form of a rainy Tuesday afternoon. When my friend and I arrived around 1pm,  parking was surprisingly easy and wait-time for a table was zilch. Score! 

One neat thing about Zazie is that the menu caters to varying levels of gluttony as the french toast, egg, and pancake dishes can be ordered in portion sizes of 1-3 pieces. After perusing the options, we decided to split 1 French Toast Tahiti, 2 Gingerbread Pancakes, and a Croque Monsieur sandwich.

Out of what we ordered, the French Toast Tahiti was top-notch and definitely my favorite dish of the meal. It's too bad we only got one piece! The combination of challah stuffed with caramelized bananas and walnuts was simply divine. However, after the French Toast Tahiti, the meal took a turn for the worse. Next up were the Gingerbread Pancakes with pears and lemon curd. And while it was a pretty solid dish, it wasn't anything to rave about. I expected the ginger flavor to be a little more prevalent. Finally, the Croque Monsieur was the last dish to be served, and it was also the worst. It just wasn't on par with Croque Monsieurs I've had at other establishments. The gruyere baked on top tasted off, and the bread was over-cooked. 

Additionally, while the service was definitely friendly, it was a little questionable for the following reasons: 
1) The waitress was constantly getting people's orders mixed up.
2) Same waitress was thumbing people's lattes. 
3) Same waitress dropped a steak knife that was centimeters from slicing my ankle during it's fall to the floor. 

Humm...is this the same Zazie that everybody is raving about? I'm thinking I just came on an off-day since there are 1,000+ people out there who would disagree with my assessment. Guess I'll have to wait for the next opportune weekday to roll around so I can come back and re-deliberate. Their Egg's Benedict is on SF's 7x7, so I plan on trying that next! 3.5 stars for now.
author: Natasha H.

description:
With the number of existing reviews it would be hard to go wrong. 

Breakfast was delicious. 
We sampled gingerbread pancakes, miracle cornmeal pancakes, French toast Tahiti, and home fries. Everything was delicious and portions were generous.

The service was friendly and quick. 

Would return again and try sitting on the patio.
author: Miharu Y.

description:
I went here for brunch and lunch. The first time I came I ordered the French Toast Tahiti with two pieces. You get very thick egg covered toast covered in caramelized bananas and walnuts. It was very good. The second time I ordered the Zazie burger. The burger was nice and juicy even though it was slightly overcooked when I ordered medium. The potatoes were flavorful but the whole garlic cloves were a little much.

Come here on a weekday if you want to avoid the crowds on the weekend. The seating outside in the back is very nice. Service is a little on the slow side.
author: Alexander L.

description:
Here is why I LOVE Zazie. First, it is a quintessential SF brunch place. Tiny hole in the wall where a great mix if people come to gather around a hearty plate of eggs. 

The coffee drinks are served in gigantic bowls, which, while somewhat inconvenient, it is totally awesome and really makes you feel like you're in a boutique cafe in France. If I were to know what that was like.

Get the gingerbread pancake and use it as a brunch appetizer. You won't regret it. And then you can fully indulge in the more savory menus items without shame. In fact everything is sold in ones, twos, and threes, so you can do your eggs and sweets to boot! If they're out of French toast that day, which happens because its amazing, there's plenty to choose from but you must come back. The French Toast Tahiti is on my list of death row meals. 

My best recommendation for Zazie though, come on either a crappy foggy day to avoid the bulk of the crowds or come on a beautify sunny day and wait for the outside table which is first come first served. Either way, be prepared for one of the best brunches of your life.
author: C. Nikole S.

description: Zazie was our final taste of local flavor before leaving the city.  We went based on Yelp reviews, and what a treasure we found.  Nestled in the Cole Valley neighborhood, this place is a gem.  Don't be deterred by a long line...totally worth the wait!  We tried several selections, all of which were perfect. Don't miss the pumpkin spice pancakes, banana walnut French toast, or the terrific home fries!  A little slice of French Food heaven!!
author: Barb S.

description:
My favorite brunch resto!  Everything from the french onion soup to the proscuitto benedict (with that crazy delicious roasted tomato), to the fluffiest pancakes in the world...it all makes up to the perfect brunch!

Street parking often difficult. Wait times usually too long.  STILL worth it :)
author: Ames L.

description: The miracle pancakes are indeed tasty. However, one star off because the second pancake is not cooked enough and is soggy. Another star off because they don't even bother to fix the bathroom door. Only one bathroom, and people would try to yang the door open while you are on the toilet seat. Not appropriate and not classy for such a popular restaurant.
author: Xixi C.

description: This place is absolutely amazing! Delicious food and decor. Staffs are really friendly. There is of course a line since this place is so popular. I would put your name on the list and WAIT cause you won't be disappointed. I want to come back and try all their menu. They say "pictures are a thousand words" but it still doesn't justified til you taste it.
author: Tu N.

description:
Zazie is one of those neighborhood favorites. Any weekend morning you will see a cluster of folks awaiting their eggs and alcohol. Their brunch is good, but because it is so busy, service is sacrificed. 

A better idea...is to go for dinner, anytime. The food is even better, the service is stellar and it is not as crowded. Also, a highlight upon entering the restaurant at night is Suhail, the maitre'd. He is a model maitre'd; being both warm and welcoming in a genuine and unique way that makes you feel special, where most hosts are lazy and just say the same thing to everyone. Go for dinner, it is much better.

Side note: once you learn about the owner and her business practices with managing her staff, you will be a regular at this restaurant.
author: Jenn D.

description:
Zazie is a wonderful start to the day with breakfast that'll make you start feeling good right away. The first thing that caught my eye was their restaurant values: supporting the staff to be successful by including built in prices that include gratuity so no actual tips are part of the equation. This helped justify the overly expensive eggs Benedict and pancakes we purchased.  Their form of customizing your own breakfast is neat - instead of ordering a plate you can choose how many eggs Benedict you would like or how many pancakes. This is awesome for portion control and knowing what to expect! If you're a bottomless pit I would warn you to find the nearest typical breakfast place with a little more quantity minus the quality: the quality that zazie puts in its food.

We ordered three pancakes with a side of apple sausage;  and two of the divorcee eggs Benedict (crispy bacon alongside avacado with a perfectly poached egg on top of the English muffin) with salad. The pancakes were worth every bite - delicious alongside the provided typical maple syrup: Fluffy and thick pancakes. Apple sausage was delicious - not anything new though. 

The eggs Benedict was cooked perfectly with the yolk slightly running when you cut it open but still suspended within the yolk. The hollandaise sauce was a little bland but that's something a little salt and pepper couldn't fix. Perhaps this is the way they would like their guests to cut down on sodium? The avacado was a nice contrast to the bacon grease which added to the overall balanced taste. The salad on the side was also a great way to balance off the meal - aka green mix leaves without dressing. If you don't like plain leaves I would get the fries.

Overall I felt like the staff enjoyed working there and it was evident in the general vibe of the place! I wish the staff asked whether I'd like to sit outside out back - it's quite nice back there! Lastly this is super close to the N line so give it a shot!
author: James L.

description: This place is awesome, located in Cole Valley and was super easy to find street parking. I ordered their Monaco poached eggs, which contained prosciutto and some sort of tomatoes, very tasty. All of their poached eggs come with your choice of potatoes or salad, pretty standard for a lot of brunch spots. I was really enjoying the "mom and pop" vibe I was getting while I was there. It's super casual, but it's kind of a cramped space. They have a patio seating area in the very back, which looked really nice. All in all this place is a solid choice for breakfast/brunch if you're ever in the Cole Valley area.
author: Aaron C.

description:
Headed out on our last day of a weekend getaway, we decided on Zazie for brunch. It was a Monday, and people are right--there's still a wait. Fortunately, it's not too long. I can't imagine trying to have come on a weekend though.

We sat in a cozy little booth inside. Wish the garden had seating because it was super cute. But we were hungry. I loved the fact that you could order one of something and one of something else; sweet and savory, together at LAST!

I got one of the salmon eggs benedict and one of the miracle pancakes, which on that day was a lemon poppyseed ricotta melt-in-your-mouth-oh-my-god-i'm-really-full-but-can't-stop-eating pancake. They were both SO good. I ate every last bite. I later regretted it on our walk over the Golden Gate, but at least it burned some of the calories. We also ordered the egg scramble with eggplant, peppers, onions...maybe a mediterranean? Can't remember the exact name but it was also good. And of course, we had to try the French Toast Tahiti. Mmmm.

Since there's so much to do we probably won't be back for a while because, well, we don't live there. But it was a great place for breakfast! Especially for out of towners looking for something a little more local. Can't wait to visit the city again.
author: Lauren B.

description:
Super cute little French restaurant! We arrived 30 min early for our reservation on a Friday night and we're immediately seated on the lovely heated patio. Loved the food and loved the service. It was really a great place to have a lovely quiet evening.

I had the lemon ricotta ravioli which was scrumptious. My friend had the duck which I tasted and thought it was really delicious. I know this is a big brunch place but the dinner was really great. Totally recommend.
author: Sahar P.

description: Unbelievable food! Lots of food options and you can get a small/medium/large of most dishes so lots of flexibility. Expect a decent line for weekend brunch but there's an option to wait at the sports bar next door and they will come find you when the food is ready. Highly recommended!
author: Kabir J.

description:
Way overhyped!!  I didn't think it was bad, but I didn't think it was the greatest either!  Yummy for those living in the area, but not for those who have to journey to get there and wait another 45 minutes or so!

Service is OK also!  If you don't sit in a highly visible spot, they are more spotty on the service.  

The highlight of our visit was the Tahiti French Toast!! Generous portion, filled with walnut cream and carmelized banana strips.  Well balanced dish, without the feeling of it being too heavy!  Kept you wanting to come back for more!

The gingerbread pancake was dense and heavy though (especially if you plan on eatting the entire pancake)! The pear did little for me.  The sweet lemon curd was delicious, and went well with the pancake though!

Lastly, the challah french toast with orange cinnamon batter was my least favorite of the three.  Pretty average.  I'd probably wouldn't order it again if I came back.

On the savory side, we also tried a poached egg benedict.  We tried the Monaco with proscuitto and tomatoes, which was great!  That is, until we got to the middle of our eggs, and noticed that our poached eggs were really cooked inside! No runnyiness at all :(  

Sighh, after reading all the reviews, I really wanted to like this place, and make it one of my top five brunch places in SF....
author: Tramy V.

description:
First I want to mention that this is my first restaurant review. Woo Hoo!

Now that the business is out of the way time for the pleasure. And this place was all that. 

My girl and I are visiting San Francisco for the weekend so we searched the web for the best places to eat while we where here. Zazie came up as one of the best places to get breakfast and after reading the menu we decided to go check out the brunch. 

After finally tracking down the place we came across the worst part of this experience, finding a place to park! Took us about 20 minutes to find a spot. After that little annoyance it was pure bliss.

There was a line out the door. There is no real host/hostess to speak of but a clipboard outside the door. Put your name on the list and when you can finally sit down they call you. You don't wait in a normal lobby or seating area but outside which was actually really nice considering it was a bright and sunny day. 

We only waited another 15 minutes or so then we were called in. The place is small, but seating feels less congested and more intimate. Like you are in a room full of your friends. Brightly painted, cool art, and if you look around you can see why they named the place Zazie.

The service was great. Our waiter was attentive and friendly. At one point I dropped my knife on the floor and,  this is no exaggeration, in less than 10 seconds he took the dirty one and replaced it which I really appreciated because I didn't want to stop eating. 

Oh right, the food.... WAS AMAZING!

I had the French Toast Tahiti and the Mexico style scrambled egg (minus the toast) and she had the New York style scrambled eggs (with the wheat toast). I have nothing bad to say about any of it. The french toast was soft, big, moist, and flavorful. Both of our scrambled eggs were hot and delicious. I did not try the toast personally but she loved it so much we had to get extra butter. I did not confirm it but I am sure they get their bread fresh everyday. 

Honestly though my favorite part was the water. It came in this antique looking glass bottle. It was clearly tap, but honestly I love tap water. If you are in town for any reason I say get up and go check this place out. I will definitely be back here any time I can.
author: Chad T.

description: Went her for brunch with friends. Arrived at 10 and had a 25 min wait. We ordered the Miracle pancakes, the ginger bread pancakes, St Trop and salmon scramble. Everything was delicious. The service was friendly but a little slow. They were extremely busy too.
author: Faiz S.

description:
This place is STUPID good. 

Pros: 
- pancakes
- any of their eggs Benedict 'cus their hollandaise sauce is ridiculous! 

Cons: 
- Be wary of the wait here! 
- Parking... but I'm not a local so I don't walk, bike or take lyft or uber
author: Sharon C.

description: Really enjoyed the brunch here. Had the Mexico scrambled eggs and it was very good. The wait wasn't too long which was quite surprising from what I heard about this place. Interesting take here is that they don't require any tipping. Tips are built into the menu prices.
author: Wayne H.

description: A friend referred us and it was great. We were lucky enough to have no wait, and enjoyed sitting outdoors with heat which cut the chill. Our meal was great, and the server was very attentive. Food was delicious, and presented well.
author: Carm B.

description:
Call in sick and go to Zazie's.  You'll be surprised how you're not the only one doing it. 
They have all these amazing speciality pancakes, which you can order REAL maple syrup with (802 love), and just about everything is solid. 
Can't wait to get back!
author: Jonathan B.

description: Was craving for French Toast and read they had one of the best French Toast in the city. Had to try it. Love the decor in Zazie very homey and country and quaint. It's a French Bistro popular for its brunch menu! French Toast was good made with Challah bread. The  La Mer which was like eggs Benedict but with crab meat and avocado was delicious. Portions are rather small for the price but had a enjoyable eating experience. It gets pretty crowded but the lines go fast. Service is great!
author: Maria M.

description:
Much anticipation in coming here after having bookmarked for several months.

The three of us arrived Tuesday today between 9:30am-10am. and no line as stated by other yelpers.  By the time we left around 11am, they were jotting names down on a clipboard for a table.

You're presented with two menus once seated.  One is the regular menu and the other is the special listing some of their specialties.  

Had both the La Mer eggs benedict and the Challah french toast topped with sliced strawberries as two of us split our individual breakfast choices.  Both were very very good.

Strong coffee too.

Metered parking on Cole St. and 2 hour residential permit parking around the corner.

Would love to come back anytime.
author: Shirley N.

description:
Friends recommended Zazie for brunch. 
The menu has five different French Toasts to choose from plus many excellent Waffles. 
The Sandwich Brigitte was outstanding and the Italian scrambled eggs was very good. 
Richard took care of our table amicably. 
When we are back to Sam Francisco, we will definitely come back here. 
It is also our first experience in a Tip Free restaurant. 
Great.
author: Ghassan R.

description:
Delicious.  We shared the lemon poppyseed pancakes and dungeness benedict, both were really awesome.  We got one of the table's out front (first come, first served) and sat outside with our pup.  

Only reason I wouldn't give it five stars was the wait to get inside for brunch.  Reservations would be nice, because otherwise the wait is really long (I think an hour when we arrived) so beware.  I guess they don't need them since they have these wait times, but would make the experience more pleasant.
author: Nicole D H.

description:
I've been here a couple times for dinner and once for brunch. The food can be described as French comfort food. And it is awesome.

My first visit was the most memorable - we met the owner upon checking in on Valentine's Day. She's hilarious and super sweet. And guess what - despite it being a holiday and special menu, they still honored the 'No Corkage Tuesday' deal. The special bottle we brought was free to enjoy with our meal! 

The servers themselves are excellent -- some of the best I've experienced in San Francisco.

I really enjoy the Hangar steak -- my main course on my first visit. I've also liked other dishes at Zazie during subsequent meals, though not to the same extent. Perhaps one of the drawbacks of a large and varied menu is that it sets itself up for some hits-and-misses.

The lemon soufflé is probably my favorite dessert in the city. Unfortunately it's seasonal, and not always on the menu.

I'm dying to go back on one of their doggie nights (Monday nights, you can eat with your dog on the back porch). I don't have a dog, but I wish I did.
author: Greg K.

description:
Always a line here.  Our wait was nearly 30 minutes on a Sunday at noon.  Seems to be a really popular place.  They should have more tables...

After the wait, the waitress took our order and gave us our drinks.  The food did come really quickly after ordering, though.  The only reason you come to Zazie is for the eggs benedict.  They were wonderful, perfectly done and served with home fries.  The dishes are a bit pricey for what you get, from my observation.  Maybe next time I'll order the huge stack of pancakes or french toast.
author: Wally W.

description:
[+] Crab Benedict!
[+] Love the neighboorhood
[+] Friendly servers
[+] Cute restaurant

[-] A little on the pricey side but it's totally worth it!!
author: Tammy F.

description:
Amazing food. Well sourced food. 
However you must be patient. If it wasn't the 30-60 minute wait I always experience its great. Worth the wait! But just be prepared. esp for brunch.
author: M D.

description:
Great French food, cozy atmosphere... New York style seating though, up close and personal with your neighbors.

British waiter knows his menu inside and out, and knows his wine list equally well - trust his recommendations!

Love the Monday night special, 10% off your check if you bring your dog!
author: Patrick M.

description: I love the concept here - no tipping needed because workers are paid fairly. Of course because of that prices on the menu reflects that concept, but it is well worth it regardless. Food has been consistent the times I've been here - my friends agree. Service is good. Sometimes the wait can be a little annoying, but again....it's San Francisco, and most of the time the wait is indeed well worth it. Not the biggest fan of the Chai's, but the latte's, etc are good!
author: Rebecca J.

description: I was fully prepared to love Zazie and want to come back every weekend. But alas, I did not love it at all. I was in the hood on a weekday so decided to stop by and try my luck. I only had to wait for 2 min and they seated me right away. I had the benedict Pierre with the bacon and tomatoes Provençal. It came with two anemic eggs atop some nice bacon and some limp tomatoes. The worst part was the home fries - it was made up of 10 garlic cloves and 4 small pieces of potato. Gross! Who wants to eat 10 cloves of garlic? And for $20? Sad to say but the hype is just that. Hype.
author: Jennifer C.

description:
Decent brunch place! I think everything on the menu here is pretty good, 

But the wait is really long... Best to put your name down and go do something else for an hour. Or come right when it opens. 

I really enjoyed their poached eggs w/ hollandaise!
author: Alisa C.

description:
A little expensive, but they have such a great selection of mimosas, + their eggs divorce are absolutely yummy, you forget about the bill :)
Highly recommended for brunch!
author: Carole P.

description: This place is TIP FREE. I love that style of dining it reminds me of France. This place is great. I had a coffee and a plate of eggs. The one thing I love about this place is the menu and daily specials. I would definitely recommend this place for anyone who's into brunch.
author: Kathy F.

description:
Out of my two trips to SF this is probably my favorite brunch spot that I have tried.  Sure we had to wait an hour, but that gave Betty and I enough time to head down the road and enjoy some coffee and macarons.  

The wait was well worth it because the weather was so beautiful and what better way to enjoy the uncharacteristically warm weather than to have a great brunch on a large patio out back.  

Betty and I both enjoyed bloody marys and they were made very well.  Betty had the French Toast Tahiti, Pinkie's challah stuffed with caramelized bananas and walnuts.  Great flavor profile.  I had the La Mer benedict, fresh hand picked dungeness crab, green onions, and haas avocados.  Not necessarily cheap at $19, but well worth it considering the surroundings and the quality of the food...and the weather.

Service was attentive and I would definitely come back.
author: Bob B.

description:
The host wasnt accurate with our waiting time. But I forgot all about it when I tasted their food.  Its a small place, but has that homey feel. Service was not bad.  Enjoyed the greece omelet w red onions, spinach, n feta cheese and it also included toast & home fries! 

I wanted to try a second meal, so I ordered gingerbread pancakes which was ok. Bacon was nice and crispy though.  Look at my pics, I definitely housed both my meals.  My girl had her usual french toast which she loved!  

Come early because the line here gets long quick.  If you do have an iphone, they will give you an app to download for your phone so you can see how far along you are from the waiting list.
author: Jeff M.

description: The only reason I would ever return to SFO. One of the top 5 restaurants I've eaten in my life. And I don't even like French food. What a great place and what an amazing story. We met the owner and she was delightful.
author: Elias V.

description: Cozy, amazing menu and outstanding service. Brunch lines can get a little long but it worth the wait.  Fish soup on the dinner menu is the best!
author: Natalie S.

description: I had the poached egg Monaco, superb! House made cream cheese coffee cake and latte, makes me want to go back there right now. Highly recommend. It gets very busy but we slipped after the morning rush on a Friday at 9:10am-ish.
author: S A.

description:
WOW! Cannot rave about this place enough. I was in town visiting a friend and came here for Saturday brunch, and I have been talking about Zazie to anyone who will listen.

I had a Croque Madame and it was to die for. The bread was toasted perfectly, topped with an abbundance of cheese. The cheesy béchamel (or what I thought was béchamel) was perfectly flavorful without overpowering the ham. 

Our waiter was incredible - funny, nice and attentive. We were lucky to be able to sit outside in the back on a beautiful sunny day. Would definitely recommend sitting out back if given the option.

Certainly not a cheap brunch place, but worth every penny..... can't wait to go back!
author: Roberto G.

description:
Food Quality - Excellent
Food Taste - Excellent
Food Originality - Excellent
Price - Excellent
Customer Service - Excellent
Ambiance - Excellent

Nothing bad to say except that you NEED a reservation otherwise the wait is long. We've been here a few times and love both the brunch menu, and the dinner menu. Service is friendly and warm too.
author: Vibhor C.

description:
Occasion: Brunch with Susan 

What I had: 
Organic Granola with fresh fruit and yogurt
Mimosa

Food: Big fat bowl of my favorite "healthy" brunch. I'm a huge believer that every item on the menu should be fantastic for what it is. No half-assing your sides, your fruit, your eggs. Zazie's granola bowl was great. 

Service: Nothing in particular about the service. 

Venue: Street parking is tough to come by, so be prepared to take some time searching for a spot, let alone the 40 minute wait. But, there's a crepe cafe a block away you can grab a cup of coffee while you're waiting. 

The element that sold me on Zazie was it's outdoor patio: it reminded me of a brunch place I tried in Brooklyn. Love the lights and flowers behind the restaurant. Try to get seated in the back outside even if it takes a little more waiting! 

Overall Impression: Great food, but the little venue in the back is definitely the selling point. Zazie puts the "cute" in "cute brunches."
author: Rachael K.

description:
I hadn't been here for about ten years for no particular reason. Got curious about it again after reading about their employment and all-inclusive-prices (except tax) policies. Especially with so many restaurants adding those peevish surcharges, sometimes surreptitiously, this place sounded like it would probably be a lot more fun, and it was.

Low five, but still a five. I will be back.

First off, high five to the no tipping policy. Giving the staff profit sharing, making them partners in the restaurant's success, does more for honest, warm service than any need to play to a customer does. Service was excellent. This doesn't mean fast. Expect to spend a full hour or more for dinner.

The soup of the day, lentil, was delivered quickly and comforting. Four stars. Watch out for the roll - it's hot!

The lamb tagine was heavenly. The flavors mixed well, providing contrast with different bites. A couple spots were on the dryish side, making this a low five. It is delicious - every bite full of flavor - and I would order this again after trying some of the other dishes. There was a wait for this one - do order an app so you're not starving - and it totally shows in the development of the complex yet simple tastes.

The petit pot du creme au chocalat was creamy and intensely chocolatey, with a cloud of whipped cream on top. It was petite, as advertised, yet there's nothing more I could have possibly eaten that evening that would have topped it. High five stars. I want to try other things on their dessert menu as well - and the cheese plate - but the memory calls to me "come back, come back."

Actually, alternating memories of the lamb tagine and the chocolate call to me.

Interesting that with all the hard surfaces the noise level was so low. The background music was barely perceptable, which probably kept peoples' voices down. One more reason this is a great place. No single-diner attitude, either, and no attitude about my not drinking.

You really get to understand that dinner is about enjoying a relaxed meal here. More restaurants could do to follow this business model.

Oh, and a couple posters on the wall for Zazie Dans Le Metro, I film I enjoyed many years ago.
author: Charles B.

description:
Good food - french toast was delicious. I'm sure the benedicts were good too. 
However, really really long wait time due to the horrendous host - who called our name (there were just the two of us) while we were standing very very close by (probably he was soft or everyone else was loud) and thus skipped us. So we ended up waiting another 20minutes. When is our turn, he went "why look so unhappy?" Well, we waited for more an hour. 

Zazie is a good place. However, there are also other good brunch places such as Mama's that you can go to that are probably more convenient for you if cole valley is out of the way.
author: Catherine T.

description: When did this place become such a tourist trap?? Lukewarm food, long waits, friendly service, $$$$...Pass
author: kiwi l.

description: Husband and I were craving French for dinner and we landed here. Apparently this place is known for its brunch but their dinner menu is incredible. They take walk-ins which is a plus. The atmosphere is homey, cozy, and intimate. The pork chop was cooked to perfection, and the mussels are a must. Great list of French wines to choose from. Our experience was flawless
author: Amanda W.

description:
Love love love this place for brunch. It's in Cole Valley, which is a really cute part of SF. But if you come here for brunch on the weekends (especially on sundays) be prepared for a wait!! You write your name down on a list by the door and they'll come get you when they have something available for you. The one no-no at Zazie is asking how long the wait is. They get really sassy about it because they say it slows them down and what not which makes sense I guess. But you just really gotta wait patiently here. 

There's always a big crowd camped outside since the restaurant is actually really tiny. But they do have a back patio which has more seating. There are two tables out front though which are special. These are first come first serve so if you happen to see someone leaving the table, be prepared to pounce. This is only convenient in nice SF weather though. And only for the brave of heart as everyone waiting out side will judge you as you eat. Every bite. Judgement. Just saying. I've been on both ends. It's intense. 

So yes, this place is mostly a brunch place, though they are a regular restaurant, I haven't been for anything but brunch though. 

They are kind of pricey, but hey it's brunch. So it's worth it. Any of their scrambles are delicious I've had a few of them. It comes with two pieces of toast and either a salad (I think) or home fried. Go for the fries. Come on now. Do you even have to think about it? The homefries come with roasted garlic which is delicious. I like to spread it on the toast and it's so good. 

For brunch they usually have a special going on. This morning, I went and the special was an omelette with white cheddar, asparagus, pesto, and chicken apple sausage. Prime brunch munch perfection. It was delicious and I'm always into getting those not on the menu, only can try once kind of things. 

Their drinks are pretty pricy, but rather large so if you really want your mocha or latte fix, I'd say go for it. The chai I got wasn't so great though. Kind of watered down. But side note - if you want to take whatever's left of it to go when you're finished they'll transfer it to a to go cup which is nice. 

Again, the place is tiny so be prepared for a wait. But the food is delicious and the service is pretty good. Definitely one of the top brunch places in SF though, I must say.
author: Erika M.

description:
Definitely one of the best brunch places in SF.  

Came here on a Friday at 12:30pm.  The wait wasn't too long, only five minutes.  All the staffs were very friendly and welcome.  

My friend and I shared the French Toast Tahiti ($10.00 Two pieces) and Fontainbleau Scrambled Eggs ($11.00).  OMG both dishes were so good.  

French Toast Tahiti was the toast that stuffed with caramelized bananas and walnuts.  At first, I thought it would be very sweet but it was not.  If they could add more walnuts, it would be better.  The bananas went so well with the toast.  

Fontainbleau Scrambled Eggs had portobellos, shiitake, porcinis and spinach.  All the ingredients were so fresh and the eggs were so smooth and flavorful.  The portion was good too because it came with toast and home fries or salad.  

Can't wait to go back there for some pancakes :-)
author: Liza T.

description: The food and service are stellar.  We went for our anniversary-it was perfect.  I especially like that tips aren't required as the restaurant takes care of their employees. I can't wait to go back!
author: Roxanne M.

description: Foocking delicious but the big white bearded waiter could definitely pay more attention to the customers. Coming back regardless.
author: Charlie V.

description: Zazie is a weekend staple for me. Love their mango mimosas, french toast, bacon, hell everything is awesome. I'd recommend taking a seat outside and enjoy people watching. Keep serving amazing food.
author: Brooke C.

description: My little sister took me here and it was amazing!! We waited two hours outside in line on a Sunday hungover but it was actually so fun and so worth it. The food was delishhhh and I'm a very picky eater :) there is a No Tip policy also because it's basically included in all the prices which is nice!!
author: Grace L.

description: Service is "barely there," which is great if you're looking to chat with your brunch partner(s) and don't want any interruptions. Our dude was pretty chill, but being a server myself, I was glad that I didn't have to tip him for his lackluster performance. I hope Zazie's system of paying their employees a great wage is working out for them...this guy just didn't seem too pumped to be at work.
author: Jenefer _.

description:
Love their brunch it's so tasty and comforting. The service is quite good!
I especially love their buttermilk pancakes, yummy!
If they didn't have those crazy lines and waiting times I would give them 5 stars.
author: T A.

description: We got here at 8:30 and they don't open till 9 but thank god we got there early coz there was a long line already. You would think their food would taste like out of this world because of the line and all the reviews here in Yelp but it was OK.Their magic pancake is delicious and I got Florentines eggs benedict, side of bacon and orange juice. Servers are attentive and good quality of food. The place is really small, we got the table in the corner and they sat a family of 5 next to us where I can't even go through without the dad moving, that was my main issue and it just made my entire breakfast experience uncomfortable. On the good note, I like how they pay for their employee's health benefits with the surcharge that is clearly printed on the receipt that also explains why the food is a little bit pricey and why tipping is not required. So way to go Zazzie and I hope the seating arrangement can be fix.
author: Jerrica A.

description:
We went to Zazie for breakfast on the first day of our San Francisco vacation. I never thought I would recommend a place for their canned sodas, but Diet Coke should legitimately be advertising this place. I was served a can of Diet Coke with the most intensely frosted glass I've ever seen, not only frosted but with ice frozen into the bottom of the glass. It was so crisp and divine. 

After a great first impression, I asked Brian our waiter if the BLT was good and he encouraged me to go with it. I often hesitate on ordering BLTs because they typically come dry. NOT this one. This was one of the best sandwiches I have ever eaten - real life. It had tomatoes provencales which were moist and flavorful. It had goat cheese and aioli on the toasted focaccia. It was AWESOME and quite large, too. My boyfriend had the Challa French Toast which was also a success. Brian even gave us quarters for parking - what a gem. 5 stars to Zazie and 15 stars to the BLT!!
author: Kate R.

description:
so yummy!!! I ordered the smoked salmon eggs benedict, and the walnut banana french toast (I forgot the exact names of the menu items). SO GOOD. Luckily we came in right before the lunch rush, so we got a seat without having to wait. They do have outdoor seating that's first come first serve, so if it's a nice day, sit outside! 

The french toast is probably the best french toast I've ever had. It had carmelized bananas, and walnut in the toast...soooo good. I will definitely be coming back since I'm a big fan of french toast!

--They make a great bloody mary too :)
author: Michelle Z.

description:
Wait staff is always friendly.
Great swanky atmosphere.
Food is usually good if not great.
Only thing, not completely consistent on the Holliday sauce. I've had it spot on, but once it was bland.
Otherwise, love this place and has such great coffee!
Now that I live out of state,  I always try to visit this place when I am in town. A true gem :)
author: Nicole M.

description:
Definitely worth a brunch here if you are staying in the area. We showed up early, just before it opened and there was already a line. Luckily we got a table when they opened, and I must say they have their service on point, even with 50 people entering at once.

I had the granola and fruit which was a nice home made granola, but just melon in the fruit salad. My husband had a breakfast plate with eggs and sausage and enjoyed it. The highlight was the gingerbread pancakes we shared. Massive serving so if you are sharing it, just get one, but so, so yummy. The lemon curd is delish and the ginger bread is an unusual but delightful way to have a pancake.

Definitely more pricey than some others in the area, but the food and service was worth it for a treat.
author: Sarah B.

description:
Double date with the BFF and her boy on a Sunday. There was quite a wait for 10am (they were 1/2 way down the 1st page and our name was listed 1/2 way down the next page, so the boy and I walked around since the others were late. I'm not exactly sure how long we waited... maybe around 30 minutes?

Gingerbread pancakes with lemon curd is food of the gods. My new favorite. Florentine poached eggs are delicious too. We all ordered a round of mimosas, which was good but pricey. For the same price, I could get bottomless mimosas in the Castro. Please make them bottomless! Until then, I will withhold the 5th star. 

Our total was just shy of $100 (including tip) for 4 people. Despite the price, one of THE BEST spots for brunch in the city.
author: Katrina L.

description:
Was there with a party of 4, 2 kids. The wait was really long..probably over an hour on a Sunday. We finally sat done and the waitress greeted us immediately. Drinks delivered within 5 minutes which was really nice after an hour wait. 

This is the second time I've been to Zazie and this time it's a bit disappointing. Here's why:
1. Tahini French toss with caramelised banana - way too much caramelised banana and tahini was not up to the flavour. Basically eating syrup drenched french toast. 
2. Chicken Sausage Omlette with home fries and toast - Omlettee needed salt and pepper. Home fries was good, flavourful 
3. Croque Mosiuer - blend. They had the cheddar melted on top of the bread with a thin piece of black forest ham in between. Not impressive and will not wait for an hour for this..
4. Crab Poached Eggs on biscuit - best dish of the order. Eggs are perfectly cooked and the yolk oozed onto the crab biscuit. That is some heavenly goodness.

I will still return and hopefully they have some improvement then....
author: Vicky M.

description:
Wow, almost 1500 reviews? Always a good sign... My friend took me here on my first morning in the city, in town for a long weekend, saying it was THE brunch place in the Haight. I was excited, and I was hungry.

I could just TELL that it was an off morning. The reviews are so positive, the ratings so high and so plentiful, and I caught glimpses of brilliance.

But we were taken to a table on the back patio so small and so jammed in against other tables that we actually opted to return to the pool and wait for a decent table. I'm 6'6... squeezing into a 4" gap between tables is just not an option. When we were seated, the service was a bit slow... and when we received our breakfasts, my eggs were ice cold. It was obvious that they were sitting there 5-10 minutes before being served. Not cool.

Flavors, presentation, and vibe were all spot-on, but they weren't bringing their A-game this morning, that's for certain...
author: Sean B.

description:
Brunch this morning at zazie was so tasty! We arrived about 10:30am and found a huge line outside (I guess everyone else had the same idea we did...) but we put our names on the list and waited. We were probably only waiting about 15 minutes although in I'm hungry time it felt like a lot longer. We did get frustrated when a table was open for a while and they sat a group of 4 who had literally just arrived before us because I guess they were waiting to put us a table for 2. 

I ordered the new york egg scramble (lox, cream cheese and onions) served with homefries and toast. My friend ordered the monacco poached egg also with homefries. The food is really good, no complaints about that at all. 

We had a bit of a hard time getting coffee refills but otherwise service was very good as well. It's not cheap (plan on spending about $15-20 per person) but it's tasty!

A quick note on seating: The tables outside in the front are first come first served. We were seated outdoors on the patio in the back where they have heatlamps but sitting out there it actually got really hot. So definitely layer up or be prepared to wait extra time for a table inside.
author: Rachel E.

description:
Will be coming back for sure! Line is shorter than Mama and not as snooty as Brenda!

French toast: If you don't like bananas...then don't order this. I typically don't like banana flavored foods but this dish was delicious. It's a sweet dish...so try sharing a savory dish with another person. 

Gingerbread pancakes: comes with yellow curd and poached pear. The pancakes are huge and I was glad I only ordered one. 

Chicken Sandwich: surprisingly good. My dad loved his dish and he rarely does so this says lots. 

La Mer (crab, avacodo, poached egg) : yum! No complaints. 

Everyone is friendly here and the atmosphere is cozy. Can't wait to visit again.
author: Logan N.

description: The place is amazing! Eggs Benedict with salmon are the best I have ever tasted! Great choice of mimosas, beautiful atmosphere.
author: Irina K.

description:
This morning I had the most delicious eggs Benedict with home fries.
The English muffin was cooked perfectly as was the bacon and poached egg. The only thing I would do is get a side of the delicious wheat toast.
author: Donald M.

description:
Arrived at 10AM on a Sunday to still find a 30-45 minute wait. After perusing a few stores along the block and grabbing some coffee, before we knew it our table was ready. We scored the awesome table right next to the window to give us a view of the growing hungry crowd gathering outside and waiting patiently.

We ordered the following: 

French toast Tahiti - stuffed with bananas and walnuts
Fontainbleau - scrambled eggs with variety of mushrooms
New York - scrambled eggs with smoked salmon 
La Mer - Poached eggs with crab

Latte came out in a bowl. Love it. Felt like I was drinking soup rather than coffee. I also appreciated they let patrons choose how many eggs or slices of French toast they prefer. So from the small to the big eaters, the portion sizes will be tailored to your preference. Everything came with a side of home fries, which were thick chunks of potatoes with whole cloves of buttery garlic. YUM! I could eat them every day. All of the dishes were solid and delicious, but nothing was a true standout for me. The flavors and ingredients have all been done before, and considering the big crowds, I was expecting much more. Maybe I've unknowingly become a brunch snob. Or maybe I've heard way too much hype about Zazie and my expectations were through the roof. Whatever it was, I'm not sure if the food is enough to warrant the ridiculously long wait time. 

Minus the line, I would definitely re-visit Zazie again for a consistent and hearty brunch. However, since there doesn't seem to be a time when the crowd ever dwindles, I'd much rather frequent Mama's, Lime, or Foreign Cinema for a more memorable brunch.
author: Vivian D.

description: Really cool place for brunch. Ginger Pancakes are a must try and so is the Croque Mosieur! Banana french toast should also make your list. I also ordered a Salmon sandwich - it didn't really scream brunch but it was delicious and filling if you want to eat right and somewhat light!  They have a NO TIP policy as prices already cover for tips. A cute and warm and welcoming decor on the inside and laidback patio/garden seating on the outside. The only thing I wish they added to their menu was free refills on juices and maybe eventually refills on mimosas haha. Definitely an institution to try for brunch.
author: Dhruv B.

description:
This place is so over-hyped. We went there with a party of 4 around 1:00pm on a Friday and we got seated right away which was really promising - until we looked at the menu. EVERYTHING was over-priced. 

I've been wanting to cut back on the carbs so I opted for a side of 2 eggs and chicken apple sausage (rather than getting the $12 egg platter with toast and home fries). The eggs were $3 (FOR TWO!) and the sausage was $4.50. (Typically chicken apple sausage is more expensive, and I totally get that because I love it and I think it's worth it) 

When I got my two side dishes I noticed that instead of one large chicken apple sausage link - like they are at EVERY OTHER PLACE IN THE WORLD - I received two small sausages that tasted nothing of chicken or apple and more like a standard italian sausage. I didn't want to make a big deal out of it so I brushed it off and was hoping that they wouldn't charge me the $4.50 and would adjust the price for a standard sausage side. 

The whole time I was eating my scrambled eggs and sausage (which cost me $7.50 + a $1.25 401(k) charge for the employees/person) I kept thinking to myself, "I could probably 3 of these orders at some sweet family-run breakfast spot somewhere else and the quality would be just the same."

Others in my party got a veggie egg platter and the polenta with egg and pasta sauce (???) special... All of their dishes were SUB PAR. 

When the bill came I let one of the waiters know about the sausages and he rudely snaps back, "You must have gotten chicken apple sausage. It's the only sausage we have." I was very taken aback by this and I was so fed up with the whole restaurant I just paid the bill and quickly left. I didn't want anything more to do with this terrible restaurant. 

Bottom line: I wouldn't go here unless you're in the mood for bland, pricey food and servers who think that they're too good to serve you.
author: Tiffany M.

description:
J and I were worried about the wait when we went on a Sunday around 12:30, but we were seated (party of 2) inside after only a ~40-minute wait.  Shorter wait than we expected!

I loved the Croque Monsieur -- the melty cheese is delectable.

J got the La Mer & said it was tasty -- it's basically 'eggs benedict' but with crab & avocado.

Oh, and the cream cheese coffee cake was unique.  Unlike most other coffee cakes, it's not crunchy, but if you like cream cheese, you'll love it.

It's a struggle to find parking (what else is new?).

Ambience was bleh - the restaurant is tiny, and if you happen to be sitting near a walkway, expect to get bumped & rubbed against by busy employees rushing by you.
author: Grace C.

description: the wait for this brunch spot is not as long as the other well known places in SF (Brenda's, Plow, Foreign Cinema...)  it is quaint and cozy..menu is typical of what you expect from a brunch restaurant.
author: Christina K.

description: If you want some delicious breakfast you need to try out this little gem in Cole Valley SF. With the outside seating and al a cart beni, you have to give it a go. This is a staple of the area. Love love love it. If there's a wait, the bar next door has some nice looking bloodies. it's to the right! lookers right!
author: Lauren F.

description:
Finally came to Zazie after discussing it for roughly a year.  We probably should have come earlier as there was quite a wait, but we knew what we were in for.  Pro tip: the tables out front are first come first serve.  A couple left one, we stood around for a while and no one had yet swooped in, so we did.  Cut our wait time at least in half!

I had the Zazie Spritzer with the Croque Monsieur- this sandwich was so delicious I never wanted to stop eating it.  I wanted to eat it forever, and wish I were eating it now.  I can't wait to go back and eat it again.
author: Nora S.

description:
I think this place is way OVER-HYPED. The wait for a table took very long about more than an hour. On top of that, I was really hungry. Did not help at all. Hungry+waiting=GRUMPY!

I got the St. Trop Benedict with smoked salmon, capers, and red onions. I did not know that the onions were raw, I should've asked for grilled (if that was an option). I did not like the combination of the whole thing. I felt that they could've replace it with something else that brings out the flavors more.

I also ordered their latte which came in a huge mug but was way too watered down and sweet. The price for the size is good but not the taste.

My friends got the flight sampler and the florentine benedict. I had a bite of their dishes and I thought it was only ok. I've had way better food than this place. I don't think I would come back here.
author: Annie H.

description:
You don't need to read my yelp review to know it was an incredibly long wait. my friend and I almost pretended to be other parties who had left... we should have.

It's Sunday, it's brunch... you wait. 

Food- good.
Mimosas- AMAZING
author: Rachel E.

description:
My lady and I came here on our little San Francisco weekender, taking a break from shopping at Haight.  We were recommended Zazie's by a friend and were very glad that we came here.  It was a nice day and despite there being a wait, we got to sit outside in the nice patio out back.  My lady had the crocque monseiur and I had the crocque royale with an egg.  Both were awesome.  Even the accompanying salads were great - dark greens tossed in a smidgen of dressing.  Even my iced tea was of high quality!  We absolutely loved every little thing about this place.

I do have to say, I love that the menu states explicity that a$1.25 surcharge goes to the staff's benefits.  The simple fact that the restaurant offers their staff healthcare makes me want to return.  That and those delicious looking egg benedicts!
author: Thai D.

description: had better brunch than this...though not bad...just don't think the line is worth the wait.
author: Vicki T.

description: Came to Zazie's on a Monday for lunch so there was virtually no wait. We ordered the French toast stuffed with banana and and the La Mer. The French toast was good but too sweet to finish. The La Mer was tasty with a good amount of crab meat and perfectly done eggs. The food is decent but doesn't really stand out.
author: Helen L.

description:
Being that Zazie is on the SF 7x7 list,  i was was dying to check out this place cause it's known for their eggs benedicts. I got the La Mer: with fresh hand picked dungeness crab, green onions, and haas avocados. THE BEST benedicts I've had!!! it is a bit pricey but it is soo worth the $17-$20!  

the Croque Madame: Croque Monsieur topped with a sunny side up free range egg is also DELISH!!
author: Jenn F.

description:
Came here today for brunch with some friends and it was an hour wait.  It was really not worth the wait because there was really nothing special about it.  Nothing really blew my mind.  I could have gotten the same breakfast elsewhere minus the wait.

I got the Florentine which was the 2 pouched eggs with spinach and mushrooms on top of an english muffin.  The house potatos were good.

I was just not impressed and not worth the wait...sorry.  The server was nice, but that was it.
author: James L.

description: It's been a while since I've been to Zazie, but it's just as good as I remember. Actually, it was better this time around! Both my boyfriend and I got the "Un, Deux, Trois," which includes your choice of pancakes or french toast, two eggs, and bacon. He got the pancakes and I got the french toast. Both were mouth watering. It was just a good classic breakfast. And their potatoes were so crispy and they certainly weren't shy about the garlic :). I was so stuffed. Love this place! It's also in a very nice location. We sat out on the patio and fortunately the weather was very sunny.
author: Kristina T.

description:
This place is worth the wait, it's seriously off the chizzzain. The couple sitting next to us travelled from Palo Alto for breakfast - now that's dedication!

Check it out, you won't be disappointed.
author: Jake H.

description: A great find in Cole Valley! Mushroom ravioli and duck were both outstanding, although a bit pricey for portion sizes. The garden area in the back has a cozy ambiance.
author: Ryan D.

description:
I'm an impatient person who happens to get bored quickly. You can attest that fact to the snobby truth that I have traveled half the world and eaten delicacies that are written solely in books and left in the memories of others, or to the fact that I love great food, excellent service-and I enjoy (sometimes above all else) dependability.

We're city folk (some of the few born and raised in S.F.) and have been coming to Zazie (admittedly with religious fervor) for four years now. Each and every time we are welcome with the same delightful kindness and prompt service that we received upon our first visit. 

Whether you would prefer a hearty lunch (relatively authentic Parisian if it comes down to it minus the illegal cheese and all)  such as Onion Soup Gratinee with a Croque Royale with an optional but mandatory egg on top or the short but sweet list of egg dishes there is no way to lose. The oily and delicious crispy garlic potatoes linger in my memory for days-until at last we are again free from work and have a day off,-and are allowed to taste the deliciousness that is Zazie again.
author: Danielle S.

description: Came here with my three kids today and had a great time. The owner and staff were super nice, got everything in our slightly complicated order right, brought cups with lids and straws for the kids, and didn't even bat an eye when my one year old spilled her food. Pumpkin pancakes and Mexico eggs were delicious and the coffee was hot and plentiful!
author: Sarah E.

description: My honey and I came here for brunch. The line was out the door even at 10:30am and the wait was about an hour. We were prepared for the wait and this place did not disappoint. The 'no tip' policy was very very encouraging and their policy was impressive. I'm impressive that the tip is built in to the prices. We ordered a poached egg breakfast plate and a sandwich. Food came out very fast and taste very good. The cappuccino and mocha was very good too.
author: Allan W.

description: My husband and I tried this place for all its reviews and while we weren't blown away by the food, we will certainly consider it if in the area.
author: Shraddha D.

description:
Go here if you definately don't mind waiting in line...there is usually a line def at weekends..but who cares ..because they do such a kickass brunch..

Beautiful little out door patio, with quick service and delicious food..

Close to Haight Ashbury..perfect for a walk around afterwards!
author: Lindsey S.
