Our whole dinning experience was just so unsatisfactory from the service to the food. I will definitely not be recommending this place to any of my friends.
author: Nava N.

description: Long ass wait weekend mornings, but the food is delish!! I would say it's worth it. I had the crab benedict, which was sooo delicious. The only downside is the portions were kind of small. Oh, and don't try to be healthy & order a salad as your side... go for the house fries!! I was so sad when my friends' mouth watering potatoes came out & i got a sorry ass salad. lol, it's okay because they shared with me. The area is pretty nice too & there's nice to walk around to check out the other little shops or grab coffee down the street while you wait. They also have a outdoor patio seating area in the back, which is reallly nice. The server was also wonderful, super friendly, polite & attentive. The front outdoor seating is first come first serve, so you can try n prowl for seats but you'll probably get a bunch of dirty looks from all the people waiting in front.
author: Elise T.

description:
Have been reading about this place for a bit so finally decided to stop in and try it out. The wait can be long so I've heard but arrived by 9:45ish and was seated about 30 minutes afterward. It's also nice to stop into Peet's for a cup of coffee while you wait.

Once seated, the actual sitting area isn't quite big but I did see outdoor patio seating in the back. Menu isn't too crazy which I like about places otherwise I'm struggling for more than 15 minutes deciding what to eat.

Ordered the New York scrambled eggs with smoked salmon, green onion and cream cheese. Eggs weren't overcooked and slightly runny which I like. Came with their home fries which had good flavor though I like a crispier potato. 

Overall, service was very attentive constantly filling coffee when needed and food didn't take too long to come out. Food was very tasty and only thing would probably be the wait if you come too late for weekend brunch.
author: Marie L.

description: We had the Fountain bleu (mushroom) scramble and the Mexican (chilli, chorizo) scramble. Both were delicious meals! We were also impressed that this is a non-tipping restaurant. If you are wanting to explore Haight street, make this your first stop.
author: Sarah B.

description: I've been to many brunch spots in SF and I have to say that Zazie is one of my absolute favs!! I looove their dungenous crab benedict and their pancakes are sooo good!
author: Alex A.

description: 2 thumbs up for Zazie. Like any good brunch spot expect a long wait. You'll enjoy their original menu with artisan options..I don't have any absolute recommendations as everything seemed worth a taste!
author: MissM R.

description: Hands down the best breakfast place in the city.  Took my friend (Tom P.) from Washington, DC there for breakfast Monday for the Dungeness Crab Eggs Benedict and gingerbread pancakes and was greeted by Mario who remembers everyones' name and what they ordered (even if it's been a few months/years).  He is professional, efficient, and courteous.  My friend loved it so much, we decided to go back on Wednesday before his flight but Mario had the day off, but our server Jon, was excellent, attentive, and professional.  Jon even chatted with us for a bit, which made my friend comment later that their service and food were memorable.  Yes, this little French Bistro is my first choice for celebrating with friends (Brittany Villegiantte, Hillary Lopez)  and family.
author: Kea C.

description: Zazie generally speaking is a good choice for breakfast/brunch but the past few times I have been there they haven't been on their game like they used to be. They really skimp on the crab on their Le Mer benedict, to the point where I don't see how $19 can be justified. I had to have gotten less than a tablespoon of crab. I don't mind the price as long as I'm getting what I pay for. Also, the food comes out luke warm, even when they're not their usual weekend chaotic busy and it's a Monday. I expect my food to come out hot, is that unreasonable?
author: Mira N.

description: I ordered the gingerbread pancake and french toast because I like to live on the edge. In case you are torn between the two potentials, I'd recommend the gingerbread pancake. If I hadn't been shamed into putting my fork down, I probably would have continued attacking it.
author: Sharon L.

description:
I had an omelette with veggies which was fairly solid, if a tiny bit oily. there was a nice salad on the side. Sat on the patio outside in the corner, which was prime seating. it was a saturday morning, but luckily the wait was not bad, even though they had the sign up sheet going. although, this may be because cole valley was going through a construction armageddon. 

service was good.
food was good. 

some of the other items looked yummy, so I'd be down to come back and try something different. i was just in an omelette mood, and it definitely hit my craving, but nothing to rave about. 

all-around solid brunch.
author: S L.

description: I live in Cole Valley and have never been to Zazie for breakfast. I have, however, been to Zazie many many many times for dinner. I cannot say enough good things about this place. The food is delicious and lovingly prepared by a team of great cooks in a small kitchen. The staff is competent, funny, friendly, just the right amount of everything (Megan is a favorite - doesn't get better). Great charcuterie plate, great french onion soup, great burger, great pork chop. A glass of crisp Sancerre with a bowl of mussels on the patio at night with friends - best kept SF secret.
author: Walker A.

description: Delicious!!! Small place that gets very busy. We sat outside in there adorable little patio. Pancakes were unreal!!
author: Rachelle G.

description: Brunch was fabulous! Get there early and be willing to sit outside on the heated patio or front for a great toasty seat. Service was exceptional. Food kept me comforted for the rest of the day. Very fresh and creative menu. Recommend the latte served in a small bowl!
author: Bridget M.

description: I'm sad to give only 1 star because this place looked delicious. I came here on Saturday to get brunch with some friends to kick off my friends bachelorette party & was treated pretty rudely by the host. I wrote my name down and asked how long the wait was and he said he couldn't tell me at that time because was seating customers, which I totally understand since I used to be a hostess/server. Than he called our name and one of the members of our party was running 5-10 minutes late and he said maybe we should call her to find out where she was, as if we didn't already text her. She said she would be there in 10 minutes and he said well the wait could be up to 45 minutes, you know Petes coffee is down the street. We decide to wait and our friend showed up and we waited, then he had the nerve to come up and say " so you decided not to go to petes". I am bummed that it happened, we ended up going down the street to Padrecitos which was delicious and sat us and was very nice. I was looking forward to trying Zazies.
author: Julia T.

description: Yep....she's my boo on a cold summer morning! Love Zazies! Try the Lemon-Meringue, Raspberry pancake aka Miracle pancake. Good wholesome food and service. Go early if you are wanting to have a good seat.
author: Betty B.

description: Best Brunch in town! The Benedict's and the challa French toast! DAMMNNNNN!!! Came here last year for brunch on Valentines day. Super crowded out front, 9 am on Valentines day and still only waited about 1/2 hour for the best brunch I had while in SF.
author: Rob D.

description: Loved it. The wait was long but with any good brunch spots I expect a wait...and this wait was definitely worth it. Let me just say I love how their menu is set up in 1-2-3's meaning u can control the portions size...and can order your meal with 1..2...or 3 eggs. Or 1..2..or 3 pancakes or French toast. This made it easier to try diff things and not feel overly full or look like a piglet with a bunch of dishes on one small table. The other thing I loved is the variety of mimosas! U can choose what kind of champagne and what kind of fruit juice. We had mango and it was delish! We sat on the patio on this sunny day and it was a great time. Food and service was awesome. I'll be back for sure.
author: Cherry C.

description:
Take my review with a grain of salt, we ordered brunch as takeout from here.  I was not a fan.  We had a fair assortment of the usual breakfast items, I think there was pancakes, french toast, some kind of benedict.  Nothing was especially tasty and in fact a few bites in I felt like it wasn't worth the calories.

We much prefer Mission Beach Cafe.
author: Lisa S.

description:
I'm French and the food is not really French... but it's sooooo good!
nice service, too
the lamb is great, and the wine list has great references
author: Julien S.

description:
This place was a lucky find but i'm glad that my friends and I stumbled upon this place.  The food was good.  I ordered the scrambled eggs with eggplant and it was yummy.  It came with a side of potatoes, toast, and an orange.  It was really filling.  I couldn't even finish the potatoes and toast.  Besides the food the service was okay.  It was kind of hard to track down the waiter.  We sat outside and felt kind of neglected.  The waiter came out about 2 times to check up on us.  By the time we were done with our food and wanted the check we had to wave down a waiter from the outside. 

Overall the experience was good.  We didn't have to wait in line for a seat and the atmosphere was relaxing.  Definitely a good place for brunch.
author: Joyce L.

description:
food: 3/5
service: 4/5
atmosphere/decor: 3/5

This is another brunch place in the bay area. Maybe it's because I've been so so many similar places that Zazies does not stand out. Came here around 1030 on a weekend and the wait was about 30 mins. Be sure to sign your name on the clip board. 

The place is what I call cramped hipster place. Small restaurant with tables smushed up together and expensive food. You would think for the prices they charge and mediocre quality, you would get a better dinning experience. I'm wary when the hostess says to many tables "its going to be a little cozy. you okay with that? or you wanna wait longer?". Thank goodness this place isn't communal tables too. I had one dish to myself and my party shared an eggs benedict dish (one egg each person). All for that, the total came out to $28(including tax n tip). Brunch food should never be that expensive if it's just normal faire. They let you choose how many eggs to have on your dish, each egg is about $6. What the heck...Those eggs better be organic, free range chickens, and never been seen or handled by humans. 

I would say that the food is decent here, but the prices is what will prevent me from coming back. Pancakes here are a must have. they also do ginger bread pancakes very well here too.
author: Cecile S.

description:
It's horrible. Don't go. ...okay? Okay. Seriously. Go elsewhere. kthxbai!

::Aside::

Are they gone? Oh good. I really don't want anyone else lengthening those damned lines. Already I have to drag myself out of bed earlier than I'd like on a weekend morning to try to beat the long wait. But it's always worth it. I love that they have DIY lemonade (the Citron Presse) so I can sweeten it to perfection. I adore the La Mer--perfectly poached eggs atop Dungeness crab and avocado, with crisp red potatoes that have whole roasted garlic cloves nestled among them. I love indulging in these with a good book in my hand, and the sunshine playing on my shoulders. And I don't want to share!

It's not just brunch. I've had dinner here plenty of times with friends and family and everyone loves it. I have sometimes made a dinner out of the small plates, rather than order an entrée, just to try various things. The chicken liver paté is crazy indulgent and delicious. I nearly wept when the duck cassoulet was cycled out of their menu, but cheered up because it was replaced by some other yummy thing.

Oh--and Monday night is BYOD: Bring Your Own Dog. I love dogs and don't have any, so this is a real treat for me. People show up with their dogs in tow and there is a serious overload of Adorable. Or adograble, ho ho.

Not everything is perfectly perfect; I've had a couple of desserts that I didn't care for, but they are exceptions rather than the rule. And some things are a matter of taste: the pot de créme is lighter than I'd like--I want my chocolate dark and intense, and this was less so, but that makes it a greater hit with more people.

Anyway. The important thing is to tell everyone quite firmly that this place is overhyped and useless and direct them elsewhere, so that we can have it all to ourselves. Got it? Excellent. Just like Zazie.
author: Neha B.

description: Zazie has decent food. Brunch is far better than dinner, although I would never wait more than 20-30 min tops. We used to come here a few times per year because it is a decent option. Then we had our son. We went for lunch one day and sat on the patio. He was 1, not even walking yet and well behaved (ie entertained by his parents). While the staff was not rude, they were far from welcoming - we felt neglected, the service was ridiculous for mid-day, mid-week. We left and have not been back since there are so many local restaurants that embrace families. The recent anti-children ranting by the owner confirmed the vibe we had sensed. Not cool to make such broad statements about all kids. Nopalito, Eats and Chow are all a far better choice for brunch in my opinion. For dinner, the list of better options is long
author: Nina B.

description:
Love this place for a huge breakfast!
Must have the pancakes and the eggs benedict :)
Eat in the garden patio when the weather is nice!

Complete review (in French): http://blogs.lexpress.fr/styles/french-foodies-chronicles/2012/02/11/le-brunch-de-zazie-sans-le-metro/
author: Chloë O.

description: My wife and I both are here this morning. I had the Tanishan  French toast and my wife had a Mexican breakfast the came with chorizo and eggs. We sat down in a small cramped environment and it took about 10 minutes before someone recognized that we were ready to order. They were busy and the atmosphere was pleasant. When our food arrived it had great flavor and you could tell that the ingredients are fresh. Food is way above average We gave it 4 stars because of the poor service and at the end we received our bill with an extra $2.50 charge to pay for the employees benefits. I don't think that we should be responsible for that isn't that managements job? Anyways if you're looking for good food this is definitely a place that you'd want to try.
author: Michael F.

description:
can a brunch place seriously be THIS good??

Some friends and I decided to deviate from our usual Sunday brunch options, and my god am I glad we did. A quick Yelp search for brunch places in or near Lower Haight led us to this JEWEL. As we were walking up Cole we noticed a mob of people and as we got closer we realized that those people were all waiting to get seated. We flipped through two pages, yes, TWO pages of people's names, and wrote ours down. 

Yes! Bar next door! We wrote "@ 'Finnegan's'" next to our name on the Zazie list and walked next door. After a while we realized that most of the people inside were also waiting to be seated at Zazie. I noticed a lot of people drinking Bloody Marys and decided to order one myself. It was pretty dang good! A little spicy and it came with a pickled string bean.

A few drinks later and we hear, "Ethan party of 3!" 

I'll fast forward to the food because that's what really matters in a Yelp review right? I got the Croque Madame and some Lavendar champagne drink and they were absolutely incredible. The service was impeccable, the outdoor patio area was adorable, and my friends and I had the best time ever. I recommend this place to all of my friends who come from out of town!
author: Lea N.

description:
I don't usually eat breakfast, but being on vacation, and knowing if I didn't, I'd be stuck with food trucks at a crowded music festival for the rest of the day, I made a stop at Zazie.  Conveniently located right on the N line, it wasn't hard for an out-of-towner like myself to find.  When you arrive, you write your name down on the waiting list, and stand around for awhile.  I only had to wait about 20 minutes, and it was on a Saturday, so not too shabby.

I was seated in the patio out back, which is a nice, quaint space that makes you forget you're in a really crowded city.  The weather was overcast, which might make a patio seat undesirable for some, but I'm from Phoenix, so cool and overcast is a nice change from the usual hot and sunny.

I ordered the dungeness crab poached eggs, a side of bacon, and a glass of mango juice.  Doing so forced me to turn down such delicious-looking items as the Tahiti French Toast and the Gingerbread Pancakes, but seeing dungeness on a breakfast menu makes me swoon like a shallow teenage girl listening to a forgettable, soulless 1D tune.

The poached eggs were amazing.  It's basically a benedict, with bread, crab, avocado, runny eggs, and hollandaise, and maybe another ingredient or two I'm forgetting.  Turns out crab and avocado are a winning combination.

The side bacon was also perfect: crispy and flavorful.  The mango juice was mango juice.  The home fries were OK - I ate them all, but honestly, I had forgotten there were home fries until I saw someone's picture.

At $35 after tip, I wouldn't say this is the best breakfast deal, but it's money well spent.  The food is good enough to justify the occasional splurge, and you'll have a good time here as well.
author: Jeremy P.

description:
I was torn between 4 stars and 5 stars for Zazie. The place is small and quaint, the service is very friendly, and we had no trouble finding street parking. We tried a variety of dishes. The mussels and the duck were amazing, and I really enjoyed the soup of the day (carrot and ginger). Also, do try the hot chocolate dessert, it's quite a creation!

My main criticism is that they tried to do too much with their menu. There was a lot to choose from, and when it all arrived, we realized that many of the dishes had repeated components. For example, the trout came with half plate of salad, as did the burger, and we also ordered a salad appetizer to start. We didn't realize the first two dishes came with salad, and most of all, we were disappointed to find that it was the exact same salad on all three dishes. I realize it's a small restaurant, but as a suggestion, perhaps it might be better to have a smaller menu that is changed on a bi-weekly or monthly basis.
author: Laurent L.

description: Excellent and worth the little wait! Very accommodating with our dog too. The challah French toast special was insanely good a must have if you like French toast no too just it was perfect. The service was very friendly and attentive this is a "must" for breakfast if you're in the area!
author: Denice W.

description: This place lives up to they hype. Such a great authentic little neighborhood place and worth the wait on the sidewalk. I've now been here for dinner and for lunch and both times were great -- love the fresh dishes, lovely salads (if you're trying to watch your calories)... Friendly staff. One of my faves...
author: Lisa W.

description:
If  I could eat breakfast food/ brunch for all three meals of the day, I WOULD! My favorite place to get french toast was this place in Monterey (yes the city) and every year (if we were lucky) my bf and I would drive 3 hours over there just to eat breakfast food.......NOW that we found Zazie's there will be no more driving long distances for good food.....Zazie's French Toast Tahiti is seriously THE BEST french toast I have ever tasted. It's the Pinkie's challah stuffed with caramelized bananas and walnuts. I was hesitant at first because I don't like nuts in my food, especially walnuts, however, when the dish came out, I could barely taste and didn't even notice the walnuts. The walnuts were actually a good compliment to the dish (in terms of texture).

I also got to try the Fontainbleau (scramble eggs with portobellos, shiitake, porcinis, spinach, fontina). It was very light and fluffy without being too oily. Their home fries were excellent and not burnt like most places.

I came here on a Friday afternoon around 11:00 and parking was easy to find and I didn't have to wait in line! The last time I was here, we didn't get to try Zazie's because the wait was an hour and a half. Weekends can get a bit crazy, so I say avoid it and Zazie's on a Weekday.
author: Nancy Y.

description: Go early... Long wait. Food was great but probably because we were starved from the wait. Four stars for a potential bias due to hunger.
author: Andy D.

description:
Love this place. There will always be a wait but it's definitely worth it. 
Their egg Benedict, pancakes, potatoes (lots of garlic) and coffee.
author: Karina P.

description:
Okay, I'm from So Cal... We have tons of these type of places.

Don't get your hopes up! Service was great, food wasn't.

If you can, ask for JOHNNY as your server.

FANTASTIC!
author: Robert V.

description:
Okay, there's always going to be a wait here.  The list is long, but moves pretty fast.  You can walk across the street to the well-stocked hardware store and pick up a few things you've not had the time to stop for, until now.

The food is expensive, but top quality.  I've only been here once and had the special, a prawn omelet with white cheddar...perfect!  Wait staff very friendly and fast.

Parking easy.  We walked from here down to the de young (25-30 min stroll) and caught a cab back for $5.  Nice!
author: Paula B.

description: I am rarely compelled to Yelp a place while I am still in it. Zazie is the exception. Exquisite food. Excellent service. Super friendly staff. Really reasonable prices. Love it and will definitely be back!!
author: Amy M.

description:
I really wanted to like Zazie; but, much to my surprise it was a bit of a disappointment.   We went for Sunday Brunch.  The wait for a table was well over an hour, no reservations for Brunch, so you wait on the sidewalk with many others waiting for what has been billed by so many as a great French restaurant.

First, the host is not friendly (he was not French - spoiler right off the bat).  He was very "as a matter of a fact."  Must be nice to be so successful that you don't need to be respectful to your prospective guests (smile and have a little fun buddy, life can't be that bad).

Second, the Brunch menu is hardly French.  For the reputation, I had set my chops  for something very French and special.  What is that you say; "no French onion soup on Sunday Brunch menu," are you kidding me?

I had hoped for a plate of delicious French cheese, a light and flaky croissant with slices of fresh fruits.  Instead it was cold pancakes, cold eggs and cold bacon. Brunch for 5 $120 out the door.  No coffees, or other special drinks, mostly water at our table.  Oh yes; bring cash they do not take American Express cards.

Lots of rules like 'no substitutions because our staff is very busy and the kitchen is too small.'  Really?  Again; not about the guest but their staff instead.

Plan on spending around a half hour looking for a parking space.

The server was very nice; but, clearly working too many tops for the demand.
author: Gary J.

description: I had the oatmeal and gingerbread pancakes. SO delicious! The wait was extremely long and they didn't call our name loud enough so we ended up not hearing our name and waiting even longer. The worker guy didn't seem to care which is why I gave this place a 3 star rating instead of 4. Otherwise there were many options on the menu and I'd love to return.
author: Kristy F.

description: Was a little scared at first when I saw the huge group waiting to be seated but was pleasantly surprised at how fast me and my sister got a table. Made the mistake of saying we needed a couple more minutes the first time the waiter checked on us, which resulted in him giving us another 20 or so minutes*sigh*. Finally ordered and everything was delicious! The staff was super friendly and the interior was so warm and inviting. Very cute; would definitely recommend.
author: Calai S.

description:
Holy badass eats Batman!  It is a fact that when I make a trip, I plan it around food.  People think it's silly to plan a trip around food.  "Don't you want to bike across the Golden Gate Bridge into Sausalito,?"  my friends asked.   Are you kidding me?

We make it to Zazie on a early Sunday morning.  I got the group there as early as we can to avoid the lines I heard about on Yelp.  Fortunately, we got there in time to split out group of 10 into 2 tables of 5.  The decor at Zazie made me feel I was eating in France.  Whether it was the tiny tables, limited seating, and impossibly small bathroom, it was great.  

My sister and I had a plan.  We would both get the two things on the menu we thought would be great and share them.  It worked out perfectly.  I got La Mer eggs benedict (3 total) and she got eggs benedict with bacon (2 total).  This was the ideal situation.  I got the best of both worlds.  The La Mer eggs benedict was great.  Perfect little English muffin with crab meat, a poached egg, avocado, and glorious Hollandaise sauce.  Life's good. Substitute the bacon for crab and you've got the other benedict.  They both came with roasted potatoes with ROASTED GARLIC. Yes, ROASTED GARLIC Yummy!

I was also able to sample the French Toast Tahiti.  It's a winner.  Also, my sister and I went for an extra side of bacon to be even more decadent Americans =)  One this is certain: Zazie's defines good eats.
author: Jonathan Z.

description:
Tried Zazie out for dinner and sat at the table in the window nook. 

Food was really good! Mushroom polenta was tasty, but I could have used more of that yummy sauce. 

That duck dish I was told didn't have rice, which my friend found surprising.  

Rabbit was good as well and looked hearty. 

Corkage fee is a flat $12 and there's a $1.25 health charge per person.

Overall, cute French place that has 2 vegetarian options on their dinner menu... That I'm grateful that for. 

Also, the pipping hot bread that came out was delicious as well!

#vegetarian review
author: Eric H.

description:
Another item checked off on the 7x7 Big Eat SF List!

I came on a Sunday afternoon for brunch, and the wait wasn't too bad.  We waited for about 5 minutes and then were seated on the back patio.  It was slightly chilly, but they had heat lamps to keep us warm and toasty.

I ordered the Poached Eggs La Mer and Vince K. got Poached Eggs Florentine and Pinkie's Challah French Toast.  The food came out pretty fast, so I was able to fill my hungry tummy.  The eggs were cooked just right so that the yolk was still runny.  And the crab meat and avocado were a great combo.

This place has really good service and good food.  Its a very popular spot, so there's usually a wait on the weekends.  Make sure you go early or else you're hungry tummy will be waiting for a while.
author: Patra I.

description:
When i think of a great breakfast to bring friends to this spot is in my top 5 to bring em too.  Can be a bit crowded and a bit of a wait during busy hours especially the weekend.  They have a really cute patio in the back if the weather is nice outside.

This place has great service and I love the old style cottage decour.  Im a huge fan of their benedict and gingerbread pancakses
author: Christopher C.

description:
So, I feel a wee bit guilty for not reviewing this fine french restaurant. Especially because it's my most favorite brunch place in all the city. Which, as a young 20 something in this culinary induced city, is saying a lot. Lets start with the con's as every ending should be sweet as desert.

Cons: 

-Very small but in a charming way.
-The wait is a bit insane especially if it's around 10 am. it could be 10 mins to a hour and a half.
-One time for food was on the colder side, but I eat it with no complaint 
(yes it is that good)

Pros:

-The food is amazing. I love their eggs benedict. Some mornings I have a strong craving for them. Their gingerbread pancakes are also stelar. As well as their mimosas.
-There pricing is fair.
-They also, have a very cute back patio. 

Over all it's one of the best brunch places in sf and you can quote me on that!
author: diana b.

description:
Probably one of the better brunch spots in San Francisco. I'll start with the drawbacks: long line for weekend brunch, difficult to find parking. 

Other than those two drawbacks, the food and service is amazing. We shared the day's special omelette (chicken sausage, feta cheese, tomato), French toast Tahiti, and del Mer Benedict (the one with crab). Everything tasted great, service was great. I wish I could wait for an outdoor patio seat but I was too hungry (already waited for 1.5 hours. 

Tip: write your name down, take a walk around the neighborhood to work up your appetite :)
author: Daniel K.

description: Might be my favorite brunch food in SF. The crab Benedict is amazing! The only thing that sucks is the wait, but one time I showed up at 9:30 on a Saturday morning and there was one table for 2 immediately available! Best day ever.
author: Allison P.

description: The Tahiti French toast here blows my mind!!Also,try la mer, it's great!!Waiters here are super friendly. The place is very cozy and my parents and I had a very good time here.
author: Hin L.

description: Had a fantastic dinner here recently.  The menu is deep but not too deep, and the French food seems to have a mild California tweak, which broadens the options further.  One of the things that stood out was the staff.  This is no tip venue (prices include a "living wage, profit sharing, fully funded health & dental insurance, paid sick leave, paid maternity/ paternity leave, and a 401(k) with employer match").  From the moment we entered the restaurant, the staff were very friendly and knowledgeable.  In SF I'll come back to experience just that, but yes, the food was excellent too.  Thank you Zazie.
author: Luke F.

description: Went to Zazie for a brunch after some crazy SF night. We sat by the windows and ordered full breakfast plates with omelettes and hot coffee. The place was pretty packed and small, so you get a joyful chatty atmosphere in the morning, makes you feel at home when the whole family comes over for the weekend and everyone gets breakfast together. Food was amazing and in generous portion for a big breakfast hunger, and our waiter was crazy nice and immediately chatted with us when he realized we were foreigners. Will recommand the place for sure!
author: Delphine R.

description: If you do not mind waiting for a couple hours on a weekend you will not be disappointed.  Zazzies' many variations of eggs benedict are amazing. Not only is the food great but the runners and servers I have caught on several occasions singing :) if that is not a good sign, I don't know what is!
author: christyl s.

description:
The host who seated our party was an ass! 

Zazie has a cute back patio 

I enjoyed their Pinkie's Challah French Toast!
author: Arlynn A.

description:
Yum this place is great!

Came here for the first time on Sunday for brunch and immediately spotted the place a few blocks away when I saw the huge crowd of people waiting outside. The tables out in front are first come first serve and despite the huge line, nobody claimed them, so we were seated within 5 minutes of arriving.

The brunch menu is extensive and I had trouble picking something out. For the commitaphobic, it's great that you can choose to order 1, 2, or 3 pieces of the pancake and french toast. I eventually ordered the fontainbleu scrambled eggs with wheat toast and home fries and also ordered a side of one challah french toast with orange cinnamon batter. The scrambled eggs were fluffy, the roasted garlic home fries were greasy and delicious, and the challah french toast left me stuffed!
author: Bommy C.

description: I expected this place to be a bougie spot with great food, but no. It was just a over pretentious small restaurant that over charged. Here's the thing: At the bottom of the menu they explain that every person will be charged $1.25 in addition to their bill to 'pay for their worker's health insurance.' I was okay with this bullshit charge because a lot of Chinese restaurants do this as a 'tea charge.' However, I expected great service from this place because of this statement and due to the $20+ plates. Nope. I was wrong. Well, maybe the food would be dizzy dank. Nope. I was wrong. The service seemed a little off to me because we were Asian. Everyone else in there was white. The food was just okay. My lamb was dry as fuck (I couldn't even finish it, and if you know me, you know that that is absurd). My friend's salmon was good, but nothing mindblowing. To split a bill, an 18% gratuity is automatically added, which is also bullshit. When we left, they didn't even say a simple 'Bye' or 'Thank you.' I will never return and fuck you very much!
author: Nathan T.

description:
I would give this place a 3.5, but we don't get that option here. The place was small and packed, but I really liked the atmosphere. The wait wasn't too bad either and the bill also wasn't that much. 3 plates for 40 bucks. Pretty decent in my opinion.
Anyways I was recommended this place by my cousin. She really enjoyed the Egg Benedict Florentine, The French Toast, and the Pancake Sampler. 

Egg Benedict Florentine was ok. It wasn't bad nor was it amazing. I have had better benedicts in the past, but still pretty decent. The French Toast though was pretty amazing. One of the best ones I've had in awhile. Lastly the pancake sampler came with 3 different pancakes. Buttermilk, Gingerbread, and the other one was called Miracle something. The pancakes are probably one of the best pancakes I've had. Very tasty and not too doughy/floury.
author: Kevin Q.

description:
I've been here maybe 6 or 7 times, and the food was good, but this last time it wasn't that great. It was Sunday brunch. 

We waited over an hour for our table and when we finally got there the waiter didn't show up for another 10 minutes. When he finally came over (with a surly 'tude) he said, "what do you guys want?" No "hello," no "thanks for waiting." Some service, huh?! When our food arrived he never showed up again until we were done. (There was a mistake with our order, but the server was no where to be found, we ate it anyway, I mean we waited forever already at this point). Then we finally got the check, paid, left a 20 percent tip in cash (as I always do), and left the restaurant. 

Later, I went over my credit card statement and found that our server had left himself exactly a 20 percent tip on the credit card statement (having been a server before, I find this SUPER SKETCH). Nice. Had to call the credit card company and get it cleared up. Annoying. 

I'm never going back.
author: Lady W.

description: Came here twice. Once for brunch and once to take my gf on a date. It's a really good place. For some reason this place makes me want to order things I generally would not. The place is really good for a date. On a nice night, you could sit outside. The prices are what they are. They don't tax and they don't expect a tip. So you already know what you're paying. Their house porter is really good too.
author: Cëma M.

description:
My favorite place to get breakfast in Sunset and Cole Valley.
highly recommend: French Toast Tahiti and La Mer Benedict
author: Sophia B.

description: I LOVE ZAZIE!! The little patio area is adorable, and the service is fast and friendly! I am obsessed with ALL of their pancakes!
author: Cat M.

description:
Hmm. Read the good reviews and decided to check it out. Got a little lost in the neighborhood and called for directions. Lady answering seemed a little disoriented and not so helpful. Found some parking and scored the window seat (outside tables are cute too for sunny days.) Bathroom is super tiny and there is only one so it can be a long wait- just outside the kitchen.
Service was a little slow, they were busy at the beginning, but when things slowed down, the service didn't pick up. 
Ordered the La Mer Benedict... and was truly disappointed. It was dry crab cakes with and over-poached egg (yolk was solid) and lacked the hollandaise sauce. The cornmeal pancakes were much better and the lemon curd was delicious. The latte was enormous and the ice tea decent.
author: Naomi K.

description:
Zazie. What can I say? The food alone deserves a 5 star rating. Highlights include the Wild Smoked Salmon sandwich which had cream cheese and smoked salmon and onions, the French Toast Tahiti with caramelized bananas, and the Croque Madame. Also had some of the Croque Royale and I think it's safe to say that a Croque anything is going to be delicious, mostly in part to that tasty gruyere. I should have asked for the name of the brand! Ordered a round of mimosas which were really yummy, and strong. Or maybe I'm a lightweight because my face was red. Zazie has a bunch of different flavors of juice that you can choose for the mimosas too and I want to try them all. Oh and order any hot drink (I got the hot chocolate) because it comes out in cute and colorful little bowls!

The wait though?? An hour and 20 minutes! I have to take off a star for that. I get it, the food is bomb, but man it sucks to wait! Next time I'll have to go earlier. I do have to note that the man in charge of seating people, think his name is Mario(?), has created such a quick and efficient system and his customer service skills are excellent. He'll even run over to Tully's and the bar next door to get you when your table is ready if you let him know. He deserves a raise!
author: Mymy N.

description:
My boyfriend and I went here on the whim one night, hoping for breakfast foods at 9PM. Unfortunately, the place apparently doesn't serve a breakfast menu that late (unless we completely overlooked the breakfast menu some place..). Yelp! deceived us when we looked up breakfast joints at that time. Anywho, we were about to jet on out when we saw the average price on the menu was about 20 bucks per entree. But after much debate and delicious bread, we stayed. I ordered the NY steak--omg. It was truly medium rare. Grilled perfectly on the outside, and tender and just the right amount of rare on the inside. I loved it. The service was great and even considerate when I told him we were gonna skip dessert and head for BiRite's. He even recommended some flavors! 

My boyfriend on the other hand, felt like he got jipped. He ordered the ravioli for about twenty bucks and only got five pieces--which I do admit, I would have been mad too. But I wasn't. Steak...Yum.

I'd totally love to come back here for breakfast.
author: Sheri N.

description:
Confirming my 3-star review from two years ago.

Finally was able to return to check out Zazie again. Last time, I remember being underwhelmed so I wanted to doublecheck.

This time we went, and I got the Eggs in Fonte...and sadly have to say I was underwhelmed again. My friend got the Un, Deux, Trois (with french toast instead) and it also didn't look that exciting.

So, cute place, decent foods, but not wowed.
author: Jung-Ah Y.

description: Absolutely delicious, with a cozy feel and classy atmosphere.  Fresh ingredients were obviously the standard here.
author: Amy F.

description:
I'm updating and adding one star, because since couple of years I've realized Zazie is truly a BRUNCH spot. Still, nothing French about it, super American breakfast and brunch items. Which, by the way, you can order any day of the week. Yay.
If only these restaurants realized that wholewheat pancakes taste so much better than the pancakes made of white flour which only make me feel a bit funny...
author: Mien S.

description: Despite having to endure the typical couple that sits next to each other and feed one another at restaurants in my line of sight throughout my meal the last time I was here (*cue major eye rolling. Can we pass a bill to ban this?), Zazie's always comes through clutch when I'm in need of some great French Toast or Chicken Apple Sausage. Their potatoes are pretty dang amazing as well. On my 21st birthday last year, their mimosa was my first legal drink at a restaurant and it definitely hit the spot. Customer service is always great as the staff is really friendly. Try getting a seat on the patio if you can. It's always nice back there on a sunny day especially when you have a pretty date to impress like I did.
author: Puka N.

description:
Zazie's is a-ok.  I came here after I had my knee surgery and was craving some distraction to put the pain off lol.  The wait for me was about 15-30 minutes for an outside table, but I think that it was cuz I totally staked it out with my crutch and huge leg cast lol.  The servers were so sweet in accommodating me with an extra chair and I appreciate them for their help.  Parking here is a bust, so be prepared to make your rounds around the neighborhood.  

That being said, I wasn't thrilled with their food.  I had their french toast with fruit, and while it was good, it didn't blow me away.  The addition of fruit also cost me extra.  I tried my cousin's salmon plate, which was a lot better but one thing that I definitely have to praise is their mimosa!  It was so deeelic that I ordered 2 glasses of that nectar.
author: Mary N.

description:
What a charming establishment. First major plus: breakfast until 2:30 every day.

My partner and I stopped in on a Monday morning. Rustic and quant decor; I particularly like the spiral, wrought iron staircase to the right of the door (reminds me of Philly!). Interior is crowded despite the off time--about 11:10 or so--with only two recently-vacated tables available. We opt for the back patio seating (word?), which still sounds alluring despite a chilly, misty morning; we soon discover there are heat lamps, so this turns out to be an excellent move. We walk directly past the open dish station and kitchen to get outside: green wooden bench seating along the perimeter, rattan bistro chairs, green metal tables, wooden deck, greenery with flowers growing along the top of the property-dividing wall. Overall, excellent aesthetic outside.

The latte my partner ordered was enormous and served in a giant bowl-like apparatus. My coffee was on par and never dipped below half-full.

We order the Eggs Benedict Divorcee (special: bacon, avocado, fontina cheese) and the Eggs Benedict Monaco (proscuitto and tomatoes provencales): both dishes were cooked perfectly. The combinations of ingredients worked well, and the lemon flavor of the Hollandaise sauce complimented both dishes nicely, giving an added refreshing element to the meal. 

The Lemon-Ricotta Pancake special definitely stole the show--one is definitely NOT enough, as we learned the hard way. Soft and springy, moist and plump, the creaminess of the ricotta was translated nicely into the finished product, with just the right amount of tang from Meyer lemon. A Meyer lemon and raspberry puree adorned the top of this fluffy treasure and finished the dish perfectly--skip the syrup!

$1.25/guest surcharge ensures "full benefits for our hardworking staff
[including health insurance, dental insurance, and an employer funded 401(k)]." This is a novel concept to me, but one about which I am ambivalent: why would you intentionally manifest to your guests the fact you are surcharging them? To show you are committed to employee welfare? Why not just build said benefits into the business plan?

Despite this confounding surprise at the finish, I will definitely return to this neighborhood gem.
author: Justin M.

description: Fantastic brunch, the eggs benedict are on point and worth the wait!
author: Melissa Y.

description: Perfect day to get patio seating! I didn't even know about the patio until I got there hahaha it was so cute! The service was good and the food was AMAZING. I saw pictures and reviews about the pancakes and french toast and was dying to try them, but I didn't know there were like 5 different options! So lucky for me, there was the Sarah Janes Griddle Flight (or something like that) and it included "sampler" sizes of 1 buttermilk pancake, 1 gingerbread pancake, and 1 french toast! From the first to last bite, it was just a journey of yummy-ness. I think the buttermilk pancake was probably one of the best I've ever had. The gingerbread one was my least favorite but it was still good. I picked the french toast tahiti and I liked it a lot, but I wouldn't suggest it unless you really like bananas because they load that shit on. My friend got like the lox bagel and the dungeness crab benedict I believe. I only took a bite out of the benedict but it was enough for me to say that it was really good. Better than squat and gobbles, they actually used fresh crab meat here.. Anyways, our main dishes were incredible, but the shining star was the housemade cream cheese coffee cake! Every bite was perfection. It was warm and moist and the cream cheese just topped it off! The portion was huge too! I mean it was $7 but I guess we paid what it's worth. I couldn't stop eating it, so I definitely recommend getting that to start you off. Zazie's is one hell of a brunch place. No doubt am I coming back to try their other dishes!
author: Holly P.

description:
There is nothing more terrifying than arriving somewhere you want to eat and seeing it flooded with people- inside and out.
Fortunately, since it was brunch people were out quick and we were seated within 35-45 minutes or arriving. 
Despite the large amount of hungry people in a small place, the service is still incredible and the staff will regularly check up on you to see if you need anything.
The food is spectacular! I can literally say this is the best brunch I've ever had.
I ordered the Florentine poached eggs dish with 2 eggs and a side of fries. Delicious!
Light, yet flavorful. And surprisingly the fries (more like potato chunks) were well seasoned and a highlight of the dish. Good thing I wasn't in the mood for salad!
We also got French Toast Tahiti. Oh man, I already loved banana bread and taking caramelized bananas and walnuts and putting it in french toast was the next level for me!
It was warm, sweet but not too sweet with maple syrup for you to amp it up yourself! If autumn had a flavor, this embodies it!
Will be back here soon, do recommend!
author: Veronica L.

description: Sat outside on the back terrace on a beautiful sunny morning. Delicious breakfast with bottomless cup of coffee and terrific attentive service. This is as good as it gets.
author: Carl F.

description:
decided to try this French cafe for brunch on a weekend SF trip. So yes, I came as a tourist and not a local. Popular spot for brunch as the wait was about an hour, but I didn't mind. 

Our table had: poached eggs la mer, challah french toast with fruit, and an omelette. For beverages, we had the following mimosas: peach sorbet with currant, mango, and elderflower.

The poached eggs la mer had nice big chunks of crab meat with nicely poached eggs on top. 

The omelette was fluffy and delicious.

The french toast was yummy as well, not too sweet, and the fresh fruit complemented the french toast well. Can't go wrong with freshly cut fruit!

Mimosas were great too! around $10 a piece, but they have a great deal where you can get a bottle of champagne and a pitcher of juice for like.. 20? 20something? We wanted to try different flavors so we opted out of that deal. I think my favorite was the mango mimosa, although the sorbet made me feel fancy haha. But you can add a scoop of peach sorbet to any mimosa for an additional charge. 

The table next to us had a side of house potatoes with their dish, and the potatoes had big cloves of roasted garlic in it... and they smelled delicious... next time i shall have the potatoes...

Cute little cafe with delicious food. And an adorable little loo!
author: Lily C.

description: wonderful dinner menu. all dishes cooked to perfection. Duck is exquisite, the salmon with right amount of sauce and vegetables, quality above all.Excellent atmosphere!
author: Mariel A.

description:
Wow! Great food, friendly staff, awesome place! Cole Valley is a bit out of my usual stomping grounds but I am so glad that I ventured out here! My friends and I came here after a recommendation from Sosh and it obviously the word has gotten out about the greatness of this gem because it was packed! The outside tables are first come first served so if you're sneaky enough you might not have to wait, for the amount of people that were waiting I was pleasantly surprised by the 25 minute wait on a Saturday for brunch. They have a pretty efficient system and multiple options of seating (inside, patio, and outside)

I love the options of this restaurant also! You can choose how many of an item you get. So if you want a little bit of sweet and savory you can get a piece of their scrumptious stuffed french toast. And then get one poached egg la mer (poached egg with Dungeoness Crab, Avocado, and topped with light hollandaise sauce) The food was absolutely phenomenal. I can't wait to come back and try more!

I can't recommend this restaurant more! This will definitely become a regular in the rotation!
author: Megan S.

description:
Wow! This place was absolutely delicious. My partner and I managed to get in before the Friday lunch crowd with a 5-10 minute wait, which was pretty fantastic. With the numerous options of mimosas, it was a must to at least try one. We ordered the Sunshine and the Bourgogne, and they were so amazing. The Bourgogne was by far our favorite, and we were very glad our waiter recommended it when deciding between that and one on the specials list with coconut sorbet. 

If you're unable to decide between which pancake or french toast option to choose from, the Sarah Jane Griddle Flight was fantastic. You could try them all! The original pancake was by far my favorite with its lightness and fluffiness that could absorb the syrup we poured. We also got the La Mer Poached Eggs, and that was equally delicious. It was well-balanced and cooked perfectly.  You could really enjoy the crab, muffins, eggs, avocado, and other ingredients. Best of all it wasn't oversalted, which  tends to happen with seafood brunch items at other establishments.

I will definitely go back, and if they had bottomless mimosas, I'd never leave.
author: O L.

description:
Umm.. Zazie has always been a distant dream and desire for me mainly because of its distance from me. About two months ago, I finally woke up earlier than usual and bused there for a brunch date. I mean it was a great day because there was no line and it was sunny, crazy. We were seated quickly and ordered the poached eggs with spinach and mushrooms and French toast Tahiti. It took awhile for the orders to come but it was okay because I got to have a nice talk in a nice place. And I understand that the kitchen is tiny and there are a lot of orders to make.  Both plates were amazing, the eggs were done perfectly and the French toast was just beautiful with the glazed banana and walnuts. The whole experience was flawless, including my visit to the bathroom. In this jam packed place, the bathroom is super tiny and the door and lock match this place very well. The door is a sliding door and the lock is only a hook. 

Food is TERRIFIC. Service is pretty good. Love the atmosphere and the bathroom is just omg. Will definitely go back if it's a weekday and if I decide to wake up early because it's just way too far.
author: Lily L.

description: While dating a San Franciscan long-distance, I have fond memories of jumping off my plane at SFO, enduring a super shuttle ride to Cole Valley, and heading directly to Zazie's back patio for romantic dinners. Everything I've had here has been amazing - the mussels, the fish soup, the trout, and the crispy duck leg - all delicious.  Desserts were always decadent, especially the seasonal fruit crumble and the creme brûlées.  If you have a big enough appetite, their Prix Fixe dinner is an amazing deal - $25 for three courses.  As many other Yelpers have mentioned, the brunch here is also excellent, but I'm just more of a dinner kind of gal.  Now that my California girl has relocated to my city, I've missed this place terribly!
author: Andrea P.

description:
Zazie's a great place for brunch.  Came here with a friend to catch up.

I had the crab benedict.  Good thing about this place is that you can have 1, 2 or 3 egg choice - depending on your appetite!

It comes with a side of potatoes with lots of big chunks of roasted garlic.

I've also had the croque madame here and loved it too!
author: JJAMZ C.

description: Stopped by here for brunch and it was so worth it. We had a handsome and friendly waiter who was so helpful with suggestions. I ordered the sour cream poppyseed miracle pancakes with lemon curd and strawberry , I've never had such amazing pancakes. The flavors were perfectly balanced and the portion size was just right. Dad ordered the polenta with eggs from the specials menu(i don't remember the proper name). It had spicy tomato sauce and perfectly cooked mushrooms and spinach. The eggs were runny but well cooked and the polenta was soft and flavorful. The piece de resistance for me was that they add a 1.25% charge which provides healthcare, dental and employee benefits. It's nice to know that they treat employees well . I'd definitely repeat this if I had more time in San Fran (:
author: Prathima G.

description: Incredible food... From the french onion soup I've been craving since I was last there to the creamy mushroom ravioli and the steak that was cooked to perfection.. Hats off to you!!
author: Hiba S.

description:
The good and the bad...

The bad first:
The back patio smells like trash.  No way to put this nicely, it straight-up smelled like trash.  We were smart and moved inside before we ordered and the waitress out there got all huffy and snatched up the waters and walked away.

The good:
We went inside and it was much more pleasant and had a much nicer waitress.  The food was great, and my favorite thing, strangely enough, was the home fries (potato wedges), they had incredible flavor.  We also got pancakes (sampler with the best being a "miracle" pancake made of bread pudding) and some good scrambled eggs.  The mimosa was way over priced for the lack of flavor and tiny size, but otherwise everything was solid.
author: Vince P.

description: Such a cute restaurant! I recommend sitting on the outside patio. It's really cute and the perfect atmosphere for a morning brunch. Also, you can never go wrong with their mango mimosa or the La Mer. Not only is it a cute atmosphere but the food is delicious!
author: Erin S.

description:
Beef shank was well cooked and fell off the bone nicely but did not have much flavor.

Same goes for the roasted trout which did not have crisp skin and lacked salt. 

Blandness. Chef needs to muster up courage to flavor dishes.

Chocolat Chaud beautifully presented with baked marshmallows on top. Delicious but we were hoping for more complexity in the chocolate (cinnamon or pepper anyone?).  This was plain melted chocolate.

Service good.
author: M Y.

description: Zazie has slipped in their evening service. I always have a reservation, yet these days we usually get water near the end of the meal, drinks come well after we've been seated most times waiting 10+ minutes for a waiter to even greet the table. The evening wait staff is so aloof. It's weird, and again I come here all the time. You'd think that would count for something. I prefer the dinner food, yet prefer the on-point, efficient, and friendly staff during brunch. What to do, what to do.
author: SF M.

description: Celebrated my mother's 85th birthday at Zazie. From the coffee to our breakfast entrée we were very satisfied! Service could've been better but didn't put a hamper on our morning. We will be back.
author: Carmen D.

description: This is by far the best brunch place I have been to. I had the eggs florentine with hard poached eggs. It was amazing. The hollandaise sauce is a winner! Their home fries is very tasty and the garlic in it adds an amazing zing to it. Love their pancakes too. The only downside is waiting for at least an hour to be seated but if you do it will be worth it.
author: Arvind G.

description:
Small charming and cozy French restaurant near Golden Gate Park. They open at 5:30pm for dinner, and it fills up fast! Their menu is pretty short but everything on it looks fun and interesting to try. 

I got the Fresh Black Truffle and Porcini Raviolis, which was amazing and delicious. I love mushrooms and cheese so this was a perfect combination of everything I like. It's served on a huge plate which makes the dish look small but is actually really filling!

For dessert we had the bread pudding, which is big enough to share for two people. Bread was very soft and chewy and went well with the ice cream. 

Took off a star because the wait staff didn't seem that friendly. Our waitress seemed impatient even though they had just opened for dinner. I tried asking for suggestions because the menu looked complicated, but she wasn't that helpful. Was a little disappointed but at least the food made up for it!
author: Connie C.

description: We went there on a Tuesday night for a special occasion dinner and the service was excellent.  They do take reservations and I used the "Open Table" app. All of reviews I see on Yelp are for brunch and a breakfast type of fare. This will be a dinner review.  The food was even better, my wife had the Trout dish and i had the French Provencal fish soup. Both were on the pre-fixe dinner list for $37.00 and it is a very good value. The pre-fixe dinner includes an appetizer, main course and desert.  All one needs, plus on Tuesday night you are encouraged to bring your own wine with no corkage fee. We brought a Bonny Doon wine, a eight year old Clos de Gilroy, it went well with the meal.  They were not familiar with Bonny Doon in spite of the fact Randall Graham the owner is in the Culinary Hall of fame, they seem to have a preference for french wines. Oh well. had the mussels for the appetizer and they were in a Garlic cream sauce that was the best part of the meal for me.  My wife's appetizer was the chicken pate with brandy sauce.  She said it the best she has had in a long time.  The main course the French Fish soup had a vegetable base to it, but it is filled with lots of salmon, mussels (more) and other fish.  Very good hearty fare,  Yet plenty of delicate flavors.   My wife's Trout was completely de-boned had a lemon butter sauce to die for.   To top it off, the Deserts were as good as the main courses.  My wife's Cream Broule was hard on top and wonderfully smooth on the inside, as it should be.   My Creme au Chocolate and very delicious not too sweet, just right a dark chocolate dish.  This restaurant has a no tipping policy, as according to their website their employees are well compensated including a medical and 401K plan.  To sum up a great meal for under $80.00, a nice bistro atmosphere, good service by a knowledgeable wait staff.
author: John F.

description:
Just ok. I don't normally mind waiting to eat breakfast as long as the food is absolutely worth it. This, in my opinion, wasn't. We waited over an hour for a table and were quite excited to finally be seated. We ordered eggs benedict, a waffle and a side of poached eggs. Two of the three poached eggs on my plate were undercooked and tasted very strongly of vinegar, to the point of overpowering the egg itself. So were my husband's eggs. He also said the waffle was average at best. The seasoning on the eggs and hollandaise was quite good, the taste of vinegar notwithstanding.
Oh, the bathroom looked quite dirty, too.
Overall, given the high price tag, we weren't very impressed and are not likely to go back. There are much better breakfast options out there.
author: The A.

description:
Was in the mood for some eggs, and decided to have brunch here.  I ordered an English muffin topped with dungeness crab a poached egg, and hollandaise sauce.  I egg was beautifully poached and spewed with golden yellow deliciousness when I forked it open.  The hollandaise sauce was rich and tasty.  

The service was awesome too.  I sat outside to enjoy the beautiful day, but the waitress still made frequent trips to see if everything was okay, and to refill water.  

A totally awesome experience!
author: Edward N.

description:
I thought the brunch was very good. I went during Outside lands weekend. 

They send you to the bar next door while you wait for your table which is really fun and has a great back patio. They come and get you when the table is ready which is awesome.

The food was really really good. I thought it was better than some other places that are higher rated on Yelp. 

Good atmosphere, friendly waitstaff, and delicious. Trifecta.
author: Kate C.

description:
Today's brunch...
Mango Mimosa 
Bloody Mary
Cream cheese Coffee Cake
French Toast Tahiti
Gingerbread pancakes
Poached eggs La Mer

The stars were definitely the Bloody Mary (made very close to my own with lots of fresh horseradish and cracked pepper),
Coffee Cake, (the warm cream cheese takes it over the top)
FRENCH TOAST TAHITI (probably the best french toast I've ever had... the caramelized bananas in between the slices are like a warm compote.  So very, very good!)

Gingerbread pancakes were good, but not enough for a reorder on my next visit.
The La Mer was done perfectly also... but Crab Benedict with avocado is what it is... Pretty much third place in commonality behind a regular ham Benedict or Florentine.
Pretty sure its canned crab meat...  Not necessarily a bad thing, but could you imagine how killer it would be with fresh Dungeness and some crab butter mixed into the Hollandaise?

Still.  I'd put this up there with my favorite breakfast/brunch spots in The City.
author: Barry A.

description: This is one of the best places for breakfast/brunch.  It can get pretty packed though even on a weekday.  The servers are nice and the food is excellent.  Make sure to their Miracle Pancakes and Tahiti French Toast.
author: Gia A.

description: I love this place! The food is always incredible, the staff is super friendly, and the atmosphere is romantic and unpretentious. This place has a special place in my heart for sure! I've greatly enjoyed coming here over the years. Ah, the memories.
author: Rebeca B.

description:
WOW!  This review is long overdue.  My wife and I are frequent diners at Zazie and we can't seem to get enough of it.  The breakfast is incredible but the long waits can get a bit annoying, so we actually prefer to dine here for dinner (they take dinner reservations, not breakfast reservations).  The backside patio is awesome, they provide heaters and blankets if you are feeling a bit chilly, the atmosphere is really great and the menu is superb!  While they seem to keep some staple items on their menu at all times, quite a few of their dishes are changing frequently, which makes each experience a little more fun and exciting, and if it hasn't changed, we are usually just as excited because we know whatever we order will be fantastic.  We love the Tuesday night no corkage fee night, and it you can't come here on a Tuesday, I think their corkage fee is only $12, which is very reasonable and well worth it if you want to enjoy a quality bottle of wine that you have been saving at home with an incredible meal!  They also offer a quality wine list if you don't bring your own!

Dishes we love:

Appetizer:  
Assiette de Fromages - Cheese plate with all three cheeses and their figs, simply awesome, the toasted walnut levin that comes with it is perfect!
Salade Louis Malle - We love the caramelized walnuts and gorgonzola on this salad, it's great!
French Onion Soup Gratinee - I'm a huge fan of French onion soup, this one is good, but not the best I have ever had, the bread that comes on top of it could be a bit crispier.  But if you have a craving for French onion soup, go for it, you probably won't be disappointed, it gets the job done.

Dinner:  
Lamb Tagine - Awesome, I love this dish, it's new, and I hope it stays on their menu for awhile.
Truite aux Noisettes - Broiled white trout with toasted hazelnuts is awesome, I love the salad that comes with it, it keeps it light and refreshing  
They recently offered a Rabbit dish that was delicious but I'm not sure if it still on their menu.
Their duck is usually great as well. 
 I know everyone usually raves about the pork chop, I'm just not a pork chop kind of guy, I have tried it, but I wasn't blown away by it.
The grilled niman ranch hanger steak is good but definitely not the best hanger steak I have ever had, I would go with something else rather than the steak.
The Fish Soup Provencale is great too, definitely worth a try if you have a craving for fish soup!
They used to offer a beef shank dish served over vegetables and potato's that I loved!  Unfortunately this dish is no longer on the menu, but I'm hoping it will return sometime soon, it was GREAT!!

Dessert: 
Baked Chocolat Chau -We love the hot chocolate cake dessert, it's one of the best desserts we've had in a long time, and the melted marshmallows that come on top of it are awesome with just the right amount of crisp!!  Be careful though, the dish that it is served in is super hot!
Les Deux Cremes - We love crème brule, this dessert offers a crème brule and a separate chocolate dessert as well that is great if you have the craving for both!

Long story short, if you can't make it here for breakfast, definitely try it for dinner!  You will not be disappointed!  Oh, and I forgot to mention, the staff has always been tentative and polite to us, they are busy, but we still seem to get great service!
author: Drew H.

description: This place has a lot of hype, and after the hour wait, I can't say that it was worth it. The atmosphere is charming and the service was quick, but I didn't find the food to be superior. I got the Albert, and the poached eggs were good. The hollandaise was very light, the cheese was not melted, the English muffins were tough, and I got about 6 potatoes and about 15 cloves of garlic. Overall, I've definitely had better.
author: Danielle C.

description: Omagosh. I was super impressed with the menu here. I love that you can order smaller plates and customize your brunch. And the food was spectacular. I can't way to go back and try the oatmeal brûlée!
author: Jennifer M.

description: This is one of my bookmarked restaurants to try in San Francisco. Luckily my wait was about 10 minutes on a weekday around 12 noon. Jon, my server was very nice throughout my dining experience. I like that the Brunch menu gives you the options to choose the portion that you would like to have. For example, you can order 1, 2 or 3 slices of pancake(s). Therefore, I took the advantage to order 1 poached egg and 1 slice of french toast. The egg was perfect. The only downside was that the food was not hot enough when they were brought to the table.
author: Lianna D.

description: This place is a gem. The food is always outstanding and the service is consistently great. Definitely has a local feel to it. The French onion soup is to die for and I love the fresh, homemade ravioli. Start everything off with warm bread rolls. Lovely atmosphere with a cozy heated back patio. One of my absolute faves!
author: Kate H.

description: Tooooooooo loooooooong of a wait!!! Never go on Sat, Sun!!! not with kids never.
author: Niki H.

description: IMHO, one of the most overrated brunch places in San Francisco. I've been told this was one of the spots I must visit, so I gave it a try... They accept reservations, BUT you have to come THERE and put your name on the list. After almost an *hour and a half* of waiting (!!) we finally got our patio table. Service was good. Food, below average. I have no idea why this place is so over-hyped, it must be some hipster thing I just don't understand. It was also a bit pricey compared to similar places. Patio felt cheap, like someone opened a restaurant in their house back yard.
author: Igor P.

description:
This is a really late review for November...buttt 
I think what made them earn the 5-stars is the French Toast Tahiti!!! 
It was just AMAZING. and i couldn't get enough of it... 

Although the Florentine Spinach and Mushrooms was really good too, but my breath was taken away from the french toast!! sadly the Omelette was just so-so
author: Alice K.

description:
After a 20 minute wait, I ate here for lunch. The fish soup was OK at best. I have eaten many times here before and I feel that the service has gone down over time and now the food is mediocre. I requested my Pinot Noir by the glass to be freshly opened bottle. The waiter said he can not do that as there are too many bottles from last night that need to be finished first. I greatly appreciate this guy's honesty (instead of bringing me a one day old wine and telling me he just opened it). But I don't understand why it is so difficult to open a fresh bottle when the customer specifically requests it. The food was OK and wasn't worth a 20 minute wait. 

I like their brunches. I do not like their lunch food anymore.
author: bora o.

description:
A little overhyped and always has a wait but a pretty solid restaurant. 

Service is excellent and back patio is amazing. Lattes and coffee are great. I love my latte in a big mug! 

The home fries are a little bland. 

Would be nice if they could indicate gluten free options.
author: K C.

description:
I don't think there's a single thing on Zazie's brunch or dinner menu that is not good! 

Last week my boyfriend and I had an evening dinner on their patio, and it was lovely. The "Poisson De Papillote" was *incredible*, try it! 

It goes without saying their brunch is fantastic and one of the best brunches you can have in SF. Just be weary that they don't take reservations, so arrive right at 8am when they open.

The staff has consistently been kind, helpful and friendly.

I only knock one star off because it's high time Zazie did something about their line, besides a list. They could for starters put out a few benches on the side or curb for people waiting. They could also take reservations for brunch like they do for dinner. And how about using mobile technology to signal customers with a 20+ minute wait? We're in San Francisco after all!
author: Anastasia T.

description:
Due to my dairy ... let's say "issues,"
I practically needed some tissues
when the pancakes were my sin
due to the buttermilk within,
so I was off to put the rest of the menu to use.

My eggs were fine but a bit too loose,
though the bacon made up for that goose.
I did have to try bites
of those pancake delights,
and holy shit! did I wish my allergies would vamoose!

My nod goes to the gingerbread and pear,
though my date was happy to give that up to share.
His vote went to the original,
a true pancake vertiginal (!)
and we both agreed this was all-around-good breakfast fare.
author: Megan J.

description: Came here for dinner on Saturday eve. There were no reservations available, but we stopped in at 6pm or so and it was not a problem to find nearly any seat we wanted. The waiter was very sweet and showed us the heated back patio and told us that we can choose to sit inside if we didn't like it. We ate outside and shared dishes: steak, fettuccine, rabbit, and lemon ricotta raviolis. Everything was so delicious. Their warm bread and butter to start was a great beginning to an even better evening. The dishes took a bit to come out, but we needed the time because we ordered a charcutterie plate to start out. The reviews for brunch look really good as well. I'll try that later!
author: M M.

description:
Cute breakfast spot with too long of a wait. I advise putting your name in and then grabbing coffee at Peet's.

I had a pretty delicious breakfast here. My BFF and I ordered up a bottle of champagne with berry syrup and OJ, eggs benedict with garlic potatoes and a couple coffees.

Coffee was okay - not so delicious that I found myself going through more than one cup.

The mimosa mixers were decent.

The food was delicious and indulgent. One of the best breakfasts I have had in SF (LA has way more killer breakfast spots, in my theory, because no one goes to work there). 

The breakfast potatoes were a dream. They give you a healthy serving of garlic to smash on top of any and every bite. 

I'm definitely interested in going here for dinner after checking out their menu online.
author: Sabrina S.

description:
What a perfect little French cafe, with a truly lovely brunch.  This was the last meal nice meal I had in SF before our flight.  It was a Tuesday, so I figured it wasn't as crowded as a weekend, in which this place was packed.  We were able to secure a table outside in the sun, which was wonderful.

They have a unique brunch in which you can order how many eggs you want for your meal.  This gives you a chance to try different things, I guess.  They had a special eggs benefit with fresh crab, so I ordered two of those eggs.  My fiance went with only one of these eggs and then ordered the coffee cake.  He was feeling a little salty and sweet, I guess.

The server was super nice and took our order right away.  She was super busy so it was difficult for her to be fully attentive, but I could see she was trying.

Food came out after a little bit and it was really delicious.  Great Hollandaise sauce and the eggs were cooked well.  It was a little pricey for a typical eggs benedict but the ingredients were top quality, so I don't mind paying a little more.  

It was a lovely way to end our vacation.
author: Jaci H.

description:
Food was great. However my roommate at the time and I went speifically for the lemon poppyseed pancakes, but they werent serving them!!

So I went with ..... i think it was a pumpkin spice which was tasty as well.
Food was great and the cofee was good.
There was a line, we got there before the real rush and waited about 15 minutes.

I wanted to go to the sunny patio but was just happy to sit and eat.
Homey feeling, but I wouldnt say there was a French atmoshpere.

Thinking about eating here makes me want to round up the friends for sunday!
author: Ash R.

description:
Great for Brunch! 

Come here on a Saturday, on Sunday it is way to crowded and the line takes forever. Eat outside in the patio! They have tons of umbrellas so the sun is not in your face. 

Also the tables on the outside, in front of the restaurant, is a first come first serve basis, so I have heard...  You don't have to sign up for it. You just sit down. 

I had the mango mimosa, pretty good. Get a poached egg dish! They are known for it. I had spinach and mushroom poached egg and it was amazing. I also had a side of bacon. Delicious, thick crispy and with a smokey flavor. Finally, I also had a slice of French toast with fruit. It was also good, perfect amount of egg on the toast. The toast was not soggy at all! 

I would say the star of the meal was the poached egg and the side of bacon. It will not disappoint.
author: Jamie T.

description: I have been putting off trying this place out due to several different circumstances.  Either I forgot about this place after awhile or I didn't wanna drive, or ended up somewhere else but after finally trying this place out, I was not disappointed at all.   When you first walk into Zazie, the high ceilings caught my eye.  The workers there were very friendly and welcoming as my friend and I entered and although they were quite busy, we were seated immediately outside on the patio where we could enjoy the ambiance of the outdoors.   I looked at the menu and I must admit, it was quite pricy.   However, you definitely pay for the the quality.   I went with the St. Trop poached eggs which did not disappoint at all.   The eggs were perfectly cooked and there were just the right about of onions and salmon w/ capers.   Their homemade fries which are just garlic roasted potatoes added a filling touch to the meal.   My friend ordered the breakfast special which at the time was called La Mer which was what I got but instead of smoked salmon with onions, it was crab with avocado.   I had a bite and it was equally delicious.   Overall, I'm glad I tried this place.   I would have given them 5 stars but I'm not used to paying $15avg for breakfast but other than that, I would recommend this place to anyone wanting to try a good breakfast place =)  One thing I may add is that unless you live around the area, all of the parking is street parking and with a 30min limit.
author: Shelly W.

description: Their brunch is life changing. Whatever the wait is - do it. It is beyond worth it. Dinner there is delicious, too, and I was impressed by the variety on their dessert menu. The people there are so friendly, I feel like the star of a Disney movie walking through their restaurant passing smiles and people greeting me. This place is special. Go there. Right now. So good.
author: Casey H.

description:
Amazing food. Went in for dinner for 6. Had no problem putting tables together to accommodate. Ordered salmon, spinach and potatoes with a side of Mac and Cheese. The side did not come until after the meal so they apologized and waived it from the bill. The waiter made excellent suggestions which we all followed and were extremely happy with. 

The muscles were delicious and the broth they are cooked in was iron chef worthy.
Overall amazing restaurant.
author: Josh S.

description:
Wow what a great place brunch place!  The line is kinda crazy but the best part is that you can put your name on the list and mark that you are next door at the bar and they will come get you.  

Brunch:

Le Mer Poarched Egg  - WOW it was wonderful.  Generous with the crab.  You have the choice of ordering 1-3 eggs.  Great flavors!  It's served with garlic homefries which I absolutely love!  The big cloves of garlic was very delicious! Huge fan of it.

French Toast Taihiti - Delicioius.  Fluffy French Toast with banana on top.  Wonderful dish.  Probably good by itself.  I ordered too much like always :) 

This place is definitely worth the wait.
author: Ying F.

description:
100th review! And Zazie is worth it.

Finally made it to Zazie this last weekend when my uncle was in town. I'm not one for lines but we just ran the land's end trail, was a beautiful day out, and just sitting on the curb and catching up with family was a perfect way to wait. Surprisingly, the wait was only 20 minutes for 2 on a Sunday! All this to say, the line goes faster than you would expect.

It was an eggs and toast kind of day (meaning I must return to try the benedicts), so I ordered just the two eggs with potatoes and fresh bread. The toast was thick and delicious as were the organic eggs. They started making in house salsa but I wasn't the biggest fan (tomatillo sauce for those of you that like that) so I stuck with some tapatio.
