I've found it good, but not great. And sometimes not-so-great, when they rush things (my boyfriend got raw egg whites in his eggs once, and my food has been lukewarm/cold a couple of times). I've never been bowled over by anything here, and I'm not exactly the toughest customer, either.

If it were up to me or my boyfriend, we would never bother coming here again. And, yet, our friends who want to meet up always seem to....
author: Jason M.

description: Zazie has become our total go to restaurant.  Cole Valley is so much more pleasant than Haight Street.  I've been there three times in the last week, twice for brunch and last night for a birthday dinner.  We had made reservations for last night for our party of six. They called to confirm (and were so happy I called them back).  Our table was reserved.  Food is excellent, and reasonably priced.  We almost always have friendly, fantastic service and last night was no exception.  They very kindly asked the dinner host if I would be embarrassed about a birthday candle and singing, which I thought was very considerate!
author: Jenchris M.

description:
why did i not like this place the first time around?!? i have no idea...

this is one of the only brunch places i like going to that's opened on mondays!!!  i love their challah french toast, crab benedict, and i recently tried the challah french toast with strawberry mint butter, which i thought sounded kinda weird, but it was DELICIOUS! i love how they serve their water in cute little glass bottles. the service is nice. the wait isn't too bad on a monday. parking is not too bad it seems.

and the most AWESOME part about the wait is... you get to put yourself on the waitlist on an iPAD! pretty creative if you ask me. there's 3 iPADs by the door, 1 to show the waitlist, 1 to put yourself onto the waitlist, and 1 for employees only. overall, this is a cutsie place, try sitting in the back patio on a hot day enjoying a nice brunch. that's the way to go.
author: Tina S.

description: wow...the rudest host/manager i have ever encountered. They couldnt accommodate my existing reservation until 45 min later than original time AND gave me attitude about it. thanks for ruining my night and please check your ego Zazie. I know you have a line out the door for your brunch, but that doesnt mean you can treat your loyal customers like crap.
author: Bubliki T.

description:
Referring to the food at Zazie as "French" is a bit far-fetched, but regardless of the mélange of their menu items, almost everything I had there was excellent, very well prepared and freshly made!  Also, I'm a big sucker for café au lait in a bowl the size of a small child's head.

The only thing that stops me from going there more often is the long wait ... sometimes 30min to an hour ... and the bipolar service ... some days they're courteous and warm, and other days, they act as if you're a nuisance.  

Nevertheless, it is one of my favorite brunch/lunch places in the city, and even with the occasional abuse, I will keep going back.
author: S. I.

description:
I woke up this morning and I was french! Must have been from the awesome date night me and my gal had last night at Zazie! Love this place...
They have a great deal with the appetizers. Try 3 for $16. I know! Great! 
We had 3 of the appetizers, all of which were stellar, and then split a main dish. Was great!
Get their chocolate dessert thing with the marshmallow melted on top. I was drunk on chocolate gluttony goodness with that monster.
author: Cat S.

description:
This is my favorite brunch place in the city. Highly recommend the French Toast Tahiti (with caramelized bananas and walnuts).  Good crisply bacon and excellent home fries (with whole cloves of garlic).

Expect a long wait on the weekends unless you get there right when they open.  The outdoor patio in the back is excellent.  This is usually a good option even on foggy days since they have plenty of heaters back there.
author: Patrick R.

description:
After being almost delirious with hunger from the 45 min. wait, it was all worth the time.  Anyways, it was a beautiful day, chill out get some sun, have some coffee and walk around and enjoy the neighborhood.  After putting your name up you'll be able to tell how long you've got from the crowd outside.  The maitre'de, Mario was very cool and seemed to be ok with putting you somewhere near the top of the list if you missed your call.  

To the food...we had the Pierre & the La Mer.  Both were mouthwatering!  These guys make some ridiculous egg's benedicts.  The egg's are poached perfect, the sauce is the perfect thickness, amount & flavor and everything blended together nicely.  I f-up and only got the two egg portion...definitely go for 3.  It's made so well and everything is portioned just right that you won't be too stuffed or feeling to guilty afterwards.  Highly recommend this place. Killer neighborhood vibe...nice outdoor patio too.
author: Ramon L.

description: Great place for brunch in a quaint neighborhood spot. The line can be long, so plan ahead. Service is great, but the host managing the line is incredibly stressed. This seems to be par for the course with list managers on Saturday/Sunday mornings. Anyway, the tables out front are first come first served. As for the food... it's all good!
author: Calvin W.

description: What a quaint place! We got a table outside on the back patio. It was a gorgeous day with such a relaxing feel! We enjoyed the poached eggs with mushrooms & spinach - sensational! We also enjoyed their traditional french toast which was also quite tasty.
author: Mindy N.

description:
*** This review is specifically for Brunch ***

Zazie, I heart you. I've been wanting to visit and try you for so long, and today I finally got to. 

Ever since I went on a Brunch craze a couple months ago, I wanted to find somewhere in the Bay Area to try. Zazie's reviews caught my eye, and the menu made it a definite that I wanted to visit someday. The timing was never right, but this week while my girlfriend was in town for New York City, we decided to try it out. Before heading to Zazie, I already knew what I wanted to try (definitely did my menu and review researching before, there's so many options and I want to be sure to try the best ones). 

My friend and I ordered the French Toast Tahiti, Gingerbread Pancakes, La Mer (poached eggs), and Florentine (poached eggs). First off, all four dishes were so delicious - I really liked that each ingredient in the dishes tasted perfect and were cooked to perfection. Usually I'm not a fan of anything sweet, but the French Toast and Pancakes are to die for. I noticed a lot of good reviews for the pancakes, and I am a french toast lover so I just had to try both. 

The poached egg dishes were very delicious as well. The potatoes that accompany the dishes are so good - I wanted to be good and opt for a salad, but with potatoes that good, you gotta be bad! Poached eggs were delicious along with each of its ingredients and english muffins were toasted very well. 

I LOVED each and every dish we tried today. The service was on point and friendly, and we were so lucky to have got to Zazie around 12pm today, and we didn't have to wait at all. I really liked the atmosphere - small and cozy, yet not too cramped. They also have a very cool spiral staircase at the front which I love, and wondered how the employees shoot up and down that thing carrying storage items.

Not sure when I can return, but Zazie was definitely a wonderful brunch experience. Ahhhh, I'm salivating just thinking about the food.
author: Tiffany K.

description: The mussels are GREAT. Everything else is just ok. If you are a vegetarian, your dinner will be a side of mashed potatoes or macaroni and cheese. It's not terrible but it's not special either. The menu stays the same so it's gotten boring.
author: Amaline B.

description:
Delicious breakfast this weekend! We were #22 on the wait list when we arrived, and were seated in 30 minutes. Have no clue how that happened... line moved fast I guess.

The dungeness crab poached eggs were my favorite ...served with the garlicy home fries? Perfection! Also LOVED the Tahiti French toast and the buttermilk pancakes weren't bad either.

We'll definitely be back. Server was super friendly as well... great experience.
author: K. D.

description:
Pork Sashimi, Poork Service

There's nothing more I hate than a bad French bistro. Zazie is on that list. I really like French bistro food and when someone can't quite get it right, I get a little perturbed. Firstly, they served us raw Pork. Not sure my date was ready for Pork Sashimi, but it was clearly raw in the center. A little medium is okay if it's a fresh cut, but what happened next sealed the deal. 

My date flagged down the waitress and she brought it back to the kitchen. She brought it back a few minutes later (fired up some more and on the same plate no less) and exclaimed, "I hope that's to your liking". Flabbergasted. 

Unfortunately, it took us over 90 minutes to finish the meal. Oh, and the mussles someone loved: over priced (~15 pcs/$11) and underseasoned!
author: Tom W.

description:
When I went here, we put down our party size on an iPad. Cool, I guess.. but extremely unnecessary since the owner has to come out and manual cross off the people who have already been seated. 

As for the food, Zazie's has the best gingerbread pancakes!! The sauce for the pancakes is SOOO good, I didn't even bother with the syrup! 

Their French Toast Tahiti is great as well, the banana and the walnuts are just perfect with it!! 

I also recommend the La Mer: poached eggs with crab, onions, and avocado with a side of home fries. This is the BEST savory dish on the menu!! The avocados are so fresh you can actually taste it!

Definitely coming back!!
author: Gelene V.

description:
My buttermilk pancake was great.

I liked the whole cloves of unpeeled garlic in my home fries and the ketchup was really good.

I liked breathing my garlic breath all day the most.
author: Light Bulb J.

description: Great place for brunch. Perfect to bring a friend or two. It can be tricky for large groups since the seating is limited to fit 2-4 people max per table. The outdoor heat lamps can be a little strong, but try and score a seat out on the back patio anyway. Poached eggs are the way to go here...somehow when I've ordered omelettes, they're not as tasty or satisfying as the benedicts. The house potatoes have whole roasted garlic cloves mixed in, so unless you love garlic, watch what you spear your fork with! I must go back and try the french toast and also the sandwiches from the croque madame to the ahi tuna. My friends who dine round the midday hours tell me the half sandwich, salad, and soup du jour combo makes the perfect lunch.
author: Elaine W.

description:
Wow. My first experience of San Franciscan food was Zazie. I was incredibly tired, jet lagged and wanting something good and hearty. I met my friend off the Muni, which handily runs close to the place, and we set off for Zazie.

As soon as you see it you think it's adorable and we took a seat right in the window on a gloriously sunny Monday morning and an incredibly friendly waitress came over to drop off some iced water and give use the menus.

I chose Eggs Genevieve and coffee. The coffee was brilliant and, me being British, I was not used to free refils so this was all very exciting. Next came the food, mine looked, tasted and smelt amazing. Nothing is better for jet lag than eggs, coffee and potato. My friends had blueberry pancakes and eggs and bacon both of which look ridiculously tasty.

The atmosphere was super, the service was super, the food was super, the coffee was super, the location was super. What's not to love?
author: Adam S.

description:
I've only been to Zazie for brunch.  The first time was a few months ago and it was one of those extremely hot days in San Francisco.  We had to wait about 30 minutes for a table.  We got an indoor table, which was nice and cool and a relief from standing outside in the hot, hot sun for so long.  A and I both ordered mimosas.  I ordered the Fountain Bleu and A got the French Toast.  Super yum.

We just came again last week with my brother and my mom.  Totally opposite from our last visit, it was freezing cold and we just missed the first seating.  We were first on the list and were told the wait would be about 20 minutes.  When the first group of eaters left, the hostess called someone else (also a group of 4) in to sit.  Okay, seriously?  What's up with that?  We were first on the list and also a table of 4.  We asked the hostess about it and she said they had actually gotten there first.  Seriously, we were there first.  

Anyway, a few minutes after that she announced they were opening the back patio, so we went back there.  Sure, they have heaters, but it was still so chilly!  They were nice enough to provide some blankets to keep us warm though.

A and I ordered hot chocolate while my mom and brother ordered coffee.  The hot chocolate came in giant bowls.  They looked like bowls of hot chocolate soup!  Although they weren't really hot.  They were lukewarm.  

I ordered the Fountain Bleu again - still as good as the first time.  My mom and brother both ordered the La Mer, which also sounded good but I decided not to order it.  I don't remember what A ordered.  I think he ordered the day's special.  

Service is good.  Food is excellent.  Wait sucks since you can't make reservations for brunch.  And it was hard to walk out afterward because our feet had turned into popsicles.  It was sooooo chilly peppers that day!
author: Kris L.

description:
A real gem in the heart of San Francisco. To be honest, when I generally give food reviews, it's usually just about the food. But let me just say here that this place really knows how to create the right ambiance for a Sunday brunch.

I came here with a friend of mine who's from outside the city, and knowing that she is a huge foodie who absolutely loves ANYTHING and EVERYTHING sweet, we decided to try Zazie for their lauded gingerbread pancakes. I ordered one of the breakfast specials (scrambled eggs, dungeness crab, and English Peas) and my friend gave those pancakes a whack. Both orders came out in a timely-fashion and our server was a pleasant fellow.

1) My dish was simple, delicious, and got me where I needed to be. Nothing too special unfortunately, so I can't say much else. 3 stars

2) My friend's pancakes looked amazing. And they tasted amazing too!! She gave me a generous taste and even after sitting on her plate for 10-15min, it tasted divine. The lemon curd and bosc pears were such excellent pairings and the "gingerbreadiness" of the pancake itself made me think about Christmas. A real treat. 4 stars

3) The ambiance is the kicker that rounds up my review to 4 stars. It has a homeliness to it that takes you to the countryside with a clientele that represents the city of San Francisco. The noise level was at a minimum, making conversation easy. The walls are lined with Picasso-esque portraits and landscapes, and they have an outdoor patio area that especially appeals to dinner-diners. And the entrance has a winding staircase! (something my friend has always wanted in her house growing up). 5 stars.

With wonderful, friendly service in a simply pastoral atmosphere and delectable brunch food with a French influence, Zazie was great find. I would come back here again.

Bone Ape Tit!
author: Kenneth N.

description:
We had brunch at Zazie today after being told that "the 1.5 hr wait is a part of the experience." Considering we had a party of 8, I think we did pretty good. We spent the majority of the wait in the backyard of Finnegan's next door and wandering around the many shops nearby. It's a cute neighborhood to walk around while waiting.

Everyone had poached eggs. Why? Well, they're simply amazing. I had the St. Trop poached eggs with salad, which comes with smoked salmon and capers and a mimosa to drink. Overall, a really nice dining experience. Loved the decor of the place, the staff was super friendly, and the neighborhood is cute to boot. Color me charmed.
author: Patricia Q.

description: Not like they need any more glowing reviews, but this place is off the hook good! I had the Challah French Toast and the hubby had the Flight of pancakes and french toast. They have lots of mimosas too. AND the people that work there are sooooo sweet and friendly! We'll definitely be back!
author: Noel A.

description:
During my weekend stay in SF for NYE weekend, a few of us got the chance to check out one of the many cafes in SF. Zazie happened to be walking distance from our apartment. It took us about half an hour to be seated but I feel it was well worth the wait. I ordered the lox benedict with hash browns. This was a great dish. The potatoes were of the chunky, pan roasted kind with cloves of creamy, roasted garlic. It was delicious. The lox benedict was just as you'd expect. The hollandaise sauce was the right consistency and did not overpower the lox.

One negative about this place is that it is a bit too small. It felt congested.
author: Marvin M.

description:
Loved Zazie when I lived in Cole Valley.  Love it even more now.  Love it most on weekdays when there is not a mad scramble for seating (pardon the pun). 

Set in the middle of Cole Valley with tables on the sidewalk, tables on the back patio and an elegantly French country comfort decor inside, Zazie is a comfy classy place for breakfast, brunch or lunch.  They're also open for dinner but I haven't tried the evening fare. 

For breakfast and brunch, they have several all-time favorites:  
- Eggs en Fonte.  (eggs over easy on polenta with chanterelles)
- Miracle Pancakes (cornmeal pancakes with lemon curd and raspberry sauce)
- Challah French Toast

For lunch, I love the Mussels - supreme sauce and wonderful toast points.  The sandwiches and soups are also top notch. 

Whenever I have folks in from out-of-town, this is at the top of the list to show them local flavor in my old hood Cole Valley.  Folks are always blown away, as am I. 

Only downside is weekend can be packed.  So, put your name down, and run errands at Pharmaca, Postal Chase, and the other local shops.
author: Rob W.

description:
I went to dinner with a good friend Judette. She kept talking about their delicious mussels!  Due to Julia V. I have been eating at a lot of french mussel places in DC. I thought I give SF a try to see if they could measure up to Bistro Du Coin or Mussel Bar. Did I mention outdoor seating with heating lamps! Oh yeah I wasn't going to pass up on this bad boy! 

Food: 4 stars
Their mussels were delicious! The sauce was more creamy, right amount of wine to cream ratio. The garlic was not over powering. My recommendation is to take the awesome bread and dip it into the mussel sauce. Perfect combination. I think next time I am just going to order this as my entree. 

I ordered the Le Canard. Wee wee that's the duck leg. The duck leg was crisp on the outside and super tender. The meat fell off the bone. The fingerling potatoes and the sherry vinaigrette was amazing. I have trouble thinking of words to describe it. I should invest in a thesaurus. 

 I had Souffle Gateau Zazie for dessert. Molten cake invaded dessert scene a couple of years ago and I always feel they are pretty standard until now. Our dessert took a while because it exploded in the oven.  I have a active imagination so I just thought of the Muppet chef freaking out in the kitchen. :)  Their souffle is a white chocolate with lemon!!!! The berries were a excellent touch to really balance the sweetness of the white chocolate. I don't usually like fruity flavors in my chocolate but the lemon add a little extra something to really make this dish delicious. 

Service: 2 stars.  The service was great in the beginning since there was only 5 of us in the restaurant. I measure service on how they refill my water glass...does my cup empty or does it always stay full? I waited 10 mins for water and bread. That will give you a idea if you should take my service review with a grain of salt.  We had to wave our waiter down twice for our bill. It took about 20 mins to get the bill. I didn't mind that much since my friend and I can entertain each other for hours so if you have a friend who likes promptness it can be a problem. 

Overall, great experience and good french food. I just think the service needs some improvement. I would say this place is a good pick for dinner to catch up with friends.  Make a reservation! 

Thanks for reading my super long review! If I could I would give you 5 stars!
author: Denise F.

description:
Decided to come here for brunch with my siblings because one of my sisters live in the city. I must say, this place is DELICIOUS. It's a small place but the ambiance is so welcoming; it almost feels as if you are at home in your pajamas, eating a home-cooked meal. 

My brother ordered the Gingerbread Pancakes and they taste like Christmas morning! Mind you, I'm not a big fan of ginger but I would eat that any day. My sister and I shared the French Toast Tahiti and one of the specials which was the Poached Egg with Prawns. The french toast was amazing! It was crispy and light and the filling was not too sweet which made everything come together! Don't forget the maple syrup! Hands down a french toast that will not disappoint. The Poached Egg with Prawns was my favorite dish from the three. I'm a little biased due to the fact that I eat more savory food but this was amazing! The hollandaise sauce was creamy, smooth and decadent. Make sure you order the home fries, you will NOT be disappointed! The potatoes are cooked to perfect and they have WHOLE GARLIC CLOVES included in the home fries! Any place that cooks with whole garlic cloves is on top of my list!

I'm not a big brunch person, but I wouldn't mind eating here everyday. The food is wonderful and the staff are super nice! I'm looking forward to the day I come back to SF just so I can't eat here again!
author: Camille O.

description:
The most unique item here is the gingerbread pancakes and how they serve them with lemon curd. You can buy the mix for these from them.

All of the food is really good. They serve espresso drinks and hot chocolate in bowls. You can get any typical brunch item as a single (i.e. one egg benedict, one piece of french toast, one pancake), so you can have a bunch of different stuff in one meal.
author: Anton S.

description:
This place is officially one of my favorite brunch places in the city. The best part wasn't their service (which was great), or their mimosas (which were fabulous), nor their eggs benedict (which were amazing). No, the best part of this place are their country potatoes, hands down. 

Imagine a plate of crispy potatoes with other onions and peppers which have obviously been sitting on a low griddle for at least 2 hours to get that wonderful caramelization. Well, the best part is that for every piece of potato you get, you also have a huge garlic clove. At first I was confused as to why they would serve garlic still in its skin. Then I saw that these pieces of garlic were slow roasted and that you can literally squeeze the garlicky goodness out like a spread and spread it all over each piece f potato. When garlic is slow roasted to the point where it's really soft, it becomes really savory, fragrant, and sweet. Talking about this makes me want to have some of their potatoes right now.

I HIGHLY recommend this place! This place also makes me miss the time when I was living in France.
author: Rylan C.

description: Great for dinner.  The prix fixe dinner is well worth it.  Nice wine list.
author: Han M.

description: Food was delicious, heated garden a real bonus. Wait for food was long and service was comme ci comme ca.
author: Dan W.

description: I was skeptical about the butternut squash soup at first but it was delicious. (Soup du jour) That butternut squash soup warmed my friend's soul.
author: Joelle G.

description: I love the cozy arrangement, the spiral staircase, and the awning. I felt I had been transported somewhere else. My fish soup provencale was very good, and I loved the baked hot chocolate, which was amazing. The signature tea was soothing. I wished the roasted Brussel sprouts had been roasted a little more. Our waiter was very nice.
author: Eva UnTiger S.

description: it totally helps when you come to such a well-known spot on a Tuesday morning the second the restaurant opens at 8am. That's exactly what my mom and I did! No wait, no long delays of food coming out, we were able to take our time with our food and really enjoy our experience at Zazie. I would definitely come back here to try more items on the menu. The one thing that stuck out was the special pancake of the day...the lemon poppyseed I believe..? Boy that was de to the lish!
author: Natasha I.

description:
Boy the wait sucks but it was delicious. 

I had the pancake flight. The Miracle pancakes delivered...so amazing. I've never had anything like it before. The gingerbread pancake with lemon sauce was different and very good and the buttermilk pancakes were decent but I would suggest to just get the Miracle pancakes.

The decor inside was very cool and definitely radiated french cafe. My friends said they had watched the movie the place is themed around they said the movie was pretty crazy. I'll have to check it out sometime :)
author: Ryan T.

description: Great little brunch place. The veggie scramble was a delight. OMG, their pancakes are great!
author: Milana R.

description: The food is great, been here several times, however I think that one of the servers stole my credit card the last time I was there. Looking back at all my transactions, this was the only time the card was out of my sight.... No way to prove, but seems weird...
author: James B.

description: So much hype about this place. There is always a wait and it is a cute, cozy, intimate place. I went there on 2 occasions.. drinks, we sat outside, it was very nice , and brunch. where i ordered the french toast with fruit and coffee.. both have been great experiences.. from food to atmosphere and service. I would go back. It is a cute little neighborhood gem.
author: C A.

description:
Like the rest of the top brunch places in SF, the line for brunch is so long. You write your name on a list and then wait, and wait, and wait. Unless you get lucky to grab one of the two tables in front that are first come first serve. My group of 6 waited almost an hour to get a table.

Seated in the super cute patio, we ordered coffee and Bloody Marys and mimosas. Around the table we got both french toasts, the fountainbleu scramble, the Albert, the St. Trop and the Valence.

Overall:
Bloody Marys/mimosas: ok. Bloody Marys had too much pepper taste for my liking. Mimosas were good but stick with the original.
French Toasts: the two are essentially the same, so get the one with walnuts and bananas. Delicious. It leans toward the bready rather than eggy side of things.
Albert: Exactly as it sounds.
St. Trop: great combination even though it sounded weird.
Valence: the tomato-chevre sauce was so good.

Of the three poached eggs we got though, I felt most were overdone. Not quite runny enough for my taste.

Environment: Patio is adorable. And the heat lamps make it perfect when it's a bit cold outside.
Service: The server mostly just leaves you alone. They were pretty good about coffee refilling and he did come back and check on us.
author: Kailyn G.

description:
Zazie has lost it's edge! This used to be my favorite brunch place by far, but it's fallen in quality and service. 

When our brunch was finally served, my le mer poached eggs were overcooked and cold. My husband's st trop was a bit warmer, but still no where near hot. I found 2 large pieces of crab shell in my eggs, and when I mentioned it to the busser who took my plate, he mumbled something incomprehensible and rushed off as fast as he could. No further mention of it from the staff. 

On the plus side, the miracle pancake (lemon ricotta pancakes - yum!) were amazing, and our server was friendly. 

While this used to be the best place in town for a fancy brunch, it is no longer worth the $30+ / person given the low attention to quality.
author: Maura K.

description:
Came here last minute for a valentines dinner with NO RESErVATION.. Since we showed up early they accomodated us on the patio under a heater.. We brought a nice bottle of wine we picked out from across the street and had an amazing time.

Staff: Very friendly all smiles..great energy that night. 

Service: Good. Our server was great not amazing technically but more than made up for it with her attention to our experience and bubbly happy disposition. 

Food: EXCELLENT. We had the duck and fresh local crab raviolis were F'ing INSANE. 

I highly recommend this place.. i guess it's normally known as a brunch spot but I had a fantastic experience for dinner and hope to be back very soon! Thanks Zazie staff, you guys rocked on Valentine's night!!!!!!!!!!!!!!
author: SF M.

description: Must try. I went there for the la Miracle pancake but it was out. So i went with their French toast instead. Try to go there earlier if u hunting for their famous pancake. The waiters was  an amazing lady, we had great experience except the 2 hours wait on Sunday.
author: Emanula M.

description: Brunch!  And yes, it really is that good for brunch.  Yes, the wait is long.  Yes, it is worth it.  I really have nothing to add to what others have already said, so I'll forgo the usual witty banter, keen observations, and poetic assessments....
author: Leighton P.

description:
Really 3.5 stars. Love the place, love the dishes, love the back patio...

...but their customer service is unnecessarily awful. When is it appropriate to take a drink order when a customer sits down but not give them said beverage until halfway through the meal? Why are there looks and attitude given when a simple request is made? And why, oh why, am I always knocking boots (literally, of course) with the table next to me? These things have happened on multiple occasions and I guess I'm just not a fan. On a busy day expect to packed into the back like sardines.

I'll keep going back because their ravioli, brioche french toast, and Benedicts are too yummy. Paired with a sunny morning/afternoon on their patio and you've got yourself a good day.
author: Jasmyn M.

description: Extremely long line, the wait was 2 hours+. I ordered the omelette which was average, fries with garlic were good.  I'd recommend coming here really early if it's a weekend, otherwise not worth the hype.
author: Ubz D.

description: Food was good but stevice was slow and mediocre at best. Hollindaise was tasty. Not worth the weekend wait. Would only eat there again if there was no wait.
author: Larissa G.

description:
Actually not bad for brunch. Suggestion: Probably get here before 10:30am, or even before 10am if you want to get in faster. No matter when you arrive, there's going to be a cue (there's probably people camping overnight in front of the damn restaurant).  Around said time, expect to wait at least 15-20 minutes.

Food is good, the waitress is nice, ambiance is nice (cute).  Just don't have high expectations or else you're going to be slightly disappointed.
Roasted garlics with chopped potatoes were awesome.  Brunch IS awesome. But for a great French brunch dining experience, personally I still prefer Butler & The Chef Bistro.............

The food here tasted more like an American knock-off (duh) of French brunch cuisine.
Let me just sum up to you how I feel:
It's like getting a Louis Vuitton counterfeit purse.  It may say "Made in Italy" on the tag, but you know it's coming out of China
author: Frankie W.

description:
I've been wanting to try Zazie for the longest time, and of course I used a visiting friend as a good reason to go.  I'm glad we went, it's worth the wait.  We went on a Sunday around 11am.  For me that's *early* well, apparently not.  There was a mini-flock of denizens gathered in front of Zazie's ~ around it was pretty quiet.  I think some that saw the wait trickled over to the other eateries.

My friend was about to keel over, so we took a quick jaunt over to La Boulange ~ another charming place, and ordered a snack for her and a cup of perk for me.  We debated whether to order a meal here, but decided to hold out for Zazie.

One of those rare warm days, so standing on the sidewalk with the sun on our backs was a bonus.  We got sun *and* nourishment this morning - a double treat!

The inside of Zazie is comfy, but I'm glad we got to sit on their cozy back patio ~ I was amazed at how well they laid out their sliver of backside.

I highly recommend the Ginger pancakes.  You can order a stack of 1, 2, or 3.  They are huge!  My friend and split an order of 2 pancakes, and an order of 2 eggs, with toast, salad (or you can choose home fries), and add bacon.  We should've ordered 1 pancake to share between us ~ we couldn't finish it since we were bursting with great food.

The staff are really nice.  Next time I won't use a visiting friend as a reason to go.  I'll gladly go despite the wait.
author: Cathy K.

description: 4 stars, I don't get it.  This place was just OK.  There was nothing that made it stand out above an average breakfast in any city or town.  I was really expecting more from 4 stars with over 2,000 reviews.  I had the omlette du jour.  It was average, the potatoes scorched and the turkey sausage clearly forgotten about on the grill/griddle.  Toast was just that, toast.  The jam delicious, but not enough to make it a 4 star meal or restaurant.  Really San Fran yelpers, 4 stars?
author: Ross G.

description: We went on weekdays after 1 pm and was able to get a seat in 30 minutes.  The La Mer was done just right.  The French Toast Tahiti was very good not needing the syrup.
author: Jackie J.

description:
You gotta get in here before they even open so you can get a table at a decent hour.  It's strange to me how they open relatively later than other breakfast joints.  is it worth the wait?  I'm not exactly sure yet since I've only been there once.  Why 4 stars then?  Because EVERYONE loves this place and I want to love it more than I did a few weeks ago.  (3.5 stars get's bumped up to 4.)

The crab benedict which I got a sample of was good, not great but definitely good.  I got the special which was some omelet with chicken sausage, avocado, etc.  Pretty much something out of the Squat and Gobble, Crepevine type menu.  There's something to be said about food that gets cold shortly after it has reached your table.  Service was great, decor not memorable and the line atrocious.  But, it's good enough for me to give it another go.
author: Rosalind S.

description: Honestly what is all the hype about this place? I dont understand if its just my tastebuds that are hard to impress or people are okay with just average. My friend who was leaving back to germany treated me here for brunch. We waited outside about 10mins to be sitted. Glad we finally did getcalled because he was in a rush to the airport. Anyhoo the only item I enjoyed was the coffee that comes in a huge mug and twas pretty yummy. We ended up sharing. Otherwise, not so impressed with the food here. Plus hygiene wise- not the best. Kitchen is in the middle of hallway.
author: DeesQue N.

description:
I love brunch. Then I heard this place is one of the must-eat places in San Francisco on a Sunday morning, so I decided to check it out.  Of course I left home at a reasonable hour for a Sunday, so when I arrived there was a 45 minute to an hour wait.  Which is ok with me since the first time I went to Outerlands.  I know that sometimes the wait is worth it.  
  
When I was finally seated I got a seat inside, which sucks because I wanted to see the patio, but I'll save that for another time.  The seating isn't nearly as cramped as I thought it was going to be.  It took a minute to get my menu, since people dining alone seem to be harder to give good service to when it is slammed.  When I did get to order I got a mimosa with orange and cranberry juice, which was larger and better than expected.  I ordered the croque madame, which is an open faced ham sandwich, topped with melted gruyere and an egg over easy, and their hollandaise. It was amazing.  I was a little skeptical about the sauce, but it was amazing. Everything was in balance, even the decor. 

It also helps that I went from there to the DeYoung to do a french day and see the Picasso show.  A very nice pairing.  Going to brunch here made me want to come back and try all the other delicious things on their menu.
author: Meara G.

description:
i hate ordering at restaurants with menus that leave you no options. best menu option at zazie? 1. ONE!  you can actually order just one! one egg. one benedict. one piece of french toast. one pancake. this is an ingenious idea because it means you can try multiple things on the menu! yay for eyes bigger than my stomach :)

the benedict la mer (crab) was melt-in-your-mouth delicious and the french toast (both banana/walnut and fresh fruit) were satisfying but not overly heavy or thick. i would vow to come here every time i return to sf, but i've heard the wait is redonkulous. go on a week day, we went on a friday morning and were seated within 5 minutes.
author: Sarah Y.

description: I was in San Francisco for work and I thought I'd be inundated with options for "California food" (heavy with fresh produce, avocados, juices, etc.) but I wasn't. I was fortunate to have friends who knew about Zazie. This place is exactly what I was looking for -- innovative menu items, made from fresh and local ingredients, vegetables at the forefront of even the meat dishes. Interesting and accessible flavors. I went with the prix fixe ($39 for appetizer, meal, dessert) and it was an incredible deal for the quality of the meal. I got the chicken pate, corn cakes, petit pot du creme chocolate, and I enjoyed every bit of all of it. Service is impeccable and professional and I attribute that to the restaurant's policy of treating servers like other professionals - fair wages, health insurance, 401k, etc. I can't imagine they have a ton of turnover which always ups the quality of service. In all aspects this place is a "true California experience" and I recommend it highly.
author: Amy M.

description:
This is what brunch is all about...

So I stupidly did not order what you're supposed to: eggs benedict or french toast.  Instead, I had a very basic breakfast here with a mango-orange mimosa.  We were served the tiniest thing of pure mango-orange juice to mix with A LOT OF CHAMPAGNE.  That definitely won me over.

Luckily my hubby ordered the infamous eggs benedict, which were perfect!  Delicious and wonderfully done- totally cooked to perfection.

Very cute, Amelie-esque vibe if you get a seat indoors, where your nose will be FULL of the fragrant smell of their famous french toast... Seating outside is cosy and you get just as much attention as if you were inside.

GO EARLY.  We were the 8am crowd, which made this an enjoyable brunch... now if we waited with everyone else outside forever, then I may have written a different review.
author: Christine K.

description:
Mmmmm, ate here for brunch today. The La Mer eggs benedict (poached egg, hollandaise crab, cheese, and avocado) was fantastic. There was enough crab, and it was fresh and sweet. No old fishy taste like from the frozen stuff. The hollandaise was delicious and creamy, eggs were poached to perfection. 

The boyfriend had the mushroom ravioli which was very flavorful. Threw us off though cuz it comes in a broth so it looks more like a soup. I was expecting a cream sauce.

My only gripe is I wish they had fresh squeezed orange juice. Also, my boyfriend's chai was really watered down tasting and not sweet at all. But the food itself was delicious!
author: Aleyna S.

description:
I came here with two of my friends on a Friday afternoon for lunch. We arrived around 1:30 pm (they close at 2:30 pm) and had the window booth at the front of the restaurant. I can see how this place can get crowded on the weekends!

We came here to try the 7x7 Eggs Benedict! I ordered the St. Trop which consisted of two eggs with a delicious yellow sauce on top and smoked salmon underneath it with two slices of bread. I had the option of choosing a salad or potatoes and I went with the salad. The salad was pretty good and had a nice dressing on top that wasn't too heavy. The eggs were delicious and really hit the spot! 

The inside is really cute and they have this winding staircase for the employees. The only downside is that parking is hard and their dishes can be sort of expensive. With tax and tip my meal came out to about $16.
author: Vikki K.

description: somewhat pricey but they have great eggs Benedict. Very homey feel, small cramped place but the food is great.
author: K D.

description: Very delicious and the staff is so friendly! I went on a weekday so I there was absolutely no wait and my friend and I snagged a great window table. We tested out a bunch of dishes! We tried the gingerbread pancakes, stuffed French toast, original French toast, and cornmeal miracle pancakes...everything was fantastic! Definitely a brunch place to try!
author: Claudia L.

description:
Came here for brunch on a late Saturday morning and had a fantastic meal!

The wait:  The wait list was about a dozen people deep when we got there, but we only waited for maybe 15 min.  Not too bad.  The 2 tables outside in the front are first come first served.  If you don't mind stuffing your face in front of a bunch of hungry people hovering, drooling, and staring you down with jealousy, go for it.  But, you must act fast, and with a bit of aggression.  I watched one guy stand his ground right in front of one table, giving anyone that got near him the stink eye.  A couple others had to duke it out at the other table.

The food:  Everything on the menu sounds so tempting.  What I love about Zazie, is that they offer portions of 1, 2, or 3 for all of their brunch items except the scrambles.  This allows you to mix and match any combo you want!  My fiance and I ordered Pinkie's challah french toast, a gingerbread pancake, and the Albert poached eggs (bacon, white cheddar, salsa).  The french toast was good, although not the best I've had.  The gingerbread pancake was delicious!  It was super fluffy and had the perfect combo of spices and sweetness.  The poached eggs were amazing!  The flavors and textures were perfect.  Also loved the home fries that came with the eggs.  These roasted red potatoes with whole cloves of garlic were some of the best breakfast potatoes I've ever had.

The service:  Despite how packed the place was, our server was pretty attentive and very friendly.

Overall, Zazie is a fantastic place to come if you're looking for delicious brunch fare in the city.
author: Lori K.

description:
We got here in the misty morning and only the throngs of people in front of the restaurant showed us where Zazie was located. The wait wasn't too bad, compared to Mama's or Outerlands, about 35-40 minutes. 

OOOOhhh...I ordered 2 sunnyside up eggs with Aidell's Chicken Apple sausages, a side of wheat toast with the house fries. It was a lot of food and it was goooood. The house fries were quarter cut potato-lings with the skin still on interspersed with quarters of garlic. Wow, it was seasoned really well and not greasy! My eggs were fluffy and the toast were thick. Their jam wasn't runny but super thick.

Eduourd C. had the special of the day omelette, maple ham with half an avocado, stuffed with mushrooms and cheese...he deemed it excellently seasoned. Andrea C. had the banana french toast, and it was super yummy (*and normally I hate bananas on my bread).

The decor is reminiscent of old style Parisian cafes with their brick interior and classic french posters. There's an exterior patio with heated lamps in the back that I didn't get to see what it looked like, but the more the merrier! Service was brisk, but don't lose your cool if they don't come right away to refill your coffee.

Kudos for lots of vegetarian options, that's always a good sign the chef knows how to cook. Parking is metered in the front but go to the other streets and there's 2 hours free parking.
author: Pauline L.

description: Fantastic!  Great food and great service!  Thank you!  One of our favorite meals this weekend!  Bacon is still on our minds.
author: heidi v.

description:
Seated almost immediately in the sunny back patio by the pleasant and helpful host, we enjoyed a truly delightful and delicious breakfast today.

I have to say that the the Irish oats with the thin crème brûlée and the caramelized bananas should carry a government warning for addictiveness.  A brilliant dish.  I also liked the poached egg special served with Dungeness crab (nice, large pieces) and lemon hollandaise and accompanied by the famed roasted garlic fried potatoes.  My breakfast partner ordered the Un, deux, trois plate of buttermilk pancake, two eggs, and three strips of bacon - the consistency of the pancake was excellent.

Add to this charming and attentive service (our coffee mugs were always full!) and fair prices and you understand why this place is popular with everyone.
author: Thor T.

description:
Really enjoyed a lunch at this nice, informal restaurant. There's a garden area out back with plants. The restaurant is visually pleasant, it was sunny, and we had a good time.

Eating outdoors makes one rely on the waiter or waitress even more. At Zazie we had a wonderful, friendly waitress -- cheery, attentive, and didn't miss a beat during a fairly busy lunch hour. 

The food? Great. I had the Mediterranean Plate ($11), which featured lots of good, fresh-tasting things -- the roasted mushrooms and eggplant, and especially the potatoes were good. Zazie's menu describes this plate, as "balsamic roasted eggplant, tomatoes provencales, potatoes persillade, roasted mushrooms, roasted peppers, green beans, feta, basil, and aioli."

I was very, very satisfied until I tried my wife's salmon!  Next time I'll get the salmon, though some of the salads looked interesting. 

Though I don't normally have tea or coffee at lunch, they were good. Water is served in a large, pretty caraffe of iced water, sans the ice. Tasty. From someone born in SF, take that as a compliment, Zazie.

Zazie gets a five mostly for the all-around excellent service. I liked the way the staff busily planned for a large wheelchair before the disabled customer arrived. They obviously knew ahead of time. When he arrived, he too was treated nicely. 

Hopped on the J, so I can't tell you about the parking. I don't think it's great there.

Only minus: Don't think the waitress spoke French. Not for the snob appeal -- French is truly a beautiful language, but if your website says "Bienvenue" in as (sorta) cosmo a city as San Fran, Zazie, please teach your staff some basic French.  There are plenty of French and French-speaking people in the Haight and Inner Sunset.
author: Robert F.

description:
Zazie is our favorite restuarant from the Estates Group Real Estate.  We love to come here for a delicious breakfast.  And we mean delicious.  Your cappucino comes European style in a bowl.  

The  menu is varied and wonderful, with french flair.  The ambiance is cafe like with fun francaise touches, and deco art on the walls. We love the french toast with carmelized bananas and poached eggs with various toppings and hollaindaise.  They even serve Aidell's sausages and deligious real home fried potatoes.  There is always a wait though, so be prepared and don't grumble - it doesn't get you a table sooner.

 When the morning fog clears, they open their rear garden area - which is always a treat.  There isn't an item on their menu that isn't worth having.  Even their burger at lunch has flair.  Also -if something isn't too your liking - they will make it again...it only happened once when i received the wrong omlette.  

I take every visitor and my clients when they are available, here for breakfast.  Coles hardware is across the street and a great beauty supply is on the same block too.  It's a fun little neighborhood for shopping after your gorgeous breakfast.  

Love - Love - Love Zazies, they do it right, exotic and delicious...what more can a luxury real estate group look for in San Francisco.  This is our breakfast place of choice.
author: Erika B.

description: This place is a standard brunch spot in sf. The food is good, ambiance is nice, but the wait and parking can be troublesome. Therefore, it's not always the first place that comes to mind when I want to go for brunch. There's just so many places in the city, this one just doesn't really stand out to me.
author: Amimee D.

description: There is a reason why they have 4 stars out of 2200 reviews before mine! Love the back patio. Our favorite breakfast/ brunch spot. We either go early or on a week day to avoid the loooong line.
author: Alanur K.

description: Great place! The food, the outdoor seating, everything! Will come back anytime!
author: Tyler L.

description: Only been for breakfast. They're pancakes are ridiculously good. Service can be kind of inattentive, but those pancakes, man.
author: Jules P.

description:
I loved this place. I grabbed buisness cards and gave them to some co-workers in the office. 

This was featured on Check Please!
I told my girlfriend that night. . "its 7. .. Lets drive there tonight and try" 

Great Decision. My GF better love me for my impulsive stoner munchies
We were outside on the patio. Amazing night. Good weather. Not cold at all.
author: Break Stuff B.

description:
Note to self:

Yummy - 
Paté Sandwich   10.95 (a bit expensive though)
sinful brandy chicken liver paté and greens on grilled levain with a side of home fries for $1.95.

I tried my friend's pancake with lemon curd and the french onion soup.
author: Jboogie L.

description:
Definitely a big fan of Zazie. Ate on the back patio, which would be perfect for a date. Cozy tables, heat lamps, and a relaxed atmosphere paired with great food and service? What's not to like? 
The mussels were perfectly cooked, my burger was simple (opted for no bacon. I know... a crime...) but delicious... best I've had in a while actually. The tomatoes provencal on top was great... no need for ketchup. Our server (Fred, I think??) suggested great wines to pair with each of our courses. Big thumbs up. I will be back to try the beef bourguignon and the duck for sure. They both looked amazing.
author: Jordan R.

description:
Me & my bf eat there all the time.  The staff are very frienly and accomadating, and most importantly the food is fantastic.  The Ricotta pancakes are to die for along with the omelettes and the potatoes are yummy.
The outside patio is very romantic and there are heating lamps which keep you nice & toasty.  Of all the times we've eaten there I have never had a bad meal.  Absolutely try this place!!!
author: Molly M.

description: It used to be that Park Chow was my favorite breakfast place, but Zazie has won me over.  Definitely be prepared to wait, but know that you're in for a real treat!  Really fresh food, amazing cocktails, and a great back patio.
author: Audrey K.

description: Incredible! My friend and I fortunately went at about 11:00 on a weekday, and were seated immediately. Service was quick, coffee was perfect, and my french toast blew my mind. I got the French Toast a Diable, which was perfectly cooked and not too eggy. It was very moist, with these marinated bing cherries and a mascarpone whipped cream. It was definitely one of the best breakfast dishes I've had in recent memory. I'm excited to go back!
author: John K.

description:
I've eaten some beautiful, masterpiece and life altering breakfasts...and I am a breakfast guy. This place is my favorite all time breakfast (at least to date). I don't even live in San Francisco..I live in LA, but I love Zazie. I made my friend take work off on a Monday so we wouldn't have to wait that long.

My favorite thing about breakfast is Eggs Benedict. Zazie does it better than most (anyone in my opinion). You get your choice of 1,2 or 3 eggs, and can pretty much put anything you imagine on it. Beverages include black curant mimosas and giant Americanos...absolutely stellar. The potatoes are a garlic revelation!

 If I got hit by a truck, I would know I was in heaven if everyone I loved all went to Zazie for breakfast. Amen.
author: Matt M.

description:
What a lovely french bistro.  Dropped by here for dinner for the first time, and I will be back as soon as possible.  This place is a classic.

The food was excellent, prices reasonable, waiters informal and informative, very nice wine list.  I had salmon, perfectly cooked, served with with appropriate vegetables, and my companion had a hamburger (not something I would do :-)  Both were very well prepared and presented.  It was pleasantly busy at 8pm on a weekday, but we had no problem getting a table or getting taken care of.

Decor is casual french, comfortable, a little crowded, with some outdoor seating on Cole Street. Good indirect lighting.  I would imagine this would be great for brunch or lunch as well.
author: Tom C.

description: One star for concept, friendly staff and atmosphere. One star for solid food. Minus a star for all the hype minus a star for the quality vs price. Also minus had to ask for coffee refill- at almost $4 a coffee you better keep my cup full. Oh right also minus for the soggy "crispy " bacon. Would be 2 1/2 but feeling nice...
author: Patti L.

description: Was in town to see an exhibit at the deYoung and had asked local friends for a nearby restaurant...and Zazie was it. It was wonderful. It really was a hard decision as to what to order as the breakfast items looked great but I was in the mood for a more savory lunch. The Ahi salad with white anchovy's was perfect. The salad portion was just the right size, the dressing was light and not overly saturated. I'll definitely return when I come back to the City.
author: MaryAnne S.

description:
Zazie, 
Where have you been all my life?
 
Fantastic - Bellisimo! Ok, that's a little Italian for this fabulous French place but albeit I am not fluent it Francois!

Wow, quite a fantastic meal was had by all last weekend. We had 9 people for dinner reservation. Starting with a fantastic assortment of the charcuterie, Vegetables & Cheese platters.  Perfect amount to satisfy our hungry appetites along with a super warm and soft french bread roll.

I indulged in a drink that could only be called "heaven" or known to the bartender as a Le Metro. (Champagne, Sparkling Wine, Lavender sprig, Lemon curls and some other yumminess) My friends, ended up ditching there beers, and popping over the dark side of cocktails after tasting my Le Metro.

I had a fabulous Lamb Tagine. Tender, flavorful and the perfect amount of meat with a abundance of couscous, almonds and raisins - Perfection.

One friend got the salmon - Delicious and another got the Rabbit. I don't think any of us were expecting the rabbit to be so tender, so perfect... I know the next time, the rabbit will be on my side of the table.

Desserts were a plenty ports & coffee, a Meyer lemon and white chocolate cake with berry coulis and pot o creme & Creme brulee...

Even the Le Pison wine was brilliant.

We were all pleasantly surprised when the bill came in, for the amount of drinks, desserts, appetizers and main meal.We were pleased to split the bill and pleased to see the $ still in our wallets. 

Great intimate place, great small group dinner (under 10) great romantic spot.   

Oh and to boot - while we waited for our table next door at Finnegan's, they came over and told us our table was ready - Nice touch.

and ... I got a front row parking spot ... The stars were aligned.
author: Danie G.

description:
If you want a "hearty breakfast" then come here.  The food was really good.  I had the un, deux, trois which consists of one pancake, two eggs, and three pieces of bacon.  It was all very good.

The service was great but what I truly enjoyed seeing from this place was the sign that read that an extra dollar would be added to every customer's check so that all their workers could have health benefits.  Major props for that.  I wish they did that for places here in LA.
author: Analily V.

description:
I have been wanting to try Zazie forever, but each time I get in line, I end up leaving and going somewhere else.  Finally, I got a chance to stop in on a weekday when there was no line and get the poached eggs I've been craving.

Now, I go through food obsessions.  These days, it's poached eggs.  So, I was super excited to try their eggs benedict and, since it was a holiday weekend, they had some extra special options on the menu.  I selected the eggs benedict with avocado, bacon and Fontina cheese.  I was somewhat skeptical about the Fontina, as it melts well, but can be sour and overpowering.  And, that's exactly what I got.  The eggs were cooked perfectly, runny and poufy, and the avocado and bacon were delicious.  But, the Fontina really added a sourness to the dish that took over everything else. To top it off, my English muffin had been burnt and the meal was lukewarm when it got to the table.  Our waiter was nice, but so ridiculously busy, that he didn't have any time to check in or refill coffee.

While this is not enough to deter me from a return visit, I think next time I'll come for dinner.  I can't imagine waiting in line for an hour for that experience again.
author: Jessica L.

description: A wonderful gem on Cole! Delicious appetizers (cheese plate), entrees (rabbit, hanger steak), bread, and wine! It can get crowded, so definitely consider making a reservation first. The dessert menu is as appealing as the wine list, so try to save some room and consider taking some of your rich, hearty meal home.
author: Steve F.

description:
We ordered wild salmon sandwich with salad and side of fries, buttermilk sour pancakes with poppy seeds and two vegi s/w. all the food cameout on time and was good, nothing really that would make me run back. 

Street parking is tough to find and typical wait is 45mins to an hour.
author: Avi S.

description:
Do you want some potatoes with your whole roasted garlic cloves? Not likely to find 'em here. This morning, along with my eggs Genevieve, I got maybe five tiny pieces of potato and literally six or seven WHOLE garlic cloves (skin on). I like garlic, but really, this was a little more than overboard.

That said, the eggs were good, with a generous helping of avocado. And the pancake, eggs and bacon dish my boyfriend had looked good too. As did the fruit bowl he had. But all of that was gone before I could taste any of it, so I can only say that he looked pretty satisfied.

Also, a "large" juice at Zazie looks a lot like a "small" everywhere else.
author: Miriam W.

description: Really enjoyed brunch here with the girls. Good bowl of.... coffee.
author: C. S.

description: I decided to bring my mom here for brunch yesterday while she was in SF for a visit. It was my first time at Zazie as well. It was amazing! My mom had challah french toast and I had the pumpkin pancakes and we shared some chicken apple sausage. Everything was quite delicious. I will definitely be coming back to Zazie again.
author: Kayla H.

description: Made reservations with friends on a Saturday night, and couldn't have had a better experience. The service was fantastic - our waitress was one of the coolest people on the planet, seriously - and the wine, appetizers and entrees were to die for. We ordered the lamb, pork chop, chicken and salmon and couldn't decide which was the best - they were all incredible. If you haven't been here yet, make sure to put this on your list!
author: Olivia B.

description:
I have had the distinct pleasure of eating at Zazie 5 times in the last month (with different people!), amazingly only 1 of those times was for brunch. Even more amazing is that during those 4 dinner visits, my party never had a reservation and never had to wait. Ok, every visit was during the week, but still!!!

Brunch has been fully described by other yelpers- its all that and a bag of chips.

Dinner: 2x we ate on the patio on VERY COLD NIGHTS (we were hungry), however Zazie had all those outside heaters between every table and even blankets available for those that cared for them. I just left my jacket and scarf on and I was fine with the heaters. It made for a picturesque dinner with the white lights they have strung on the patio! The complimentary hot roll they bring every time is always fresh out of the oven hot and a perfect start to the meal. I ordered the trout and my companion the pasta a la courge with prawns- both ah-mazing. I am always surprised at how delicious Zazie is for being in Cole Valley!

The other visits we sat inside, and each one was just as good. One time we ordered mac and cheese to start, super yummy with bread crumbs on top and spiral noodles. Companions had the grandmere poulet and truffle ravioli- yummy also. I stuck to my faithful trout, delicious as always.

Dessert- if you have time, do yourself a favor and order the baked hot chocolate, its worth the 15 minute wait!!
author: Amaranta C.

description:
On a Saturday morning a party of 7 people waited about an hour to be seated. We waited because people on Yelp had really rated this place highly and I love breakfast. 

When we were finally seated, the hostess was very very nice. (5 stars)
The patio outside is nice if the temperature is just right. (4 starts)
I ordered the only omlet which was the days special, there are no omlets on the menu. The omlet I ordered was decent and came with toast and potatoes. (3 stars). 
The coffee, was strong and good. 
The ginger pancakes were delicious (4 stars). 
Parking can be tough (2 stars).

I must go back to try the Mexican scramble which I hear is good. Maybe that will bump my rating up to a 4 star. For now its a 3.5.
author: Brendan J.

description:
I came here 2 weeks ago with the friend for dinner. I heard this place has really good breakfast and brunch, but my friend told me this was a cute place to dine at night, so i listened to him and we went there.

I forgot what i got for my main dish but it was some sort of chicken. Their side dishes are good but our main course wasnt that great. Overall, food sucked, but I enjoyed the company so that didnt matter! Our waiter that helped us was super friendly and super nice. 

I'd give this place a try again. Maybe not for dinner but for their brunch.
author: jessica t.

description:
My new favorite brunch spot in the city!  Zazie has it all: delicious food, Parisian cafe charm, and excellent service!

We went on a Sunday afternoon for a late brunch.  Since it has been raining non-stop, the patio was unfortunately closed (we will definitely try to snag a seat on the patio next time!).  But on the bright side, we came in late enough that there was no wait.  

Not like we really minded sitting inside.  The restaurant is quite charming, and has the homey feeling of a cute Parisian bistro.  It reminded me a lot of La Note in Berkeley, down to the adorable menus and the menu offerings.

We ordered the following items:
- Salade Marius (spinach, caramelized walnuts, gorgonzola cheese, and roasted bosc pears): Very good!  The poached pears were delicious and the ingredients complemented one another perfectly.  

- Florentine poached eggs with spinach and portabello mushrooms:  Hands down, the BEST eggs florentine I've ever had!  I usually don't love eggs florentine because the spinach is not terribly flavorful and the hollandaise sauce can be very hit or miss.  But not here!  The mushrooms were an excellent touch and helped add a delicious hearty flavor.  The hollandaise sauce was also quite good and not too heavy, as it can often be.

- French toast Tahiti (Pinkie's challah stuffed with caramelized bananas and walnuts):  Uh-MAZING!  We are fiends for french toast and we both agreed that this was some of the best we've had!  The caramelized banana-walnut mixture that they spread over the french toast was heavenly.  I would absolutely order it again!

We originally put in a full order of all 3 items, but the waiter informed us that it might be too much food and suggested downgrading the French Toast to a single order.  I LOVE when waiters do this!  I feel like it doesn't happen enough.  Of course, we had the PERFECT amount of food when everything came out.  That's excellent service and we really appreciated it!

All in all, we LOVED Zazie and will be coming back often!  I can't wait to try the dinner here!
author: Julie S.

description:
I feel like San Francisco is a city filled with people with high culinary IQ's, so seeing the outpouring of love and adoration for Zazie's made coming here a no-brainer. I'm sure glad I did cause this was the real breakfast of champions.

I was tempted to get a burger but I hear the breakfast fare here is legendary so I just decided to stick with that. I had the New York scrambled eggs with smoked salmon and home fries. I also got to sample the poached eggs smothered in their hollandaise sauce which was also accompanied by wild smoked salmon. 

Undoubtedly the eggs benedict were a unanimous favorite. The salty, smoky note of the salmon harmonized beautifully with the creaminess of the egg yolk and the hint of lemon from the luxurious hollandaise. No morsel was spared on any of our plates.

If they had breakfast served all day here like Jack In the Box, I'd probably be camped outside.
author: Lu T.

description: I'm so thankful we don't live nearby as our bank account would be in worse shape than it is.  Came here following an ultrasound (no food or drink for 9 hours) and was dying for breakfast (thanks Yelpers).  Since it was mid-week there were a couple of tables available and my parking karma found us a spot right in front.   A latte for me and cappuccino for hubs brought us to life.  We split 2 specials, cornmeal pancakes and two eggs on toasted bread with bacon.  The bread had a light spread of goat cheese and the eggs were fried/poached.  One of the best breakfasts we've ever eaten (no exaggeration) and filled us up until dinner.
author: Joli W.

description:
been here for breakfast and dinner...both very good. ambience is fantastic...the back patio area is one of my favorite places to eat that i have been to. We were with a large party on a friday night and had an overall pretty good time. Our table had the rabbit, burger and trout among some other items. The idaho trout was very good, a bit oily, but the actual fish still did shine and was fantastic. Burger was excellent and the rabbit was very tasty too. 

The morrocon lentil soup was pretty fantastic and i would recommend it but i would ask for some lemon or lime on the side...it could us some acid. 

wine list was pretty good. nice choice of varietals and price range is very fair. 

dessert was killer...strawberry rhubarb crumble. the whip cream on top coulda been "whipped" a bit more. but thats an opinion. 

only minus star is for us having to pour our wine and a bit of mistiming with the food arriving and waiting a while to pay and some other holes in service.  In no way was this our servers fault. He was great and very helpful when he was there, but it was pretty clear that they were a bit understaffed.
author: Mohammad G.

description: I heard that this was a very very popular brunch place, so I decided to get here early when most ppl would hopefully be asleep still on a Sunday. Got here at 9:30 and only had to wait about 5 minutes for a table. I decided to be a pig and eat a lot for brunch since I also couldn't really decide what I wanted on their menu. Ended up getting a slice of Pinktie's Challah French Toast with orange cinnamon batter and fresh fruit (tasted very interesting but good...kind of reminded me of a beer bread taste but in french toast form), Albert: with bacon, white cheddar, and homemade salsa fresca (really good...loved their light lemony hollandaise sauce and the salsa fresca was pretty unique and worked well with the whole benedict), and chai tea (disappointed in this...was very light tasting and I like my chai tea heavy). Overall, a delicious and satisfying meal :)
author: Liwei Y.

description: Great food, great service, great overall experience! Prepare to wait in line, no matter what day you come though.
author: Marianna L.

description: We live in the neighborhood, and took my parents here for breakfast on a weekday morning after hearing great things, and that there are long waits on the weekends. It was not busy - maybe half full. My dad and husband both had scrambled eggs ($15 pp, for eggs, toast, bacon) that they thought were average. My mom had the bread pudding pancakes, which I tried, and they were too sweet and way too soft, even without adding syrup. I had a bowl of seasonal fruit and yogurt, which was expensive ($10). The yogurt was store bought, fine, and the fruit was unripe pineapple, honey dew, and two strawberry slices. That is not seasonal fruit for May in CA - I expected much more for the price (with granola would have been $12 - which is what Bar Tartine charges for housemade yogurt, truly local, seasonal fruit, etc. - totally worth the price). Finally, the coffee cups were small and never refilled without us flagging someone down. If you are a breakfast place, and not even busy, there is no excuse for customers sitting with empty cups mid meal. The coffee itself wasn't very good either. I wouldn't come back.
author: Laura M.

description: its good idk about waiting in line for though.  I dined in with no wait and wouldnt be back if there is a wait.
author: Jaseon F.

description:
This is a fantastic breakfast place!  It sells the breakfast basics - pancakes, cereal, toast, bagels, eggs etc. but it does them well and the menu and options are pretty extensive.   

I had the eggs florentine (spinach and mushroom) with home fries (more like roasted potatoes - Plow style). You can order 1/2/3 eggs which is a good choice.  Egg was poached to perfection and I can happily report they use free range eggs. 

The table also shared a ginger pancake and a miracle pancake between the four of us, just to try.  Both pancakes were really nice and the ginger pancake is huge.  The miracle pancake changes between four different options (each going for a week at a time).  This week it is a bread pudding with grilled banana.  It was so yummy but I'm not really a 'sweet' breakfast person so am glad we shared as personally I think it would have put me in a food coma if I had eaten a plate of miracle pancakes. 

Warning: it gets really busy!  We went on a weekday and still had to wait half an hour.  Weekends would be insane. 

Service was very friendly.
author: Pig E.

description:
Was my 1st visit last night, Bambie & me joined a party of 6. How have I managed to miss this place for the past 15 years? The $21 prix-fixe 3 course of tasty, authentic, clean, well made French-style food is a great bargain. We came for NO wine corkage night. Waiter popped our 5 bottles without a sniff of "You cheap bastards" attitude; he even brought an ice bucket for the Pinot Blanc. 

Both Bambie & I ate wild salmon on a bed of parsnip/celery root mash. The fish quality was excellent, perfect texture. Lightly pan grilled with a hint of butter. Topped with quickly wilted pea shoots & a few tiny sweet tomatoes. This dish in France would be no better for the same price. 

Menu had 3 more starters & main dishes for the $21 fixed price and about a dozen more selections for slightly more money. The generous variety from fish, fowl, meat, & pastas is impressive.

Chocolate pot au crme dessert was divine but way too small at 3 ounces. I happily could 'a had cup more. 

Verdict: Good dinner, low price, funky-cute room, good service, great dining companions - A winner!

Reading other Yelp reviews where the moans & groans about the long waits for week-end brunch that result in 1 star review is ridiculous.  If you can't wait for a long time to eat breakfast at this place either:
1.Learn how to cook an omelet at home and relax.
2.Get in your car and drive to a far-flung suburb for breakfast where crowds don't exist.
3.Go someplace else.

A good restaurant doesn't deserve a crappy review because you are too hung-over and grouchy to wait on line for breakfast with all your city comrades.  You decided to live in the city. Crowds & waiting in-lines are part of the deal. So deal!
author: Tom S.

description: If there isn't already enough reviews here's another!  Great brunch spot, minus any personal preferences or food allergies, you can't go wrong with any item on the menu.  The wait is pretty solid, but they do their best to move folks in and out.
author: Andrew M.

description:
I did enjoy the eggs monaco as I usually never get poached eggs but saw some good reviews on Yelp so I went for it..glad I did.  Glad I tried this place, but in my opinion it's not worth the 45 min - 1 hour wait.  I'd probably give it 4 stars if the wait was only 10 mins or so (if the place was bigger).

I did not get to check out the patio.. may have LOVED the place if we had gotten patio seating.. not sure.  It's also cool that you can go into the bar finnegan's next door and the guy will come and find you in the bar if you write "at the bar" on the list.
author: Melody T.

description: Local favorite, if you want to feel the vibe of cole valley. This is the 'it' place.  Get there early and you don't have to wait for a table.
author: Tony T.

description:
J'adore Zazie!

I just went here for the first time and I can't wait to go back!  We went for brunch on a Monday, and surprisingly the line was long, but well worth it.  My sister and I shared the "build your own mimosas"...they smartly use 90% bubbles and only 10% juice (the perfect ratio!), so the juice comes in a small carafe.  We shared an order of the French Toast Tahiti and the Gingerbread pancakes.  Both were absolutely delicious, and I usually don't care for pancakes, but the flavor combination of gingerbread, pear and lemon curd was too good to resist!  

As if the food and setting weren't enough, the service was fantastic!  The host offered us a choice between two tables (we elected to wait for a window booth, which was well worth the extra wait!), and our server was so friendly and hospitable.  I'll be back soon!
author: Gina B.

description:
Had a wonderful dinner and our table completely pigged out. The crowd appears to be older during dinner and it's much quieter than it is during brunch. 

Mussels Mariniere - classic dish with a deliciously rich sauce. I think it would go great with pasta as well. 

Charcuterie plate - I was expecting a few slices of meat on a plate and some bead but you get a huge thing of salad, olives, pickles, ham that reminds me of jamon, chicken liver pate, and salmon rilettes. It's worth the $14. 

Roasted Trout - this is a whole trout that is de-boned. You can eat the whole thing. Came with a pile of greens and some sort of olive tapenade/salsa thing. 

Lamb Tagine - the star dish of the night. It's lean lamb meat that must have been braised for hours and served with cous cous. 

Pork Chop - the prep was good but I wasn't a fan of the sweet cider sauce. The overall dish felt a little heavy.
author: Anthony H.

description:
Month of BRUNCH #3 finds us in Cole Valley at the venerable Zazie.  5 of us waited an hour or so for a pile of really good food and coffee.  We shared a ginger bread pancake, which was really heavy on the ginger, and a fantastic piece of lemon tinged coffee cake.  The coffee cake would be the highlight of the whole meal.

To eat here you should like poached eggs as they're featured heavily on the menu.  We tried the bacon/tomato/hollandaise and the crab/hollandaise versions and both were very good.  Cooked to perfection where the yolk just runs out when you cut into it.  The potatoes weren't my preferred style; they're the roasted kind where it's mostly potato and not very crispy/fried or seasoned.    

I wasn't blown away by anything here but it's a solid BRUNCH.
author: Matt S.

description:
A friend who loves French food was visiting recently, so we thought we'd try Zazie based on the Yelp reviews. When we got there it was prime Sunday brunch time and there were already a lot of people waiting outside, so we just put our names down on the list and had some coffee a few doors down. After that, we walked around for a little while and then went back to check on how close we were to being seated, which was not very close at all. 

But, here's an important tip: the two tables in front of the restaurant are first come, first served! When we walked up we noticed the sign out front saying as much, and so we just sat down at one of tables that was empty since no one else seemed to be taking it. We asked a server to double check that we weren't stealing someone else's table, and he confirmed that we could just help ourselves and gave us menus! We noticed some glares from people who were waiting nearby and didn't realize they could have sat down, but it was a small price to pay for the wait time we saved by snagging one of these tables...many of the people who were standing around when we were seated were still waiting when we left.

The food was pretty tasty, there were a lot of sweet and savory dishes to choose from that looked good, the staff was friendly, and the surrounding area was cute. Overall our experience at Zazie was good, but I just don't think it's worth the extremely long wait. If you come here, I'd recommend going during off-peak hours if you can.
author: Caroline T.

description:
Right across the street from Coles garage is this neat little restuarant. And yes it is in Cole Valley. I was able to sit in a front street table on this foggy evening and watch the action next door at he local saloon ( I think finnegans). They must have hootin and hollerin during the Palin -Biden debate.

I ordered the salmon with brussel sprouts and pecans $16.00 . It also came with creamy potatoes. The salmon was moist (not dry yuck) and the brussel sprouts were perfect. I'm not a big creamy potato fan and it did not eat them. 

To top it off at had the dessert pot of chocolate ( mousse with whipped cream). What a way to end a perfect evening. Definetly coming back to have breakfast in the backyard garden.

Kudos for great service.
author: Jim D.

description: Place has gotten too expensive. The food is ok to good but my last two visits the food was not hot.  Cold pancakes...yuke! The are much better and cheaper places in SF for breakfast/brunch.  Won't being going back to Zazie any time soon.
author: Monica H.

description: Lovely little cafe that definitely takes up a spot as one of my top 3 SF brunch spots. I normally don't like eating sweets for brunch but their tahitian french toast is delicious. If the weather is nice, make sure to sit outside in the back patio area. The corner table out on the patio at Zazie on a sunny day, fresh cup of coffee on the table, and taking in the smell of sweet maple syrup in the air - life doesn't get much better than that. :)
author: Susan C.

description:
Looking for a great little quaint brunch spot in the cole valley area? Look no further! This place has great decor, great servers and great food. I've been here twice and I've yet to be disappointed.
