description: When I think breakfast I think ZAZIE'S it's interchangeable! I would never go anywhere else. I'm still trying to make my favorite omelet there at home but can't perfect it like they do. Zazie's gives a new meaning to every breakfast dish you ever thought you could make. yum yum yum I want some right now! Too bad it's going through renovation right now. "OPEN, OPEN, OPEN!"
author: Alexis G.

description: Great brunch.  Mob scene.  Zazie II anyone??
author: Will C.

description:
I walked in last Monday for brunch.  (This was my third time, but may be my last time and I will have to let my friends know I may not go back here.) 
As I walked in I was invited to sit anywhere by this lovely male waiter (don't know their names but he seemed more of the professional one out of the two... ) 
I sat (unfortunately) in a table to the left side of the wall (as you walk in) and that was the table served by the unprofessional waiter (tall lanky fair skinned male waiter... again, don't know their names he didn't introduce himself.)  
I was able to order a couple of drinks (tea and a virgin bloody mary) but needed a little more time to think about what to order.  About ten maybe fifteen minutes passed and I started to wonder what had happened to my waiter and my drinks when I noticed he was being chatty with some customers for some period of time , so finally this waiter returns to take my order and I asked if I could have water ... (hint hint, I really feel thirsty and can you serve me please?)  He replies, "Of course," takes my order and goes to another table!!!  The restaurant is tiny, it doesn't take any leg work to go to the counter and retrieve my tea, water, and my bloody mary sitting on the counter getting cold getting warm... and it was not busy.  
I finally got up and asked to switch tables... and there on the counter were all my drinks waiting to be served to me and there was the guy chatting with the customers again!  He was not taking orders he was chatting... I was starting to think I had a moron for a waiter.
The guy still did not take notice of me as I got up to use their restroom and to switch tables... the restroom by the way was filthy which made my stomach turn.  
When I got my food, I thought the poached egg was cold.  For some reason, the food was not delectable as I thought the food was the first couple of times I had been there... every thing was just heavy and bland and overly sweet.  The tea had a weird bitter aftertaste.  
I believe a good part of the dining experience can be elevated or dampened by how you are being treated by the server... in my case, I felt ignored and not served well by my first waiter who basically failed to pay attention to me and bring my water, drinks as I sat there for over fifteen or more minutes feeling a little neglected, and that may have done it in for me there at Zazie's.
I did tip my second waiter well (over twenty percent) but I have a tendency to overtip because I feel waiters USUALLY work pretty hard...
author: lucia P.

description: One sentence: I'm going to miss Zazie and its charm when I make my move to SD. :(
author: Dav S.

description: Great service. Great food. Everything was very tasty from the French Onion soup to the Duck.
author: Douglas R.

description: Just came back from Zazie where I had the best burger that I can remember.  And I can't tell you why, but every part from the incredible fresh bun to the tomato to the delectable meat itself was simply perfect.  Four stars because I ordered it medium and my friend ordered it medium well and they mixed the 2 up (we wanted different toppings), but even more done than I wanted -- that burger was AMAZING!
author: m s.

description: two poached eggs, toast dry, and a side of bacon. couldn't get better, i tell you. try their blt as well. it's hands-down the best take on it that i have ever encountered.
author: eve l.

description: the place rocks. love the backyard. mussels are so good, my favorite in the city. and decently priced too. just a warning it is dog night on mondays in the backyard.
author: Nicole H.

description: Maqnifique! I LOVE this place! If I could, I would probably live at Zazie's. This place is not only super yummy, it also has a welcoming,warm ambience and staff.  I love coming here for breakfast/brunch......they have everything from a juicy Zazie burger to their phenomenal Pumpkin pancakes! They always have different specials and so you can never get bored with their menu.  I have to mention their Mimosas are off the charts, my favorite is their Blackberry sorbet Mimosa.  You also have to try their french toast, they are la creme de la creme....I won't even try to describe them, you'll just have to try them for yourself.  Oh, and if there is a bit of a wait, don't worry it's worth it.  If you get a chance to sit in the patio, do it, it's less crowded and you can bring your doggie:)
author: Rosa D.

description: Delicious!  We visited on a busy Saturday morning.  The food was delicious and the service was great.  The pumpkin pancakes were incredible!
author: Emily S.

description: Oh Zazie! You redefine outdoor patio brunch! I can't forget the joy of having french toast with banana and almond, sipping mimosa in this nifty backyard! Another great choice is  Lemer!! You've gotta try this, poached eggs with dungeness crab and avaocado on english muffin, fantastic. I still can't forget about it!  I was definitely disappointed with mexican scrambled. Chorizo and scrambled eggs were in great proportion, but it seemed to be too greasy for the standards of a place like this. I would still give it five stars just for the french toast and Lemer alone and the beautiful backyard. Be ready for the long wait, but  it is worth every second! Finally, if you want to avoid the wait  and yet enjoy the backyard, stopby for dinner which is  pretty good.
author: Kingshuk g.

description: get the BLT. thats right, thats all i am going to say.
author: miss lisa k.

description: you know that girl in spanish class who was really smart but kinda "high-risk" and whose shirt you looked down every day? zazie is like that girl. only with better cheeses.
author: John M.

description: Great breakfast place, a little small but great food and service, my wife is extremely strict and loved it there, that says a lot!!
author: Jr B.

description: My friends and i went here for brunch sunday.  We arrived a little after 130pm and had only a 20 minute wait.  I'd never walked around in cole valley - it's cute!  The host and the waitress were both very friendly and attentive.  I had the special - the miracle panckakes, which are 2 pancakes with lemon curd and a few blueberries. The part with the stuff on it was very good. The part that was just pancakes was just eh, pancakes. My friend r ate that part, and was remarking, why are these miraculous?  K had a fish dish which he liked a lot. M and L had egg dishes which they liked.  The toast was very fat.  For drinks, i had chai. My chai came in a cereal bowl. It was THAT large.  no handle or anything - a real cereal bowl!  They had mimosas. The oj ones were just oj ones. The mango one was pretty tasty, but the best was the elderflower one. I cant describe what it tasted like, but interesting and good.  No one found their food exceptional, so go here for the service and drinks.  It was good though.
author: Merredith L.

description: my favorite thing about brunch and weddings is that you get to have multiple drinks:  water, coffee, booze, champagne...take your pick or take all of them.  i love zazie because not only to they have a FAB food menu (loooooove the mexico scramble) but they also have a great brunch-drink menu!!
author: Natalie H.

description: First things first, if your heading to Zazie on the weekend get there when they open especially if it's a nice day and you want to sit out on the back terrace which I highly recommend (it's so pretty and relaxing).  If you don't get there early be prepared to wait for quite awhile, we got there ten minutes after they opened and they were already bustling with hungry people.  By the time we put our orders in the whole place was completely filled and then when we were leaving there was a very long line outside.  For your own sake ovoid the wait.  The food is delicious but  I wouldn't necessarily say this place deserves five stars however it does deserve at least 4.5 and I didn't want to give them less than they deserve so I gave them 5.  Keep in mind it's quite small but quaint.  I will definitely be going back to Zazie and I will take friends here when they are visiting or recommend it to other people.
author: Erin S.

description: I've been to Zazie before for lunch, but today I went for brunch. I love the atmosphere of the place- especially the gorgeous patio on a sunny day. I wanted to love the food too....but I think it is just good. I ordered the Eggs Mexico- with chorizo, white cheddar, roasted peppers, and fresh salsa. The tomatoes were fresh and the chorizo was not so spicy- it was a bit greasy though and I would have preferred more spice to the chorizo. I like that they serve thick slices of wheat toast. My friend ordered the Poached Eggs Monaco with prosciutto and tomatoes- her eggs were overcooked, but she loved the hollandaise sauce. Their coffee  drinks are great- but I was suprised they don't offer fresh squeezed OJ. The service and atmosphere outshone the food this time- but I plan to definitley come back to try other dishes, or for lunch perhaps. Don't be thrown off by the seemingly long wait list- it goes by quickly as people sign up and leave.
author: Laura D.

description: Glad to have it in the neighborhood. Good for dinner, byob. Good for brunch although week-ends are completely mad.  I will do some lines, this is not one of them.
author: Jeff B.

description: best french toast ever! the french toast tahiti was soooo good. i know it was loaded with sugar but it was worth eating! i also had the sunshine mimosa, grilled chicken sandwich and their home fries to share with my fiancee. i wana go back and try their poached eggs and maybe the gingerbread pancakes.
author: Ruchell F.

description: Very tasty breakfast.  My pancake was a tad over done and I would say that there was not enough hollandaise on my poached egg, but all in all, the food was great.  I will be back!
author: Debbie M.

description: This place gets 5 stars for the location and the outside patio, but the food is somewhat lacking.  It still cannot be beat for brunch on a sunny day, or a dinner on a warm night!
author: nikke e.

description: I love this place. I do not think Zazie needed another review. But I opened this account and Yelp forced me to write a review to create the list so here I am !!!
author: A S.

description: I came here for the first time last week and I'm an instant fan. I don't live far from here and whenever I walk by they're busy busy busy, so I've never made the effort to go. When I came by for lunch the place was still a little busy but didn't have a wait time to sit. I had this fig special sandwich and it was killer krazy good. I will definitely be back, maybe I will even wait for a table.
author: Jesse V.

description: cute place, satisfying food, and usually worth the wait.  weekend brunches are almost certainly a long wait, unless you get there before 1045 or after 2.   try to get the back patio - it's a quaint little space, like you're dining in someone's backyard. which, being cole valley, you kinda are.
author: Reina M.

description: The place is nice if you would like to seat outside but the waits are long and the food is very average
author: angela s.

description: staff is nice. food is good. wait is well.. not as bad as Mama's, that's for sure.. everything is GOOD.. nothing is outstanding except for this pancake or toast thing i only vaguely remember. (i'm gonna have to go back soon.) BIG downside? lack of parking.. try going there anyway. it's such a cute little place. sit in the backyard-ish area. i feel like i'm at someone's house for breakfast. j'adore!
author: Mel L.

description: This was really reasonably priced, delicious breakfast. Everything was fresh and well-prepared with quality ingredients. My boyfriend has the prociutto/asparagus benedict with white cheddar, and I had a scramble with salmon and fontina and chives. The mocha I had was delicious. The foam was creamy, and the espresso was dark and well-roasted.
author: Kristen W.

description: this is a super cute brunch spot near haight/ashbury. the wait staff are all really nice and young/hip. the poached eggs are the real winners on their menu, but the scrambled eggs with different toppings are also really good. the house potatoes are not all greasy and fried, they are real red baby potatoes roasted with garlic and onion. they also have several different flavors of mimosa and huge and delicious lattes with the perfect amount of foam that can hold a good design. the only downfall is that the wait for a table is really big. you can put your name on the list online through your iphone, but if they call your name and you aren't there yet, you will still have to wait. regardless, this is a great place, love it for a cute sunday brunch.
author: rania o.

description: For good local french cuisine this place is fantastic. For fine dining amazing french food, this absolutely holds up. Great people, great food, consistently.
author: Mindy R.

description: love the patio, cute waiter/ess, amazing place to have brunch. i never go there on the weekend, since i heard the line can be pretty long.
author: sherly A.

description: fave fave bfast brunch place hands down.  super cute french restaurant with quaint warm cozy atomsphere.  outdoor patio is super cute and romantical. esp when its warm and sunny.  fantastic menu! eggs bene.. pumpkin pancakes.  un, deux, trois. tuna sandwich. nicoise salad. yum yum yum.  perfect with mimosas! the wait can be a little hairy, but be patient and you wont be sorry.
author: Caroline S.

description: very very cute... love the outdoor patio space! i've been here for brunch many times and i'm ashamed to say that i've only tried one thing - the poached eggs albert, side of chicken apple sausage. :) it's just TOO good that i can't stay away from it! the potatoes are awesome goodness with roasted garlic. especially good if you crack open the roasted garlic and spread it all over the potatoes... if you don't mind the early-morning garlic love :) perfect time to go on weekends is before 10:30 - otherwise the line gets insanely long.
author: Lucy C.

description: decent place to go when the wait isn't insane - the mexican scramble was yummy, but the cream cheese coffee cake was too sweet! very nice service, lots of yupsters
author: Lisa M.

description: jason brought me here today.   great grub and fantastic service.  i had the BLT which is made with tasty great bacon.  not too salty which I know bugs some ppl.  they have an assortment of tasty drinks too that i think is a nice compliment then the reg coke/sprite/ice tea.
author: Rob C.

description: Went at noon, so service being slow is ok and tolerable, but the food was fantastic.  I had the Fig Figaro.  Tres bien!
author: Misti L.

description:
ugh zazie's what happened??  i usually love this place, the ambiance, the food, yada yada yada, but this trip to zazie's sucked!  

i get the same thing everytime, blt sando, which has always been amazing! $10.95 for a sandwich sucks, but normally there is a big ol' bacon/goat cheese/tomato quantity and a side salad so that's perfect for me!   maybe it's this recession/borderline depression, maybe they were just too busy to be good, but this piece of crap came as just a small sandwich on a plate, a few pieces of bacon, some goat cheese, roasted tomatoes and some borderline lettuce (you know what i mean, the lettuce that starts to turn brown around the edges) on bread.  when i got the plate w/ the little sandwich, i asked the food runner if it normally comes with a side salad, and his response was ya that's $1.90 extra now (on top of the $10.95 price tag for the sando).  so i say, thanks, way to go recession and he's all ' well they have to pay me some how' and i'm all ' no shit sherlock'.  what a douche.  anyway, i totally understand the whole customer, server relationship and i totally understand you don't take it out on the server but this guy was totally defensive about this whole thing which is effing annoying.  anyway it's not like these bitches are hurting for biz, cause there was like 20 m-effers waitin' outside to eat.  

so zazie, i will come again, but if it sucks as much as this sat did, you guys are off my good list and on my shit list.  

cheers!
author: Kate H.

description: This is one of my favorite places for my favorite meal-- brunch!  It has a cute little garden in the back to enjoy meals on nice days, and the food is great and not too expensive.  The only downsides is there is often a wait on the weekends (although usually no longer than 15 minutes) and sometimes the waitstaff is not always on top of everything.  But overall, a great brunch place.
author: Jessica R.

description: i've only eaten here once, and the best part of the meal was the very simple side salad topped with warm goat cheese. its a very cute place, beautiful patio in the back for evenings, but the food was a bit bland, for both me and my boyfriend. we still certainly finished our food, but aren't impressed enough to go back. several friends have had nothing but good things to say about it though, so maybe we should give it one more try.
author: Ellen L.

description: Fantastic breakfast - maybe one of the best I've had in the City.  Got their special omelette of the day with only egg whites (great that they accommodate that - I can't stand nasty yolks) - fontina cheese, mushrooms, bacon and fresh basil.  Heaven wrapped up together.  The potatoes were perfectly crispy and had yummy whole roasted garlic cloves.  The fiance got the benedict with smoked salmon and said it was the best he's had.  He is the most picky and snooty person when it comes to poached eggs - always has a complaint - but not here.
author: Kris W.

description: The brunch here is never disappointing. I almost always get the eggs Benedict with crab, which is served with a side of roasted garlic potatoes. Their pancakes are amazing. Sit on the patio if you can, it's especially romantic in the evening with the candles and lights.
author: Lucie T.

description: Another reviewer used the word "delightful" to describe Zazie, and I think that pretty much sums it up.  We just had such a lovely dinner there-- the food was wonderful, the staff was incredibly charming, and the decor was so warm and cozy.  The menu is French comfort food, just like your grandma used to make if she came from Provence.  Tuesdays is no corkage so bring your own bottle and drink away!
author: Beth M.

description: good food. nice location (take the N. don't try to park). patio rocks. heard great things about brunch and monday night bring your dog, but i'm reviewing so i can add it to my no corkage nights list. that's right byob at no charge on Tuesdays.
author: cool d.

description: It's sooo good!  This is one of my favorites - it's cozy, friendly and the food is great.  The outdoor patio is loveley!  Great for a romantic dinner as well as brunch on a sunny day (foggy too since they got heatlamps and they work great).  Brunch is nice.  I usually try to go for breakfast during the week to avoid waiting (one of the nice things about having a flexible schedule!)  The staff is friendly and there was a time when they knew me by name...
author: J R.

description: I really like this place. The food was great, they allow dogs on the patio and the service was good too -- you can't say that about the Kezar that's across the street. My wife and I split the grilled  Mediterranean  vegetable plate as a starter. The veggies were perfectly grilled, the tomatoes were really nice and the feta was nothing like I had ever had. My wife had the shrimp lobster ravioli in some sort of white wine and lemony sauce that was really rich and perfectly balanced with the shrimp. I, of all things, had the burger. I know, I know... It's a French restaurant  and you had a burger? Well, this wasn't just any old burger. It had a great buttery bun with melted cheese and a vinaigrette  salad mixture that was on top of the burger patty and it was quite good. I had seen somebody order this when I came in and I had my mind set on it. If I do say so myself, it was great.  We'll be back Monday with our dog.
author: Chris G.

description: Love love LOVE! It's a bit out of the way for me, and it would take a lot for me to give up a perfectly good parking space on a no-street-cleaning street in my neighborhood, but I would give it up for Zazie.  Everything I've tried has been good.  I hate waiting on long waitlists for brunch, but this place is worth it! (Seriously though, one time we thought the wait was too long, so we decided to go next door, and let me tell you, there is a REASON there is no wait next door - it was aweful!!)  Also, if it's a really nice day out, and you are fortunate enough to get a table out back, it's a really nice experience.  The back deck is really small and it feels like you're being served brunch at someone's home.  It's a nice break away from the hustle and bustle of the city.  My only gripe is that they give you your bill right as they serve your food and say 'Don't Rush!', but really, you do feel rushed.  (If someone from the restaurant is reading this, you should really re-think your policy - it's much too tacky for such a cute place!)
author: Katie J.

description: The line to get into this place is way too long on the weekends.  However, if you get the chance to go during the weekday when its not that crowded, the gingerbread pancakes are very good.
author: Waymond N.

description: great fixed price dinners and wonderful brunches. Love the pancakes!
author: joy p.

description: The garden outside is beautiful and the service is great.  The food, however, did not live up to the hype.
author: M H.

description: Put simply, if you want an amazing brunch, go to Zazie. If your family is in town, bring them here. Seriously delicious and inventive food. Can't wait to try their dinner menu.
author: Robin A.

description: I only write a review about a place that's been consistently awesome.  Holy crap.  Zazie's breakfast IS consistently the bomb.  I'm a vegetarian that only eats cage-free eggs and I've found the best breakfast joint to accommodate my needs in S.F.  In addition to the decent prices and awesome tasting breakfasts, Zazie's also has a minimal wait and accommodates my breakfast loving inner hippie.  Example: All of their eggs are free-range and they have soyrizo.  Ooh, and try the banana and walnut french toast.  Friggin' good.
author: sergio g.

description: The manager is very friendly. Been here for dinner many, many times but only recently found out they serve breakfast -- which is a very enjoyable dining experience combined with sidewalk seating on a sunny day.  If you order the Irish oats, definitely get the brulee (although it's kind of overpriced).
author: A. T.

description:
ahhhhh zazie. two visits. both memorable and absolutely delightful. the first time i went i had time to kill while waiting for my friend and i looked at the menu for maybe 10 min. by the time she got there, i still didn't know what i wanted because i wanted everything. i got the zazie burger and we shared one 'miracle pancake'. 
i still dream about that pancake...a sour cream, poppy seed pancake with lemon curd. i mean, it was barely a pancake. it was more like a...well i don't know what it was like but it was phenomenal. as was the zazie burger.
 second visit a friend and i sat on the back patio. so lovely. the sun was kind of intense and when we asked if we could move to a shady table one of the staff brought over an umbrella and the problem was solved. on that visit i got the sandwich brigitte. eggplant, tomatoes, spinach and goat cheese. and i added chicken. all the flavors blended together in such a satisfying way. it was fresh and warm and i couldn't get enough. my friend got a blt which was probably the best blt i've ever had. sadly that pancake had been replaced with another but it looked equally as a delicious. bread pudding pancake with bananas. 

the only thing is that i can only go on a weekday since on the weekends i've heard its a line down the block. but that's ok by me. a Tuesday or Wednesday zazie is the perfect way to break up the week.
author: Lindsey B.

description: Great selection of egg dishes.  The food is truly Delicious.  However the service is not so great.  The first time I ate here the waitress messed up my order.  After learning that she had made a mistake on the order she came over to me and accused me of not  specifying the special instructions for my eggs (simply cheese on the side).  Very disappointing.  The second time I ate here, my egg dish was totally cold.  It clearly had been sitting out for awhile before being served to me.  The waitress apologized and they re-made the dish.  Love the food, so just hoping the service will improve.
author: Anna F.

description: I didn't care for this place for breakfast but I went for dinner one night and my mind was completely changed.  The mussels are to die for.  It was a good thing they served great bread to sop up the broth or I would have had to drink it.  I went with a party of 5 and got to try several things and everything was excellent.  The wine list wasn't bad either.
author: John C.

description: I stumbled upon this place when I moved to the City a few years ago. Problem is: I can't stop going! I've haven't had lunch there, but their breakfast and dinner is fantastic! I highly recommend the TAHITI FRENCH TOAST for breakfast! It's to die for. The service is great, and the atmosphere is perfect for a friends get-together. The back patio area is great for a romantic date! The food and service are consistent.
author: Dena E.

description: I sooooo love this place for brunch.  I like to sit with my honey and sip my coffee like there's no care in the world.  Their pancakes are deeeeeeelicious!  Omelettes are awesome too.  But weekend brunch always has a wait.  always always...
author: rei r.

description: Zazie has wonderful food, great service, and a line like woah.  It's also closed for the month (April '08), so make sure they're back open before you go.
author: juliana e.

description: This place is really cute.  And, being a French place, I was looking forward to their fish soup.  Sadly, it was bland, boring and disappointing and not the great find I was looking for to substitute the real deal.  The rouille was good, though, altho sparse, as it was pre-smeared on my garlic toasts.  It had a nice kick which was the most flavorful part of my soup.  The service lagged and wasn't bad, but it wasn't great, either.
author: Claire P.

description: If you love benedicts, you'll love Zazie.  Best brunch spot in the City.
author: Mark K.

description: Je t'aime Zazie!  We live in Cole Valley, so we eat here a lot.  Even if we didn't live here, we would eat at Zazie.  Try the roasted trout, and finish it up with the baked chocolate chaud.  You will be happy.
author: Paul M.

description: If you've ever wandered up Cole Street on the weekends and seen tons of people milling about on the sidewalk, Zazie is why. If you can deal with the wait, the service is actually quite fast and the brunch is fantastic. I'm a weekend brunch connoiseur, and I have to say that there are barely any other places in the city that serve up such delicious eggs. I'm a poached egg fanatic, so being able to choose from at least 6 varieties is a goldmine. I'm not a pancake girl, but I've tasted theirs and they're pretty darn tasty. Not to mention the sunrise mimosas (mango and champagne? MMMM) and lattes served, French style, in small bowls. Love it. The lunch side of the menu is also great. My husband is French and floves the Croque Madame. I've only eaten dinner here once...it's fine, but nothing to write home about.
author: jessica m.

description: Pate and French Onion Soup--that's all you need to know about this place. The rest of the stuff looks good but is probably overpriced. Also, byo wine on Tuesdays w/o the corkage fee.
author: Sara H.

description: The real review would be five stars for brunch, and three for dinner, so four is the net result. Zazie makes the best pancake I've ever tasted. Ironically the first time I went I had a weird scone of some kind that I hated. Reminder that a first impression isn't everything, I guess. Dinner has also improved significantly since I first started going, I have to say, though I've only had dinner there 4-5 times, and had brunch 25 or 30, so maybe that's part of it. Great little neighborhood restaurant.
author: Jonathan B.

description: The oatmeal Creme brûlée was awesome!!!  The lattes are a soup bowl, the food was delicious. Bathroom was wierd as while you are doing your business you can hear the click and clanging of dishes 5 feet away in the kitchen, and hear the ppl talking. But the French vintage ambience and good food make it worth it :)
author: Jessica A.

description: Got there with reservations at 5:30 on a weekday.  Not crowded!  Wonderful manager & waitress.  Too much delicious food....hanger steak & pork chop entrees.  Lentils on the side were incredible.  Couldn't order dessert, no room.  Excellent regular coffee!   Have also had breakfast and was tasty as could be.  Greatly appreciate the option for small, medium & large breakfast portions on many menu items.
author: Tobi A.

description: We first went to Zazie for dog night, however the food just by itself is great. Their French Onion Soup is perfect. The other night when we went there the service was excellent, however the food was the best! We had a excellent tomato-eggplant soup, followed their beef shank, which just fell off the bone with a delicious sauce.
author: Tom M.

description: My rating is on quality of food for the price.  Extremely high quality food for a reasonable price.  The ambiance is good as well.  Outdoor and indoor seating and the service is usually very attentive.  It is often crowded, which is a testament to its quality and I would like it to open earlier on the weekends.  As a bonus they have a great dinner as well and certain days a prix fixe menu, which is a great deal.  I have only tried this once or twice over the years, but it was excellent both times.  I can't believe anyone would rate this below 4 stars but I guess you can get pretty spoiled living in San Francisco.
author: Scott L.

description: My family took me here for a birthday dinner. It was a very warm night so we sat on the patio. Lovely setting, casual but still "nice". We ordered a selection of 3 appetizers to share and they were delicious. It was just enough for the five of us to have a small taste before dinner arrived. We had mussels, pate and a salad. I had a porcini/shiitake mushroom ravioli which was flavorful but light. One of my daughters had a duck leg cassoulet, the other had fish soup and my son in law had trout. I tasted it all and every dish was wonderful. Some earlier reviews complain about portion size (mostly at breakfast). The dinner portions are normal serving size, which I like! I am not interested in quantity over quality and none of us left hungry. Half bottles of wine are available and the Kir Royal appertif was just right on a warm night. The staff was accomodating and had a sense of humor. One of my daughters cannot have gluten and when she asked about a menu item the waiter said, "We don't do substitutions but we do subtractions." Overall, a great, relaxed neighborhood restaurant with top notch food.
author: caryn g.

description: great brunch experience. seated out back in the sunny outdoor patio. scramble of portobelllo/crimini/porcini mushroom + fontina + spinach-  well seasoned, eggs cooked perfectly.  tried the much yelped about gingerbread pancakes- have to say i was disappointed - pancakes were a bit dry, and overall not very flavorful- the lemon curd topping was tasty though.
author: anjali s.

description: I came to SF to meet my daughter who lives in the Height. She had heard good things about Zazie so we decided to try it out for dinner on Saturday 5/1. The first mistake made was the offer of a childs menu to my daughter who is 21(although she could pass for much younger). After being seated in the patio area, which was very attractive and comfortable, we waited a good 10 min before our server came by. He quickly told us the soup, said he'd be right back and disappeared for another 10 min. You get the picture I'm sure, a very inattentive server. He eventually took our order and we didn't see him again until the end of the meal. Started with the charcuterie plate. The pate was good the  salmon and prosciutto just so so. As for Entrees, My Pork Chop was dry and over cooked although the savory bred pudding was excellent. My wifes steak was tough and chewy ( our server told us thats the way flank steak is...Hmmm). My daughters rabbit was bland and disappointing. We Passed on desert.
author: John B.

description: this place is a nice french-american cafe in cole valley.  the outside patio offers a nice escape in, what I consider, the heart of the city.  i have been here for breakfast once and lunch a couple times.   seating takes a little while, that is expected as it popular... mostly because it is that good.   portion sizes are perfect, the flavor combinations are good, especially in the egg dishes and in the salads, and their lattes come in a big bowl...  i don't have one bad thing to say about this place.
author: andrew p.

description: a great brunch, great patio and their bloody mary is just perfect to drink with....
author: Daniel K.

description: breakfast is good but the wait makes the experience horrible...
author: Ron S.
